title: Minister of PKP: Construction of 26,000 Huntap in Sumatra Needs IDR 8.5 Trillion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Housing and Settlement Areas (PKP) revealed that it needs a jumbo budget allocation to fulfill the procurement of 26,969 permanent housing units (huntap) for communities affected by the Sumatra disaster.

Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas (PKP) Maruarar Sirait explained that the total funding requirement to realize the construction of all residential units is projected to reach IDR 8.525 trillion.

"We have recorded data, what our officers have recorded is that there are 26,969 units [huntaps that need to be built] with a budget requirement of IDR 8.525 trillion," said Maruarar when met at the Indonesian Parliament Complex, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He explained that the housing development strategy in Sumatra would focus on the concept of one integrated stretch of land. This is done to ensure the quality of the settlement is more organized rather than a separate development pattern.

However, considering the limitations of the APBN in financing the project, the PKP Ministry emphasized plans to strengthen private sector involvement through mutual cooperation programs.

At the same time, Ara is also targeting accelerated construction so that some residential units in Sumatra can be functional in the near future.

Also Read

This target was set to respond to the urgent needs of residents, especially so that hundreds of families can occupy permanent homes before entering the upcoming Eid period.

"This is our breakthrough step, because we also want hundreds of families to enter houses that are permanent residences before Eid. This is a synergy of President Prabowo's direction, so that we can take steps quickly," explained Ara.

Previously, the PKP Ministry together with the Buddhist Tzu Chi Foundation had also realized the construction of 2,603 ​​permanent residential units intended for victims of natural disasters in the Sumatra region.

Meanwhile, referring to data from the Ministry of PKP, there are 139,485 community housing units affected by the flood and landslide disasters that occurred in the Aceh, North Sumatra and West Sumatra regions.

The Aceh region experienced the greatest damage. A total of 38,553 housing units were slightly damaged, 22,204 housing units were moderately damaged, 35,517 housing units were heavily damaged and 4,295 housing units were washed away. Thus, the total number of houses in the Aceh region affected by floods and landslides penetrated 100,569 housing units.

Then, there were 29,766 housing units affected by the disaster in North Sumatra. In detail, 19,936 units were slightly damaged, 4,304 units were moderately damaged, 4,351 units were seriously damaged and 1,135 units were washed away.

Finally, the total number of houses affected in the West Sumatra region reached 9,150 units. Of these, 5,634 units were slightly damaged, 1,174 units were moderately damaged, 1,577 units were seriously damaged and 765 units were declared washed away.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Perumahan dan Kawasan Permukiman (PKP) mengungkap membutuhkan alokasi anggaran jumbo guna memenuhi pengadaan 26.969 unit hunian tetap (huntap) bagi masyarakat terdampak bencana Sumatra. 

Menteri Perumahan dan Kawasan Permukiman (PKP) Maruarar Sirait menjelaskan bahwa total kebutuhan dana untuk merealisasikan pembangunan seluruh unit hunian tersebut diproyeksikan tembus Rp8,525 triliun.

"Kami sudah mendata, yang didata oleh petugas kami ada 26.969 unit [huntap yang perlu dibangun] dengan kebutuhan anggaran Rp8,525 triliun,” ujar Maruarar saat ditemui di Kompleks Parlemen RI, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan bahwa strategi pembangunan huntap di Sumatra akan difokuskan pada konsep satu hamparan lahan yang terintegrasi. Hal ini dilakukan untuk menjamin kualitas pemukiman yang lebih tertata dibandingkan pola pembangunan yang terpisah-pisah.

Akan tetapi, mempertimbangkan keterbatasan APBN dalam membiayai proyek tersebut, Kementerian PKP menekankan berencana memperkuat keterlibatan sektor swasta melalui program gotong royong. 

Pada saat yang sama, Ara juga menargetkan percepatan konstruksi agar sebagian unit hunian di Sumatra dapat segera fungsional dalam waktu dekat.

Target tersebut ditetapkan guna merespons kebutuhan mendesak warga, terutama agar ratusan keluarga sudah bisa menempati rumah permanen tersebut sebelum memasuki periode Lebaran mendatang.

“Ini langkah terobosan kami, karena kita juga ingin sebelum lebaran sudah ada berapa ratus keluarga yang masuk ke rumah yang bersifat hunian tetap. Itu adalah sinergi dari arahan Presiden Prabowo, supaya kita mengambil langkah-langkah dengan cepat,” jelas Ara.

Sebelumnya, Kementerian PKP bersama Yayasan Buddha Tzu Chi juga telah merealisasikan pembangunan 2.603 unit hunian tetap yang diperuntukkan bagi korban bencana alam di wilayah Sumatra.

Sementara itu, mengacu pada data Kementerian PKP terdapat 139.485 unit rumah masyarakat terdampak bencana banjir dan longsor yang terjadi di wilayah Aceh, Sumatra Utara, serta Sumatra Barat. 

Wilayah Aceh menjadi yang paling besar mengalami kerusakan. Sebanyak 38.553 unit rumah rusak ringan, 22.204 unit rusak sedang, 35.517 unit rusak berat dan 4.295 unit rumah hanyut. Dengan demikian, total rumah masyarakat wilayah Aceh terdampak bencana banjir hingga longsor tembus 100.569 unit rumah. 

Kemudian, terdapat 29.766 unit rumah terdampak bencana di Sumatra Utara. Perinciannya, 19.936 unit rusak ringan, 4.304 unit rusak sedang, 4.351 unit rusak berat dan 1.135 unit hanyut. 

Terakhir, total rumah terdampak wilayah Sumatra Barat mencapai 9.150 unit. Di antaranya 5.634 unit rusak ringan, 1.174 unit rusak sedang, 1.577 unit rusak berat dan 765 unit dinyatakan hanyut.

title: Those Who Benefit from the Lebaran Plane Ticket Discount Stimulus
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government has rolled out the stimulus for airplane discounts ahead of the Eid holiday period again. However, the effectiveness of these policies in attracting passengers and suppressing inflation is questionable, while the profit margins of airlines and airport operators are at stake.

The government hopes that through the stimulus from the State Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBN) it can encourage people's purchasing power to use airplanes, thereby increasing mobility and the economy.

Data from the Ministry of Transportation shows that with a 13%–14% discount for domestic flights during Christmas 2025/2026, the number of passengers actually fell by -0.91% compared to the same period last year.

Not to mention, the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) noted that airplane ticket prices are among the top 10 contributors to inflation in December 2025, with a contribution of 0.02% on a monthly basis.

In this year's Eid stimulus scheme, the government is providing bigger discounts through full Government Borne Value Added Tax (VAT DTP).

The government also provides a 50% discount on Aircraft Passenger Service Fees (PJP2U) aka Passenger Service Charge (PSC), as well as Aircraft Landing, Placement and Storage Service Fees (PJP4U) for national airlines.

Also Read

In addition, the government reduced the additional fuel surcharge (FS) for jet aircraft by 2% and for propellers by 20%.

Aviation observer Alvin Lie views that this policy has proven to be ineffective and actually burdens industry players.

Previously, PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia or InJourneyAirports admitted that the company's losses reached IDR 250 billion during discounts last Christmas.

Even though the government has removed 100% VAT on tickets, VAT on aviation fuel still applies to domestic flights. Through cuts to PJP2U and PJP4U, airport revenues were also cut.

"Industry players also need profits to survive. If every high season their income is cut, even though operating costs during the high season increase, they are worried that the quality of their services will decrease," he explained to Bisnis, quoted on Thursday (19/2/2026).

According to him, if the government really intends to reduce plane ticket prices and boost people's purchasing power, it is necessary to eliminate VAT on tickets and aviation fuel throughout the year.

This includes updating the Upper Limit Tariff (TBA) and Lower Limit Tariff (TBB) policies, so that ticket prices are more flexible, and can even drop lower during low season. He considered the policy to be more incidental than a concrete solution.

"Improve the TBA-TBB, remove VAT, waive import duties for aircraft components. Later throughout the year our systemic flying costs will decrease and there will be no need for incidental [discounts] every time and I'm sorry to see this is just for image purposes," he stressed.

Likewise, the Head of the Institute for Transportation Studies and transportation observer, Ki Darmaningtyas, views that this discount places the burden on operators to obtain additional input during high demand seasons.

"This is an opportunity for operators to get more input to cover expenses on normal slow days," he said.

On the other hand, the government claims to have ensured that this policy does not harm airlines.

Minister of Transportation Dudy Purwagandhi emphasized that there would be no losses for airlines due to the stimulus provided by the government.

Airlines only need to comply, because the difference from the discount is paid by the government using state treasury.

"Airlines must comply, because they are not actually harmed. The government is providing the stimulus. We are not interfering with costs or revenues from airlines," said Dudy when met at the Parliament Complex, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

In fact, the government plans to impose sanctions on rogue airlines that raise prices before the discount period.

Director General of Air Transportation, Ministry of Transportation, Lukman F. Laisa, emphasized that the admini fines strategy will be waiting for the airline, although the amount has not been determined.

"We will also hold a meeting with the legal department to determine the amount of the fine," he said.

Considering that the stimulus is a direct direction from the government, especially President Prabowo Subianto, business actors claim to be ready to carry out this mandate.

Secretary General of the Indonesian National Air Carriers Association (INACA) and President Director of PT TransNusa Aviation, Bayu Sutanto, sees that passengers will benefit the most from this discount.

"Airlines' revenues are regulated through the applicable TBA and TBB. So there is no such thing as increasing and expensive ticket prices as long as they do not exceed the TBA," he said.

Likewise, the President Director of PT Citilink Indonesia, Darsito Hendroseputro, said that the company complies with government directions regarding providing stimulus in the form of discounts on plane tickets during the 2026 Eid transport period.

"In accordance with government directions, the stimulus for Eid is valid from March 14 to 29. The price reduction is around 18% to 21%," he said when met at the Garuda Maintenance Facility (GMF), Friday (13/2/2026).

For example, the average ticket price for the Jakarta-Medan route was IDR 1.9 million, with this stimulus it fell to IDR 1.6 million.

However, the effectiveness of the airline ticket fare discount policy will only be seen after Eid 2026. Will it really be able to boost the number of passengers and strengthen the recovery of domestic flights - which are also still struggling to recover from the Covid-19 pandemic - or will it not have a significant impact on the industry.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Stimulus diskon tiket pesawat menjelang masa libur Lebaran kembali digulirkan pemerintah. Namun, efektivitas kebijakan tersebut dalam menarik penumpang dan menekan inflasi dipertanyakan, sedangkan margin keuntungan maskapai dan operator bandara ikut dipertaruhkan.

Pemerintah berharap melalui stimulus dari Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara (APBN) tersebut dapat mendorong daya beli masyarakat untuk menggunakan pesawat sehingga meningkatkan mobilitas dan ekonomi.

Data Kementerian Perhubungan menunjukkan bahwa dengan diskon 13%–14% untuk penerbangan domestik pada Nataru 2025/2026 lalu, jumlah penumpang justru turun sebesar -0,91% dibandingkan dengan periode yang sama tahun lalu.

Belum lagi, Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat harga tiket pesawat termasuk 10 besar penyumbang inflasi Desember 2025, dengan kontribusi sebesar 0,02% secara bulanan.

Dalam skema stimulus Lebaran tahun ini, pemerintah memberikan diskon lebih besar melalui Pajak Pertambahan Nilai Ditanggung Pemerintah (PPN DTP) secara penuh.

Pemerintah juga memberikan potongan tarif sebesar 50% terhadap Tarif Pelayanan Jasa Penumpang Pesawat Udara (PJP2U) alias Passenger Service Charge (PSC), serta Tarif Pelayanan Jasa Pendaratan, Penempatan, dan Penyimpanan Pesawat Udara (PJP4U) bagi maskapai nasional.

Baca Juga

  • Kabar Baik! Citilink Tebar Diskon Tiket Pesawat Lebaran hingga 21%
  • AirAsia Diskon Tiket Pesawat Mudik Lebaran 2026, Cek Jadwal dan Rutenya
  • Beli Tiket Pesawat Ekonomi Gratis PPN Mulai Hari Ini, Cek Ketentuannya!

Selain itu, pemerintah menurunkan biaya tambahan bahan bakar atau fuel surcharge (FS) untuk pesawat jet sebesar 2% dan untuk propeller sebesar 20%.

Pengamat penerbangan Alvin Lie memandang kebijakan ini terbukti tidak efektif dan justru memberatkan pelaku industri tersebut.

Sebelumnya, PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia atau InJourney Airports mengaku kerugian perusahaan mencapai Rp250 miliar saat diskon pada Nataru yang lalu.

Meski pemerintah memang menghapus 100% PPN terhadap tiket, PPN terhadap avtur tetap berlaku untuk penerbangan domestik. Melalui pemangkasan PJP2U dan PJP4U, pendapatan bandara turut dipangkas.

“Pelaku industri ini juga butuh laba untuk bertahan. Kalau setiap high season ini pendapatannya dipangkas, padahal biaya operasi pada high season naik, khawatir kualitas layanannya jadi turun,” jelasnya kepada Bisnis, dikutip pada Kamis (19/2/2026).

Menurutnya, jika pemerintah memang berniat menurunkan harga tiket pesawat dan mendorong daya beli masyarakat, perlu penghapusan PPN tiket dan avtur sepanjang tahun.

Hal itu termasuk memperbarui kebijakan Tarif Batas Atas (TBA) dan Tarif Batas Bawah (TBB), sehingga harga tiket lebih fleksibel, bahkan dapat turun lebih rendah saat low season. Dirinya menilai kebijakan tersebut lebih bersifat insidental ketimbang solusi konkret.

“Perbaiki TBA-TBB, hapus PPN, bebaskan bea masuk untuk komponen pesawat. Nanti akan sepanjang tahun sistemik biaya terbang kita akan turun dan tidak perlu setiap kali [diskon] insidental dan maaf saya melihatnya ini hanya untuk pencitraan saja,” tegasnya.

Senada, Ketua Institut Studi Transportasi sekaligus pengamat transportasi Ki Darmaningtyas memandang diskon ini membebankan operator untuk mendapatkan masukan tambahan kala musim ramai permintaan.

“Ini kesempatan bagi operator untuk mendapatkan masukan yang lebih banyak untuk menutup pengeluaran pada hari-hari biasa yang sepi,” tuturnya.

Di sisi lain, pemerintah mengaku telah memastikan kebijakan ini tidak merugikan maskapai.

Menhub: Maskapai Tak Rugi

Menteri Perhubungan Dudy Purwagandhi menegaskan bahwa tak ada kerugian bagi maskapai dengan adanya stimulus yang diberikan pemerintah.

Maskapai hanya perlu patuh, karena selisih dari adanya diskon tersebut dibayar pemerintah menggunakan kas negara.

“Airlines harus mematuhi, karena sebenarnya tidak dirugikan. Pemerintah yang memberikan stimulus. Kami tidak mengganggu biaya ataupun revenue dari para maskapai,” ucap Dudy saat ditemui di Kompleks Parlemen, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Bahkan, pemerintah berencana memberikan sanksi kepada maskapai nakal yang menaikkan harga terlebih dahulu sebelum periode diskon.

Direktur Jenderal Perhubungan Udara Kemenhub Lukman F. Laisa menegaskan, denda administrasi akan menanti maskapai, meski besarannya belum ditentukan.

“Kami akan rapatkan juga dengan bagian hukum untuk ditentukan berapa besaran dendanya,” tuturnya.

Respons Pelaku Usaha

Mengingat stimulus merupakan arahan langsung dari pemerintah, khususnya Presiden Prabowo Subianto, para pelaku usaha mengaku siap menjalankan mandat tersebut.

Sekretaris Jenderal Indonesia National Air Carriers Association (INACA) sekaligus Direktur Utama PT TransNusa Aviation, Bayu Sutanto, melihat penumpang paling diuntungkan dengan adanya diskon ini.

“Pendapatan maskapai ya seperti diatur melalui TBA dan TBB yang berlaku. Jadi enggak ada istilah harga tiket naik dan mahal sepanjang tidak melebihi TBA,” ungkapnya.

Senada, Direktur Utama PT Citilink Indonesia, Darsito Hendroseputro, menyampaikan perusahaan mematuhi arahan pemerintah terkait pemberian stimulus berupa diskon tiket pesawat pada masa Angkutan Lebaran 2026.

“Sesuai arahan pemerintah, stimulus untuk Lebaran berlaku mulai tanggal 14 sampai 29 Maret. Penurunan harga sekitar 18% sampai 21%,” ujarnya saat ditemui di Garuda Maintenance Facility (GMF), Jumat (13/2/2026).

Sebagai contoh, harga tiket pesawat rute Jakarta–Medan yang rata-rata senilai Rp1,9 juta, dengan adanya stimulus tersebut turun menjadi Rp1,6 juta.

Meski demikian, efektivitas kebijakan diskon tarif tiket pesawat baru akan terlihat setelah Lebaran 2026. Apakah benar mampu mendongkrak jumlah penumpang dan memperkuat pemulihan penerbangan domestik—yang juga masih berjuang bangkit dari pandemi Covid-19—atau justru tidak memberikan dampak signifikan bagi industri.

Mengingat stimulus merupakan arahan langsung dari pemerintah, khususnya Presiden Prabowo Subianto, para pelaku usaha mengaku siap menjalankan mandat tersebut.

Sekretaris Jenderal Indonesia National Air Carriers Association (INACA) sekaligus Direktur Utama PT TransNusa Aviation, Bayu Sutanto, melihat penumpang paling diuntungkan dengan adanya diskon ini.

“Pendapatan maskapai ya seperti diatur melalui TBA dan TBB yang berlaku. Jadi enggak ada istilah harga tiket naik dan mahal sepanjang tidak melebihi TBA,” ungkapnya.

Senada, Direktur Utama PT Citilink Indonesia, Darsito Hendroseputro, menyampaikan perusahaan mematuhi arahan pemerintah terkait pemberian stimulus berupa diskon tiket pesawat pada masa Angkutan Lebaran 2026.

“Sesuai arahan pemerintah, stimulus untuk Lebaran berlaku mulai tanggal 14 sampai 29 Maret. Penurunan harga sekitar 18% sampai 21%,” ujarnya saat ditemui di Garuda Maintenance Facility (GMF), Jumat (13/2/2026).

Sebagai contoh, harga tiket pesawat rute Jakarta–Medan yang rata-rata senilai Rp1,9 juta, dengan adanya stimulus tersebut turun menjadi Rp1,6 juta.

Meski demikian, efektivitas kebijakan diskon tarif tiket pesawat baru akan terlihat setelah Lebaran 2026. Apakah benar mampu mendongkrak jumlah penumpang dan memperkuat pemulihan penerbangan domestik—yang juga masih berjuang bangkit dari pandemi Covid-19—atau justru tidak memberikan dampak signifikan bagi industri.

title: Issue of US-Iran War Overshadows Supply, Global Oil Prices Strengthen
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — World oil prices continued their rally after recording their biggest daily increase since October. The rise was supported by reports that a United States military intervention against Iran could occur sooner than expected.

Based on Bloomberg data on Thursday (19/2/2026), the price of Brent oil for April delivery rose 0.2% to US$70.50 per barrel. Meanwhile, the price of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) oil for March delivery rose 0.3% to US$65.38 per barrel.

Brent oil held above US$70 a barrel after surging 4.3% on Wednesday, while WTI traded above US$65. US media, Axios, reported that any US military operation would likely be a campaign lasting several weeks, as well as the Israeli government pushing a scenario targeting regime change in the Islamic Republic of Iran.

The potential for armed conflict risks disrupting supplies from a region that accounts for about a third of world oil production. However, US President Donald Trump faces the risk of political pressure ahead of this year's midterm elections if a spike in oil prices drives up consumer gasoline prices.

Negotiations between the two parties have so far not resulted in a breakthrough. Tehran says it has reached a “general agreement” with Washington on the framework of a potential nuclear deal. A US official said Iranian negotiators would return to Geneva in two weeks with new proposals.

On the other hand, the US also announced visa restrictions on Iranian officials and executives following the crackdown on recent protests.

Also Read

“Failure to resolve the core issues at the heart of the dispute continues to increase the chances of military confrontation,” RBC Capital Markets analysts, including Helima Croft, wrote in a note.

Outside the Middle East, talks to end the war in Ukraine ended in less than 90 minutes with no clear outcome. Meanwhile, Russia—a member of the OPEC+ alliance—is experiencing a drilling slowdown that has the potential to further pressure oil production.

On the US supply side, crude oil inventories fell by 609,000 barrels last week, according to data from the American Petroleum Institute. Official government data is scheduled to be released on Thursday local time.

title: Prabowo Shows Off Budget Savings of IDR 303.14 T at the US–Asean Business Summit
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – President Prabowo Subianto stated that his government had succeeded in saving the state budget of around US$18 billion or around Rp. 303.14 trillion in the first few months of his leadership.

This statement was made while attending the US–Asean Business Summit at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Thursday (19/2/2026).

According to Prabowo, these savings come from cutting inefficiencies and canceling projects that are considered unproductive. He assessed that this step was in line with bureaucratic efficiency efforts which were also of concern to a number of other countries.

"I feel like I am one of the Indonesian presidents who in the first three months of his administration managed to save US$ 18 billion in cash," he said.

Prabowo revealed that one of the efficiency measures was to reduce expenditure on ceremonial activities in government agencies. He assessed that the tradition of celebrating institutional and regional birthdays often costs large budgets without having a direct impact on society.

He asked that the celebration be held simply in an office environment, for example by having lunch together, in order to maintain rational budget use.

Also Read

Apart from that, the government also cut the costs of overseas official travel which previously reached billions of dollars. Prabowo highlighted the practice of comparative studies abroad which was deemed ineffective and irrelevant to Indonesia's needs.

The head of state also cited the visit of a comparative study team to Australia to study poverty alleviation, which he said was inappropriate considering that the country is one of the richest countries in the world. He also mentioned a visit to Japan during the Christmas holidays which made the discussion agenda not run optimally.

Prabowo admits that efficiency policies are not easy to implement. He said that there had been demonstrations opposing this move, which he said was an unusual phenomenon.

“This is probably the first time in world history that there have been demonstrations against government efficiency,” he said.

Nevertheless, he emphasized his commitment to continue to cut waste in order to create legal certainty and a healthy investment climate. The number one person in Indonesia also believes that investors will not enter a country with uncertainty and weak law enforcement.

"In my opinion, as someone who has also been a foreign investor in this country, no one wants to enter an economy that is full of uncertainty, or that does not have confidence in the legal process and law enforcement. This is one of the most important things," he said.

On the other hand, the 8th President of the Republic of Indonesia also highlighted changes in communication patterns between the government and society in the digital era. He admitted that he often received direct messages from residents, including village children, who conveyed the condition of infrastructure in their area.

The statement emphasizes the Prabowo government's focus on budget efficiency, rational governance, and quick response to people's needs as part of efforts to strengthen public trust and attract investment.

Prabowo believes that increasingly open access to information requires the government to respond quickly to the needs of the community so that the state's presence is truly felt.

"We have to react quickly so that they feel that the central government and their President are listening and acting," said Prabowo.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – Presiden Prabowo Subianto menyatakan pemerintahannya berhasil menghemat anggaran negara sekitar US$18 miliar atau sekitar Rp303,14 triliun dalam beberapa bulan pertama masa kepemimpinannya.

Pernyataan tersebut disampaikan saat menghadiri Business Summit US–Asean di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Kamis (19/2/2026). 

Menurut Prabowo, penghematan tersebut berasal dari pemangkasan inefisiensi dan pembatalan proyek-proyek yang dinilai tidak produktif. Dia menilai langkah ini sejalan dengan upaya efisiensi birokrasi yang juga menjadi perhatian sejumlah negara lain.

“Saya merasa menjadi salah satu Presiden Indonesia yang dalam tiga bulan pertama pemerintahannya berhasil menghemat US$18 miliar secara tunai,” ujarnya.

Prabowo mengungkapkan bahwa salah satu langkah efisiensi dilakukan dengan mengurangi pengeluaran untuk kegiatan seremonial di instansi pemerintah. Dia menilai tradisi perayaan hari ulang tahun lembaga dan daerah sering menghabiskan anggaran besar tanpa dampak langsung bagi masyarakat.

Dia meminta perayaan dilakukan secara sederhana di lingkungan kantor, misalnya dengan makan siang bersama, guna menjaga rasionalitas penggunaan anggaran.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo Bahas Tambang Ilegal di Amerika, Ini Isi Pembicaraannya
  • Kelakar Prabowo Sebut Sisi Negatif Politisi dalam Gala Iftar Forum Bisnis AS
  • Daftar Pengusaha yang Ikut Prabowo ke AS: Bos Pertamina hingga Presdir Freeport

Selain itu, pemerintah juga memangkas biaya perjalanan dinas luar negeri yang sebelumnya mencapai miliaran dolar. Prabowo menyoroti praktik studi banding ke luar negeri yang dinilai tidak efektif dan tidak relevan dengan kebutuhan Indonesia.

Kepala negara pun mencontohkan kunjungan tim studi banding ke Australia untuk mempelajari pengentasan kemiskinan, yang menurutnya tidak tepat mengingat negara tersebut termasuk salah satu negara terkaya di dunia. Ia juga menyinggung kunjungan ke Jepang pada masa libur Natal yang membuat agenda diskusi tidak berjalan optimal.

Prabowo mengakui kebijakan efisiensi tidak mudah diterapkan. Dia menyebut sempat muncul demonstrasi yang menentang langkah tersebut, yang menurutnya menjadi fenomena tidak lazim.

“Ini mungkin pertama kalinya dalam sejarah dunia ada demonstrasi yang menentang efisiensi pemerintah,” katanya.

Kendati demikian, dia menegaskan komitmennya untuk terus memangkas pemborosan demi menciptakan kepastian hukum dan iklim investasi yang sehat. Orang nomor satu di Indonesia itu pun menilai investor tidak akan masuk ke negara dengan ketidakpastian dan lemahnya penegakan hukum.

“Menurut pendapat saya sebagai orang yang juga pernah menjadi investor asing di negara ini tidak ada yang mau masuk ke dalam ekonomi yang penuh ketidakpastian, atau yang tidak memiliki kepercayaan pada proses hukum dan penegakan hukum. Ini adalah salah satu hal terpenting,” tuturnya.

Di sisi lain, Presiden Ke-8 RI itu juga menyoroti perubahan pola komunikasi antara pemerintah dan masyarakat di era digital. Dia mengaku sering menerima pesan langsung dari warga, termasuk anak-anak desa yang menyampaikan kondisi infrastruktur di daerah mereka.

Pernyataan tersebut menegaskan fokus pemerintahan Prabowo pada efisiensi anggaran, tata kelola yang rasional, serta respons cepat terhadap kebutuhan rakyat sebagai bagian dari upaya memperkuat kepercayaan publik dan daya tarik investasi.

Prabowo menilai akses informasi yang makin terbuka menuntut pemerintah untuk merespons cepat kebutuhan masyarakat agar kehadiran negara benar-benar dirasakan.

“Kami harus bereaksi cepat agar mereka merasa bahwa pemerintah pusat dan Presiden mereka mendengarkan dan bertindak,” tandas Prabowo.

title: Purbaya opens up about reasons for maximizing 2025 APBN deficit to almost 3%
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Minister of Finance (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa finally revealed the reason the budget deficit in 2025 could reach 2.92% of gross domestic product (GDP).

Purbaya said that last year's budget deficit, which almost touched the 3% limit, was deliberately maximized to ensure a reversal in the direction of economic growth.

As a result, the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) reported that the economy grew 5.11% throughout the year and reached a post-pandemic high in the fourth quarter of 2025, namely 5.39%.

"That's actually a very smart strategy. We don't exceed the 3% [limit], expand fiscally, give stimulus to the economy, the economy will return. We just have to run, we just have to manage the future as to what the economy will be like," said Purbaya, quoted on Thursday (19/2/2025).

On the other hand, Purbaya also said that the central government debt ratio was still within safe limits even though the figure had reached 40.46% of gross domestic product (GDP).

He then compared it with several Southeast Asian countries such as Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand whose debt ratios are above 50%.

Also Read

"It's okay. So what? Singapore? How much? [More than 100%]. Malaysia how much? [More than 60%]. Thailand how much? Just check Thailand how much. With that standard, we are still safe," explained Purbaya to journalists after the Sumatra Post-Disaster Recovery Task Force coordination meeting (coordination meeting) with the DPR at the Senayan Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) emphasized that the Indonesian government needs to be careful in expanding capital expenditure in order to encourage economic growth to realize the target of becoming a developed country by 2045.

Based on the Selected Issues Paper report entitled Golden Vision 2045: Making the Most Out of Public Investment which was released in early February 2026, the IMF estimates that Indonesia needs real gross domestic product (GDP) growth in the range of 5.5% to 6.5% every year for the next two decades to achieve high-income country status in accordance with the vision of Golden Indonesia 2045.

To achieve that, the IMF identified increasing public investment as its main pillar. However, capital expenditure expansion must be accompanied by an increase in tax revenues so that the APBN deficit does not exceed the 3% threshold of gross domestic product (GDP).

The IMF report underlines that revenue mobilization is an absolute requirement to create loose fiscal space for the expansion of infrastructure and public projects.

"Mobilization of additional revenues will create the fiscal space needed to increase the scale of public investment while maintaining compliance with Indonesia's long-standing fiscal rules," explained the IMF research team consisting of Tsendsuren Batsuuri, Raju Huidrom and Philippe Wingender in the report, quoted on Saturday (14/2/2026).

In the framework of its macroeconomic simulations, the institution headquartered in Washington D.C. It projects that various domestic revenue extraction measures could contribute incremental state revenues of around 0.3 percentage points of GDP.

As an illustrative instrument, the IMF model offers the option of increasing employee income tax (labor income tax) to reduce the government's dependence on deficit financing. However, the IMF provides thick notes regarding the stages of the execution of this tax policy.

The IMF formulated that the initial surge in public investment funding be financed entirely through the budget deficit. As time goes by and the wheels of the economy begin to turn faster due to this investment, labor income tax collection is gradually increased.

This strategy of delaying the tax burden at the start is considered crucial so that tax pressure does not injure or put a brake on the rate of economic growth which is just about to take off.

Through a combination of these maneuvers, the overall fiscal deficit posture is believed to be maintained below 3%, based on the baseline realization of the 2024 APBN deficit at the level of 2.3% of GDP.

Moreover, the IMF emphasized that if the government combines this with structural reform, economic growth will accelerate and revenues will in turn further reduce the deficit.

"Increasing efficiency will require strengthening public investment management practices across all levels of government, improving project selection through rigorous project assessments that take into account positive spillover impacts, while ensuring agile oversight safeguards to minimize risks while avoiding bottlenecks," the report concludes.

Meanwhile, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa believes that increasing the role of the private sector in economic activities will help reduce the APBN deficit as well as the government debt ratio.

Purbaya does not deny that he is currently concerned about the fiscal deficit which is at risk of exceeding the 3% of GDP limit. Nevertheless, he believes that accelerated economic growth can be realized without having to violate the APBN deficit limit.

He reflected on the era of the administration of the 6th President of the Republic of Indonesia Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono (SBY), where the economy was able to grow at 6%, while the debt to GDP ratio actually shrank to 23%.

"Why? Because the private sector is working, so that could happen. If I combined the private and government sectors, the nominal debt could be flat, but the economy would grow faster," he told journalists after the Indonesia Economic Outlook event at Wisma Danantara, Jakarta, quoted on Saturday (14/2/2026).

Currently, the government debt ratio is around 40% of GDP. Regarding efforts to reduce this ratio, Purbaya explained the natural mechanism of economic growth.

According to him, if GDP grows faster then mathematically the denominator of debt becomes larger, so the debt ratio automatically decreases. On the other hand, escalating economic growth will also increase tax revenues.

Furthermore, the former chairman of the board of commissioners of the Deposit Insurance Corporation underlined that an economy driven by the private sector has historically produced a higher tax ratio, aka tax to GDP ratio.

The reason, continued Purbaya, is that private entities tend to have limitations in requesting various incentives or tax cuts compared to government projects. Purbaya compared that the average tax ratio during the SBY administration era was around 0.5% to 1% higher compared to the era of President Joko Widodo.

"That's almost automatic. If I get an additional ratio of just 0.5% from economic growth, I can get additional tax revenue of around Rp. 100 trillion. So there is hope there as long as we improve it in the future," he explained.

To ensure that the tax ratio really rises along with the movement of private machines, the Ministry of Finance is also carrying out internal improvements in state revenue collecting institutions.

Purbaya emphasized that his party had carried out a 'clean up' of the organization by rotating dozens of officials at the Directorate General of Customs and Excise and the Directorate General of Taxes to optimize collection performance.

He also admitted that he was optimistic that the strategy to encourage the private sector could produce results, reflecting on the achievement of economic growth in the fourth quarter of 2025 which successfully reached 5.39%, higher than the previous quarters.

"It's not easy, but I'm sure that with yesterday's results [in the fourth quarter of 2025], it looks like our movement in that direction is correct," said Purbaya.

"Itu sebetulnya strategi yang amat smart. Kami enggak lewatin [batas] 3%, ekspansi fiskal, kasih stimulus ke ekonomi, ekonominya balik. Tinggal kami lari, tinggal atur ke depan seperti apa yang ramai ekonominya," tutur Purbaya dikutip, Kamis (19/2/2025).

Di sisi lain, Purbaya juga mengatakan bahwa rasio utang pemerintah pusat masih dalam batas aman kendati angkanya telah menembus 40,46% dari produk domestik bruto (PDB).

Dia kemudian membandingkannya dengan beberapa negara kawasan Asia Tenggara seperti Singapura, Malaysia dan Thailand yang rasio utangnya berada di atas 50%.

  • Resep Jaga Defisit APBN di Bawah 3% dari IMF Dukung Ekspansi Fiskal
  • Ekspansi Fiskal, IMF Beberkan Skenario Agar Defisit APBN Tetap di Bawah 3%
  • Ruang Fiskal Terbatas, RUU Keuangan Negara Bergulir, Akankah Batas Defisit Diperlebar?

"Enggak apa-apa. Memang kenapa? Singapura berapa? [Lebih dari 100%]. Malaysia berapa? [Lebih dari 60%]. Thailand berapa? Coba cek aja Thailand berapa. Dengan standar itu, kami masih aman," terangnya Purbaya kepada wartawan usai rapat koordinasi (rakor) Satgas Pemulihan Pascabencana Sumatra bersama DPR di Kompleks Parlemen Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Saran dari IMF

Adapun Dana Moneter Internasional (IMF) menekankan pemerintah Indonesia perlu berhati-hati melakukan ekspansi belanja modal demi mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi untuk mewujudkan target menjadi negara maju pada 2045.

Berdasarkan laporan Selected Issues Paper bertajuk Golden Vision 2045: Making The Most Out of Public Investment yang dirilis awal Februari 2026, IMF menaksir Indonesia membutuhkan pertumbuhan produk domestik bruto (PDB) riil di kisaran 5,5% hingga 6,5% setiap tahunnya selama dua dekade ke depan untuk mencapai status negara berpendapatan tinggi sesuai visi Indonesia Emas 2045.

Untuk mencapai itu, IMF mengidentifikasi peningkatan investasi publik sebagai pilar utamanya. Kendati demikian, ekspansi belanja modal itu wajib berbarengan dengan peningkatan penerimaan pajak agar defisit APBN tidak melampaui ambang batas 3% terhadap produk domestik bruto (PDB).

Laporan IMF menggarisbawahi bahwa mobilisasi penerimaan adalah syarat mutlak guna menciptakan ruang fiskal yang longgar bagi ekspansi proyek infrastruktur dan publik.

"Mobilisasi tambahan penerimaan akan menciptakan ruang fiskal yang dibutuhkan untuk meningkatkan skala investasi publik sembari mempertahankan kepatuhan terhadap aturan fiskal Indonesia yang telah berjalan lama," papar tim peneliti IMF yang beranggotakan Tsendsuren Batsuuri, Raju Huidrom, dan Philippe Wingender dalam laporan tersebut, dikutip Sabtu (14/2/2026).

Dalam kerangka simulasi makroekonominya, lembaga yang bermarkas di Washington D.C. tersebut memproyeksikan bahwa berbagai langkah ekstraksi penerimaan domestik dapat menyumbang tambahan pendapatan negara secara bertahap sekitar 0,3 poin persentase dari PDB.

Sebagai salah satu instrumen ilustratif, model IMF menyodorkan opsi peningkatan pajak penghasilan karyawan (labor income tax) untuk mengurangi ketergantungan pemerintah pada pembiayaan defisit. Meski demikian, IMF memberikan catatan tebal terkait tahapan dari eksekusi kebijakan perpajakan ini.

IMF merumuskan agar lonjakan awal pendanaan investasi publik dibiayai sepenuhnya lewat defisit anggaran. Seiring dengan berjalannya waktu dan roda ekonomi yang mulai berputar lebih kencang akibat investasi tersebut, barulah penarikan pajak penghasilan tenaga kerja ditingkatkan secara bertahap.

Strategi penundaan beban pajak di awal ini dinilai krusial agar tekanan pajak tidak mencederai atau mengerem laju pertumbuhan ekonomi yang baru saja akan lepas landas.

Melalui kombinasi manuver tersebut, postur defisit fiskal secara keseluruhan diyakini akan tetap terjaga di bawah 3%, berdasarkan baseline realisasi defisit APBN 2024 di level 2,3% dari PDB.

Terlebih, IMF menekankan jika pemerintah mengkombinasikannya dengan reformasi struktural maka pertumbuhan ekonomi akan semakin terakselerasi dan penerimaan yang pada gilirannya akan semakin menekan defisit.

"Peningkatan efisiensi akan membutuhkan penguatan praktik manajemen investasi publik di seluruh tingkat pemerintahan, meningkatkan seleksi proyek melalui penilaian proyek yang ketat dengan mempertimbangkan dampak rambatan positif, sembari memastikan perlindungan pengawasan yang tangkas untuk meminimalkan risiko sekaligus menghindari hambatan," simpul laporan tersebut.

Strategi Purbaya Tekan Defisit

Sementara itu, Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa meyakini peningkatan peran swasta dalam aktivitas perekonomian akan ikut menekan defisit APBN sekaligus rasio utang pemerintah.

Purbaya tidak menampik bahwa saat ini kekhawatiran terhadap defisit fiskal yang berisiko melewati batas 3% dari PDB. Kendati demikian, dia meyakini akselerasi pertumbuhan ekonomi bisa terealisasi tanpa harus melanggar batas defisit APBN.

Dia berkaca pada era pemerintahan Presiden ke-6 RI Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono (SBY), yang mana ekonomi mampu tumbuh di level 6%, sementara rasio utang terhadap PDB justru menyusut ke level 23%.

"Kenapa? Karena yang bergerak sektor swasta, jadi itu bisa terjadi. Kalau saya gabung sektor swasta dan pemerintah, bisa saja nominal utangnya flat [rata], tetapi ekonominya tumbuh lebih cepat," ujarnya kepada wartawan usai acara Indonesia Economic Outlook di Wisma Danantara, Jakarta, dikutip Sabtu (14/2/2026).

Saat ini, rasio utang pemerintah berada di kisaran 40% terhadap PDB. Terkait upaya menurunkan rasio tersebut, Purbaya menjelaskan mekanisme alamiah dari pertumbuhan ekonomi.

Menurutnya, jika PDB tumbuh lebih cepat maka secara matematis pembagi (denominator) utang menjadi lebih besar, sehingga rasio utang otomatis mengecil. Di sisi lain, eskalasi pertumbuhan ekonomi juga akan mengerek penerimaan pajak. 

Lebih lanjut, mantan ketua dewan komisioner Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan itu menggarisbawahi bahwa perekonomian yang disetir oleh sektor swasta secara historis menghasilkan tax ratio alias rasio pajak terhadap PDB yang lebih tinggi.

Alasannya, sambung Purbaya, entitas swasta cenderung memiliki keterbatasan dalam meminta berbagai insentif atau potongan pajak dibandingkan dengan proyek-proyek pemerintah. Purbaya membandingkan, rata-rata tax ratio pada era pemerintahan SBY lebih tinggi sekitar 0,5% hingga 1% dibandingkan dengan era Presiden Joko Widodo.

"Itu saja hampir otomatis. Kalau saya dapat tambahan rasio 0,5% saja dari pertumbuhan ekonomi, saya dapat tambahan penerimaan perpajakan sekitar Rp100 triliun. Jadi ada harapan ke sana selama kita perbaiki ke depannya," jelasnya.

Untuk memastikan rasio pajak benar-benar terkerek naik seiring bergeraknya mesin swasta, Kementerian Keuangan juga tengah melakukan pembenahan internal di institusi pengumpul penerimaan negara.

Purbaya menegaskan bahwa pihaknya telah melakukan 'bersih-bersih' organisasi lewat rotasi puluhan pejabat di Direktorat Jenderal Bea dan Cukai dan Direktorat Jenderal Pajak untuk mengoptimalkan kinerja pungutan.

Dia pun mengaku optimis strategi memacu swasta bisa membuahkan hasil, berkaca capaian pertumbuhan ekonomi pada kuartal IV/2025 yang sukses menembus 5,39%, lebih tinggi dari kuartal-kuartal sebelumnya.

"Memang enggak gampang, tapi saya yakin dengan hasil kemarin [di kuartal IV/2025], kayaknya pergerakan kita ke arah sana sudah benar," ujar Purbaya.

title: RI Collaborates with US to Build Semiconductor Industry Worth IDR 82.88 Trillion in Batam
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Indonesia is starting a new chapter in the development of the semiconductor industry by collaborating with investors from the United States (US). This project with an initial investment value of US$4.9 billion or around Rp. 82.88 trillion (assuming an exchange rate of Rp. 16,915 per US$) was initiated by PT Galang Bumi Industri as the manager of the Wiraraja GESEIP National Strategic Project (PSN) together with US strategic partners.

Meanwhile, the cooperation agreement was also witnessed directly by President RI Prabowo Subianto at the Indonesia-US Business Summit which was held at the US. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., United States, Wednesday (18/2/2026) evening local time.

President Director of PT Galang Bumi Industri Akhmad Ma'ruf Maulana said that this collaboration was a concrete step in downstreaming green energy-based industries and semiconductor technology in Indonesia.

"The ecosystem built within PSN Wiraraja GESEIP includes the downstreaming of quartz silica into high added value products, starting from refining glass raw materials to producing polysilicon for semiconductor and solar cell needs," said Ma'ruf in a written statement received by Bisnis, Thursday (19/2/2026).

The signing of a strategic business agreement between PSN Wiraraja Green Renewable Energy & Smart Eco-Industrial Park (GESEIP) in Galang, Batam marks a new chapter in high-tech industrial collaboration and sustainable energy between Indonesia and the United States.

This project collaborates with a number of strategic partners, including Essence Global Group and Tynergy Technology Corporation USA. The Joint Development Agreement was officially signed on February 18 2026 as well as a follow-up agreement with Tynergy Technology Corp.

Also Read

He explained that his party together with the Tynergy Group of Companies (PT Tynergy Technology Group – Indonesia) would develop a downstream ecosystem which includes refining quartz silica for the glass industry through PT Quantum Luminous Indonesia, as well as refining polysilicon through PT Essence Global Indonesia.

"In the initial stage, the investment value disbursed reached US$4.9 billion," he said.

If the initial stage goes smoothly, an additional investment of US$ 26.7 billion will be realized to produce wafer ingots, wafer slicing, and fabrication to complete the integrated semiconductor production cycle in Indonesia.

In the signed agreement, it is stated that the cooperation includes investment and development of manufacturing infrastructure in Galang, expansion of renewable energy projects, workforce development, as well as research and development of cutting-edge technology.

Tynergy Technology Corp's initial investment is targeted at US$ 250 million for the construction of manufacturing facilities in Galang with a projected creation of around 2,500 skilled jobs.

To ensure adequate energy supply, Tynergy Group will also form PT Energy Tech Indonesia to build a sodium ion-based energy storage facility with a capacity of up to 150 MW of sustainable energy to support industrial area operations.

In addition, in order to facilitate the transfer of semiconductor and solar cell technology, Tynergy Technology Corporation USA formed a development collaboration between two free economic zones, namely PSN Wiraraja GESEIP in Galang, Batam, and Solanna Akimel 7 Technopark in the Phoenix metropolitan area, Arizona.

This commitment to transnational cooperation is also confirmed in the Transnational Special Economic Zone Friendship Pact between the two regions.

Ma'ruf believes this collaboration will strengthen Indonesia's position in the global supply chain of the semiconductor and renewable energy industries, as well as support the agenda for developing data centers based on artificial intelligence (AI) and the sustainable energy transition in both countries.

On the same occasion, Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto welcomed the signing of the agreement which took place at the US Chamber & Commerce office as a concrete form of eco-diplomacy nomi and strengthening the strategic partnership between Indonesia and the United States.

It is hoped that this large investment in the downstream and green energy sectors will be able to encourage national economic growth, expand employment opportunities and strengthen the competitiveness of Indonesian industry at the global level.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Indonesia memulai babak baru pengembangan industri semikonduktor dengan menggandeng investor Amerika Serikat (AS). Proyek dengan nilai investasi awal US$4,9 miliar atau sekitar Rp82,88 triliun (asumsi kurs Rp16.915 per US$) ini diinisiasi PT Galang Bumi Industri sebagai pengelola Proyek Strategis Nasional (PSN) Wiraraja GESEIP bersama mitra strategis AS. 

Adapun, kesepakatan kerja sama tersebut juga disaksikan langsung oleh Presiden RI Prabowo Subianto dalam ajang Indonesia–US Business Summit yang digelar di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Amerika Serikat, Rabu (18/2/2026) malam waktu setempat. 

Direktur Utama PT Galang Bumi Industri Akhmad Ma'ruf Maulana mengatakan bahwa kerja sama tersebut merupakan langkah konkret hilirisasi industri berbasis energi hijau dan teknologi semikonduktor di Indonesia.

"Ekosistem yang dibangun dalam PSN Wiraraja GESEIP ini mencakup hilirisasi kuarsa silika menjadi produk bernilai tambah tinggi, mulai dari pemurnian bahan baku kaca hingga produksi polysilicon untuk kebutuhan semikonduktor dan solar cell," kata Ma'ruf dalam keterangan tertulis yang diterima Bisnis, Kamis (19/2/2026). 

Penandatanganan perjanjian bisnis strategis antara PSN Wiraraja Green Renewable Energy & Smart Eco-Industrial Park (GESEIP) di Galang, Batam ini menandai babak baru kolaborasi industri berteknologi tinggi dan energi berkelanjutan antara Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat.

Proyek ini menggandeng sejumlah mitra strategis, termasuk Essence Global Group dan Tynergy Technology Corporation USA. Perjanjian Pengembangan Bersama (Joint Development Agreement) tersebut secara resmi ditandatangani pada 18 Februari 2026 serta perjanjian lanjutan dengan Tynergy Technology Corp.

Baca Juga

  • AS hingga China Ramai-ramai Bangun Pabrik Semikonduktor di RI
  • Prabowo Dorong Industri Chip Semikonduktor untuk Otomotif dan Elektronik
  • RI Mulai Genjot Industri Semikonduktor, Investasi Jumbo AS-Jerman Masuk Batam

Dia menerangkan, pihaknya bersama dengan Tynergy Group of Companies (PT Tynergy Technology Group – Indonesia) akan mengembangkan ekosistem hilirisasi yang mencakup pemurnian kuarsa silika untuk industri kaca melalui PT Quantum Luminous Indonesia, serta pemurnian polysilicon melalui PT Essence Global Indonesia. 

"Pada tahap awal, nilai investasi yang digelontorkan mencapai US$4,9 miliar," tuturnya. 

Apabila tahap awal berjalan lancar, maka akan ada tambahan investasi sebesar US$26,7 miliar yang akan direalisasikan untuk memproduksi ingot wafer, wafer slicing, hingga fabrikasi untuk melengkapi siklus produksi semikonduktor secara terintegrasi di Indonesia.

Dalam perjanjian yang ditandatangani, disebutkan bahwa kerja sama mencakup investasi dan pengembangan infrastruktur manufaktur di Galang, perluasan proyek energi terbarukan, pengembangan tenaga kerja, serta riset dan pengembangan teknologi mutakhir. 

Investasi awal Tynergy Technology Corp ditargetkan hingga US$250 juta untuk pembangunan fasilitas manufaktur di Galang dengan proyeksi penciptaan sekitar 2.500 lapangan kerja terampil. 

Untuk menjamin pasokan energi yang memadai, Tynergy Group juga akan membentuk PT Energy Tech Indonesia guna membangun fasilitas penyimpanan energi berbasis sodium ion dengan kapasitas hingga 150 MW energi berkelanjutan untuk mendukung operasional kawasan industri.

Selain itu, guna memperlancar transfer teknologi semikonduktor dan sel surya, Tynergy Technology Corporation USA membentuk kerja sama pengembangan antara dua zona ekonomi bebas, yakni PSN Wiraraja GESEIP di Galang, Batam, dan Solanna Akimel 7 Technopark di kawasan metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona. 

Komitmen kerja sama transnasional tersebut juga ditegaskan dalam Pakta Persahabatan Zona Ekonomi Khusus Transnasional antara kedua kawasan.

title_original: RI Gandeng AS Bangun Industri Semikonduktor Senilai Rp82,88 Triliun di Batam
content_original:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Indonesia memulai babak baru pengembangan industrisemikonduktordengan menggandeng investorAmerika Serikat(AS). Proyek dengan nilai investasi awal US$4,9 miliar atau sekitar Rp82,88 triliun (asumsi kurs Rp16.915 per US$) ini diinisiasi PT Galang Bumi Industri sebagai pengelola Proyek Strategis Nasional (PSN) Wiraraja GESEIP bersama mitra strategis AS.

Adapun, kesepakatan kerja sama tersebut juga disaksikan langsung oleh Presiden RIPrabowo Subiantodalam ajang Indonesia–US Business Summit yang digelar di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Amerika Serikat, Rabu (18/2/2026) malam waktu setempat.

Direktur Utama PT Galang Bumi Industri Akhmad Ma'ruf Maulana mengatakan bahwa kerja sama tersebut merupakan langkah konkret hilirisasi industri berbasis energi hijau dan teknologi semikonduktor di Indonesia.

"Ekosistem yang dibangun dalam PSN Wiraraja GESEIP ini mencakup hilirisasi kuarsa silika menjadi produk bernilai tambah tinggi, mulai dari pemurnian bahan baku kaca hingga produksipolysiliconuntuk kebutuhan semikonduktor dansolar cell," kata Ma'ruf dalam keterangan tertulis yang diterimaBisnis, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Penandatanganan perjanjian bisnis strategis antara PSN Wiraraja Green Renewable Energy & Smart Eco-Industrial Park (GESEIP) di Galang, Batam ini menandai babak baru kolaborasi industri berteknologi tinggi dan energi berkelanjutan antara Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat.

Proyek ini menggandeng sejumlah mitra strategis, termasuk Essence Global Group dan Tynergy Technology Corporation USA. Perjanjian Pengembangan Bersama (Joint Development Agreement) tersebut secara resmi ditandatangani pada 18 Februari 2026 serta perjanjian lanjutan dengan Tynergy Technology Corp.

title: OPINION: Business Competition Law Reform
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - The DPR is currently processing the Draft Third Amendment to Law no. 5 of 1999 concerning Prohibition of Monopolistic Practices and Unfair Business Competition. After a quarter century, this update is an important step in responding to new economic challenges, especially large digital platforms and increasingly complex market structures.

The DPR is currently processing the Draft Third Amendment to Law no. 5 of 1999 concerning Prohibition of Monopoly Practices and Unfair Business Competition. After a quarter century, this update is an important step in responding to new economic challenges, especially large digital platforms and increasingly complex market structures.

For the wider community, competition issues may feel far from everyday life. In fact, when unfair competition occurs, the consequences are immediately felt by consumers. Therefore, effective competition law is a prerequisite for a healthy and inclusive economy.

Competition law is a mix of economics and law. That's why many countries place economic analysis at the heart of modern competition law enforcement. The goal is simple: to protect competition in the public interest, not specific business actors. This law assesses whether a behavior harms consumers and hinders competition. The approach is based on economic impact, and this has become best practice at the global level.

So the core issue is the quality of law enforcement, not just the content of the text of the law. No matter how good the new law is, it will be dull if it is operated by institutions that are not equipped with adequate evidentiary standards. Revision of Law no. 5/1999 provides an opportunity for Indonesia to align itself with these standards. The success of reform depends not only on the content of the law, but on the way authorities implement it.

So far, Indonesia has adhered to an integrated enforcement model where one institution (KPPU) acts as investigator, prosecutor and case decider. This model can work well, but requires three main conditions: strong economic competence, clear procedures, and an effective court objection mechanism. Because the KPPU has the same function as investigator and judge, the objection mechanism in court must be strengthened in order to maintain legal certainty.

Also Read

In the political economy and legal literature, the quality of competition law enforcement is understood as part of the quality of institutions and governance. This quality is determined not only by the existence of laws, but also by consistency of implementation, procedural transparency, legal certainty, and protection against enforcement errors (especially false positives).

False positives about pro-competitive behavior will create a long-term deterrent effect. Business actors, including foreign investors, will avoid jurisdictions that have this risk.

In the ASEAN context, this effect is strengthened by the fact that investors have many options in the same region. If the risk of false positives in one country is considered high, investors will choose to invest in other Asean countries where law enforcement is more predictable.

COMPETITION IN ASEAN

Within the framework of the Asean Economic Community (AEC), foreign investors no longer view Asean countries as independent markets, but as regional investment spaces that compete with each other. They compared the costs, risks and quality of institutions between Asean countries.

Consequently, differences in the quality of competition law enforcement are one of the main differentiating factors in determining the allocation of foreign investment (PMA) in this region. Investors are very sensitive to regulatory uncertainty and competition law enforcement which is considered to exceed reasonable limits. In this context, competition law enforcement is not only an instrument for protecting the domestic market, but also an institutional signal for foreign investors.

In the Asean region, Vietnam is a country that investors tend to perceive as a more cautious jurisdiction in enforcing competition and pro-investment laws. In contrast, Indonesia is perceived as a jurisdiction with active enforcement but with a higher risk of uncertainty.

Currently, the number of FDI in Indonesia still beats Vietnam. Our government put a figure of 38.9 trillion U.S. dollars for 2025, while Vietnam recorded a figure of 31.52 trillion U.S. dollars. for the same time period. However, strengthening Vietnam's competition policy will continue to be a pulling factor for FDI, especially in the high-tech sector.

In many countries, the combination of strong laws and competent authorities has been proven to improve market quality. Therefore, the revision of Law 5/1999 is an important momentum to ensure that Indonesia has competition law that is modern, balanced, and able to respond to the needs of the times. The DPR's steps need to be supported, by strengthening institutional competence, not just the authority of the KPPU. Without that, the big goal of strengthening competition and making the economy healthy will be difficult to realize.

In the end, healthy business competition belongs to us all. He determines the prices of goods, the quality of services, and business opportunities for the younger generation. This is the time for Indonesia to build a solid competition law foundation, not only on paper, but also in its implementation.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - DPR tengah memroses Rancangan Perubahan Ketiga UU No. 5 Tahun 1999 tentang Larangan Praktik Monopoli dan Persaingan Usaha Tidak Sehat. Setelah seperempat abad, pembaruan ini menjadi langkah penting menjawab tantangan ekonomi baru, terutama platform digital besar dan struktur pasar yang makin kompleks.

DPR tengah memroses Rancangan Perubahan Ketiga UU No. 5 Tahun 1999 tentang Larangan Praktik Monopoli dan Persaingan Usaha Tidak Sehat. Setelah seperempat abad, pembaruan ini menjadi langkah penting menjawab tantangan ekonomi baru, terutama platform digital besar dan struktur pasar yang makin kompleks.

Bagi masyarakat luas, isu persaingan mungkin terasa jauh dari keseharian. Padahal, ketika persaingan tidak sehat terjadi, konsekuensinya langsung dirasakan konsumen. Karena itu, hukum persaingan yang efektif menjadi prasyarat ekonomi yang sehat dan inklusif.

Hukum persaingan adalah bauran antara ekonomi dan hukum. Itu sebabnya banyak negara menempatkan analisis ekonomi sebagai inti penegakan hukum persaingan modern. Tujuannya sederhana: melindungi persaingan demi kepentingan publik, bukan pelaku usaha tertentu. Hukum ini menilai apakah suatu perilaku merugikan konsumen dan menghambat persaingan. Pendekatannya berbasis dampak ekonomi, dan ini telah menjadi praktik terbaik di tingkat global.

Maka persoalan intinya adalah kualitas penegakan hukum tersebut, bukan sekadar isi teks undang-undang. Sebagus apa pun UU baru nanti, ia akan tumpul jika dioperasikan oleh lembaga yang tidak diperlengkapi standar pembuktian yang memadai. Revisi UU No. 5/1999 memberi kesempatan bagi Indonesia untuk menyelaraskan diri dengan standar tersebut. Keberhasilan reformasi tak hanya bergantung pada isi UU, tetapi pada cara otoritas menjalankannya.

Selama ini, Indonesia menganut model penegakan terintegrasi di mana satu lembaga (KPPU) bertindak sebagai penyelidik, penuntut, sekaligus pemutus perkara. Model ini dapat bekerja dengan baik, tetapi memerlukan tiga syarat utama: kompetensi ekonomi yang kuat, prosedur yang jelas, dan mekanisme keberatan ke pengadilan yang efektif. Karena KPPU merangkap fungsi penyelidik dan pemutus, mekanisme keberatan di pengadilan harus diperkuat demi menjaga kepastian hukum.

Baca Juga

  • Ini Alasan Dugaan Pelanggaran Persaingan Usaha Bunga Pinjol Tak Tepat
  • KPPU Dukung Purbaya Tindak Impor Baju Bekas: Merusak Persaingan Usaha
  • Polemik Pembatasan Impor BBM SPBU Swasta dan Ancaman Persaingan Usaha

Dalam literatur ekonomi politik dan hukum, kualitas penegakan hukum persaingan dipahami sebagai bagian dari kualitas institusi dan tata kelola (governance). Kualitas ini tidak hanya ditentukan oleh keberadaan undang-undang, tetapi juga oleh konsistensi penerapan, transparansi prosedural, kepastian hukum, dan perlindungan terhadap kesalahan penegakan (khususnya false positives).

False positives terhadap perilaku pro-persaingan akan menciptakan efek gentar jangka panjang. Pelaku usaha, termasuk investor asing, akan menghindari yurisdiksi yang memiliki risiko ini.

Dalam konteks Asean, efek ini diperkuat oleh fakta bahwa investor memiliki banyak opsi di kawasan yang sama. Jika risiko false positives di satu negara dianggap tinggi, investor akan memilih untuk menanamkan modal di negara Asean lain yang penegakan hukumnya lebih dapat diprediksi.

PERSAINGAN DI ASEAN

Dalam kerangka Asean Economic Community (AEC), investor asing tidak lagi memandang negara-negara Asean sebagai pasar yang berdiri sendiri, melainkan sebagai ruang investasi regional yang saling bersaing. Mereka membandingkan dengan biaya, risiko, dan kualitas institusi antarnegara Asean.

Konsekuensinya, perbedaan kualitas penegakan hukum persaingan menjadi salah satu faktor pembeda utama dalam penentuan alokasi penanaman modal asing (PMA) di kawasan ini. Investor sangat sensitif terhadap ketidakpastian regulasi dan penegakan hukum persaingan yang dianggap melebihi batas kewajaran. Dalam konteks ini, penegakan hukum persaingan tidak saja menjadi instrumen perlindungan pasar domestik, tetapi juga sebagai sinyal institusional bagi investor asing.

Di kawasan Asean, Vietnam adalah negara yang cenderung dipersepsikan investor sebagai yurisdiksi yang lebih berhati-hati dalam menegakkan hukum persaingan dan pro-investasi. Sebaliknya, Indonesia dipersepsikan sebagai yurisdiksi dengan penegakan aktif tetapi dengan risiko ketidakpastian yang lebih tinggi.

Saat ini, jumlah PMA di Indonesia masih mengalahkan Vietnam. Pemerintah kita menyebutkan angka 38,9 triliun dolar AS untuk tahun 2025, sedangkan Vietnam mencatat angka 31.52 triliun dolar A.S. untuk periode waktu yang sama. Namun, penguatan kebijakan persaingan Vietnam akan terus menjadi faktor penarik PMA, terutama di sektor teknologi tinggi.

Di berbagai negara, kombinasi antara UU yang kuat dan otoritas yang kompeten terbukti meningkatkan kualitas pasar. Oleh karena itu, revisi UU 5/1999 menjadi momentum penting untuk memastikan bahwa Indonesia memiliki hukum persaingan yang modern, berimbang, dan mampu menjawab kebutuhan zaman. Langkah DPR perlu didukung, dengan penguatan kompetensi kelembagaan, bukan sekadar kewenangan KPPU. Tanpa itu, tujuan besar memperkuat persaingan dan menyehatkan ekonomi sulit diwujudkan.

Pada akhirnya, persaingan usaha yang sehat adalah milik kita bersama. Ia menentukan harga barang, kualitas layanan, hingga kesempatan usaha generasi muda. Inilah saatnya Indonesia membangun fondasi hukum persaingan yang kokoh, tidak hanya di atas kertas, tetapi juga dalam pelaksanaannya.

title: Freeport Agrees to Give an Additional 12% Free Shares to RI
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX) officially signed an agreement regarding the divestment of an additional 12% of PT Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) shares with the Indonesian government.

This agreement is contained in a memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding the extension of PTFI's operating rights which was signed as part of the Indonesia–US Business Summit agenda at the US. Chamber of Commerce, Washington, D.C., Wednesday (18/2) local time. The signing was also witnessed by President Prabowo Subianto.

The MoU states that FCX will transfer 12% of its share ownership in PTFI to the Indonesian government at no cost.

However, the party receiving the shares is obliged to reimburse FCX for the proportional costs incurred based on book value, for investments whose benefits will continue after 2041.

Meanwhile, the new share transfer process will be carried out in 2041. Therefore, FCX will still maintain its current ownership in PTFI of 48.76% until 2041. Later, FCX's ownership of PTFI shares after 2041 will be around 37%.

"The current governance and operational structure, as well as the provisions in the shareholder agreement, IUPK [special mining business permit], and other agreements that are still valid, will continue to operate throughout the life of the reserve," wrote FCX management in an official statement, quoted Thursday (19/2/2026).

Also Read

As part of the agreement, PTFI will be given an extension of operating rights for the life of the reserves in the Grasberg mineral area after 2041.

By signing this MoU, PTFI will immediately complete the IUPK extension application process in accordance with the agreed provisions.
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX) resmi menandatangani kesepakatan terkait divestasi tambahan 12% saham PT Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) dengan pemerintah Indonesia.

Kesepakatan tersebut tertuang dalam nota kesepahaman atau memorandum of understanding (MoU) terkait perpanjangan hak operasi PTFI yang ditandatangani dalam rangkaian agenda Indonesia–US Business Summit di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington, D.C., Rabu (18/2) waktu setempat. Penandatanganan turut disaksikan oleh Presiden Prabowo Subianto.

Dalam MoU ditegaskan bahwa FCX akan mengalihkan 12% kepemilikan sahamnya di PTFI kepada pemerintah Indonesia tanpa biaya.

Namun, pihak yang menerima saham tersebut wajib mengganti kepada FCX biaya proporsional yang telah dikeluarkan berdasarkan nilai buku, untuk investasi yang manfaatnya masih berlanjut setelah tahun 2041.

Adapun, proses pengalihan saham baru dilakukan pada 2041. Oleh karena itu, FCX masih akan mempertahankan kepemilikan saat ini di PTFI sebesar 48,76% hingga 2041. Nantinya, kepemilikan FCX pada saham PTFI selepas 2041 menjadi sekitar 37%.

title: Freeport-RI Agree to Extend Mining Permit After 2041, Reserve Life Contract
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX) and the Indonesian government officially signed a memorandum of understanding or memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding the extension of the operating rights of PTFreeport Indonesia (PTFI) for the life of the reserves in the Grasberg mineral area.

There are six points of agreement contained in the MoU. First, PTFI's Special Mining Business License (IUPK) will be amended to provide an extension of operating rights for the life of the reserve.

Second, PTFI will increase support for the community in Papua, including funding support for the construction of a new hospital and two medical education facilities.

Third, PTFI will increase exploration spending and accelerate studies to identify and develop long-term resources and expansion opportunities.

Fourth, PTFI will continue to prioritize domestic downstreaming through domestic sales of processed copper, precious metals, sulfuric acid and other products. PTFI will also be in a position to expand the marketing of processed copper to the United States (US) according to market mechanisms if the US needs additional copper supplies.

Fifth, FCX will transfer 12% of its share ownership in PTFI to the Indonesian government without charge in 2041, provided that the recipient reimburses FCX for the proportional (pro-rata) costs that have been incurred based on the book value of investments that provide benefits for the period after 2041.

Also Read

Meanwhile, FCX will maintain its current ownership in PTFI of 48.76% until 2041 and to around 37% starting in 2042.

Sixth, the current governance and operational structure, as well as the provisions in the shareholder agreement, IUPK, and other agreements that are still in force, will continue to apply throughout the life of the reserve.

FCX Chairman Richard C. Adkerson and FCX President and Chief Executive Officer Kathleen Quirk expressed their appreciation for the long-term partnership with the Indonesian government and the people of Indonesia and Papua.

"Grasberg operations have provided significant benefits for all stakeholders over the last 6 decades, and this extension will provide an opportunity to continue creating great value for all stakeholders in one of the most significant copper and gold reserves in the world," said Freeport management in a written statement, quoted Thursday (19/2/2026).

The extension of operating rights and other agreed provisions are subject to the issuance of an IUPK which has been amended by the Indonesian Government.

By signing this MoU, PTFI will immediately complete the IUPK extension application process in accordance with the agreed provisions.

Terdapat enam poin kesepakatan yang tertuang dalam MoU tersebut. Pertama, Izin Usaha Pertambangan Khusus (IUPK) PTFI akan diamendemen untuk memberikan perpanjangan hak operasi selama umur cadangan.

Kedua,PTFI akan meningkatkan dukungan bagi masyarakat di Papua, termasuk dukungan pendanaan untuk pembangunan satu rumah sakit baru dan dua fasilitas pendidikan medis.

Ketiga, PTFI akan meningkatkan belanja eksplorasi serta mempercepat studi untuk mengidentifikasi dan mengembangkan sumber daya jangka panjang dan peluang ekspansi.

Keempat, PTFI akan terus memprioritaskan hilirisasi dalam negeri melalui penjualan domestik tembaga olahan, logam mulia, asam sulfat, dan produk lainnya. PTFI juga akan berada pada posisi untuk memperluas pemasaran tembaga olahan ke Amerika Serikat (AS) sesuai mekanisme pasar apabila AS membutuhkan tambahan pasokan tembaga.

Kelima, FCX akan mengalihkan 12% kepemilikan sahamnya di PTFI kepada pemerintah Indonesia tanpa biaya pada 2041, dengan ketentuan pihak penerima mengganti kepada FCX biaya proporsional (pro-rata) yang telah dikeluarkan berdasarkan nilai buku atas investasi yang memberikan manfaat untuk periode setelah 2041.

Adapun, FCX akan mempertahankan kepemilikan saat ini di PTFI sebesar 48,76% hingga 2041 dan menjadi sekitar 37% mulai 2042.

Keenam, struktur tata kelola dan operasional yang berlaku saat ini, serta ketentuan dalam perjanjian pemegang saham, IUPK, dan perjanjian lain yang masih berlaku, akan tetap berjalan selama umur cadangan.

Chairman FCX Richard C. Adkerson serta President dan Chief Executive Officer FCX Kathleen Quirk menyampaikan apresiasinya atas kemitraan jangka panjang dengan pemerintah Indonesia dan masyarakat Indonesia serta Papua. 

“Operasi Grasberg telah memberikan manfaat yang signifikan bagi seluruh pemangku kepentingan selama 6 dekade terakhir, dan perpanjangan ini akan memberikan peluang untuk terus menciptakan nilai yang besar bagi seluruh pemangku kepentingan di salah satu cadangan tembaga dan emas paling signifikan di dunia," ujar manajemen Freeport melalui keterangan tertulis, dikutip Kamis (19/2/2026).

Perpanjangan hak operasi dan ketentuan lain yang telah disepakati tersebut tunduk pada penerbitan IUPK yang telah diubah oleh Pemerintah Indonesia.

Dengan penandatanganan MoU ini, PTFI segera menyelesaikan proses pengajuan perpanjangan IUPK sesuai dengan ketentuan yang telah disepakati.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Menjelang Hari Raya Idulfitri 2026, pencairan Tunjangan Hari Raya (THR) bagi Pegawai Negeri Sipil (PNS) kembali menjadi perhatian publik. THR bukan hanya membantu memenuhi kebutuhan Lebaran, tetapi juga berperan menjaga daya beli masyarakat dan mendorong perputaran ekonomi nasional.

Untuk tahun 2026, skema THR PNS mengacu pada Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 11 Tahun 2025. Meski nominal resminya masih menunggu pengumuman pemerintah, gambaran komponen dan perhitungannya sudah dapat diprediksi berdasarkan regulasi tersebut.

Jadwal THR PNS 2026 

Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa memastikan tunjangan hari raya (THR) 2026 bagi ASN, prajurit TNI, dan anggota Polri mulai dicairkan pada pekan pertama Ramadan. Pemerintah telah menyiapkan anggaran Rp55 triliun yang masuk dalam belanja negara triwulan I 2026 sebesar Rp809 triliun, dengan penyaluran dilakukan di awal puasa untuk menopang daya beli dan menjaga laju pertumbuhan ekonomi.

“Ada pasti nanti (pencairan THR ASN). Tapi, saya tidak tahu tanggal pastinya, yang jelas di awal-awal puasa kita harapkan udah bisa kita salurkan.” ujarnya.

Namun jika mengacu pada pencairan THR pada tahun 2025, dana ditransfer ke rekening penerima 10-15 hari kerja sebelum idulfitri, maka THR PNS 2026 kemungkinan cair pada 4 hingga 9 maret 2026.

Siapa Saja yang Berhak Menerima THR 2026?

Berdasarkan regulasi, penerima THR tidak hanya PNS aktif. Berikut kelompok yang berhak menerima:

Baca Juga

  • THR PNS 2026 Cair Awal Ramadan, Ini Perkiraan Jadwal dan Besar Anggarannya
  • Cara Tukar Uang Baru di PINTAR BI untuk THR Lebaran, Login pintar.bi.go.id
  • 8 Ide Bisnis Ramadan 2026 dengan Modal Kecil
  1. PNS dan CPNS
  2. PPPK (Pegawai Pemerintah dengan Perjanjian Kerja)
  3. Prajurit TNI
  4. Anggota Polri
  5. Pejabat Negara
  6. Pensiunan PNS, TNI, Polri, dan Pejabat Negara
  7. Penerima pensiun janda, duda, anak, dan orang tua

Kebijakan ini merupakan bentuk apresiasi negara atas pengabdian aparatur dan pensiunan.

Komponen THR PNS 2026

Mengacu pada Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 11 Tahun 2025, THR PNS terdiri dari beberapa komponen utama:

  1. Gaji pokok
    Disesuaikan dengan pangkat, golongan, dan masa kerja.
  2. Tunjangan keluarga
    Meliputi tunjangan suami/istri dan anak sesuai ketentuan.
  3. Tunjangan pangan
    Biasanya dalam bentuk tunjangan beras atau pengganti nilai beras.
  4. Tunjangan jabatan atau tunjangan umum
    Termasuk tunjangan struktural, fungsional, atau tunjangan umum bagi ASN non-jabatan.
  5. Tunjangan kinerja (tukin)
    Pemberiannya menyesuaikan kebijakan fiskal pemerintah. Bisa dibayarkan penuh atau sebagian.

Untuk PNS daerah, THR juga dapat mencakup tambahan penghasilan daerah (TPP) maksimal sebesar penghasilan satu bulan, dengan mempertimbangkan kapasitas fiskal masing-masing daerah. Secara prinsip, THR dibayarkan 100 persen tanpa potongan iuran.

Cara Menghitung THR PNS 2026

Perhitungan THR ASN umumnya mengacu pada masa kerja:

  • Masa kerja lebih dari 12 bulan
    = 1 bulan gaji pokok + tunjangan tetap (jika berlaku)
  • Masa kerja kurang dari 12 bulan
    = (Masa kerja dalam bulan ÷ 12) × gaji pokok

Skema ini memastikan ASN yang baru diangkat tetap memperoleh hak secara proporsional.

Ketentuan Khusus THR Guru, Dosen, CPNS, dan PPPK

Beberapa kelompok ASN memiliki skema berbeda:

1. Guru ASN

Guru yang tidak menerima tunjangan kinerja berhak memperoleh THR berupa tunjangan profesi guru atau tambahan penghasilan guru ASN, maksimal setara satu bulan.

2. Dosen ASN

Dosen yang tidak menerima tukin berhak atas tunjangan profesi dosen atau tunjangan kehormatan profesor sesuai ketentuan.

3. CPNS

CPNS menerima:

  • 80% gaji pokok
  • Tunjangan keluarga
  • Tunjangan pangan
  • Tunjangan jabatan/umum
  • Tunjangan kinerja (jika tersedia)

4. PPPK

  • Masa kerja kurang dari 1 tahun: THR dibayarkan secara proporsional.
  • Masa kerja kurang dari 1 bulan sebelum Hari Raya: tidak menerima THR.

Tunjangan yang Tidak Masuk Komponen THR

Tidak semua tunjangan dihitung dalam THR. Beberapa yang dikecualikan antara lain:

  • Tunjangan insentif kerja
  • Tunjangan risiko dan bahaya
  • Tunjangan pengamanan
  • Tunjangan khusus wilayah (Papua, daerah perbatasan, dan sejenisnya)
  • Tunjangan khusus lain di luar komponen resmi

Tujuan Pemberian THR PNS

Pemberian THR memiliki beberapa tujuan strategis:

  • Menjaga dan meningkatkan daya beli masyarakat
  • Mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi menjelang Lebaran
  • Meningkatkan kesejahteraan ASN dan pensiunan
  • Memberikan penghargaan atas pengabdian aparatur negara

Dengan dasar hukum yang jelas, kebijakan THR PNS 2026 diharapkan memberikan kepastian dan manfaat nyata bagi seluruh penerima. Masyarakat kini tinggal menunggu pengumuman resmi terkait nominal dan jadwal pencairan dari pemerintah.

title: The government wants to forcefully execute the Sultan Hotel, this is the fate of the workers
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government officially submitted a letter of application for a follow-up to the execution of the Sultan Hotel to the Chairman of the Central Jakarta District Court on Wednesday (18/2/2026).

This was done after PT Indobuildco ignored the court's warning (aanmaning) which required the voluntary handover of assets within an eight-day deadline starting February 9, 2026.

Main Director of the Gelora Bung Karno Complex Management Center (PPKGBK), Rakhmadi Afif Kusumo, explained that the forced execution process will certainly continue to pay attention to the rights of workers and consumers of the Sultan Hotel.

He emphasized that the execution process was only carried out in the context of restructuring state assets which are currently still managed by PT Indobuildco.

"We appeal to all affected parties such as employees, vendors and tenants to remain calm. The state is not here to kill businesses, but to reorganize the management of these assets so that they are more professional, transparent and beneficial to the public," he explained in an official statement, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Rakhmadi continued, after the execution, the government will prepare a big plan to revitalize the area into a wider and more modern green open space (RTH).
