Adapun selama Ramadan, MRT Jakarta menghadirkan kampanye #MelajuPenuhMakna sebagai ajakan untuk menjadikan setiap perjalanan memiliki nilai yang lebih dalam. Melalui rangkaian program mulai dari konten edukatif, aktivasi digital dan promo interaktif, kegiatan berbagi takjil di area stasiun, hingga inisiatif sosial seperti buka puasa bersama anak yatim-piatu dan penyandang disabilitas.

content_original:
Bisnis.com,JAKARTA — PTMRTJakarta (Perseroda) memperbolehkan penumpang untuk makan dan minum maksimal 10 menit setelah azan Magrib di area rangkaian MRT selamaRamadan1447 H.

Corporate Secretary Division Head MRT Jakarta Rendy Primartantyo menjelaskan, pengguna jasa hanya diperbolehkan membatalkan puasa dengan air putih dan buah kurma. Sejatinya, MRT melarang penumpang makan dan minum di area berbayar dan kereta.

Meski demikian, para pengguna jasa tetap dapat melanjutkan kegiatan membatalkan puasa di area beranda peron tidak berbayar (unpaid concourse) tanpa batasan waktu.

title: Airlangga: Prabowo and Trump Will Sign Trade Tariff Agreement Today
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto confirmed that President Prabowo Subianto will leave for the United States (US) on February 19 2026. Among the agenda, Prabowo will sign trade cooperation entitled the Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff (ART) between Indonesia and the US.

Airlangga's statement was delivered at the State Palace after being summoned by President Prabowo Subianto today, Wednesday (11/2/2026).

"Earlier we discussed the update on the Indonesian-American negotiations and the President said that he plans to attend the event on the 19th and around that date there will also be plans to sign the ART, Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff," said Airlangga at the Presidential Palace Complex on Wednesday (11/2/2026).

Separately, Airlangga stated that in substance, all negotiations related to tariffs with the US had been completed. Both countries have also completed the process of harmonizing legal language (legal drafting).

Previously, after meeting with USTR Jameson Greer in Washington D.C. At the end of last year, the government targeted that the ART document could be signed by President Prabowo and US President Donald Trump between January 12-19 2026. However, until entering the second week of February 2026, this ceremony had not yet been realized.

For the record, within the framework of the initial agreement that was built in July last year, Indonesia was committed to waiving import duties for the majority of products from the US. In return, Uncle Sam's country agreed to reduce reciprocal tariffs on Indonesian products from 32% to 19%.

Also Read

Apart from that, the US also gave the green light for tariff exemptions for Indonesia's leading export commodities, ranging from palm oil (CPO), coffee, to cocoa.

On the other hand, Prabowo's visit to the US is also related to the agenda of the Gaza Board of Peace Summit. Minister of State Secretary (Mensesneg) Prasetyo Hadi also said that the President had accepted the invitation to the summit which will be held on February 19 2026.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto memastikan bahwa Presiden Prabowo Subianto akan berangkat ke Amerika Serikat (AS) pada 19 Februari 2026. Di antara agenda itu, Prabowo akan menandatangani kerja sama perdagangan bertajuk Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff (ART) antara Indonesia dan AS.

Pernyataan Airlangga itu disampaikan di Istana Negara usai dipanggil Presiden Prabowo Subianto pada hari ini, Rabu (11/2/2026). 

"Tadi membicarakan terkait dengan update perundingan Indonesia-Amerika dan disampaikan Bapak Presiden rencananya akan menghadiri acara di tanggal 19 dan di sekitar tanggal itu juga akan ada rencana penandatanganan ART, Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff," ujar Airlangga di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan pada Rabu (11/2/2026).

Terpisah, Airlangga menyatakan bahwa secara substansi, seluruh negosiasi terkait dengan tarif dengan AS telah rampung. Kedua negara pun telah menuntaskan proses harmonisasi bahasa hukum (legal drafting).

Sebelumnya, usai pertemuan dengan USTR Jameson Greer di Washington D.C. akhir tahun lalu, pemerintah menargetkan dokumen ART dapat diteken oleh Presiden Prabowo dan Presiden AS Donald Trump pada kisaran tanggal 12—19 Januari 2026. Kendati demikian, hingga memasuki pekan kedua Februari 2026, seremoni tersebut belum terealisasi. 

Sebagai catatan, dalam kerangka kesepakatan awal yang dibangun sejak Juli tahun lalu, Indonesia berkomitmen membebaskan tarif bea masuk untuk mayoritas produk asal AS. Sebagai timbal balik, Negeri Paman Sam sepakat menurunkan tarif resiprokal atas produk Indonesia dari 32% menjadi 19%.

Selain itu, AS juga memberikan lampu hijau pengecualian tarif bagi komoditas unggulan ekspor RI, mulai dari minyak kelapa sawit (CPO), kopi, hingga kakao. 

Di sisi lain, lawatan Prabowo ke AS pun terkait dengan agenda KTT Board of Peace atau Dewan Perdamaian Gaza. Menteri Sekretaris Negara (Mensesneg) Prasetyo Hadi pun mengatakan bahwa Presiden telah menerima undangan KTT tersebut yang akan digelar 19 Februari 2026.

title: Prabowo: Investing in MBG Can Profit Up to 35 Times
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — President Prabowo Subianto emphasized his commitment to overcome child hunger and malnutrition through the Free Nutritious Meal Program (MBG). Investment in this program will also provide economic benefits of up to 35 times.

This was conveyed by Prabowo in his speech at the United States–Asean Business Summit at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Thursday (19/2/2026).

Prabowo explained that the program was inspired by practices in the United States and Europe which have long provided free meals for students. According to him, democracy must provide real benefits through education and health services.

He considers this program to be a concrete step to overcome the problem of stunting which is still experienced by around 25 percent of Indonesian children.

"I just found out that 25% of our children are stunted. Their brain cells are not optimal, as are their bone and muscle cells. They will become very physically weak when they grow up. We cannot accept this," he said

Prabowo emphasized that program funding comes from state budget savings resulting from cutting inefficiencies and misuse of funds. He denied accusations of waste, calling the policy a reallocation of resources for the benefit of the people.

Also Read

According to him, a number of international institutions consider the free meal program as a strategic investment. He quoted the findings of an American research institute which stated that every dollar invested could produce economic benefits of up to seven times, even up to 35 times in the long term.

"Because for every dollar spent on free meals for children, the return [return] according to their research is at least seven dollars, even in the long term it can provide returns of up to 35 times," he added.

The 8th President of the Republic of Indonesia also said that this program was starting to show an economic impact. Domestic consumption in January is said to be the highest in the last 10-15 years.

"We are now starting to feel the impact. Several members of Apindo [Indonesian Employers' Association] came to me last week and said that last January was the highest domestic consumption in the last 10 or 15 years," he said.

Currently, said Prabowo, the government has built around 23,000 program kitchens, each of which employs around 50 people in villages.

The program also increases demand for local food such as eggs, chicken and vegetables, thereby providing market certainty for farmers and creating an economic multiplier effect in rural areas.

Prabowo assesses that this program helps strengthen social and political stability through creating jobs and improving community welfare. He also said that national rice production had reached a record high and was approaching self-sufficiency for most food commodities.

Closing his speech, Prabowo stated that there were still many achievements that could be delivered in the first year of his government, but he chose to summarize the main points regarding priority programs that had a direct impact on the people.

"I could talk at length about the achievements of this first year, but I will keep my remarks short. As you know, if you give a microphone to a political leader, he tends not to want to stop talking," concluded Prabowo.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Presiden Prabowo Subianto menegaskan komitmennya mengatasi kelaparan dan malnutrisi anak melalui Program Makan Bergizi Gratis (MBG). Investasi di program itu pun akan memberikan manfaat ekonomi hingga 35 kali lipat.

Hal tersebut disampaikan oleh Prabowo dalam pidatonya pada Business Summit Amerika Serikat–Asean di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Kamis (19/2/2026).

Prabowo menjelaskan program tersebut terinspirasi dari praktik di Amerika Serikat dan Eropa yang telah lama menyediakan makan gratis bagi pelajar. Menurutnya, demokrasi harus menghadirkan manfaat nyata melalui layanan pendidikan dan kesehatan.

Dia menilai program ini menjadi langkah konkret untuk mengatasi persoalan stunting yang masih dialami sekitar 25 persen anak Indonesia.

“Saya baru tahu bahwa 25% anak-anak kami mengalami stunting [tengkes]. Sel otak mereka tidak optimal, begitu juga sel tulang dan otot mereka. Mereka akan menjadi sangat lemah secara fisik saat tumbuh dewasa. Kita tidak bisa menerima ini,” ucapnya

Prabowo menegaskan pendanaan program berasal dari penghematan anggaran negara hasil pemangkasan inefisiensi dan penyalahgunaan dana. Dia membantah tudingan pemborosan, menyebut kebijakan tersebut sebagai relokasi sumber daya untuk kepentingan rakyat.

Baca Juga

  • Bos BGN Ngaku Deg-degan Jalankan MBG: Kepemimpinan Prabowo Jadi Taruhan
  • Core Ingatkan Risiko Gizi Rendah di Balik Menu Makanan Kering MBG saat Ramadan
  • Prabowo Minta Kepala KSP Kumpulkan Video Ejekan MBG, Buat Ditonton Tiap Malam

Menurutnya, sejumlah lembaga internasional menilai program makan gratis sebagai investasi strategis. Dia mengutip temuan lembaga riset Amerika yang menyebut bahwa setiap satu dolar yang diinvestasikan dapat menghasilkan manfaat ekonomi hingga tujuh kali lipat, bahkan mencapai 35 kali lipat dalam jangka panjang.

“Karena untuk setiap satu dolar yang dihabiskan untuk makan gratis bagi anak-anak, imbal hasilnya [return] menurut penelitian mereka setidaknya tujuh dolar, bahkan dalam jangka panjang bisa memberikan imbal hasil hingga 35 kali lipat,” imbuhnya.

Presiden Ke-8 RI itu juga mengungkapkan program ini mulai menunjukkan dampak ekonomi. Konsumsi domestik pada Januari disebut menjadi yang tertinggi dalam 10—15 tahun terakhir.

“Kami sekarang mulai merasakan dampaknya. Beberapa anggota Apindo [Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia] datang kepada saya minggu lalu dan mengatakan bahwa Januari kemarin adalah konsumsi domestik tertinggi dalam 10 atau 15 tahun terakhir,” tuturnya.

Saat ini, kata Prabowo, pemerintah telah membangun sekitar 23.000 dapur program yang masing-masing mempekerjakan sekitar 50 orang di desa.

Program tersebut juga meningkatkan permintaan bahan pangan lokal seperti telur, ayam, dan sayuran, sehingga memberi kepastian pasar bagi petani dan menciptakan efek pengganda ekonomi di pedesaan.

Prabowo menilai program ini turut memperkuat stabilitas sosial dan politik melalui penciptaan lapangan kerja serta peningkatan kesejahteraan masyarakat. Dia juga menyebut produksi beras nasional mencapai rekor tertinggi dan mendekati swasembada untuk sebagian besar komoditas pangan.

Menutup pidatonya, Prabowo menyatakan masih banyak capaian yang dapat disampaikan pada tahun pertama pemerintahannya, tetapi dia memilih merangkum poin utama terkait program prioritas yang berdampak langsung bagi rakyat.

“Saya bisa bicara panjang lebar mengenai pencapaian di tahun pertama ini, tapi saya akan mempersingkat sambutan saya. Seperti yang Anda tahu, jika Anda memberikan mikrofon kepada seorang pemimpin politik, dia cenderung tidak mau berhenti bicara,” pungkas Prabowo.

title: Lack of Interest, Number of Government Bond Auction Bids Drops 17.6%
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – The Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu) noted a decrease in offers for Government Debt Securities, aka SUN, in the auction which took place on Wednesday (18/2/2026).

The Ministry of Finance noted that the number of bids entered in yesterday's auction reached IDR 63.06 trillion or a decrease of around 17.6% from the auction period on February 3 2026 which reached IDR 76.58 trillion. This amount has also shrunk considerably compared to the bid entered at the January 20 2026 auction worth IDR 82.9 trillion.

According to the official website of the Directorate General of Financing and Risk Management (DJPPR) of the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu), the number of debt securities auctioned last Wednesday included 9 series, namely SPN01260322 (new issuance), SPN03260521 (new issuance), SPN12270204 (reopening), FR0109 (reopening), FR0108 (reopening), FR0106 (reopening), FR0107 (reopening), FR0102 (reopening) and FR0105 (reopening).

If detailed, the total bids received for the SPN01260322 series reached IDR 700 billion, SPN03260521 IDR 300 billion, SPN12270204 IDR 4.77 trillion, FR0109 IDR 24.16 trillion, FR0108 IDR 21.07 trillion, FR0106 IDR 4.33 trillion, FR0107 IDR 3.29 trillion, FR0102 IDR 2.23 trillion, and FR0105 IDR 2.18 trillion.

Due to sluggish bidding, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa finally increased the auction amount for winning debt securities, which was initially targeted at IDR 33 trillion to IDR 40 trillion. The auction results were also higher compared to the auction period on February 3 2026, which was only IDR 36 trillion.

The decline in offers occurred in the majority of debt securities except the Fixed Rate series or FR0108, where the total offer reached IDR 21.07 trillion.

Also Read

Meanwhile, the State Treasury Letter series or SPN12270204 with a weighted average yield of 4.48%, for example, which at the auction on February 3 2026 was able to record a bid of IDR 6.92 trillion at the auction on February 18 2026 fell to IDR 4.77 trillion.

Similar conditions also occurred in the Fixed Rate or FR series with yields in the range of 5.67% - 6.77%, the FR0109 series offer fell from IDR 25.39 trillion to IDR 24.16 trillion, FR0106 fell from IDR 8.93 trillion to IDR 4.33 trillion, FR0107 from IDR 4.13 trillion to IDR 3.29 trillion, FR0102 which was originally IDR 3.78 trillion became IDR 2.23 trillion, and the FR0105 series decreased from IDR 34.74 trillion to IDR 2.18 trillion.

Previously, the government through the Directorate General of Financing and Risk Management (DJPPR) of the Ministry of Finance targeted funds worth IDR 33 trillion from the auction of Government Debt Securities (SUN) on Wednesday (18/2/2026).

According to the official DJPPR website, the auction will be held for 9 types of SUN. A total of 3 series are State Treasury Notes (SPN) and the other 6 are State Bonds (ON).

The three types of SPN that will be auctioned include SPN01260322 (New Issuance), SPN03260521 (New Issuance), and SPN12270204 (Reopening). These three series have a maturity date of 1-12 months. The rate of return on these three products is discounted.

Meanwhile, the other six bond products include FR0109 (Reopening), FR0108 (Reopening), FR0106 (Reopening), FR0107 (Reopening), FR0102 (Reopening), and FR0105 (Reopening). The maturity date for these six products ranges from 5-38 years.

The product with the longest tenor is FR0105 which matures on July 15 2064. This product offers a yield of 6.87%, the second highest after FR0107 and FR0106.

On the one hand, FR0106 has a maturity date of August 15 2040 and FR0107 has a maturity date of August 15 2045. These two products offer the highest yield of 7.12%.

The product with the lowest yield is offered by FR0109 with an amount of 5.87%. This product also has the shortest maturity date among Government Bond issuances, namely March 15 2031.

"The indicative target is IDR 33 trillion, with a maximum target of winning 150% of the indicative target," wrote the DJPPR announcement, quoted Monday (16/2/2026).

Melansir laman resmi DJPPR, lelang akan digelar terhadap 9 jenis SUN. Sebanyak 3 seri merupakan Surat Perbendaharaan Negara (SPN) dan 6 lainnya merupakan Obligasi Negara (ON). 

Ketiga jenis SPN yang akan dilelang antara lain SPN01260322 (New Issuance), SPN03260521 (New Issuance), dan SPN12270204 (Reopening). Ketiga seri ini memiliki tenggat jatuh tempo 1-12 bulan. Tingkat imbal hasil ketiga produk ini diskonto.

Sementara keenam produk obligasi lainnya antara lain FR0109 (Reopening), FR0108 (Reopening), FR0106 (Reopening), FR0107 (Reopening), FR0102 (Reopening), dan FR0105 (Reopening). Tenggat jatuh tempo keenam produk ini berkisar pada 5-38 tahun.

Produk dengan tenor terpanjang digenggam oleh FR0105 yang jatuh tempo pada 15 Juli 2064. Produk ini menawarkan imbal hasil sebesar 6,87%, menjadi kedua tertinggi setelah FR0107 dan FR0106.

Di satu sisi, FR0106 memiliki tenggat jatuh tempo pada 15 Agustus 2040 dan FR0107 dengan tenggat jatuh tempo 15 Agustus 2045. Kedua produk ini menawarkan imbal hasil tertinggi 7,12%.

Produk dengan imbal hasil terendah ditawarkan oleh FR0109 dengan besaran 5,87%. Produk ini sekaligus menggenggam maturity date terpendek di antara penerbitan Obligasi Negara, yaitu pada 15 Maret 2031.

"Target indikatif Rp33 triliun, dengan target maksimal dimenangkan 150% dari target indikatif," tulis pengumuman DJPPR, dikutip Senin (16/2/2026).

title: MRT Expands Underground Line, Integrated with Grand Hyatt and Plaza Indonesia?
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PTMRT Jakarta (Perseroda) began construction of an expansion of the underground station at the HI Bank Jakarta Roundabout, on Wednesday (18/2/2026), which will integrate buildings around the station, including hotels and malls.

MRT on its official Instagram social media @mrtjkt informed that MRT Jakarta will develop the concourse area in the city center area through space expansion.

Apart from that, several new access points have been added in the form of lifts and additional entrances, as well as underground connections that are integrated with buildings around the HI Bank Jakarta Roundabout MRT Jakarta Station.

"Starting this year, construction of the Extended Concourse project will begin immediately as a form of MRT Jakarta's commitment to presenting a public transportation system that is increasingly inclusive, connected and oriented towards the future of the city," wrote MRT, quoted on Thursday (19/2/2026).

This development is part of our commitment to continue to improve service quality and customer comfort, while providing a more integrated, modern and seamless transit experience in the heart of Jakarta.

Judging from the picture shared, the additional entre or entrance will be carried out in the area opposite the Transjakarta bus stop in front of the Grand Hyatt which is connected to Plaza Indonesia. The entrance is a regular staircase and elevator.

Also Read

It is also observed that additional entrances will be carried out in front of the Pullman hotel which is also integrated with Wisma Nusantara.

Later, underground there will be a multifunctional MRT Bundaran HI area so that the concourse at this station will be wider and connected to surrounding buildings. However, it has not been stated whether it will also be connected to the Kempinski Hotel or Grand Indonesia Mall.

Due to this construction, entrance C which is connected to the Transjakarta bus stop is temporarily closed until further notice.

"As an alternative, MRT Jakarta customers can use Entre A to access the HI Astra Roundabout Transjakarta Bus Stop," he wrote.

For your information, currently the concourse area is at a depth of 10 meters from ground level and the passenger platform area is at a depth of 18 meters below ground level.

Jakarta MRT operations continue to run normally on weekdays from 05.00-24.00 WIB with an interval of 5 minutes during peak hours and 10 minutes during normal hours. Meanwhile, on weekends/holidays it is 05.00-24.00 WIB with an interval of 10 minutes.

As of January 2026, MRT recorded a total ridership figure in January 2026 reaching 4,195,303 customers with an average of 135,332 customers every day. On weekdays Monday-Friday (weekdays), the transportation figure has reached 159,492 customers per day and on Saturday-Sunday (weekends) it has reached 91,406 customers per day.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) mulai melakukan pembangunan perluasan stasiun bawah tanah di Bundaran HI Bank Jakarta, pada Rabu (18/2/2026), yang akan mengintegrasikan bangunan sekitar stasiun, termasuk hotel dan mall. 

MRT dalam media sosial Instagram resminya @mrtjkt menginformasikan, MRT Jakarta akan melakukan pengembangan area concourse di kawasan pusat kota melalui perluasan ruang. 

Selain itu, juga penambahan beberapa titik akses baru berupa lift dan entre tambahan, serta koneksi bawah tanah yang terintegrasi dengan bangunan di sekitar Stasiun MRT Jakarta Bundaran HI Bank Jakarta.

“Mulai tahun ini, pembangunan proyek Extended Concourse akan segera dimulai sebagai wujud komitmen MRT Jakarta dalam menghadirkan sistem transportasi publik yang semakin inklusif, terkoneksi, dan berorientasi pada masa depan kota,” tulis MRT, dikutip pada Kamis (19/2/2026). 

Pengembangan ini merupakan bagian dari komitmen kami untuk terus meningkatkan kualitas layanan dan kenyamanan pelanggan, sekaligus menghadirkan pengalaman transit yang lebih terintegrasi, modern, dan seamless di jantung Kota Jakarta.

Melihat dari gambaran yang dibagikan, penambahan entre atau pintu masuk akan dilakukan di area sebrang halte Transjakarta di depan Grand Hyatt yang terhubung dengan Plaza Indonesia. Pintu masuk berupa tangga biasa dan lift.

  • Plaza Indonesia (PLIN) Bakal Renovasi Grand Hyatt Hingga 2023
  • MRT Jakarta Bakal Tembus hingga Bekasi, Mulai Dibangun Tahun Ini

Penambahan pintu masuk juga terpantau akan dilakukan di depan hotel Pullman yang juga terintegrasi dengan Wisma Nusantara. 

Nantinya pun di bawah tanah akan ada area multifungsi MRT Bundaran HI sehingga concourse di stasiun ini akan lebih luas dan terhubung ke gedung sekitar. Namun, belum disebutkan apakah juga akan terhubung dengan Hotel Kempinski maupun Mall Grand Indonesia. 

Adanya pembangunan tersebut, pintu masuk C yang terhubung dengan halte Trasnsjakarta ditutup untuk sementara waktu hingga pemberitahuan lebih lanjut. 

“Sebagai alternatif, pelanggan MRT Jakarta dapat menggunakan Entre A untuk akses menuju Halte Transjakarta Bundaran HI Astra,” tulisnya.  

Untuk diketahui, saat ini area concourse berada di kedalaman 10 meter dari permukaan tanah dan area peron penumpang pada kedalaman 18 meter di bawah permukaan tanah. 

Operasional MRT Jakarta tetap berjalan normal di hari kerja adalah pukul 05.00-24.00 WIB dengan selang waktu 5 menit di jam sibuk dan 10 menit di jam normal. Sedangkan di akhir pekan/hari libur adalah pukul 05.00-24.00 WIB dengan selang waktu 10 menit.

Pada hari kerja Senin—Jumat (weekdays), angka keterangkutan telah mencapai 159.492 pelanggan per hari dan pada Sabtu—Minggu (weekend) mencapai 91.406 pelanggan per hari.

title: Beda Purbaya and Village Heads Provide 58% of Village Funds for Kopdes Merah Putih
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – The allocation of 58.03% of village funds to the Red and White Village Cooperative (KDMP) has received various responses. Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa and village heads have different views regarding the new village fund budget policy.

Just for the record, Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) no. 7/2026 concerning Village Fund Management for Fiscal Year 2026 stipulates that the government allocates more than 58% of the Village Fund allocation to support the KDMP program. In the previous regulation, aka PMK No.145/2023, there was no special allocation clause for the village cooperative program.

Article 15 paragraph (3) PMK 7/2026 specifically states that adjustments to the Village Fund allocation for KDMP reach a total nominal value of IDR 34.57 trillion.

With the total Village Fund ceiling for the 2026 Fiscal Year set at IDR 60.57 trillion, the remaining budget—excluding the Red and White Cooperative—is just IDR 25 trillion. This amount is allocated as the regular Village Fund ceiling.

"Prioritised use of Village Funds is to support sustainable development: ... e. support for the implementation of KDMP," as stated in Article 20 paragraph (1) letter e of the regulation.

The detailed use of these funds is directed at installment payments for the physical construction of outlets, warehousing and KDMP equipment. In line with the large allocation, the disbursement scheme is also separated exclusively.

Also Read

Based on Article 22 paragraph (4), the distribution of Village Funds to support the implementation of KDMP is no longer transferred through the Regional Cash Account (RKUD), but is channeled directly from the State General Cash Account (RKUN) to the holding account for the distribution of funds.

As an additional incentive, the government also includes the status of the KDMP establishment and its business performance as crucial criteria. Villages that have KDMP business performance have the opportunity to receive additional disbursement in the form of Village Incentives taken from the fund allocation of IDR 1 trillion calculated for the current fiscal year as regulated in Article 7 paragraph (3).

Minister of Finance Purbaya was not surprised to hear this figure. He even said that the 2026 Village Fund allocation for KDMP should be even higher.

"My count is bigger than that [58%]," said Purbaya at the Senayan Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

The state treasurer also asked for time to ensure more certainty regarding the new Village Fund structure regulations this year. He admitted that he would check the numbers again.

Previously, President Prabowo Subianto said that the use of Village Funds was deemed ineffective.

According to Prabowo, inefficiencies and indications of Village Fund distribution have been ongoing for the last decade. He assessed that trillions of rupiah in state money had failed to transform into real prosperity at the grassroots.

"For the past 10 years we have to admit that a lot of these funds have not reached the people. This is proven by the many village heads who have been forced to face the law because they cannot be properly accounted for in the use of these funds," said Prabowo at the Indonesia Economic Outlook 2026 event at Wisma Danantara, South Jakarta, Friday (13/2/2026).

For this reason, the head of state and government mandated the formation of KDMP as a new economic engine at the village level which is expected to have more measurable and accountable governance.

Meanwhile, a number of village leadership organizations asked to meet Prabowo following the government's decision to allocate 58.03% of the 2026 village fund ceiling for the Red and White Village Cooperative program, aka KDMP.

This demand was conveyed directly by the leaders of six village head organizations (Kades) and the village consultative body (BPD) to the Minister of Villages and Development of Disadvantaged Regions (Mendes PDT) Yandri Susanto. They held a meeting on Monday (16/2/2026).

Chairman of the Central Leadership Council of the Indonesian Village Heads Association (DPP AKSI) Irawadi said the meeting was held following concerns from village leaders over President Prabowo Subianto's statement highlighting the ineffectiveness of using Village Funds, as well as responding to the issuance of a new Ministry of Finance regulation requiring 58% of Village Funds for the KDMP program.

Irawadi openly admitted that the series of issues, especially Prabowo's statement, had disturbed the spiritual situation of village heads at the grassroots.

"The President's statement, yes, it is clear, it is clearly disturbing, it has made the village head's friends from the lower levels uneasy," he said to Bisnis, Wednesday (18/3/2026).

During the meeting, Irawadi said that PDT Village Minister Yandri Susanto was trying to calm the village leaders. According to Yandri, he continued, Prabowo's statement was only to motivate village officials to work harder.

"But how can you be enthusiastic, if the Village Fund which is the means for developing the village has been completely cut and diverted?" said Irawadi.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – Pengalokasian 58,03% dana desa untuk Koperasi Desa Merah Putih (KDMP) menuai berbagai macam tanggapan. Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa dan para kepala desa memiliki perbedaan pandangan mengenai kebijakan baru anggaran dana desa tersebut.

Sekadar catatan, Peraturan Menteri Keuangan (PMK) No. 7/2026 tentang Pengelolaan Dana Desa Tahun Anggaran 2026 mengatur bahwa pemerintah mengalokasikan lebih dari 58% alokasi Dana Desa untuk menyokong program KDMP. Dalam aturan sebelumnya alias PMK No.145/2023, belum ada klausul alokasi khusus untuk program koperasi desa.

Pasal 15 ayat (3) PMK 7/2026 secara spesifik menyatakan bahwa penyesuaian alokasi Dana Desa untuk KDMP mencapai total nominal sebesar Rp34,57 triliun.

Dengan total pagu Dana Desa Tahun Anggaran 2026 yang ditetapkan sebesar Rp60,57 triliun, sisa anggaran—di luar untuk Koperasi Merah Putih—tinggal sebesar Rp25 triliun. Besaran tersebut dialokasikan sebagai pagu Dana Desa reguler.

"Dana Desa diutamakan penggunaannya untuk mendukung pembangunan berkelanjutan: ... e. dukungan implementasi KDMP," demikian sebagaimana termaktub dalam Pasal 20 ayat (1) huruf e aturan tersebut.

Penggunaan dana tersebut secara rinci diarahkan pada pembayaran angsuran dalam rangka pembangunan fisik gerai, pergudangan, dan kelengkapan KDMP. Seiring dengan besarnya alokasi tersebut, skema pencairannya pun dipisahkan secara eksklusif.

  • Para Kades Ingin Temui Prabowo usai 58% Dana Desa untuk Kopdes Merah Putih
  • Nasib Dana Desa, Disorot Prabowo, Mayoritas Dialokasikan ke Kopdes Merah Putih

Berdasarkan Pasal 22 ayat (4), penyaluran Dana Desa untuk dukungan implementasi KDMP tidak lagi ditransfer lewat Rekening Kas Daerah (RKUD), melainkan disalurkan langsung dari Rekening Kas Umum Negara (RKUN) ke rekening penampung penyaluran dana.

Sebagai insentif tambahan, pemerintah juga memasukkan status pembentukan KDMP dan kinerja usahanya sebagai kriteria krusial. Desa yang memiliki kinerja usaha KDMP berpeluang mendapatkan kucuran tambahan berupa Insentif Desa yang diambil dari alokasi dana sebesar Rp1 triliun yang dihitung pada tahun anggaran berjalan seperti yang diatur Pasal 7 ayat (3).

Respons Purbaya dan Prabowo

Adapun Menkeu Purbaya tidak kaget mendengar angka tersebut. Dia malah menuturkan bahwa seharusnya alokasi Dana Desa 2026 untuk KDMP bahkan lebih tinggi lagi.

"Hitungan saya lebih besar dari itu [58%]," ujar Purbaya di Kompleks Parlemen Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Bendahara negara itu pun meminta waktu untuk memastikan lebih pasti terkait aturan baru struktur Dana Desa tahun ini. Dia mengaku akan mengecek angka itu lagi.

Adapun sebelumnya, penggunaan Dana Desa yang dirasa tidak efektif sudah disampaikan secara terbuka oleh Presiden Prabowo Subianto. 

Menurut Prabowo, inefisiensi dan indikasi penyaluran Dana Desa telah berjalan selama satu dekade terakhir. Dia menilai triliunan rupiah uang negara gagal bertransformasi menjadi kesejahteraan nyata di akar rumput.

"Selama ini 10 tahun kita harus akui banyak dana tersebut tidak sampai ke rakyat. Ini dibuktikan dengan banyak sekali kepala desa yang terpaksa berhadapan dengan hukum karena tidak dapat dipertanggungjawabkan dengan baik penggunaan dana tersebut," kata Prabowo dalam acara Indonesia Economic Outlook 2026 di Wisma Danantara, Jakarta Selatan, Jumat (13/2/2026).

Oleh sebab itu, kepala negara dan pemerintahan itu mengamanatkan pembentukan KDMP sebagai mesin ekonomi baru di tingkat desa yang diharapkan memiliki tata kelola yang lebih terukur dan akuntabel.

Para Kepala Desa Protes

Sementara itu, sejumlah organisasi pimpinan desa meminta bertemu Prabowo usai keputusan pemerintah yang mengalokasikan 58,03% pagu dana desa 2026 untuk program Koperasi Desa Merah Putih alias KDMP.

Tuntutan tersebut disampaikan langsung oleh pimpinan enam organisasi kepala desa (Kades) dan badan permusyawaratan desa (BPD) kepada Menteri Desa dan Pembangunan Daerah Tertinggal (Mendes PDT) Yandri Susanto. Mereka melakukan pertemuan pada Senin (16/2/2026).

Ketua Dewan Pimpinan Pusat Asosiasi Kepala Desa Seluruh Indonesia (DPP AKSI) Irawadi mengungkapkan pertemuan tersebut dilakukan menyusul keresahan para pimpinan desa atas pernyataan Presiden Prabowo Subianto yang menyoroti inefektivitas penggunaan Dana Desa, sekaligus merespons terbitnya regulasi baru Kementerian Keuangan yang mewajibkan 58% Dana Desa untuk program KDMP.

Irawadi secara terang-terangan mengakui bahwa rentetan isu tersebut, terutama pernyataan Prabowo, telah mengusik situasi kebatinan para kepala desa di akar rumput. 

"Pernyataan Presiden, ya jelas itu, jelas mengusik lah ya, membuat gelisah para teman-teman Kades dari arus bawah" ujarnya kepada Bisnis, Rabu (18/3/2026). 

Dalam pertemuan, Irawadi menyampaikan Mendes PDT Yandri Susanto mencoba menenangkan para pimpinan desa. Menurut Yandri, sambungnya, pernyataan Prabowo hanya untuk memotivasi para perangkat desa agar bekerja lebih keras.

"Tapi bagaimana mau semangat, kalau Dana Desa-nya saja yang menjadi sarana untuk membangun desa sudah habis dipotong untuk dialihkan?" ujar Irawadi.

title: Different Purbaya and Entrepreneurs Respond to Shrinking Private Foreign Currency Debt
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa revealed that the decline in the position of private External Debt (ULN) in the fourth quarter of 2025 was not related to the careful steps taken by entrepreneurs in expanding.

It is known that Bank Indonesia (BI) data shows that the position of private external debt in the fourth quarter of 2025 was recorded at US$192.78 billion. This figure is lower than the achievement in the third quarter of 2025 which was at US$194.48 billion, marking the lowest position in the last four years.

Purbaya believes that the decline in private external debt cannot necessarily be translated as an indicator of sluggishness in the business world, or the easing of private expansion strategies.

"I'm sure it will fall every first, second and third quarter, then in the fourth quarter it will start to rise again in line with economic activity. In the future it will be even better," he said at the Senayan Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

This belief refers to the realization of economic growth in the fourth quarter of 2025 which reached 5.39%. This figure is higher than the previous quarters last year.

Furthermore, the state treasurer views that the reduction in debt withdrawals from abroad by the private sector is in line with the government's strategy of flooding domestic banks with liquidity.

Also Read

According to him, the abundant availability of funds in the country means that corporations have the option to switch to using financing from local banks.

"Maybe they [business actors] also see that in the country there is more funding from banks, because we are encouraging liquidity into the economic system, right? So, the translation is not one way like that [the private sector is holding back expansion]," said Purbaya.

Throughout the second half of 2025, Purbaya was observed to be aggressive in diverting state cash stored at the central bank to be distributed to commercial banks to stimulate credit distribution.

It was recorded that the initial injection was made of IDR 200 trillion to state-owned banks (Bank Mandiri, BNI, BRI, BTN) and BSI on September 12 2025. The government then again injected IDR 76 trillion on November 10 2025.

Even though Purbaya had withdrawn funds amounting to IDR 75 trillion last December, the remaining state cash that was still sitting as liquidity ammunition in the domestic banking system was still recorded to be very large, reaching IDR 201 trillion.

For the record, Bank Indonesia (BI) reported that banking credit grew 9.69% on an annual basis (year on year/YoY) in 2025. Even though it was in the target range of 8-11% YoY, the realization was still lower than banking credit growth in the previous period or 2024 of 10.39%.

Previously, Bank Indonesia also reported that Indonesia's Foreign Debt reached US$431.7 billion per quarter IV/2025 or around IDR 7,196.43 trillion (JISDOR exchange rate for December 31 2025 was IDR 16,670 per US dollar).

Compared to the previous period or the third quarter of 2025 of US$427.6 billion, Indonesia's foreign debt (ULN) position increased by 0.96%.

Executive Director of the Communications Department, Ramdan Denny Prakoso, explained that external debt is divided into government and private debt. In detail, government external debt was recorded at US$214.3 billion, an increase from the previous period of US$210.1 billion.

"The development of external debt was influenced by the inflow of foreign capital in international Government Securities [SBN]," explained Denny in his statement, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He said the government's external debt was directed to support the financing of priority programs, which were said to be for sustainability and strengthening the national economy.

Based on sector, government ULN is used for the Health Services and Social Activities Sector (22.1% of total government ULN); Government Administration, Defense, and Mandatory Social Security (19.8%); Education Services (16.2%); Construction (11.7%); to Transportation and Warehousing (8.6%).

"The position of government external debt is dominated by long-term debt with a share reaching 99.99% of the total government external debt," he explained.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa mengungkapkan penurunan posisi Utang Luar Negeri (ULN) swasta pada kuartal IV/2025 tidak terkait langkah hati-hati pengusaha dalam berekspansi.

Diketahui, Data Bank Indonesia (BI) menunjukkan posisi ULN swasta pada kuartal IV/2025 tercatat senilai US$192,78 miliar. Angka ini susut dibandingkan dengan capaian pada kuartal III/2025 yang berada di level US$194,48 miliar, sekaligus menandai posisi terendah dalam empat tahun terakhir.

Purbaya menilai turunnya ULN swasta itu tidak bisa serta-merta diterjemahkan sebagai indikator kelesuan dunia usaha, maupun meredanya strategi ekspansi swasta.

"Saya yakin turunnya setiap triwulan pertama, kedua, dan ketiga, lalu pada kuartal keempat mulai naik lagi sesuai dengan aktivitas ekonomi. Ke depan akan lebih bagus lagi," ujarnya di Kompleks Parlemen Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Keyakinan tersebut merujuk realisasi pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal IV/2025 yang mencapai 5,39%. Angka tersebut lebih tinggi dari kuartal-kuartal sebelumnya pada tahun lalu.

Lebih lanjut, bendahara negara memandang penyusutan penarikan utang dari luar negeri oleh pihak swasta justru sejalan dengan strategi pemerintah yang membanjiri perbankan domestik dengan likuiditas.

  • Utang KUR UMKM Capai Rp12,19 Triliun
  • Korporasi Lebih Pilih Surat Utang
  • Purbaya Bandingkan Rasio Utang RI dengan Singapura Cs: Kami Masih Aman

Menurutnya, ketersediaan dana yang melimpah di dalam negeri membuat korporasi memiliki opsi untuk beralih menggunakan pembiayaan dari perbankan lokal.

"Mungkin mereka [pelaku usaha] juga melihat di dalam negeri sudah lebih banyak funding dari perbankan, karena kita dorong likuiditas ke sistem perekonomian kan? Jadi, terjemahannya tidak satu arah seperti itu [swasta menahan ekspansi]," tegas Purbaya.

Sepanjang paruh kedua 2025, Purbaya memang terpantau agresif mengalihkan kas negara yang tersimpan di bank sentral untuk disalurkan ke bank umum guna memacu penyaluran kredit.

Tercatat, injeksi perdana dilakukan sebesar Rp200 triliun ke bank pelat merah (Bank Mandiri, BNI, BRI, BTN) dan BSI pada 12 September 2025. Pemerintah kemudian kembali menyuntikkan dana Rp76 triliun pada 10 November 2025.

Kendati Purbaya sempat menarik kembali dana sebesar Rp75 triliun pada Desember lalu, sisa kas negara yang masih mengendap sebagai amunisi likuiditas di sistem perbankan domestik tercatat masih sangat tebal, yakni mencapai Rp201 triliun.

Sebagai catatan, Bank Indonesia (BI) melaporkan kredit perbankan tumbuh 9,69% secara tahunan (year on year/YoY) pada 2025. Meski berada di kisaran target 8-11% YoY, namun realisasi itu tetap lebih rendah dibandingkan pertumbuhan kredit perbankan periode sebelumnya atau 2024 sebesar 10,39%.

Sebelumnya, Bank Indonesia juga melaporkan Utang Luar Negeri Indonesia mencapai US$431,7 miliar per kuartal IV/2025 atau sekitar Rp7.196,43 triliun (kurs JISDOR 31 Desember 2025 sebesar Rp16.670 per dolar AS).

Dibandingkan periode sebelumnya atau kuartal III/2025 sebesar US$427,6 miliar, posisi utang luar negeri (ULN) Indonesia itu naik 0,96%.

Direktur Eksekutif Departemen Komunikasi Ramdan Denny Prakoso menjelaskan ULN terbagi ke utang pemerintah dan swasta. Perinciannya, ULN pemerintah tercatat sebesar US$214,3 miliar atau naik dari periode sebelumnya sebesar US$210,1 miliar.

"Perkembangan ULN tersebut dipengaruhi oleh aliran masuk modal asing pada Surat Berharga Negara [SBN] internasional," jelas Denny dalam keterangannya, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dia menyebut ULN pemerintah diarahkan untuk mendukung pembiayaan program-program prioritas, yang disebut untuk keberlanjutan dan penguatan perekonomian nasional.

Berdasarkan sektornya, ULN pemerintah dimanfaatkan untuk Sektor Jasa Kesehatan dan Kegiatan Sosial (22,1% dari total ULN pemerintah); Administrasi Pemerintah, Pertahanan, dan Jaminan Sosial Wajib (19,8%); Jasa Pendidikan (16,2%); Konstruksi (11,7%); hingga Transportasi dan Pergudangan (8,6%).

"Posisi ULN pemerintah tersebut didominasi utang jangka panjang dengan pangsa mencapai 99,99% dari total ULN pemerintah," paparnya.

title: DPR Commission V:  Ministry of Transportation Shortfall in Budget of IDR 20 Trillion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Chairman of the VDPR Commission Lasarus encouraged the Ministry of Transportation (Kemenhub) to fight for additional allocations in the 2026 budget ceiling, because he considered the figure received to be too minimal, namely IDR 28.48 trillion.

Lasarus said that looking at the Ministry of Transportation's budget posture, there is a backlog or lack of funds of around IDR 20 trillion for this year.

According to him, the Ministry of Transportation needs to fight for these budget needs with the National Development Planning Agency (Bappenas), because the Ministry of Transportation has an important and mandatory task in providing public services.

"With such a large backlog, how to respond to the budget to focus on public services, PSO and transport subsidies, this must receive priority and attention. The Ministry of Transportation must fight at Bappenas. In my opinion, it is a bit illogical for the Ministry of Transportation's budget to be at this year's figure," he stressed during the Commission V Working Meeting with the Ministry of Transportation, Wednesday (18/4/2026).

For this reason, he asked the Minister of Transportation Dudy Purwagandhi to communicate with Bappenas and provide the best possible data regarding the need for additional budget.

Especially before the Idul Fitri or Lebaran period, the Ministry of Transportation needs a lot of funds to carry out ramp checks or transportation feasibility tests.

Lasarus emphasized that this test is an absolute requirement, aka mandatory and non-negotiable because it involves public services and endangers many people if it is not carried out.

He views that the Ministry of Transportation is quite 'overwhelmed' in arranging Rp. 28 trillion for all of Indonesia because there are mandatory activities. The bigger the movement and the bigger the fleet, the higher the costs automatically.

Lasarus also asked the members of the Budget Agency (Banggar) in Commission V to return the Non-Tax State Revenue (PNBP) and Business Services Agency (BLU) that the Ministry of Transportation deposited into the state treasury, to overcome the existing backlog.

The worry, continued Lasarus, is that services will become chaotic at important moments involving many people.

"Even if you have to fly it's a plane, because there's no money for a ramp check, Mr [Minister of Transportation] grounded the plane, if there's a ship sailing, it hasn't been ramp checked, even if passengers are piled up, don't sail the ship," said Lasarus.

Meanwhile, Minister of Transportation Dudy Purwagandhi said that his party would coordinate with Bappenas and the Ministry of Finance regarding the availability of the budget.

"We will optimize the available budget. However, we will also try as hard as possible to overcome the backlog worth IDR 20 trillion," he answered.

In 2026, the Ministry of Transportation will receive a budget of IDR 28.48 trillion. This amount is down from the 2025 effective ceiling of IDR 32.27 trillion, even much lower than the 2024 ceiling of IDR 45.42 trillion.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Ketua Komisi V DPR Lasarus mendorong Kementerian Perhubungan (Kemenhub) untuk memperjuangkan tambahan alokasi dalam pagu anggaran 2026, karena memandang angka yang diterima terlalu minim, yakni senilai Rp28,48 triliun. 

Lasarus menyampaikan, melihat postur anggaran Kemenhub, terdapat backlog atau kekurangan dana sekitar Rp20 triliun untuk tahun ini. 

Menurutnya, Kemenhub perlu memperjuangkan kebutuhan anggaran tersebut kepada Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Nasional (Bappenas), karena Kemenhub memiliki tugas penting dan wajib dalam memberikan layanan publik. 

“Dengan backlog yang begitu besar, bagaimana menyikapi anggaran untuk fokus pelayanan publik, PSO dan subsidi angkutan, ini harus mendapat prioritas dan perhatian. Kemenhub harus berjuang di Bappenas. Menurut saya agak tidak logis anggaran Kemenhub di angka yang tahun ini,” tegasnya saat Rapat Kerja Komisi V bersama Kemenhhub, Rabu (18/4/2026). 

Untuk itu, dirinya meminta Menteri Perhubungan Dudy Purwagandhi untuk berkomunikasi dengan Bappenas dan memberikan data sebaik mungkin terkait kebutuhan penambahan anggaran.  

Terlebih menjelang periode Idulfitri atau Lebaran, Kemenhub membutuhkan banyak dana untuk melakukan ramp check atau uji kelaikan transportasi. 

Lasarus menegaskan bahwa uji tersebut menjadi syarat mutlak alias wajib dan tidak dapat ditawar karena menyangkut layanan publik dan membahayakan banyak orang jika tidak dilakukan.  

Dirinya memandang Kemenhub cukup ‘kewalahan’ mengatur Rp28 triliun untuk seluruh Indonesia karena ada kegiatan wajib. Semakin besar pergerakan dan semakin besar armada, otomatis biayanya semakin banyak. 

Lasarus pun meminta kepada para anggota Badan Anggaran (Banggar) yang berada di Komisi V untuk mengembalikan Penerimaan Negara Bukan Pajak (PNBP) dan Badan Layanan Usaha (BLU) yang Kemenhub setor ke kas negara, untuk mengatasi backlog yang ada. 

Khawatirnya, lanjut Lasarus, pelayanan akan menjadi kacau pada momen-momen penting yang melibatkan banyak orang. 

“Biarpun harus terbang itu pesawat, karena enggak ada duit untuk ramp check, bapak [Menhub] grounded itu pesawat, kalau ada kapal berlayar, belum ramp check, walaupun penumpang numpuk, jangan berlayar itu kapal,” ucap Lasarus.  

Sementara itu, Menteri Perhubungan Dudy Purwagandhi menyampaikan pihaknya akan berkoordinasi dengan Bappenas dan Kementerian Keuangan terkait ketersediaan anggaran tersebut. 

“Kami akan mengoptimalkan anggaran yang tersedia. Namun demikian kami juga akan berupaya sekeras mungkin untuk mengatasi backlog senilai Rp20 triliun tersebut,” jawabnya. 

Pada 2026, Kemenhub menerima anggaran senilai Rp28,48 triliun. Jumlah tersebut turun dari pagu efektif 2025 yang senilai Rp32,27 triliun, bahkan jauh lebih rendah dari pagu 2024 yang senilai Rp45,42 triliun.

title: Property Broker Competition in the Digital Era
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – In the digital era, online marketing platforms, virtual tours and data-based marketing will accelerate growth and competition in the property broker services industry in Indonesia.

CEO of Indonesia Property Watch (IPW) Ali Tranghanda said that the business prospects for property broker services in Indonesia are still very open. However, this applies only to actors who are able to adapt to changes in market behavior.

Ali assesses that the growth of the middle class, housing needs in urban areas, and increasing interest in property investment remain the main drivers of increasing demand for property broker services from time to time.

However, he emphasized that transaction patterns are now more rational and information-based. Because of this, the role of brokers shifts from being just an intermediary to being a property consultant who provides analysis of value, risk and investment potential.

"Brokers who survive are those who are able to add value, not just offer products. Consumers now come with data, so brokers must be better prepared in terms of knowledge, technology and service," he said in the LJH Realty podcast, quoted Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He also highlighted digitalization as a determining factor in the future of the property brokerage services industry. Online marketing platforms, virtual tours and data-based marketing are considered to accelerate natural selection in this industry.

Also Read

Companies that have a continuous training system, high service standards and modern marketing strategies are predicted to have greater opportunities for growth.

However, Ali emphasized that the industry's main challenge is not market demand, but the quality of human resources. He said that professionalism, integrity and consistent self-development are the main foundations for brokers who want to survive in the long term.

"With increasing consumer expectations and information transparency, professionalism is no longer an option, but a basic requirement to survive in the property marketing services business in Indonesia," he added.

Director of LJH Realty, Oka Mahendra, believes that changes in consumer behavior and digitalization of marketing require property brokers to continue to increase their capacity, with an excellent service orientation.

"The growth of digital property platforms has encouraged an increase in the number of brokers in Indonesia. Along with increasing consumer education, service differentiation has now become the main factor for success in competition in the property broker services industry," he said.

Quoting Indonesian Real Estate (REI) data, it shows that the growth in property transactions in big cities is accompanied by an increase in the number of brokers and property brokerage offices.

Meanwhile, marketing platforms such as Rumah123 and other digital portals reveal changes in the way brokers search for clients, market units and build reputations.

"This condition makes the professionalism standards of brokers even higher, starting from communication skills, understanding the legality of transactions, to mastery of digital marketing," said Oka.

According to Oka Mahendra, a professional broker should have a number of main characteristics and competencies. First, consistent self-development. Professionalism is not formed in a short time. Brokers must continue to learn, practice and update their marketing and communications skills.

Second, implementing high service standards. Third, strategic marketing competency, where property brokers are required to be able to understand consumer psychology, negotiation techniques and data-based marketing strategies.

Fourth, certification and professional track record. Professional property brokers undergo continuous training, have competency certification, and demonstrate consistent performance.

Fifth, mastery of digital technology, including the ability to use social media, educational videos and digital platforms. It is an important part of modern professionalism.

Oka added, in facing tight competition in the property marketing services industry, br Oker must place human resource development as the main strategy for business sustainability.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – Dalam era digital, platform pemasaran online, virtual tour, dan pemasaran berbasis data akan mempercepat pertumbuhan sekaligus persaingan di industri jasa broker properti di Indonesia.

CEO Indonesia Property Watch (IPW) Ali Tranghanda mengatakan, prospek bisnis jasa broker properti di Indonesia masih sangat terbuka. Namun, hal itu berlaku hanya bagi pelaku yang mampu beradaptasi dengan perubahan perilaku pasar.

Ali menilai pertumbuhan kelas menengah, kebutuhan hunian di kawasan urban, serta meningkatnya minat investasi properti tetap menjadi motor utama peningkatan permintaan jasa broker properti dari waktu ke waktu.

Namun, ia menegaskan bahwa pola transaksi kini lebih rasional dan berbasis informasi. Karena itu, peran broker bergeser dari sekadar perantara menjadi konsultan properti yang memberi analisis nilai, risiko, dan potensi investasi.

“Broker yang bertahan adalah yang mampu memberi nilai tambah, bukan hanya menawarkan produk. Konsumen sekarang datang dengan data, sehingga broker harus lebih siap secara pengetahuan, teknologi, dan layanan,” ujarnya dalam podcast LJH Realty, dikutip Rabu (18/2/2026).

Ia juga menyoroti digitalisasi sebagai faktor penentu masa depan industri jasa broker properti. Platform pemasaran online, virtual tour, serta pemasaran berbasis data dinilai akan mempercepat seleksi alam di industri ini.

Baca Juga

  • Denyut Sektor Properti Melemah, Daya Beli Kelas Menengah Jatuh
  • Geliat Emiten Properti SMRA, BSDE, Cs di Awal Tahun
  • Lini Properti hingga Energi Diprediksi jadi Motor Pertumbuhan Aset Asuransi Umum

Perusahaan yang memiliki sistem pelatihan berkelanjutan, standar layanan tinggi, dan strategi pemasaran modern diprediksi memiliki peluang lebih besar untuk tumbuh.

Meski demikian, Ali menekankan bahwa tantangan utama industri bukan pada permintaan pasar, melainkan pada kualitas sumber daya manusia. Profesionalisme, integritas, dan konsistensi pengembangan diri disebutnya sebagai fondasi utama bagi broker yang ingin bertahan dalam jangka panjang.

“Dengan meningkatnya ekspektasi konsumen dan transparansi informasi, profesionalisme bukan lagi pilihan, melainkan syarat dasar untuk bertahan dalam bisnis jasa pemasaran properti di Indonesia,” imbuhnya.

Direktur LJH Realty, Oka Mahendra, menilai bahwa perubahan perilaku konsumen dan digitalisasi pemasaran menuntut broker properti harus terus meningkatkan kapasitas diri, dengan berorientasi service excellent (layanan prima).

“Pertumbuhan platform digital properti mendorong peningkatan jumlah broker di Indonesia. Seiring dengan meningkatnya edukasi konsumen, diferensiasi layanan kini menjadi faktor utama kesuksesan dalam persaingan di industri jasa broker properti,” tuturnya.

Mengutip data Real Estat Indonesia (REI), menunjukkan bahwa pertumbuhan transaksi properti di kota besar diikuti peningkatan jumlah broker dan kantor broker properti.

Sementara itu, platform pemasaran seperti Rumah123 dan portal digital lainnya mengungkapkan adanya perubahan cara broker mencari klien, memasarkan unit, dan membangun reputasi.

"Kondisi ini membuat standar profesionalisme broker semakin tinggi, mulai dari kemampuan komunikasi, pemahaman legalitas transaksi, hingga penguasaan digital marketing,” ujar Oka.

Menurut Oka Mahendra, seorang broker profesional seyogyanya memiliki sejumlah karakter dan kompetensi utama. Pertama, konsistensi pengembangan diri. Profesionalisme tidak terbentuk dalam waktu singkat. Broker harus terus belajar, berlatih, dan memperbarui kemampuan pemasaran serta komunikasi.

Kedua, menerapkan standar layanan tinggi. Ketiga, kompetensi pemasaran strategis, dimana broker properti dituntut mampu memahami psikologi konsumen, teknik negosiasi, dan strategi pemasaran berbasis data.

Keempat, sertifikasi dan rekam jejak profesional. Broker properti profesional mengikuti pelatihan berkelanjutan, memiliki sertifikasi kompetensi, serta menunjukkan kinerja yang konsisten.

Kelima, penguasaan teknologi digital, mencakup kemampuan menggunakan media sosial, video edukasi, dan platform digital. Hal itu menjadi bagian penting dari profesionalisme modern.

Oka menambahkan, dalam menghadapi kompetisi industri jasa pemasaran properti yang ketat, broker harus menempatkan pengembangan sumber daya manusia sebagai strategi utama keberlanjutan bisnis.

title: Minister of PKP: Construction of 26,000 Huntap in Sumatra Needs IDR 8.5 Trillion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Housing and Settlement Areas (PKP) revealed that it needs a jumbo budget allocation to fulfill the procurement of 26,969 permanent housing units (huntap) for communities affected by the Sumatra disaster.

Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas (PKP) Maruarar Sirait explained that the total funding requirement to realize the construction of all residential units is projected to reach IDR 8.525 trillion.

"We have recorded data, what our officers have recorded is that there are 26,969 units [huntaps that need to be built] with a budget requirement of IDR 8.525 trillion," said Maruarar when met at the Indonesian Parliament Complex, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He explained that the housing development strategy in Sumatra would focus on the concept of one integrated stretch of land. This is done to ensure the quality of the settlement is more organized rather than a separate development pattern.

However, considering the limitations of the APBN in financing the project, the PKP Ministry emphasized plans to strengthen private sector involvement through mutual cooperation programs.

At the same time, Ara is also targeting accelerated construction so that some residential units in Sumatra can be functional in the near future.

Also Read

This target was set to respond to the urgent needs of residents, especially so that hundreds of families can occupy permanent homes before entering the upcoming Eid period.

"This is our breakthrough step, because we also want hundreds of families to enter houses that are permanent residences before Eid. This is a synergy of President Prabowo's direction, so that we can take steps quickly," explained Ara.

Previously, the PKP Ministry together with the Buddhist Tzu Chi Foundation had also realized the construction of 2,603 ​​permanent residential units intended for victims of natural disasters in the Sumatra region.

Meanwhile, referring to data from the Ministry of PKP, there are 139,485 community housing units affected by the flood and landslide disasters that occurred in the Aceh, North Sumatra and West Sumatra regions.

The Aceh region experienced the greatest damage. A total of 38,553 housing units were slightly damaged, 22,204 housing units were moderately damaged, 35,517 housing units were heavily damaged and 4,295 housing units were washed away. Thus, the total number of houses in the Aceh region affected by floods and landslides penetrated 100,569 housing units.

Then, there were 29,766 housing units affected by the disaster in North Sumatra. In detail, 19,936 units were slightly damaged, 4,304 units were moderately damaged, 4,351 units were seriously damaged and 1,135 units were washed away.

Finally, the total number of houses affected in the West Sumatra region reached 9,150 units. Of these, 5,634 units were slightly damaged, 1,174 units were moderately damaged, 1,577 units were seriously damaged and 765 units were declared washed away.
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Perumahan dan Kawasan Permukiman (PKP) mengungkap membutuhkan alokasi anggaran jumbo guna memenuhi pengadaan 26.969 unit hunian tetap (huntap) bagi masyarakat terdampak bencana Sumatra. 

Menteri Perumahan dan Kawasan Permukiman (PKP) Maruarar Sirait menjelaskan bahwa total kebutuhan dana untuk merealisasikan pembangunan seluruh unit hunian tersebut diproyeksikan tembus Rp8,525 triliun.

"Kami sudah mendata, yang didata oleh petugas kami ada 26.969 unit [huntap yang perlu dibangun] dengan kebutuhan anggaran Rp8,525 triliun,” ujar Maruarar saat ditemui di Kompleks Parlemen RI, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan bahwa strategi pembangunan huntap di Sumatra akan difokuskan pada konsep satu hamparan lahan yang terintegrasi. Hal ini dilakukan untuk menjamin kualitas pemukiman yang lebih tertata dibandingkan pola pembangunan yang terpisah-pisah.

Akan tetapi, mempertimbangkan keterbatasan APBN dalam membiayai proyek tersebut, Kementerian PKP menekankan berencana memperkuat keterlibatan sektor swasta melalui program gotong royong. 

Pada saat yang sama, Ara juga menargetkan percepatan konstruksi agar sebagian unit hunian di Sumatra dapat segera fungsional dalam waktu dekat.

  • Usai Bangun 1.368 Huntara, Danantara Segera Groundbreaking Huntap di Sumatra
  • Pemerintah Bakal Kucurkan Banpres Rp3 Juta Buat 200.000 UMKM Korban Bencana Sumatra
  • Menteri PKP Targetkan 2.603 Unit Huntap di Sumatra Rampung Mei 2026

Target tersebut ditetapkan guna merespons kebutuhan mendesak warga, terutama agar ratusan keluarga sudah bisa menempati rumah permanen tersebut sebelum memasuki periode Lebaran mendatang.

title: Those Who Benefit from the Lebaran Plane Ticket Discount Stimulus
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government has rolled out the stimulus for airplane discounts ahead of the Eid holiday period again. However, the effectiveness of these policies in attracting passengers and suppressing inflation is questionable, while the profit margins of airlines and airport operators are at stake.

The government hopes that through the stimulus from the State Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBN) it can encourage people's purchasing power to use airplanes, thereby increasing mobility and the economy.

Data from the Ministry of Transportation shows that with a 13%–14% discount for domestic flights during Christmas 2025/2026, the number of passengers actually fell by -0.91% compared to the same period last year.

Not to mention, the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) noted that airplane ticket prices are among the top 10 contributors to inflation in December 2025, with a contribution of 0.02% on a monthly basis.

In this year's Eid stimulus scheme, the government is providing bigger discounts through full Government Borne Value Added Tax (VAT DTP).

The government also provides a 50% discount on Aircraft Passenger Service Fees (PJP2U) aka Passenger Service Charge (PSC), as well as Aircraft Landing, Placement and Storage Service Fees (PJP4U) for national airlines.

Also Read

In addition, the government reduced the additional fuel surcharge (FS) for jet aircraft by 2% and for propellers by 20%.

Aviation observer Alvin Lie views that this policy has proven to be ineffective and actually burdens industry players.

Previously, PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia or InJourneyAirports admitted that the company's losses reached IDR 250 billion during discounts last Christmas.

Even though the government has removed 100% VAT on tickets, VAT on aviation fuel still applies to domestic flights. Through cuts to PJP2U and PJP4U, airport revenues were also cut.

"Industry players also need profits to survive. If every high season their income is cut, even though operating costs during the high season increase, they are worried that the quality of their services will decrease," he explained to Bisnis, quoted on Thursday (19/2/2026).

According to him, if the government really intends to reduce plane ticket prices and boost people's purchasing power, it is necessary to eliminate VAT on tickets and aviation fuel throughout the year.

This includes updating the Upper Limit Tariff (TBA) and Lower Limit Tariff (TBB) policies, so that ticket prices are more flexible, and can even drop lower during low season. He considered the policy to be more incidental than a concrete solution.

"Improve the TBA-TBB, remove VAT, waive import duties for aircraft components. Later throughout the year our systemic flying costs will decrease and there will be no need for incidental [discounts] every time and I'm sorry to see this is just for image purposes," he stressed.

Likewise, the Head of the Institute for Transportation Studies and transportation observer, Ki Darmaningtyas, views that this discount places the burden on operators to obtain additional input during high demand seasons.

"This is an opportunity for operators to get more input to cover expenses on normal slow days," he said.

On the other hand, the government claims to have ensured that this policy does not harm airlines.

Minister of Transportation Dudy Purwagandhi emphasized that there would be no losses for airlines due to the stimulus provided by the government.

Airlines only need to comply, because the difference from the discount is paid by the government using state treasury.

"Airlines must comply, because they are not actually harmed. The government is providing the stimulus. We are not interfering with costs or revenues from airlines," said Dudy when met at the Parliament Complex, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

In fact, the government plans to impose sanctions on rogue airlines that raise prices before the discount period.

Director General of Air Transportation, Ministry of Transportation, Lukman F. Laisa, emphasized that the admini fines strategy will be waiting for the airline, although the amount has not been determined.

"We will also hold a meeting with the legal department to determine the amount of the fine," he said.

Considering that the stimulus is a direct direction from the government, especially President Prabowo Subianto, business actors claim to be ready to carry out this mandate.

Secretary General of the Indonesian National Air Carriers Association (INACA) and President Director of PT TransNusa Aviation, Bayu Sutanto, sees that passengers will benefit the most from this discount.

"Airlines' revenues are regulated through the applicable TBA and TBB. So there is no such thing as increasing and expensive ticket prices as long as they do not exceed the TBA," he said.

Likewise, the President Director of PT Citilink Indonesia, Darsito Hendroseputro, said that the company complies with government directions regarding providing stimulus in the form of discounts on plane tickets during the 2026 Eid transport period.

"In accordance with government directions, the stimulus for Eid is valid from March 14 to 29. The price reduction is around 18% to 21%," he said when met at the Garuda Maintenance Facility (GMF), Friday (13/2/2026).

For example, the average ticket price for the Jakarta-Medan route was IDR 1.9 million, with this stimulus it fell to IDR 1.6 million.

However, the effectiveness of the airline ticket fare discount policy will only be seen after Eid 2026. Will it really be able to boost the number of passengers and strengthen the recovery of domestic flights - which are also still struggling to recover from the Covid-19 pandemic - or will it not have a significant impact on the industry.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Stimulus diskon tiket pesawat menjelang masa libur Lebaran kembali digulirkan pemerintah. Namun, efektivitas kebijakan tersebut dalam menarik penumpang dan menekan inflasi dipertanyakan, sedangkan margin keuntungan maskapai dan operator bandara ikut dipertaruhkan.

Pemerintah berharap melalui stimulus dari Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara (APBN) tersebut dapat mendorong daya beli masyarakat untuk menggunakan pesawat sehingga meningkatkan mobilitas dan ekonomi.

Data Kementerian Perhubungan menunjukkan bahwa dengan diskon 13%–14% untuk penerbangan domestik pada Nataru 2025/2026 lalu, jumlah penumpang justru turun sebesar -0,91% dibandingkan dengan periode yang sama tahun lalu.

Belum lagi, Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat harga tiket pesawat termasuk 10 besar penyumbang inflasi Desember 2025, dengan kontribusi sebesar 0,02% secara bulanan.

Dalam skema stimulus Lebaran tahun ini, pemerintah memberikan diskon lebih besar melalui Pajak Pertambahan Nilai Ditanggung Pemerintah (PPN DTP) secara penuh.

Pemerintah juga memberikan potongan tarif sebesar 50% terhadap Tarif Pelayanan Jasa Penumpang Pesawat Udara (PJP2U) alias Passenger Service Charge (PSC), serta Tarif Pelayanan Jasa Pendaratan, Penempatan, dan Penyimpanan Pesawat Udara (PJP4U) bagi maskapai nasional.

Baca Juga

  • Kabar Baik! Citilink Tebar Diskon Tiket Pesawat Lebaran hingga 21%
  • AirAsia Diskon Tiket Pesawat Mudik Lebaran 2026, Cek Jadwal dan Rutenya
  • Beli Tiket Pesawat Ekonomi Gratis PPN Mulai Hari Ini, Cek Ketentuannya!

Selain itu, pemerintah menurunkan biaya tambahan bahan bakar atau fuel surcharge (FS) untuk pesawat jet sebesar 2% dan untuk propeller sebesar 20%.

Pengamat penerbangan Alvin Lie memandang kebijakan ini terbukti tidak efektif dan justru memberatkan pelaku industri tersebut.

Sebelumnya, PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia atau InJourney Airports mengaku kerugian perusahaan mencapai Rp250 miliar saat diskon pada Nataru yang lalu.

Meski pemerintah memang menghapus 100% PPN terhadap tiket, PPN terhadap avtur tetap berlaku untuk penerbangan domestik. Melalui pemangkasan PJP2U dan PJP4U, pendapatan bandara turut dipangkas.

“Pelaku industri ini juga butuh laba untuk bertahan. Kalau setiap high season ini pendapatannya dipangkas, padahal biaya operasi pada high season naik, khawatir kualitas layanannya jadi turun,” jelasnya kepada Bisnis, dikutip pada Kamis (19/2/2026).

Menurutnya, jika pemerintah memang berniat menurunkan harga tiket pesawat dan mendorong daya beli masyarakat, perlu penghapusan PPN tiket dan avtur sepanjang tahun.

Hal itu termasuk memperbarui kebijakan Tarif Batas Atas (TBA) dan Tarif Batas Bawah (TBB), sehingga harga tiket lebih fleksibel, bahkan dapat turun lebih rendah saat low season. Dirinya menilai kebijakan tersebut lebih bersifat insidental ketimbang solusi konkret.

“Perbaiki TBA-TBB, hapus PPN, bebaskan bea masuk untuk komponen pesawat. Nanti akan sepanjang tahun sistemik biaya terbang kita akan turun dan tidak perlu setiap kali [diskon] insidental dan maaf saya melihatnya ini hanya untuk pencitraan saja,” tegasnya.

Senada, Ketua Institut Studi Transportasi sekaligus pengamat transportasi Ki Darmaningtyas memandang diskon ini membebankan operator untuk mendapatkan masukan tambahan kala musim ramai permintaan.

“Ini kesempatan bagi operator untuk mendapatkan masukan yang lebih banyak untuk menutup pengeluaran pada hari-hari biasa yang sepi,” tuturnya.

Di sisi lain, pemerintah mengaku telah memastikan kebijakan ini tidak merugikan maskapai.

Menhub: Maskapai Tak Rugi

Menteri Perhubungan Dudy Purwagandhi menegaskan bahwa tak ada kerugian bagi maskapai dengan adanya stimulus yang diberikan pemerintah.

Maskapai hanya perlu patuh, karena selisih dari adanya diskon tersebut dibayar pemerintah menggunakan kas negara.

“Airlines harus mematuhi, karena sebenarnya tidak dirugikan. Pemerintah yang memberikan stimulus. Kami tidak mengganggu biaya ataupun revenue dari para maskapai,” ucap Dudy saat ditemui di Kompleks Parlemen, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Bahkan, pemerintah berencana memberikan sanksi kepada maskapai nakal yang menaikkan harga terlebih dahulu sebelum periode diskon.

Direktur Jenderal Perhubungan Udara Kemenhub Lukman F. Laisa menegaskan, denda administrasi akan menanti maskapai, meski besarannya belum ditentukan.

“Kami akan rapatkan juga dengan bagian hukum untuk ditentukan berapa besaran dendanya,” tuturnya.

Respons Pelaku Usaha

Mengingat stimulus merupakan arahan langsung dari pemerintah, khususnya Presiden Prabowo Subianto, para pelaku usaha mengaku siap menjalankan mandat tersebut.

Sekretaris Jenderal Indonesia National Air Carriers Association (INACA) sekaligus Direktur Utama PT TransNusa Aviation, Bayu Sutanto, melihat penumpang paling diuntungkan dengan adanya diskon ini.

“Pendapatan maskapai ya seperti diatur melalui TBA dan TBB yang berlaku. Jadi enggak ada istilah harga tiket naik dan mahal sepanjang tidak melebihi TBA,” ungkapnya.

Senada, Direktur Utama PT Citilink Indonesia, Darsito Hendroseputro, menyampaikan perusahaan mematuhi arahan pemerintah terkait pemberian stimulus berupa diskon tiket pesawat pada masa Angkutan Lebaran 2026.

“Sesuai arahan pemerintah, stimulus untuk Lebaran berlaku mulai tanggal 14 sampai 29 Maret. Penurunan harga sekitar 18% sampai 21%,” ujarnya saat ditemui di Garuda Maintenance Facility (GMF), Jumat (13/2/2026).

Sebagai contoh, harga tiket pesawat rute Jakarta–Medan yang rata-rata senilai Rp1,9 juta, dengan adanya stimulus tersebut turun menjadi Rp1,6 juta.

Meski demikian, efektivitas kebijakan diskon tarif tiket pesawat baru akan terlihat setelah Lebaran 2026. Apakah benar mampu mendongkrak jumlah penumpang dan memperkuat pemulihan penerbangan domestik—yang juga masih berjuang bangkit dari pandemi Covid-19—atau justru tidak memberikan dampak signifikan bagi industri.

title: Issue of US-Iran War Overshadows Supply, Global Oil Prices Strengthen
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — World oil prices continued their rally after recording their biggest daily increase since October. The rise was supported by reports that a United States military intervention against Iran could occur sooner than expected.

Based on Bloomberg data on Thursday (19/2/2026), the price of Brent oil for April delivery rose 0.2% to US$70.50 per barrel. Meanwhile, the price of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) oil for March delivery rose 0.3% to US$65.38 per barrel.

Brent oil held above US$70 a barrel after surging 4.3% on Wednesday, while WTI traded above US$65. US media, Axios, reported that any US military operation would likely be a campaign lasting several weeks, as well as the Israeli government pushing a scenario targeting regime change in the Islamic Republic of Iran.

The potential for armed conflict risks disrupting supplies from a region that accounts for about a third of world oil production. However, US President Donald Trump faces the risk of political pressure ahead of this year's midterm elections if a spike in oil prices drives up consumer gasoline prices.

Negotiations between the two parties have so far not resulted in a breakthrough. Tehran says it has reached a “general agreement” with Washington on the framework of a potential nuclear deal. A US official said Iranian negotiators would return to Geneva in two weeks with new proposals.

On the other hand, the US also announced visa restrictions on Iranian officials and executives following the crackdown on recent protests.

Also Read

“Failure to resolve the core issues at the heart of the dispute continues to increase the chances of military confrontation,” RBC Capital Markets analysts, including Helima Croft, wrote in a note.

Outside the Middle East, talks to end the war in Ukraine ended in less than 90 minutes with no clear outcome. Meanwhile, Russia—a member of the OPEC+ alliance—is experiencing a drilling slowdown that has the potential to further pressure oil production.

On the US supply side, crude oil inventories fell by 609,000 barrels last week, according to data from the American Petroleum Institute. Official government data is scheduled to be released on Thursday local time.
