content_original:
Bisnis.com,JAKARTA — Sejumlah pemimpin korporasi dan asosiasi bisnis papan atas dari Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat turut mendampingi Presiden Prabowo Subianto dalam rangkaian agenda Indonesia–US Business Summit di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington, D.C., Rabu (18/2) waktu setempat. Kehadiran para pengusaha ini menegaskan upaya penguatan diplomasi ekonomi serta perluasan kemitraan strategis kedua negara.

Berdasarkan keterangan resmi yang diterimaBisnis,forum tersebut dihadiri oleh sejumlah tokoh penting dari kalangan dunia usaha dan organisasi bisnis. Pengusaha papan atas ikut hadir, antara lain Ketua KADIN Indonesia Anindya Novyan Bakrie, Ketua APINDO Shinta Widjaja Kamdani, Direktur Utama Pertamina Simon Aloysius Mantiri, serta Presiden Direktur PT Freeport Indonesia Tony Wenas.

Sementara dari pihak Amerika Serikat dan organisasi internasional, tampak hadir CEO US-Asean Business Council Brian McFeeters, Presiden USINDO David Merrill, serta Senior Vice President U.S. Chamber of Commerce John Murphy.

Sejumlah bos korporasi global juga turut hadir, antara lain Chairman Freeport-McMoRan Richard C. Adkerson, CEO S&P Global Martina Cheung, President ExxonMobil Indonesia Wade Floyd, Senior Vice President Caterpillar Inc. Kathryn Karol, Senior Vice President Cargill Kelsey Freeman Saelens, serta Vice President PepsiCo Caroline Berson.

Dalam forum tersebut, Presiden Prabowo juga menyaksikan penandatanganan sedikitnya 11 nota kesepahaman (MoU) investasi dengan total nilai mencapai US$38,4 miliar atau sekitar Rp650,07 triliun. Kerja sama mencakup sektor strategis seperti pangan, energi, industri manufaktur, furnitur, hingga teknologi semikonduktor.

Forum yang diselenggarakan oleh KADIN Indonesia bersama US–ASEAN Business Council dan USINDO ini mempertemukan pejabat tinggi dan pelaku usaha kedua negara guna memperkuat kerja sama investasi serta implementasi rencana Perjanjian Perdagangan Resiprokal RI–AS.

Baca Juga

Kehadiran para pemimpin korporasi global mendampingi Presiden Prabowo menegaskan bahwa diplomasi ekonomi Indonesia kini semakin terintegrasi dengan sektor swasta. Sinergi ini diharapkan mampu mempercepat arus investasi, memperluas transfer teknologi, serta memperkuat posisi Indonesia sebagai mitra strategis Amerika Serikat di kawasan Asia Tenggara.

Dorong Kemitraan Ekonomi Strategis

Kegiatan ini diawali denganexclusive business roundtableyang membahas penguatan kolaborasi ekonomi kedua negara melalui sinergi pemerintah dan sektor swasta. Fokus utama diskusi mencakup relaksasi kebijakan dan peluang investasi yang diharapkan meningkatkan arus perdagangan bilateral.

Kehadiran Presiden Prabowo dalam forum tersebut menegaskan komitmen Indonesia untuk menciptakan iklim investasi yang stabil dan ramah bagi mitra internasional, sekaligus memperkuat posisi Indonesia sebagai mitra strategis Amerika Serikat di kawasan Asia Tenggara.

Dengan nilai investasi yang signifikan dan cakupan sektor yang luas, kesepakatan ini diharapkan menjadi katalis pertumbuhan ekonomi serta memperdalam hubungan ekonomi Indonesia–Amerika Serikat di masa mendatang.

title: Explanation of Purbaya's Subordinates Impact of SUN Offering Continuously Declines
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Finance assesses that the trend of decreasing investor interest in Government Debt Securities (SUN) auctions which has occurred successively since the beginning of this year was triggered by banking strategies which began to hold back liquidity in preparation for the Eid al-Fitr momentum, as well as the Chinese New Year holiday in a number of global financial markets.

Based on data from the Directorate General of Financing and Risk Management (DJPPR) of the Ministry of Finance, incoming bids at SUN auctions continue to trend downward.

At the auction on January 6 2026, the government still pocketed a bid of IDR 90.96 trillion. This figure decreased to IDR 82.9 trillion at the January 20 auction, fell again to IDR 76.58 trillion at the February 3 auction, and finally reached IDR 63.06 trillion at the February 18 2026 auction.

Reflecting on the last auction, the Director General of Financing and Risk Management at the Ministry of Finance, Suminto, believes that investor interest is still relatively solid even though nominal bids have decreased. He highlighted that the supply contraction was most pronounced in short tenor instruments.

"The decrease in incoming bids mainly came from short tenor SPN [State Treasury Letters], in line with banking strategies in anticipating liquidity needs ahead of Eid," he said, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Apart from domestic factors, Suminto said that global market conditions which were still in the atmosphere of the Chinese New Year celebration holiday in several financial centers such as Singapore and Hong Kong also influenced the volume of incoming offers.

Also Read

Of the total incoming bid of IDR 63.06 trillion at the February 18 auction, the government decided to absorb funds amounting to IDR 40.00 trillion.

In more detail, investor demand was observed to be highly concentrated in medium tenor instruments. The 5 year and 10 year series dominate the market with recorded incoming bids of IDR 24.16 trillion and IDR 21.07 trillion respectively.

Suminto believes that this development indicates a strong investor preference for tenors that are liquid and act as benchmarks in the secondary market.

In terms of profile, Suminto explained that domestic investors, especially the banking sector, still dominate the portion of auction winners. In the midst of the Chinese New Year holiday, he also highlighted that foreign investors continued to register participation with an absorption portion of around 15.50% of the total bids won.

"[The participation of foreign investors] reflects confidence in Indonesia's economic fundamentals and the credibility of fiscal management," said the subordinate of Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa.

As for borrowing costs, the government claims that the yield, aka auction returns, is relatively stable. Suminto claims that the increase in weighted average yield is still very limited when compared with previous SUN auctions, even though the auction was held after a revision of the outlook by the rating agency Moody's.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Keuangan menilai tren penyusutan minat investor dalam lelang Surat Utang Negara (SUN) yang terjadi secara beruntun sejak awal tahun ini dipicu oleh strategi perbankan yang mulai menahan likuiditas untuk persiapan menjelang momentum Lebaran, serta faktor libur Tahun Baru Imlek di sejumlah pasar keuangan global.

Berdasarkan data Direktorat Jenderal Pengelolaan Pembiayaan dan Risiko (DJPPR) Kementerian Keuangan, penawaran masuk (incoming bids) pada lelang SUN terus menempuh tren penurunan.

Pada lelang 6 Januari 2026, pemerintah masih mengantongi penawaran Rp90,96 triliun. Angka ini susut menjadi Rp82,9 triliun pada lelang 20 Januari, turun lagi ke level Rp76,58 triliun pada lelang 3 Februari, dan terakhir di angka Rp63,06 triliun pada lelang 18 Februari 2026.

Berkaca dari lelang terakhir, Direktur Jenderal Pengelolaan Pembiayaan dan Risiko Kementerian Keuangan Suminto meyakini animo investor secara masih tergolong solid meski secara nominal penawaran menurun. Dia menyoroti bahwa kontraksi penawaran paling terasa pada instrumen tenor pendek.

"Penurunan incoming bids terutama berasal dari SPN [Surat Perbendaharaan Negara] tenor pendek, seiring dengan strategi perbankan dalam mengantisipasi kebutuhan likuiditas menjelang Lebaran," ungkapnya, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Selain faktor domestik, Suminto menyebut kondisi pasar global yang masih dalam suasana libur perayaan Chinese New Year di beberapa pusat keuangan seperti Singapura dan Hong Kong turut mempengaruhi volume penawaran yang masuk.

Baca Juga

  • Nasib Pembiayaan APBN Ketika Surat Utang Pemerintah Sepi Peminat
  • Sepi Peminat, Jumlah Penawaran Lelang Surat Utang Negara Anjlok 17,6%
  • Korporasi Lebih Pilih Surat Utang

Dari total incoming bids sebesar Rp63,06 triliun pada lelang 18 Februari, pemerintah memutuskan untuk menyerap dana sebesar Rp40,00 triliun.

Lebih rinci, permintaan investor terpantau sangat terkonsentrasi pada instrumen tenor menengah. Seri 5 tahun dan 10 tahun mendominasi buruan pasar dengan catatan incoming bids masing-masing sebesar Rp24,16 triliun dan Rp21,07 triliun.

Suminto menilai, perkembangan tersebut mengindikasikan preferensi investor yang kuat terhadap tenor-tenor yang likuid dan bertindak sebagai benchmark di pasar sekunder.

Dari sisi profil, Suminto menjelaskan investor domestik, khususnya sektor perbankan, masih mendominasi porsi pemenang lelang. Di tengah libur Imlek, dia juga menyoroti investor asing tetap mencatatkan partisipasi dengan porsi serapan sekitar 15,50% dari total penawaran yang dimenangkan.

"[Partisipasi investor asing ini] mencerminkan kepercayaan terhadap fundamental ekonomi Indonesia dan kredibilitas pengelolaan fiskal," ujar anak buah Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa itu.

Adapun dari kacamata biaya pinjaman, pemerintah mengklaim yield alias imbal hasil lelang relatif terjaga. Suminto mengklaim bahwa kenaikan weighted average yield masih sangat terbatas apabila dikomparasikan dengan lelang SUN sebelumnya, meskipun lelang digelar pasca-adanya revisi outlook oleh lembaga pemeringkat Moody’s.

title: The Fate of APBN Financing When Government Debt Securities Are Low in Interest
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – Indications of a decline in investor interest in the auction of Government Debt Securities, aka SUN, cast a shadow over the debt financing target of the 2026 State Revenue and Expenditure Budget, aka APBN, worth IDR 832.2 trillion.

However, amidst the large need for budget financing, the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu) actually noted that the number of incoming bids in 4 debt securities auctions continued to decline.

During the auction period on January 6 2026, for example, the government recorded that the total incoming bids still reached IDR 90.96 trillion. This figure fell to IDR 82.9 trillion at the auction on January 20 2026, fell again to IDR 76.58 trillion on February 3 2026, and most recently on February 18 2026 it decreased to IDR 63.06 trillion.

This condition is inversely proportional to the realization of the SUN auction in early 2025 which saw incoming bids growing over the next three auctions. At the first SUN auction in 2025, the government collected IDR 31.65 trillion and tended to grow until Tuesday (18/2/2025) raising funds worth IDR 84 trillion.

However, the Director General of Financing and Risk Management (DJPPR) of the Ministry of Finance, Suminto, stated that the number of offers or incoming bids at the auction on February 18 2026 still reflects fairly solid demand conditions amidst global market conditions which are still celebrating Chinese New Year in several countries such as Singapore and Hong Kong.

"Investor demand is still concentrated in medium tenors, especially the 5 year and 10 year series which recorded incoming bids of IDR 24.16 trillion and IDR 21.07 trillion respectively. This shows investors' preference for liquid tenors and has become a benchmark in the secondary market," said Suminto to Bisnis, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Also Read

Suminto also explained that domestic investor participation remained strong, especially the banking sector which dominated the share of auction winners.

On the other hand, even though several financial markets are on holiday, interest from foreign investors also remains high. The number of winning bids from foreign investors was around 15.50% of the total won. "This reflects confidence in Indonesia's economic fundamentals and the credibility of fiscal management."

Apart from that, even though incoming bids have decreased compared to previous SUN auctions, continued Suminto, the yield or return requested by investors is still quite competitive. According to him, the decline in incoming bids, especially from short tenor SPNs, occurred in line with banking strategies in anticipating liquidity needs ahead of Eid.

"In terms of costs, the auction yield was relatively maintained with an increase in the weighted average yield which remained limited compared to the previous SUN auction, even though it took place after the outlook revision by Moody's. "This reflects investor confidence which remains solid in the fundamentals of the domestic financial market," he stressed.

Meanwhile, the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu) noted a decrease in bids or incoming bids for Government Debt Letters aka SUN in the auction which took place on Wednesday (18/2/2026) yesterday.

The Ministry of Finance noted that the number of bids entered in yesterday's auction reached IDR 63.06 trillion or a decrease of around 17.6% from the auction period on February 3 2026 which reached IDR 76.58 trillion. This figure is also much smaller than the bid at the January 20 2026 auction of IDR 82.9 trillion.

According to the official website of the Directorate General of Financing and Risk Management (DJPPR) of the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu), the number of debt securities auctioned last Wednesday included 9 series, namely SPN01260322 (new issuance), SPN03260521 (new issuance), SPN12270204 (reopening), FR0109 (reopening), FR0108 (reopening), FR0106 (reopening), FR0107 (reopening), FR0102 (reopening) and FR0105 (reopening).

If detailed, the total bids received for the SPN01260322 series reached IDR 700 billion, SPN03260521 IDR 300 billion, SPN12270204 IDR 4.77 trillion, FR0109 IDR 24.16 trillion, FR0108 IDR 21.07 trillion, FR0106 IDR 4.33 trillion, FR0107 IDR 3.29 trillion, FR0102 Rp. 2.23 tri liun, and FR0105 IDR 2.18 trillion.

Due to sluggish bidding, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa finally increased the auction amount for winning debt securities, which was initially targeted at IDR 33 trillion to IDR 40 trillion. The auction results were also higher compared to the auction period on February 3 2026, which was only IDR 36 trillion.

The decline in offers occurred in the majority of debt securities except the Fixed Rate series or FR0108, where the total offer reached IDR 21.07 trillion.

Meanwhile, the State Treasury Letter series or SPN12270204 with a weighted average yield of 4.48%, for example, which at the auction on February 3 2026 was able to record a bid of IDR 6.92 trillion at the auction on February 18 2026 fell to IDR 4.77 trillion.

Similar conditions also occurred in the Fixed Rate or FR series with yields in the range of 5.67% - 6.77%, the FR0109 series offer fell from IDR 25.39 trillion to IDR 24.16 trillion, FR0106 fell from IDR 8.93 trillion to IDR 4.33 trillion, FR0107 from IDR 4.13 trillion to IDR 3.29 trillion, FR0102 which was originally IDR 3.78 trillion became IDR 2.23 trillion, and the FR0105 series decreased from IDR 34.74 trillion to IDR 2.18 trillion.

Mounting geopolitical tensions between the US and Iran are considered to be one of the causes of increasingly sluggish market demand in the auction of Government Debt Securities (SUN) throughout 2026.

Head of Fixed Income Anugerah Sekuritas Indonesia, Ramdhan Ario Maruto, believes that increasingly mounting geopolitical tensions have discouraged foreign investors from investing in Indonesia through SUN instruments.

"If foreigners leave, psychologically this indicates that they will go down because they are aggressive. Domestic will usually follow too. For yesterday's decline, foreigners left. That will make domestic ones come too," he said to Business, Monday (16/2/2026).

Inevitably, geopolitical instability has also led DJPPR to issue more short-tenor SUN. Compared to 2025, State Treasury Letters (SPN) are usually issued 2 times and this has increased to 3 times this year.

Market uptake is no less large for SPN. "In the latest SUN issuance, for example, the three SPN tenors received market absorption worth Rp. 11.98 trillion, greater than the actual absorption of Rp. 8.56 trillion at the last auction in 2025. "This short tenor is due to the previous uncertainty. So the risk is longer, volatility is usually higher. The potential for price corrections and yield changes is also greater. Indeed, market demand is higher in the short term because current conditions are unstable," he added.

Meanwhile, KB Valbury Sekuritas Economist Fikri C. Permana believes that the increasingly sluggish market uptake of SUN auctions recently is more due to domestic macroeconomic conditions. Fikri highlighted the 2025 APBN deficit and state tax revenues which tend to be low.

Domestic conditions like this make investors ask for a higher risk premium for government-issued debt securities. "This means there is concern, perhaps the data is not in line. Indonesia's capacity is decreasing over time. This is what makes the market, I think it's not only Moody's that is asking for a higher yield, but all investors. That's why demand for SBN is lower," he said to Bisnis, Monday (16/2/2026).

Meanwhile, the consistent realization of sukuk auction bids is at a level of around IDR 50 trillion - IDR 40 trillion, which is thought to be more due to the niche market for sharia products. That way, this product will continue to receive stable offers from investors.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA – Indikasi penurunan minat investor dalam lelang Surat Utang Negara alias SUN membayangi target pembiayaan utang Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara alias APBN 2026 senilai Rp832,2 triliun.

Namun di tengah besarnya kebutuhan pembiayaan anggaran, Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu) justru mencatat bahwa jumlah penawaran yang masuk (incoming bids) dalam 4 kali lelang surat utang terus mengalami penurunan.

Pada periode lelang 6 Januari 2026 lalu, misalnya, pemerintah mencatat total penawaran yang masuk masih menembus angka Rp90,96 triliun. Angka ini turun menjadi Rp82,9 triliun pada lelang 20 Januari 2026, turun lagi ke Rp76,58 triliun pada 3 Februari 2026, dan yang terakhir pada 18 Februari 2026 kemarin menyusut ke angka Rp63,06 triliun.  

Kondisi ini berbanding terbalik dengan realisasi lelang SUN pada awal 2025 yang menorehkan penawaran masuk yang bertumbuh hingga tiga lelang selanjutnya. Pada lelang SUN perdana 2025, pemerintah menghimpun dana Rp31,65 triliun dan cenderung tumbuh hingga Selasa (18/2/2025) menghimpun dana senilai Rp84 triliun.

Pemerintah Klaim Permintaan Solid

Meski demikian, Direktur Jenderal Pengelolaan Pembiayaan dan Risiko (DJPPR) Kemenkeu Suminto mengemukakan bahwa jumlah penawaran atau incoming bids pada lelang 18 Februari 2026 masih mencerminkan kondisi permintaan yang cukup solid di tengah kondisi pasar global yang masih merayakan Imlek di beberapa negara seperti  Singapura, dan Hong Kong. 

“Permintaan investor masih terkonsentrasi pada tenor menengah, khususnya seri 5 tahun dan 10 tahun yang mencatat incoming bids masing-masing sebesar Rp24,16 triliun dan Rp21,07 triliun. Hal ini menunjukkan preferensi investor terhadap tenor yang likuid dan menjadi benchmark di pasar sekunder,: kata Suminto kepada Bisnis, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Baca Juga

  • Sepi Peminat, Jumlah Penawaran Lelang Surat Utang Negara Anjlok 17,6%
  • Minat Investor Turun, Lelang SUN Himpun Penawaran Masuk Rp63,03 Triliun
  • IHSG Berisiko Melemah Hari Ini (18/1), Pasar Cermati Lelang SUN Rp33 Triliun

Suminto juga menjelaskan bahwa partisipasi investor domestik tetap kuat, terutama sektor perbankan yang mendominasi porsi pemenang lelang.

Di sisi lain walaupun beberapa pasar keuangan libur, minat investor asing juga tetap tinggi. Jumlah penawaran yang dimenangkan awarded bids dari investor asing sekitar 15,50% dari total dimenangkan. “Hal ini mencerminkan kepercayaan terhadap fundamental ekonomi Indonesia dan kredibilitas pengelolaan fiskal.”

Selain itu, meskipun incoming bids menurun dibandingkan dengan lelang SUN sebelumnya, lanjut Suminto, yield atau imbal hasil yang diminta investor masih cukup kompetitif. Menurutnya, penurunan incoming bids terutama berasal dari SPN tenor pendek terjadi seiring strategi perbankan dalam mengantisipasi kebutuhan likuiditas menjelang Lebaran.

“Dari sisi biaya, yield hasil lelang relatif terjaga dengan kenaikan weighted average yield yang tetap terbatas dibandingkan lelang SUN sebelumnya, meskipun berlangsung setelah revisi outlook oleh Moody’s. Hal ini mencerminkan kepercayaan investor yang tetap solid terhadap fundamental pasar keuangan domestik,” tegasnya.

Hasil Lelang 18 Februari 2026

Adapun Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu) mencatat adanya penurunan penawaran atau incoming bids Surat Utang Negara alias SUN dalam lelang yang berlangsung pada Rabu (18/2/2026) kemarin. 

Kemenkeu mencatat jumlah penawaran yang masuk dalam lelang kemarin mencapai Rp63,06 triliun atau turun sekitar 17,6% dari periode lelang 3 Februari 2026 yang mencapai Rp76,58 triliun. Angka itu juga menyusut jauh dibandingkan penawaran pada lelang 20 Januari 2026 senilai Rp82,9 triliun. 

Melansir laman resmi Direktorat Jenderal Pengelolaan Pembiayaan dan Risiko (DJPPR) Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu), jumlah surat utang dilelang pada Rabu kemarin mencakup 9 seri yakni SPN01260322 (new issuance), SPN03260521 (new issuance), SPN12270204 (reopening), FR0109 (reopening), FR0108 (reopening), FR0106 (reopening), FR0107 (reopening), FR0102 (reopening) dan FR0105 (reopening).

Adapun jika dirinci, total penawaran yang masuk untuk seri SPN01260322 mencapai Rp700 miliar, SPN03260521 Rp300 miliar, SPN12270204 Rp4,77 triliun, FR0109 Rp24,16 triliun, FR0108 Rp21,07 triliun, FR0106 Rp4,33 triliun, FR0107 Rp3,29 triliun, FR0102 Rp2,23 triliun, dan FR0105 Rp2,18 triliun.

Akibat lesunya penawaran, Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa pun akhirnya menaikkan jumlah penetapan lelang surat utang yang dimenangkan yang awalnya ditarget senilai Rp33 triliun menjadi Rp40 triliun. Penetapan hasil lelang itu juga lebih tinggi dibandingkan periode lelang 3 Februari 2026 lalu, yang hanya sebesar Rp36 triliun.

Penurunan penawaran itu terjadi di mayoritas surat utang kecuali seri Fix Rate atau FR0108 yang jumlah penawarannya mencapai Rp21,07 triliun.

Sementara itu, seri Surat Perbendaharaan Negara atau SPN12270204 dengan yield rata-rata tertimbang 4,48%, misalnya, yang pada lelang 3 Februari 2026 mampu membukukan penawaran sebesar Rp6,92 triliun pada lelang 18 Februari 2026 turun menjadi Rp4,77 triliun.

Kondisi serupa juga terjadi pada seri Fix Rate atau FR dengan yield di kisaran 5,67%-6,77%, penawaran seri FR0109 turun dari Rp25,39 triliun menjadi Rp24,16 triliun, FR0106 turun dari Rp8,93 triliun menjadi Rp4,33 triliun, FR0107 dari Rp4,13 triliun ke Rp3,29 triliun, FR0102 yang semula Rp3,78 triliun menjadi  Rp2,23 triliun, serta seri FR0105 turun dari Rp34,74 triliun menjadi Rp2,18 triliun.

Pemicu Lesunya Permintaan

Ketegangan geopolitik yang memuncak antara AS dan Iran dinilai menjadi salah satu penyebab kian lesunya permintaan pasar dalam lelang Surat Utang Negara (SUN) sepanjang 2026.

Head of Fixed Income Anugerah Sekuritas Indonesia Ramdhan Ario Maruto, menilai ketegangan geopolitik yang kian memuncak telah menyurutkan minat investor asing untuk berinvestasi di Tanah Air melalui instrumen SUN.

”Kalau asing keluar, secara psikologis ini menandakan akan turun karena mereka agresif. Domestik biasanya akan mengikuti juga. Untuk penurunan kemarin, asing sempat keluar. Itu akan membuat yang domestik ikut juga,” katanya kepada Bisnis, Senin (16/2/2026).

Tak pelak, ketidakstabilan geopolitik turut membuat DJPPR menerbitkan lebih banyak SUN bertenor pendek. Dibandingkan dengan 2025, Surat Perbendaharaan Negara (SPN) biasanya diterbitkan sebanyak 2 kali dan bertambah menjadi 3 kali pada tahun ini.

Serapan pasar tidak kalah besar terhadap SPN. Pada penerbitan SUN teranyar misalnya, tiga tenor SPN mendapatkan serapan pasar senilai Rp11,98 triliun, lebih besar ketimbang realisasi penyerapan senilai Rp8,56 triliun pada lelang terakhir 2025. ”Tenor pendek ini karena uncertain tadi. Jadi risikonya semakin panjang, biasanya volatilitas lebih tinggi. Potensi koreksi harga, perubahan yield juga lebih besar. Memang kebutuhan pasarnya lebih tinggi di jangka pendek karena memang kondisi sekarang tidak stabil,” tambahnya.

Sementara itu, Ekonom KB Valbury Sekuritas Fikri C. Permana menilai kian lesunya serapan pasar terhadap lelang SUN belakangan lebih disebabkan oleh kondisi makroekonomi dalam negeri. Fikri menyoroti ihwal defisit APBN 2025 hingga penerimaan pajak negara yang cenderung rendah.

Kondisi dalam negeri seperti ini, membuat investor meminta risk premi yang lebih terhadap surat utang terbitan negara. ”Artinya ada kekhawatiran, jangan-jangan datanya tidak sejalan. Kemampuan dari Indonesia makin lama kok makin turun. Ini yang membuat marketnya, saya pikir tidak hanya Moody’s yang minta yield yang lebih besar, tapi semua investor. Makanya permintaan terhadap SBN lebih rendah,” katanya kepada Bisnis, Senin (16/2/2026).

Sementara itu, realisasi penawaran lelang sukuk yang konsisten berada pada level sekitar Rp50 triliun—Rp40 triliun, dinilai lebih disebabkan oleh market niche produk syariah itu. Dengan begitu, produk ini akan secara tetap mendapatkan penawaran yang stabil dari investor.

Kondisi ini berbanding terbalik dengan realisasi lelang SUN pada awal 2025 yang menorehkan penawaran masuk yang bertumbuh hingga tiga lelang selanjutnya. Meski demikian, Direktur Jenderal Pengelolaan Pembiayaan dan Risiko (DJPPR) Kemenkeu Suminto mengemukakan bahwa jumlah penawaran atauincoming bidspada lelang 18 Februari 2026 masih mencerminkan kondisi permintaan yang cukup solid di tengah kondisi pasar global yang masih merayakan Imlek di beberapa negara seperti  Singapura, dan Hong Kong.

“Permintaan investor masih terkonsentrasi pada tenor menengah, khususnya seri 5 tahun dan 10 tahun yang mencatat incoming bids masing-masing sebesar Rp24,16 triliun dan Rp21,07 triliun. Suminto juga menjelaskan bahwa partisipasi investor domestik tetap kuat, terutama sektor perbankan yang mendominasi porsi pemenang lelang.

Jumlah penawaran yang dimenangkanawarded bidsdari investor asing sekitar 15,50% dari total dimenangkan. “Hal ini mencerminkan kepercayaan terhadap fundamental ekonomi Indonesia dan kredibilitas pengelolaan fiskal.”

Menurutnya, penurunanincoming bidsterutama berasal dari SPN tenor pendek terjadi seiring strategi perbankan dalam mengantisipasi kebutuhan likuiditas menjelang Lebaran.

“Dari sisi biaya,yieldhasil lelang relatif terjaga dengan kenaikanweighted average yieldyang tetap terbatas dibandingkan lelang SUN sebelumnya, meskipun berlangsung setelah revisioutlookoleh Moody’s. Kemenkeu mencatat jumlah penawaran yang masuk dalam lelang kemarin mencapai Rp63,06 triliun atau turun sekitar 17,6% dari periode lelang 3 Februari 2026 yang mencapai Rp76,58 triliun. Angka itu juga menyusut jauh dibandingkan penawaran pada lelang 20 Januari 2026 senilai Rp82,9 triliun.

Adapun jika dirinci, total penawaran yang masuk untuk seri SPN01260322 mencapai Rp700 miliar, SPN03260521 Rp300 miliar, SPN12270204 Rp4,77 triliun, FR0109 Rp24,16 triliun, FR0108 Rp21,07 triliun, FR0106 Rp4,33 triliun, FR0107 Rp3,29 triliun, FR0102 Rp2,23 triliun, dan FR0105 Rp2,18 triliun.

title: Mamin Entrepreneurs: Need a Roadmap to Get Rid of Dependence on Imported Raw Materials
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Association of Indonesian Food and Beverage Entrepreneurs (Gapmmi) assesses that Indonesia needs a clear roadmap to reduce dependence on imported raw materials for the food and beverage industry (mamin).

General Chairman of Gapmmi Adhi S. Lukman said that high dependence is considered to make the industry vulnerable to fluctuations in the rupiah exchange rate and the dynamics of global trade policies.

Moreover, until now most of the main raw materials for the food and beverage industry still come from abroad. In fact, this sector is expected to be one of the pillars of national economic growth, including a growth target of up to 8%.

"We want to absorb it from within the country, but upstream developments are slower than industrial needs, so we are increasingly lagging behind and need more and more imported raw materials," said Adhi to Bisnis, Thursday (19/2/2026).

He explained that strict import regulations such as prohibitions and restrictions (lartas) had good intentions. However, without synchronization with industry needs, these regulations have the potential to hamper production, especially when domestic supplies are inadequate.

According to Adhi, the solution needed is not just a relaxation of regulations, but an integrated short and long term road map between upstream and downstream sectors. The roadmap is expected to contain a strategy for the next five to ten years to strengthen domestic raw material production capacity.

Also Read

"We need to make a clear roadmap, five years to where, ten years to where. The important thing is that we have to support upstream development so that we can gradually reduce dependence on imports," he said.

Gapmmi data shows that a number of strategic commodities are still very dependent on imports. For the food industry, almost 100% of sugar is still imported, 100% of wheat, around 80% of milk, 90% of food corn, and around 70% of soybeans. Meanwhile, industrial salt is still around 70% dependent on foreign supplies.

This condition is considered worrying, especially when industry is encouraged to grow higher to support national economic expansion. Gapmmi emphasized that the industry is ready to contribute, as long as support for the availability of raw materials, logistics and infrastructure can be ensured.

"If industry is told to grow high to support 8% economic growth, we are ready. But industrial resources must be provided, both raw materials, logistics and infrastructure," he stressed.

In the future, Gapmmi also warned of the potential for disruption to the supply of food commodities such as milk, eggs and chicken if there are no coordinated strategic steps. Without a comprehensive and implementable roadmap, it is feared that import dependence will deepen and become a recurring polemic every year.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Gabungan Pengusaha Makanan dan Minuman Indonesia (Gapmmi) menilai Indonesia membutuhkan roadmap yang jelas untuk mengurangi ketergantungan impor bahan baku industri makanan dan minuman (mamin).

Ketua Umum Gapmmi Adhi S. Lukman mengatakan ketergantungan yang tinggi dinilai membuat industri rentan terhadap fluktuasi nilai tukar rupiah serta dinamika kebijakan perdagangan global.

Apalagi, hingga kini sebagian besar bahan baku utama industri mamin masih berasal dari luar negeri. Padahal, sektor ini diharapkan menjadi salah satu penopang pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional, termasuk target pertumbuhan hingga 8%.

“Kita ingin menyerap dari dalam negeri, tapi perkembangan di hulu lebih lambat dibandingkan kebutuhan industri, sehingga kita makin tertinggal dan makin banyak butuh bahan baku impor,” kata Adhi kepada Bisnis, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan, regulasi impor yang ketat seperti larangan dan pembatasan (lartas) memang bertujuan baik. Namun, tanpa sinkronisasi dengan kebutuhan industri, aturan tersebut berpotensi menghambat produksi, terutama ketika pasokan dalam negeri belum memadai.

Menurut Adhi, solusi yang dibutuhkan bukan sekadar pelonggaran aturan, melainkan peta jalan jangka pendek dan panjang yang terintegrasi antara sektor hulu dan hilir. Roadmap tersebut diharapkan memuat strategi lima hingga sepuluh tahun ke depan untuk memperkuat kapasitas produksi bahan baku domestik.

Baca Juga

  • Pengusaha Mamin Blak-blakan Garam Petambak Susah Diserap Industri
  • Produk Mamin Diwajibkan Pakai Label Gula, Pengusaha Tak Terbebani
  • Industri Mamin - Elektronik Bakal Terdampak Bea Tambahan Impor Bahan Baku Plastik

“Kita perlu bikin roadmap yang jelas, lima tahun ke mana, sepuluh tahun ke mana. Yang penting kita harus mendukung perkembangan hulunya supaya secara bertahap bisa mengurangi ketergantungan impor,” tuturnya.

Data Gapmmi menunjukkan sejumlah komoditas strategis masih sangat bergantung pada impor. Untuk industri makanan, gula hampir 100% masih diimpor, gandum 100%, susu sekitar 80%, jagung pangan 90%, serta kedelai sekitar 70%. Sementara itu, garam industri masih sekitar 70% bergantung pada pasokan luar negeri.

Kondisi tersebut dinilai mengkhawatirkan, terlebih ketika industri didorong untuk tumbuh lebih tinggi demi mendukung ekspansi ekonomi nasional. Gapmmi menegaskan industri siap berkontribusi, asalkan dukungan ketersediaan bahan baku, logistik, dan infrastruktur dapat dipastikan.

“Kalau industri disuruh tumbuh tinggi untuk mendukung pertumbuhan ekonomi 8%, kita siap. Tapi harus disediakan sumber daya industrinya, baik bahan baku, logistik, maupun infrastruktur,” tegasnya.

Ke depan, Gapmmi juga mengingatkan potensi gangguan pasokan komoditas pangan seperti susu, telur, dan ayam jika tidak ada langkah strategis yang terkoordinasi. Tanpa roadmap yang komprehensif dan implementatif, ketergantungan impor dikhawatirkan semakin dalam dan berulang menjadi polemik setiap tahun.

title: Prabowo Shows Off to US Businesspeople: We Never Default, Maintain Fiscal Discipline
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — President Prabowo Subianto emphasized the strength of Indonesia's economic fundamentals and his government's commitment to improving governance while attending the Iftar Business Summit Gala at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Wednesday (18/2/2026) local time.

In a meeting with United States business leaders, Prabowo said that the world is now increasingly recognizing Indonesia's strong and stable economic foundation, the result of years of disciplined economic management.

"We have never defaulted on payments in our history. In fact, subsequent governments have always respected the previous government's debts, even though they were political opponents," he said.

Prabowo emphasized that the tradition of respecting financial obligations is part of Indonesia's governance culture.

He said this commitment was an important factor in maintaining international confidence in the national economy.

Nevertheless, he admitted that Indonesia had tended to stay under the radar because it was focused on solving various pressing domestic problems.

Also Read

The 8th President of the Republic of Indonesia highlighted the major challenges still facing the nation, including poverty, hunger and malnutrition among children. He emphasized the government's determination to resolve this problem directly and systematically.

"I am determined to solve these problems. We must have the courage to admit weaknesses and look for the best solutions," he said.

In discussions with American corporate executives, Prabowo emphasized that the government is aware of Indonesia's strengths and weaknesses. Therefore, bureaucratic reform and increasing government efficiency are priorities.

He emphasized his commitment to building a more efficient government, realizing good governance, and preparing a new generation of leaders who are highly educated, trained and have a strong foundation in modern administration and management.

"We are determined to realize good governance. We are trying to create a new generation of leaders who are highly educated, well trained, but also have a strong foundation in good administration, good governance, as well as rational, logical and pragmatic management in solving problems," concluded Prabowo

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Presiden Prabowo Subianto menegaskan kekuatan fundamental ekonomi Indonesia serta komitmen pemerintahannya dalam memperbaiki tata kelola saat menghadiri Gala Iftar Business Summit di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Rabu (18/2/2026) waktu setempat.

Dalam pertemuan dengan para pemimpin bisnis Amerika Serikat, Prabowo menyampaikan bahwa dunia kini semakin mengakui fondasi ekonomi Indonesia yang kuat dan stabil, hasil dari pengelolaan ekonomi yang disiplin selama bertahun-tahun.

“Kami tidak pernah gagal bayar dalam sejarah kami. Bahkan pemerintahan berikutnya selalu menghormati utang pemerintahan sebelumnya, meskipun mereka lawan politik,” ujarnya.

Prabowo menekankan bahwa tradisi menghormati kewajiban finansial merupakan bagian dari budaya tata kelola Indonesia.

Dia menyebut komitmen tersebut menjadi faktor penting dalam menjaga kepercayaan internasional terhadap ekonomi nasional.

Kendati demikian, dia mengakui Indonesia selama ini cenderung berada di bawah radar karena fokus menyelesaikan berbagai persoalan domestik yang mendesak.

Fokus Atasi Kemiskinan dan Malnutrisi

Presiden Ke-8 RI itu menyoroti tantangan besar yang masih dihadapi bangsa, termasuk kemiskinan, kelaparan, dan malnutrisi pada anak. Ia menegaskan tekad pemerintah untuk menyelesaikan persoalan tersebut secara langsung dan sistematis.

“Saya bertekad untuk menyelesaikan masalah-masalah ini. Kita harus berani mengakui kelemahan dan mencari solusi terbaik,” katanya.

Dalam diskusi dengan eksekutif korporasi Amerika, Prabowo menekankan bahwa pemerintah menyadari kekuatan sekaligus kelemahan Indonesia. Oleh karena itu, reformasi birokrasi dan peningkatan efisiensi pemerintahan menjadi prioritas.

Dia menegaskan komitmen untuk membangun pemerintahan yang lebih efisien, mewujudkan tata kelola yang baik, serta menyiapkan generasi pemimpin baru yang berpendidikan tinggi, terlatih, dan memiliki landasan kuat dalam administrasi serta manajemen modern.

“Kami bertekad untuk mewujudkan tata kelola yang baik. Dalam pertemuan dengan para pemimpin bisnis Amerika Serikat, Prabowo menyampaikan bahwa dunia kini semakin mengakui fondasi ekonomi Indonesia yang kuat dan stabil, hasil dari pengelolaan ekonomi yang disiplin selama bertahun-tahun.

“Kami tidak pernahgagal bayardalam sejarah kami. Bahkan pemerintahan berikutnya selalu menghormati utang pemerintahan sebelumnya, meskipun mereka lawan politik,” ujarnya.

Prabowo menekankan bahwa tradisi menghormati kewajiban finansial merupakan bagian dari budaya tata kelola Indonesia.

Dia menyebut komitmen tersebut menjadi faktor penting dalam menjaga kepercayaan internasional terhadap ekonomi nasional.

Kendati demikian, dia mengakui Indonesia selama ini cenderung berada di bawah radar karena fokus menyelesaikan berbagai persoalan domestik yang mendesak.

Baca Juga

Presiden Ke-8 RI itu menyoroti tantangan besar yang masih dihadapi bangsa, termasuk kemiskinan, kelaparan, dan malnutrisi pada anak. Ia menegaskan tekad pemerintah untuk menyelesaikan persoalan tersebut secara langsung dan sistematis.

“Saya bertekad untuk menyelesaikan masalah-masalah ini. Kita harus berani mengakui kelemahan dan mencari solusi terbaik,” katanya.

Dalam diskusi dengan eksekutif korporasi Amerika, Prabowo menekankan bahwa pemerintah menyadari kekuatan sekaligus kelemahan Indonesia. Oleh karena itu, reformasi birokrasi dan peningkatan efisiensi pemerintahan menjadi prioritas.

Dia menegaskan komitmen untuk membangun pemerintahan yang lebih efisien, mewujudkan tata kelola yang baik, serta menyiapkan generasi pemimpin baru yang berpendidikan tinggi, terlatih, dan memiliki landasan kuat dalam administrasi serta manajemen modern.

“Kami bertekad untuk mewujudkan tata kelola yang baik. Kami mencoba menciptakan generasi pemimpin baru yang berpendidikan tinggi, terlatih dengan baik, namun juga memiliki landasan kuat dalam administrasi yang baik, tata kelola yang baik, serta manajemen yang rasional, logis, dan pragmatis dalam memecahkan masalah,” pungkas Prabowo

title: Witnessed by Prabowo, Entrepreneurs Sign 11 RI-US Investment MoUs of IDR 650.07 Trillion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Indonesian government together with business actors signed at least 11 investment memorandums of understanding (MoU) at the Indonesia–US Business Summit which was held at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., United States, Wednesday (18/2/2026) evening local time.

The signing was witnessed directly by President Prabowo Subianto in a series of Gala Iftar sessions after breaking the fast together. The business forum organized by the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry together with the US-Asean Business Council and USINDO brought together high-ranking officials and corporate leaders from the two countries to strengthen investment and trade cooperation, including the implementation of the planned RI-US Reciprocal Trade Agreement.

The total value of cooperation signed at the forum reached US$38.4 billion or around Rp. 650.07 trillion, which is targeted to encourage investment growth across sectors, especially food, industry, energy and technology.

Present at the event were corporate leaders and business associations from Indonesia and the United States, including Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry Anindya Bakri, Chairman of APINDO Shinta Widjaja Kamdani, CEO of USABC Brian McFeeters, President of USINDO David Merrill, Senior Vice President of U.S. Chamber of Commerce John Murphy, Chairman of Freeport Mc Moran Richard Adkerson, CEO of S&P Global Martina Cheung, President of Exxon Mobil Indonesia Wade Floyd, Senior Vice President of Caterpillar Inc. Kathryn Karol, Cargill Senior Vice President Kelsey Freeman Saelens, and PepsiCo Vice President Caroline Berson.

This activity began with an exclusive business roundtable which discussed strengthening economic collaboration between the two countries through synergy between the government and the private sector. The main focus of the discussion includes policy relaxation and investment opportunities which are expected to increase bilateral trade flows.

President Prabowo's presence at the forum confirmed Indonesia's commitment to creating a stable and friendly investment climate for international partners, as well as strengthening Indonesia's position as a strategic partner of the United States in the Southeast Asia region.

With significant investment value and broad sector coverage, this agreement is expected to be a catalyst for economic growth and deepen economic relations between Indonesia and the United States in the future.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pemerintah Indonesia bersama pelaku usaha meneken sedikitnya 11 nota kesepahaman (MoU) investasi dalam ajang Indonesia–US Business Summit yang digelar di U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Amerika Serikat, Rabu (18/2/2026) malam waktu setempat. 

Penandatanganan tersebut disaksikan langsung oleh Presiden Prabowo Subianto dalam rangkaian sesi Gala Iftar usai buka puasa bersama. Forum bisnis yang diselenggarakan oleh Kadin Indonesia bersama US-Asean Business Council dan USINDO itu mempertemukan pejabat tinggi dan pimpinan korporasi dari kedua negara guna memperkuat kerja sama investasi dan perdagangan, termasuk implementasi rencana Perjanjian Perdagangan Resiprokal RI–AS.

Total nilai kerja sama yang ditandatangani dalam forum tersebut mencapai US$38,4 miliar atau sekitar Rp650,07 triliun yang ditargetkan mendorong pertumbuhan investasi lintas sektor, khususnya pangan, industri, energi, dan teknologi.

Hadir dalam acara tersebut para pemimpin perusahaan dan asosiasi pelaku usaha Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat antara lain Ketua KADIN Indonesia Anindya Bakri, Ketua APINDO Shinta Widjaja Kamdani, CEO USABC Brian McFeeters, President USINDO David Merrill, Senior Vice President U.S. Chamber of Commerce John Murphy, Chairman Freeport Mc Moran Richard Adkerson, CEO S&P Global Martina Cheung, President Exxon Mobil Indonesia Wade Floyd, Senior Vice President Caterpillar Inc. Kathryn Karol, Senior Vice President Cargill Kelsey Freeman Saelens, dan Vice President PepsiCo Caroline Berson.

Dorong Kemitraan Ekonomi Strategis

Kegiatan ini diawali dengan exclusive business roundtable yang membahas penguatan kolaborasi ekonomi kedua negara melalui sinergi pemerintah dan sektor swasta. Fokus utama diskusi mencakup relaksasi kebijakan dan peluang investasi yang diharapkan meningkatkan arus perdagangan bilateral.

Kehadiran Presiden Prabowo dalam forum tersebut menegaskan komitmen Indonesia untuk menciptakan iklim investasi yang stabil dan ramah bagi mitra internasional, sekaligus memperkuat posisi Indonesia sebagai mitra strategis Amerika Serikat di kawasan Asia Tenggara.

Dengan nilai investasi yang signifikan dan cakupan sektor yang luas, kesepakatan ini diharapkan menjadi katalis pertumbuhan ekonomi serta memperdalam hubungan ekonomi Indonesia–Amerika Serikat di masa mendatang.

Berikut daftar 11 MoU kesepakatan strategis penting yang diteken antara pelaku usaha Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat: 

  1. Mineral kritis — MoU Critical Mineral Freeport antara McMoran dengan Menteri Investasi/CEO Danantara Rosan Roeslani.
  2. Pemulihan ladang minyak (oilfield recovery) — MoU Oilfield Recovery antara Pertamina dan Haliburton
  3. Komoditas jagung — Cargill AS dengan PT Sorini Agro Asia Corporindo (Cargill Indonesia).
  4. Kapas (cotton) — Busana Apparel Group dengan National Cotton Council.
  5. MoU kapas antara Daehan Global dan US National Cotton Council
  6. MoU pakaian bekas (shredded worn clothing) tekstil daur ulang — Pan Brothers dengan Ravel.
  7. MoU Furnitur — ASMINDO dengan Bingaman & Son Lumber.
  8. MoU furnitur antara HIMKI dan American Hardwood Export Council
  9. MoU Semiconductor antara Galang Bumi Industri dan Essence
  10. Semikonduktor — proyek hilirisasi di Batam oleh PSN Wiraraja/Galang Bumi Industri dengan Tynergy Technology Group.
  11. Transnational Free Trade Zone Friendship Pact — kerja sama kawasan perdagangan bebas antara Galang Bumi Industri dan Solanna Group LLC.

title: The Fed's FOMC Minutes: Beware of Inflation, Interest Rate Hike Option Pops Up
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Federal Reserve (The Fed) officials showed a more cautious attitude towards cutting interest rates at their policy meeting last month. Some even indicate the Fed may need to raise interest rates again if inflation remains high.

The minutes of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting 27–28 January 2026 quoted on Thursday (19/2/2026) show that the majority of officials are not considering increasing interest rates in the near future.

However, the document confirms that the Fed is increasingly moving away from the consensus to cut interest rates again.

The development has the potential to fuel tensions with President Donald Trump and could complicate the task of his preferred Fed chairman, Kevin Warsh.

Trump has repeatedly expressed his desire for the next head of the Fed to lower interest rates. Two days after the policy meeting, on January 30, Trump announced the nomination of Warsh—former Governor of the Fed—to replace Jerome Powell, whose term ends in May.

"The minutes have a more hawkish bent. This creates an interesting dynamic if and when Kevin Warsh is confirmed as chairman of the Fed," wrote Gregory Daco, chief economist at EY-Parthenon, quoted from Bloomberg.

White House spokesman Kush Desai said the latest, more positive price data was evidence that inflation was now cooling and stabilizing thanks to Trump's policies that boosted the supply side of the economy.

"It's time for the Fed to recognize this very clear reality and cut interest rates to provide further relief for American homebuyers and businesses," he said.

The minutes also showed a majority of FOMC members assessed last year's labor market weakness—which prompted the central bank to cut interest rates three times by the end of 2025—starting to ease in late January.

"The vast majority of participants assessed the downside risk to employment as having reduced in recent months, while the risk of more persistent inflation remains," the minutes said.

That view came before the release of a strong January jobs report. In fact, a group of policy makers at the meeting took a firmer stance in rejecting additional easing.

"Several participants warned that further policy easing amidst still high inflation could be misinterpreted as weakening policymakers' commitment to the 2% inflation target," the minutes read.

However, a number of other officials are still open to further cuts in interest rates if inflation falls according to expectations, although most believe that the process of reducing inflation could be slower than expected.

At its January meeting, the FOMC voted 10-2 to maintain the benchmark federal funds rate in the range of 3.5%–3.75%. Governors Christopher Waller and Stephen Miran dissented and supported a cut of 25 basis points. The committee also removed a phrase that had previously highlighted increasing downside risks to the labor market.

Since the meeting, a number of data show that US economic growth is strengthening, inflation is slowing, and the labor market is stable. The consumer price index (CPI) in January rose modestly, held back by falling energy costs, according to data from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics. Meanwhile, core inflation—which excludes food and energy components—rose according to monthly expectations.

Nonfarm payrolls in January recorded their biggest increase in more than a year, while the unemployment rate fell unexpectedly to 4.3%, signaling a stabilization of the job market in early 2026. Data showed the addition of 130,000 jobs in the month.

A number of Fed officials emphasized that the relatively stable US economic conditions provide room for the central bank to be patient before adjusting interest rates further. However, Trump and his administration officials continue to push for it interest rates were immediately reduced.

In financial markets, market players are starting to reduce expectations on the timing of the next cut, although the federal funds futures contract still indicates a chance of a cut in June.

At the same meeting, the committee also unanimously re-elected Jerome Powell as Chair of the FOMC and filled a number of other positions until the next election at the first scheduled meeting in 2027.
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pejabat Federal Reserve (The Fed) menunjukkan sikap yang lebih berhati-hati terhadap pemangkasan suku bunga dalam pertemuan kebijakan bulan lalu. Beberapa di antaranya bahkan mengindikasikan The Fed mungkin perlu kembali menaikkan suku bunga jika inflasi tetap tinggi.

Risalah rapat Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) 27–28 Januari 2026 yang dikutip pada Kamis (19/2/2026) memperlihatkan bahwa mayoritas pejabat belum mempertimbangkan kenaikan suku bunga dalam waktu dekat. 

Namun, dokumen tersebut menegaskan bahwa The Fed semakin menjauh dari konsensus untuk kembali memangkas suku bunga.

Perkembangan ini berpotensi memicu ketegangan dengan Presiden Donald Trump dan dapat mempersulit tugas calon ketua The Fed pilihannya, Kevin Warsh.

Trump berulang kali menyatakan keinginannya agar pimpinan The Fed berikutnya menurunkan suku bunga. Dua hari setelah pertemuan kebijakan tersebut, tepatnya pada 30 Januari, Trump mengumumkan pencalonan Warsh—mantan Gubernur The Fed—untuk menggantikan Jerome Powell yang masa jabatannya berakhir pada Mei.

“Risalah ini memiliki kecenderungan yang lebih hawkish. Hal ini menciptakan dinamika menarik jika dan ketika Kevin Warsh dikonfirmasi sebagai ketua The Fed,” tulis Gregory Daco, kepala ekonom EY-Parthenon dikutip dari Bloomberg.

Juru Bicara Gedung Putih Kush Desai menyatakan data harga terbaru yang lebih positif menjadi bukti bahwa inflasi kini mendingin dan stabil berkat kebijakan Trump yang mendorong sisi penawaran ekonomi.

“Sudah saatnya The Fed mengakui realitas yang sangat jelas ini dan memangkas suku bunga untuk memberikan keringanan lebih lanjut bagi pembeli rumah dan pelaku usaha Amerika,” ujarnya.

Risalah juga menunjukkan mayoritas anggota FOMC menilai pelemahan pasar tenaga kerja tahun lalu—yang mendorong bank sentral memangkas suku bunga tiga kali pada akhir 2025—mulai mereda pada akhir Januari.

“Mayoritas besar peserta menilai risiko penurunan terhadap lapangan kerja telah berkurang dalam beberapa bulan terakhir, sementara risiko inflasi yang lebih persisten tetap ada,” demikian isi risalah tersebut.

Pandangan itu muncul sebelum rilis laporan ketenagakerjaan Januari yang kuat. Bahkan, sekelompok pembuat kebijakan dalam pertemuan tersebut mengambil sikap yang lebih tegas menolak tambahan pelonggaran.

“Beberapa peserta mengingatkan bahwa pelonggaran kebijakan lebih lanjut di tengah inflasi yang masih tinggi dapat disalahartikan sebagai melemahnya komitmen pembuat kebijakan terhadap target inflasi 2%,” tulis risalah.

Meski demikian, sejumlah pejabat lainnya masih membuka ruang untuk pemangkasan suku bunga lanjutan jika inflasi turun sesuai ekspektasi, walaupun sebagian besar menilai proses penurunan inflasi bisa berlangsung lebih lambat dari perkiraan.

Dalam pertemuan Januari, FOMC memutuskan dengan suara 10-2 untuk mempertahankan suku bunga acuan federal funds di kisaran 3,5%–3,75%. Gubernur Christopher Waller dan Stephen Miran berbeda pendapat dan mendukung pemangkasan sebesar 25 basis poin. Komite juga menghapus frasa yang sebelumnya menyoroti meningkatnya risiko penurunan pada pasar tenaga kerja.

Sejak pertemuan tersebut, sejumlah data menunjukkan pertumbuhan ekonomi AS menguat, inflasi melambat, dan pasar tenaga kerja stabil. Indeks harga konsumen (CPI) pada Januari naik moderat, tertahan oleh penurunan biaya energi, menurut data Biro Statistik Tenaga Kerja AS. Sementara itu, inflasi inti—yang tidak memasukkan komponen makanan dan energi—naik sesuai ekspektasi bulanan.

Nonfarm payrolls pada Januari mencatat kenaikan terbesar dalam lebih dari setahun, sementara tingkat pengangguran turun tak terduga menjadi 4,3%, menandakan stabilisasi pasar kerja di awal 2026. Data menunjukkan penambahan 130.000 lapangan kerja pada bulan tersebut.

Sejumlah pejabat The Fed menegaskan kondisi ekonomi AS yang relatif stabil memberi ruang bagi bank sentral untuk bersabar sebelum menyesuaikan suku bunga lebih lanjut. Namun, Trump dan pejabat pemerintahannya terus mendesak agar suku bunga segera diturunkan.

Di pasar keuangan, pelaku pasar mulai mengurangi ekspektasi waktu pemangkasan berikutnya, meskipun kontrak berjangka federal funds masih mengindikasikan peluang pemangkasan pada Juni.

Dalam pertemuan yang sama, komite juga secara bulat kembali memilih Jerome Powell sebagai Ketua FOMC serta mengisi sejumlah posisi lainnya hingga pemilihan berikutnya pada rapat terjadwal pertama pada 2027.

title: Pontjo Sutowo Refuses to Hand Over Sultan Hotel, Government Submits Execution Request
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government officially sent a letter of application for a follow-up to the execution of the Sultan Hotel to the Central Jakarta District Court, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

The management of the Gelora Bung Karno Complex Management Center (PPKGBK) assesses that this firm legal step was taken after Pontjo Sutowo's PT Indobuildco ignored the deadline for voluntary handover of assets set by the court.

Attorney for the Ministry of State Secretariat and PPKGBK, Kharis Sucipto, explained that the eight-day warning or warning period given on February 9 has expired on February 17 2026.

In line with the end of the deadline, PPKGBK assesses that there is no good faith from the company to return the strategic assets of Block 15 GBK covering an area of 13 hectares which have been controlled without rights since March and April 2023.

"Until the last second of the February 17 deadline, there was no response or effort to voluntarily hand over assets from PT Indobuildco. This confirms the lack of good faith in complying with the law. Therefore, today we ask the Central Jakarta District Court to immediately carry out constating and issue an Execution Order for Vacation," said Kharis in a written statement, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Kharis emphasized that the state will no longer tolerate various maneuvers aimed at delaying land handover. The submission of the execution request letter is the state's final effort to save state assets in the Gelora Bung Karno area which has so far been managed by private parties without a valid legal basis.

Also Read

In terms of law, the government stated that the new lawsuits filed by Indobuildco could not delay the execution.

Meanwhile, this refers to civil decision Number 208/Pdt.G/2025 which is immediate or uitvoerbaar bij voorraad, so that the decision can still be implemented even if there are other legal remedies.

"The rule of law must not be defeated by repeated litigation strategies. The state has the right to take back what belongs to the people," added Kharis.

Previously, PT Indobuildco, which currently still manages the Sultan Hotel, confirmed that it maintained control of the land in Block 15 of the Gelora Bung Karno (GBK) area even though there had been an order to vacate it.

PT Indobuildco's attorney, Hamdan Zoelva, said that currently the case related to land management rights is still in the appeal stage at the Jakarta High Court (PT).

In line with this, his party asked PPKGBK to respect the ongoing litigation process before taking physical action in the field.

"This case is still in the appeals process at PT Jakarta. Therefore, GBK has been asked to wait for the ongoing legal process. There is a risk of significant state loss if GBK insists on requesting vacation even though the judicial process and legal efforts are ongoing," said Hamdan Zoelva to Bisnis, Sunday (8/2/2026).

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pemerintah resmi melayangkan Surat Permohonan tindak lanjut eksekusi Hotel Sultan kepada Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Pusat, Rabu (18/2/2026). 

Manajemen Pusat Pengelolaan Komplek Gelora Bung Karno (PPKGBK) menilai langkah hukum tegas ini diambil setelah PT Indobuildco milik Pontjo Sutowo mengabaikan batas waktu penyerahan aset secara sukarela yang telah ditentukan oleh pengadilan.

Kuasa Hukum Kemensetneg dan PPKGBK, Kharis Sucipto menjelaskan masa teguran atau aanmaning selama delapan hari yang diberikan sejak 9 Februari lalu telah jatuh tempo pada 17 Februari 2026. 

Sejalan dengan berakhirnya tenggat tersebut, PPKGBK menilai tidak ada itikad baik dari perusahaan untuk mengembalikan aset strategis Blok 15 GBK seluas 13 hektare yang telah dikuasai tanpa hak sejak Maret dan April 2023.

“Hingga detik terakhir tenggat waktu 17 Februari kemarin, tidak ada respons maupun upaya penyerahan aset secara sukarela dari PT Indobuildco. Hal ini menegaskan ketiadaan itikad baik untuk mematuhi hukum. Oleh karena itu, hari ini kami meminta Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Pusat untuk segera melakukan konstatering dan menerbitkan Perintah Eksekusi Pengosongan,” ujar Kharis dalam keterangan tertulis, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Kharis menegaskan bahwa negara tidak akan lagi memberikan toleransi terhadap berbagai manuver yang bertujuan untuk mengulur waktu penyerahan lahan. Penyerahan surat permohonan eksekusi ini menjadi upaya final negara dalam menyelamatkan aset negara di kawasan Gelora Bung Karno yang selama ini dikelola oleh pihak swasta tanpa dasar hukum yang sah.

Baca Juga

  • Jalan Panjang Eksekusi Hotel Sultan yang Dikuasai Pontjo Sutowo
  • Sengketa Hotel Sultan: Pontjo Sutowo Tuntut Uang Jaminan ke PPKGBK
  • Istana Ungkap Status Hotel Sultan Usai Ambil Alih dari Pontjo Sutowo

Dalam kaitan hukum, pemerintah menyatakan bahwa gugatan-gugatan baru yang diajukan oleh pihak Indobuildco tidak dapat menunda pelaksanaan eksekusi. 

Adapun, hal tersebut merujuk pada putusan perdata Nomor 208/Pdt.G/2025 yang bersifat serta-merta atau uitvoerbaar bij voorraad, sehingga putusan tetap dapat dijalankan meskipun ada upaya hukum lain.

“Supremasi hukum tidak boleh kalah oleh strategi litigasi yang berulang. Negara berhak mengambil kembali apa yang menjadi milik rakyat,” tambah Kharis.

Sebelumnya, PT Indobuildco yang saat ini masih mengelola Hotel Sultan, memastikan tetap mempertahankan penguasaan lahan di Blok 15 Kawasan Gelora Bung Karno (GBK) meskipun telah ada perintah pengosongan. 

Kuasa Hukum PT Indobuildco Hamdan Zoelva mengatakan, saat ini perkara terkait hak pengelolaan lahan tersebut masih dalam tahap upaya banding di Pengadilan Tinggi (PT) Jakarta.

Sejalan dengan hal itu, pihaknya meminta PPKGBK untuk menghormati proses litigasi yang sedang berlangsung sebelum mengambil tindakan fisik di lapangan. 

"Perkara ini masih proses upaya banding di PT Jakarta. Karena itu diminta kepada GBK untuk menunggu proses hukum yang sedang berjalan. Ada risiko kerugian negara yang cukup besar jika GBK memaksa untuk meminta pengosongan padahal proses peradilan dan upaya hukum sedang berjalan," ujar Hamdan Zoelva kepada Bisnis, Minggu (8/2/2026).

title: Parung Panjang Market Traders Complain that Egg Prices Have Soared Since MBG
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — A number of market traders complained about the significant increase in prices of eggs and chicken meat on the first day of Ramadan 2026, in line with increasing demand for the free nutritious meal program (MBG).

Ujang (35), a chicken trader at Parung Panjang Market, said that the price of chicken meat has increased significantly since the MBG program started. Currently, the price of chicken is in the range of IDR 45,000–IDR 55,000 per head, depending on size.

"Chickens are expensive, since MBG chickens have been expensive. Now IDR 45,000, IDR 50,000, IDR 55,000 [per head] depending on the size. Yes, because MBG, it's already cheap, usually IDR 60,000 [per head]," said Ujang when met by Bisnis, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Egg traders also feel the same thing. Udin (50) said that the price of purebred chicken eggs is now at IDR 31,000 per kilogram, up from the normal price which is usually around IDR 27,000 per kilogram.

"Eggs are now IDR 31,000 [per kilogram], usually IDR 27,000 [per kilogram]. Expensive because MBG, there are no empty eggs in the cage," said Udin.

Udin said this condition was inversely proportional to the previous annual Ramadan pattern. At the start of Ramadan last year, egg prices actually tended to be cheaper.

Also Read

"Usually at the beginning of last year's fast, it was cheap at IDR 28,000 [per kilogram]. Now it's even gone up, if there [manufacturers] increase, [sellers] can get up to IDR 32,000 [per kilogram]," he added.

Meanwhile, Agricultural Observer from the Indonesian Center of Reform on Economics (Core) Eliza Mardian explained that the creeping price of eggs and chickens was due to the concentration of these two supplies in a number of large companies.

"Because eggs and chickens are controlled by just a few companies, so when there is MBG they focus on fulfilling MBG. So consumers fight over it," said Eliza to Bisnis.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Sejumlah pedagang pasar mengeluhkan lonjakan harga telur dan daging ayam yang signifikan pada hari pertama Ramadan 2026, seiring meningkatnya permintaan program makan bergizi gratis (MBG).

Ujang (35), pedagang ayam di Pasar Parung Panjang, menyebut harga daging ayam mengalami kenaikan signifikan sejak program MBG bergulir. Saat ini, harga ayam dibanderol di kisaran Rp45.000–Rp55.000 per ekor, tergantung ukuran.

“Ayam mahal, semenjak ada MBG ayam mahal. Sekarang Rp45.000, Rp50.000, Rp55.000 [per ekor] tergantung ukuran. Iya karena MBG, segini sudah murah biasanya Rp60.000 [per ekor],” kata Ujang saat ditemui Bisnis, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Hal serupa juga dirasakan pedagang telur. Udin (50) mengatakan harga telur ayam ras kini berada di level Rp31.000 per kilogram, naik dari harga normal yang biasanya sekitar Rp27.000 per kilogram.

“Telur sekarang Rp31.000 [per kilogram], biasanya Rp27.000 [per kilogram]. Mahal karena MBG, telur di kandang juga nggak ada yang kosong,” ujar Udin.

Udin menyebut kondisi tersebut berbanding terbalik dengan pola tahunan Ramadan sebelumnya. Pada awal Ramadan tahun lalu, harga telur justru cenderung lebih murah.

Baca Juga

  • Amran Minta Pedagang Daging hingga Beras Tak Kerek Harga jelang Ramadan
  • Jelang Ramadan 2026, Pedagang: Harga Beras-Cabai Cs Meroket meski Stok Aman

“Biasanya awal puasa tahun kemarin itu murah Rp28.000 [per kilogram]. Sekarang malah naik, kalau di sana [produsen] naik, [pedagang jual] bisa sampai Rp32.000 [per kilogram],” tambahnya.

Sementara itu, Pengamat Pertanian dari Center of Reform on Economics (Core) Indonesia Eliza Mardian menjelaskan merangkaknya harga telur dan ayam disebabkan lantaran masih terkonsentrasinya kedua pasokan tersebut pada sejumlah perusahaan besar.

“Karena telur dan ayam ini kan dikuasai cuma sama beberapa perusaahaan, jadinya ketika ada MBG ini mereka fokusnya ke pemenuhan MBG. Jadi rebutan sama konsumen,” kata Eliza kepada Bisnis.

title: MRT Allows Passengers to Break Fast on Trains During Ramadan
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PTMRTJakarta (Perseroda) allows passengers to eat and drink a maximum of 10 minutes after the Maghrib call to prayer in the MRT network area during Ramadan 1447 H.

Corporate Secretary Division Head of MRT Jakarta Rendy Primartantyo explained that service users are only allowed to break their fast with water and dates. In fact, the MRT prohibits passengers from eating and drinking in paid areas and trains.

It is important to remember that service users are not allowed to break their fast with drinks other than water (tea, coffee, syrup, soda, etc.) and snacks other than dates.

"This policy will take effect Thursday 19 February 2025, along with the start of fasting," he said in an official statement, Thursday (19/2/2026).

However, service users can still continue their fast-breaking activities on the veranda area of ​​the unpaid platform (unpaid concourse) without time limits.

Comparing this with the provisions for breaking the fast on other modes, for example LRT which allows passengers to break their fast until 19.00 WIB. However, all modes recommend breaking the fast with food and light drinks.

Also Read

Meanwhile, during Ramadan, MRT Jakarta presents the #MelajuFullMeaning campaign as an invitation to make every journey have deeper value. Through a series of programs ranging from educational content, digital activations and interactive promos, takjil sharing activities in the station area, to social initiatives such as breaking the fast with orphans and people with disabilities.

MRT also opens public donations, distributes Ramadan blessing packages, and invites the public not just to move from one station to another, but also to move together in the spirit of sharing, caring and togetherness during Ramadan.

Currently, Jakarta MRT operations on weekdays are 05.00-24.00 WIB with an interval of 5 minutes during peak hours and 10 minutes during normal hours. Meanwhile, on weekends/holidays it is 05.00-24.00 WIB with an interval of 10 minutes.

From January to December 2025, PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) recorded a total of 46,449,629 customers using MRT Jakarta services. On average, daily transportation figures throughout 2025 will reach 127,259 customers per day.

Entering January 2026, PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) recorded 135,332 customers every day. On weekdays Monday-Friday (weekdays), the transportation figure has reached 159,492 customers per day and on Saturday-Sunday (weekends) it has reached 91,406 customers per day. The total ridership figure in January 2026 reached 4,195,303 customers.

The station with the highest number of customers was recorded at Dukuh Atas BNI Station with 753,380 customers. Blok M BCA Station with 514,064 customers is in second place, and Bundaran HI Bank Jakarta Station with 435,810 customers is in third place.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) memperbolehkan penumpang untuk makan dan minum maksimal 10 menit setelah azan Magrib di area rangkaian MRT selama Ramadan 1447 H.  

Corporate Secretary Division Head MRT Jakarta Rendy Primartantyo menjelaskan, pengguna jasa hanya diperbolehkan membatalkan puasa dengan air putih dan buah kurma. Sejatinya, MRT melarang penumpang makan dan minum di area berbayar dan kereta. 

Penting diingat, pengguna jasa tidak diperbolehkan untuk membatalkan puasa dengan minuman selain air putih (teh, kopi, sirup, soda, dll) dan kudapan selain buah kurma. 

“Kebijakan ini mulai berlaku Kamis 19 Februari 2025, seiring dengan dimulainya pelaksanaan ibadah puasa,” ujarnya dalam keterangan resmi, Kamis (19/2/2026).  

Meski demikian, para pengguna jasa tetap dapat melanjutkan kegiatan membatalkan puasa di area beranda peron tidak berbayar (unpaid concourse) tanpa batasan waktu. 

Membandingkan dengan ketentuan buka puasa di moda lainnya, misalnya LRT yang membolehkan penumpang membatalkan puasa hingga pukul 19.00 WIB. Namun, seluruh moda mengimbau agar buka puasa dilakukan dengan makanan dan minuman ringan.

Adapun selama Ramadan, MRT Jakarta menghadirkan kampanye #MelajuPenuhMakna sebagai ajakan untuk menjadikan setiap perjalanan memiliki nilai yang lebih dalam. Melalui rangkaian program mulai dari konten edukatif, aktivasi digital dan promo interaktif, kegiatan berbagi takjil di area stasiun, hingga inisiatif sosial seperti buka puasa bersama anak yatim-piatu dan penyandang disabilitas. 

MRT juga membuka donasi publik, penyaluran paket berkah Ramadan, serta mengajak masyarakat untuk tidak sekadar bergerak dari satu stasiun ke stasiun lain, tetapi juga melangkah bersama dalam semangat berbagi, kepedulian, dan kebersamaan selama Ramadan.

Saat ini, Operasional MRT Jakarta di hari kerja adalah pukul 05.00-24.00 WIB dengan selang waktu 5 menit di jam sibuk dan 10 menit di jam normal. Sedangkan di akhir pekan/hari libur adalah pukul 05.00-24.00 WIB dengan selang waktu 10 menit.

Sepanjang Januari hingga Desember 2025, PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) mencatat total 46.449.629 pelanggan menggunakan layanan MRT Jakarta. Secara rata-rata, angka keterangkutan harian sepanjang tahun 2025 mencapai 127.259 pelanggan per hari. 

Memasuki Januari 2026, PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) mencatatkan 135.332 pelanggan setiap hari. Pada hari kerja Senin—Jumat (weekdays), angka keterangkutan telah mencapai 159.492 pelanggan per hari dan pada Sabtu—Minggu (weekend) mencapai 91.406 pelanggan per hari. Total angka keterangkutan (ridership) pada Januari 2026 mencapai 4.195.303 pelanggan.

Stasiun dengan jumlah pelanggan tertinggi tercatat di Stasiun Dukuh Atas BNI dengan 753.380 pelanggan. Stasiun Blok M BCA dengan 514.064 pelanggan di urutan kedua, dan Stasiun Bundaran HI Bank Jakarta dengan 435.810 pelanggan di urutan ketiga.

Memasuki Januari 2026, PT MRT Jakarta (Perseroda) mencatatkan 135.332 pelanggan setiap hari. Pada hari kerja Senin—Jumat (weekdays), angka keterangkutan telah mencapai 159.492 pelanggan per hari dan pada Sabtu—Minggu (weekend) mencapai 91.406 pelanggan per hari. title: Airlangga: Prabowo and Trump Will Sign Trade Tariff Agreement Today
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto confirmed that President Prabowo Subianto will leave for the United States (US) on February 19 2026. Among the agenda, Prabowo will sign trade cooperation entitled the Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff (ART) between Indonesia and the US.

Airlangga's statement was delivered at the State Palace after being summoned by President Prabowo Subianto today, Wednesday (11/2/2026).

"Earlier we discussed the update on the Indonesian-American negotiations and the President said that he plans to attend the event on the 19th and around that date there will also be plans to sign the ART, Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff," said Airlangga at the Presidential Palace Complex on Wednesday (11/2/2026).

Separately, Airlangga stated that in substance, all negotiations related to tariffs with the US had been completed. Both countries have also completed the process of harmonizing legal language (legal drafting).

Previously, after meeting with USTR Jameson Greer in Washington D.C. At the end of last year, the government targeted that the ART document could be signed by President Prabowo and US President Donald Trump between January 12-19 2026. However, until entering the second week of February 2026, this ceremony had not yet been realized.

For the record, within the framework of the initial agreement that was built in July last year, Indonesia was committed to waiving import duties for the majority of products from the US. In return, Uncle Sam's country agreed to reduce reciprocal tariffs on Indonesian products from 32% to 19%.

Also Read

Apart from that, the US also gave the green light for tariff exemptions for Indonesia's leading export commodities, ranging from palm oil (CPO), coffee, to cocoa.

On the other hand, Prabowo's visit to the US is also related to the agenda of the Gaza Board of Peace Summit. Minister of State Secretary (Mensesneg) Prasetyo Hadi also said that the President had accepted the invitation to the summit which will be held on February 19 2026.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto memastikan bahwa Presiden Prabowo Subianto akan berangkat ke Amerika Serikat (AS) pada 19 Februari 2026. Di antara agenda itu, Prabowo akan menandatangani kerja sama perdagangan bertajuk Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff (ART) antara Indonesia dan AS.

Pernyataan Airlangga itu disampaikan di Istana Negara usai dipanggil Presiden Prabowo Subianto pada hari ini, Rabu (11/2/2026). 

"Tadi membicarakan terkait dengan update perundingan Indonesia-Amerika dan disampaikan Bapak Presiden rencananya akan menghadiri acara di tanggal 19 dan di sekitar tanggal itu juga akan ada rencana penandatanganan ART, Agreement on Reciprocal Tariff," ujar Airlangga di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan pada Rabu (11/2/2026).

Terpisah, Airlangga menyatakan bahwa secara substansi, seluruh negosiasi terkait dengan tarif dengan AS telah rampung. Kedua negara pun telah menuntaskan proses harmonisasi bahasa hukum (legal drafting).

Sebelumnya, usai pertemuan dengan USTR Jameson Greer di Washington D.C. akhir tahun lalu, pemerintah menargetkan dokumen ART dapat diteken oleh Presiden Prabowo dan Presiden AS Donald Trump pada kisaran tanggal 12—19 Januari 2026. Kendati demikian, hingga memasuki pekan kedua Februari 2026, seremoni tersebut belum terealisasi. 

Sebagai catatan, dalam kerangka kesepakatan awal yang dibangun sejak Juli tahun lalu, Indonesia berkomitmen membebaskan tarif bea masuk untuk mayoritas produk asal AS. Sebagai timbal balik, Negeri Paman Sam sepakat menurunkan tarif resiprokal atas produk Indonesia dari 32% menjadi 19%.

title: Prabowo: Investing in MBG Can Profit Up to 35 Times
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — President Prabowo Subianto emphasized his commitment to overcome child hunger and malnutrition through the Free Nutritious Meal Program (MBG). Investment in this program will also provide economic benefits of up to 35 times.

This was conveyed by Prabowo in his speech at the United States–Asean Business Summit at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Washington D.C., Thursday (19/2/2026).

Prabowo explained that the program was inspired by practices in the United States and Europe which have long provided free meals for students. According to him, democracy must provide real benefits through education and health services.

He considers this program to be a concrete step to overcome the problem of stunting which is still experienced by around 25 percent of Indonesian children.

"I just found out that 25% of our children are stunted. Their brain cells are not optimal, as are their bone and muscle cells. They will become very physically weak when they grow up. We cannot accept this," he said

Prabowo emphasized that program funding comes from state budget savings resulting from cutting inefficiencies and misuse of funds. He denied accusations of waste, calling the policy a reallocation of resources for the benefit of the people.

Also Read

According to him, a number of international institutions consider the free meal program as a strategic investment. He quoted the findings of an American research institute which stated that every dollar invested could produce economic benefits of up to seven times, even up to 35 times in the long term.

"Because for every dollar spent on free meals for children, the return [return] according to their research is at least seven dollars, even in the long term it can provide returns of up to 35 times," he added.

The 8th President of the Republic of Indonesia also said that this program was starting to show an economic impact. Domestic consumption in January is said to be the highest in the last 10-15 years.

"We are now starting to feel the impact. Several members of Apindo [Indonesian Employers' Association] came to me last week and said that last January was the highest domestic consumption in the last 10 or 15 years," he said.

Currently, said Prabowo, the government has built around 23,000 program kitchens, each of which employs around 50 people in villages.

The program also increases demand for local food such as eggs, chicken and vegetables, thereby providing market certainty for farmers and creating an economic multiplier effect in rural areas.

Prabowo assesses that this program helps strengthen social and political stability through creating jobs and improving community welfare. He also said that national rice production had reached a record high and was approaching self-sufficiency for most food commodities.

Closing his speech, Prabowo stated that there were still many achievements that could be delivered in the first year of his government, but he chose to summarize the main points regarding priority programs that had a direct impact on the people.

"I could talk at length about the achievements of this first year, but I will keep my remarks short. As you know, if you give a microphone to a political leader, he tends not to want to stop talking," concluded Prabowo.
