title: After Building 1,368 Huntaras, Danantara Immediately Groundbreaking Huntaras in Sumatra
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA  — Chief Operating Officer (COO) of the Investment Management Agency (BPI) Danantara Dony Oskaria revealed that he would hold the groundbreaking for permanent housing (huntap) for communities affected by the disaster in Sumatra, tomorrow, Thursday (19/2/2026).

Dony explained that the permanent housing would be spread across three provinces affected by the disaster, starting from Aceh, North Sumatra and West Sumatra.

"Tomorrow we will groundbreaking the plan in West Sumatra for the first huntap, then continue in Aceh and North Sumatra," he explained at the Coordination Meeting of the Sumatra Post-Disaster Recovery Task Force, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Dony explained that his party had coordinated with the Minister of PKP, Maruarar Sirait regarding the groundbreaking plan.

At the same time, Dony said that to date BPI Danantara has carried out the construction of 1,368 Danantara Residential (Huntara) units.

In detail, 1,075 shelter units were built in Aceh, 200 shelter units in North Sumatra, and 123 shelter units in West Sumatra. "And after we handed it over to the local government, most of it was occupied, already occupied,"  he added.

Also Read

Meanwhile, on a different occasion, PKP Minister Maruarar Sirait agreed that his party had coordinated with Danantara regarding the Groundbreaking.

When confirmed about the value of the project, he was reluctant to answer. He only confirmed that this effort was a form of government mutual cooperation in accelerating the distribution of community housing.

"We are currently preparing, I was also present at the groundbreaking in Sibolga, Central Tapanuli and North Tapanuli. I checked earlier, quite a lot [of units will be built], how many hundreds of houses will be completed before Eid," he concluded.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA  — Chief Operating Officer (COO) Badan Pengelola Investasi (BPI) Danantara Dony Oskaria mengungkap akan melangsungkan peletakan batu pertama (groundbreaking) hunian tetap (huntap) untuk masyarakat terdampak bencana di Sumatra, besok, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Dony menjelaskan bahwa hunian tetap itu akan tersebar di tiga provinsi yang terdampak bencana mulai dari Aceh, Sumatra Utara, serta Sumatra Barat.

"Besok kami akan groundbreaking rencananya di Sumatra Barat untuk huntap yang pertama, kemudian dilanjutkan di Aceh dan di Sumatra Utara," jelasnya dalam Rapat Koordinasi Satgas Pemulihan Pasca Bencana Sumatra, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dony menjelaskan pihaknya telah berkoordinasi dengan Menteri PKP, Maruarar Sirait mengenai rencana groundbreaking tersebut.

Pada saat yang sama, Dony menyebut bahwa hingga saat ini BPI Danantara telah melaksanakan pembangunan Hunian Danantara (Huntara) sebanyak 1.368 unit.

Perinciannya, 1.075 unit huntara dibangun di Aceh, 200 unit huntara di Sumatra Utara, dan 123 unit huntara di Sumatra Barat. "Dan setelah kami serah terimakan kepada pemerintah setempat, sebagian besar sudah dihuni, sudah ditempati,"  tambahnya.

title_original: Usai Bangun 1.368 Huntara, Danantara Segera Groundbreaking Huntap di Sumatra
content_original:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA  — Chief Operating Officer (COO) Badan Pengelola Investasi (BPI) DanantaraDony Oskaria mengungkap akan melangsungkan peletakan batu pertama (groundbreaking) hunian tetap (huntap) untuk masyarakat terdampak bencana di Sumatra, besok, Kamis (19/2/2026).

Dony menjelaskan bahwa hunian tetap itu akan tersebar di tiga provinsi yang terdampak bencana mulai dari Aceh, Sumatra Utara, serta Sumatra Barat.

"Besok kami akangroundbreakingrencananya di Sumatra Barat untuk huntap yang pertama, kemudian dilanjutkan di Aceh dan di Sumatra Utara," jelasnya dalam Rapat Koordinasi Satgas Pemulihan Pasca Bencana Sumatra, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dony menjelaskan pihaknya telah berkoordinasi dengan Menteri PKP, Maruarar Sirait mengenai rencanagroundbreakingtersebut.

Pada saat yang sama, Dony menyebut bahwa hingga saat ini BPI Danantara telah melaksanakan pembangunan Hunian Danantara (Huntara) sebanyak 1.368 unit.

Perinciannya, 1.075 unit huntara dibangun di Aceh, 200 unit huntara di Sumatra Utara, dan 123 unit huntara di Sumatra Barat. "Dan setelah kami serah terimakan kepada pemerintah setempat, sebagian besar sudah dihuni, sudah ditempati,"  tambahnya.

Sementara pada kesempatan berbeda, Menteri PKP Maruarar Sirait mengamini bahwa pihaknya telah berkoordinasi dengan Danantara mengenai Groundbreaing tersebut.

title: Krakatau Steel (KRAS) Predicts Steel Needs for the Shipbuilding Industry to Increase
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Iron and steel producer, PTKrakatau Steel(Persero) Tbk. (KRAS) estimates that the need for steel supplies for the needs of the shipbuilding industry will increase significantly with a double digit percentage growth.

KRAS Commercial, Business Development and Portfolio Director Hernowo said that currently the company routinely supplies 400,000 tons of steel to the national shipbuilding industry.

Through efforts to strengthen the Indonesian maritime industry and a mandate from Danantara to supply steel to PT PAL as a pioneer shipbuilder, the party believes that the absorption of steel into local industry will become more massive.

"So now Krakatau Steel supplies approximately 400,000 tonnes [of shipyards] a year. Yes, around that much per year, routine needs. So if the initial size is like that, the growth is significant," said Hernowo, quoted on Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He hopes that strengthening the national maritime industry will also go hand in hand with the use of local raw materials, including domestically produced steel. This is because the need for steel for the shipbuilding industry is quite large.

"If everything is built domestically, it can double as long as the materials are not imported. So, if the materials are domestic, it can double our ship industry in terms of absorbing raw materials," he explained.

Also Read

As previously reported, Danantara Indonesia is encouraging state-owned shipping and railway manufacturing sectors to become the main absorbers of steel stocks produced by PT Krakatau Steel Tbk (KRAS).

Danantara COO Dony Oskaria said that the proceeds from ship or train manufacturing production would also be absorbed by BUMN in the field of providing transportation services on the downstream side.

"We encourage industrialization in several aspects, which are especially related to companies within the Danantara scope," said Dony in the DPR RI Commission VI RDP, quoted Thursday (5/2/2026).

He explained that Danantara would require all companies that require ship manufacturing within Danantara's scope to be carried out at PT PAL Indonesia's shipyard facilities.

"The aim is to improve our shipping industry, including PT PIS [Pertamina International Shipping], PT Pelni, PT ASDP, we are obliged to manufacture their ship needs at PT PAL," said Dony.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Produsen besi dan baja, PT Krakatau Steel (Persero) Tbk. (KRAS) memperkirakan kebutuhan pasokan baja untuk kebutuhan industri galangan kapal melonjak signifikan dengan persentase tumbuh double digit. 

Direktur Komersial, Pengembangan Usaha, dan Portofolio KRAS Hernowo mengatakan saat ini perseroan secara rutin memasok 400.000 ton baja untuk industri galangan kapal nasional. 

Lewat upaya penguatan industri maritim Indonesia dan amanat dari Danantara untuk memasok baja ke PT PAL sebagai pionir galangan kapal, pihaknya meyakini penyerapan baja ke industri lokal makin masif. 

“Jadi sekarang Krakatau Steel itu satu tahun kira-kira mensuplai 400.000 ton [galangan kapal]. Ya, sekitar segitu per tahun rutin, ya kebutuhan rutin. Jadi kalau ini size-nya seperti itu, itu growth-nya signifikan itu,” kata Hernowo, dikutip Rabu (18/2/2026). 

Dia berharap penguatan industri maritim nasional juga beriringan dengan penggunaan bahan baku lokal, termasuk baja yang diproduksi dalam negeri. Pasalnya, kebutuhan baja untuk industri galangan cukup besar. 

“Kalau dibangun di domestik semua bisa double dengan catatan materialnya tidak impor. Nah, jadi kalau materialnya domestik itu bisa double industri kapal kita ya dari sisi penyerapan bahan baku,” jelasnya.

title: Prices of Purebred Chicken Meat and Eggs Still High, Impact of MBG?
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) said that the commodity prices for purebred chicken meat and purebred chicken eggs were still above the respective sales reference prices (HAP) in the second week of February 2026.

BPS Deputy for Distribution and Services Statistics Ateng Hartono explained that nationally, the average price of purebred chicken meat reached IDR 40,471 per kilogram or an increase of 0.86% compared to the January 2026 period. This nominal value is above the HAP for purebred chicken meat of IDR 40,000 per kilogram.

"There are 155 districts/cities where purebred chicken meat experienced an increase in the IPH [price development index]," said Ateng in a regional inflation control coordination meeting, broadcast live on the Ministry of Home Affairs' YouTube, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Furthermore, BPS recorded that the highest price for purebred chicken meat reached IDR 100,000 per kilogram, which occurred in Intan Jaya Regency. In contrast, the lowest price for purebred chicken meat was recorded at IDR 25,000 per kilogram.

Regarding purebred chicken eggs, Ateng explained that the national average price for this commodity was IDR 31,757 per kilogram in the second week of this month.

This value decreased by 1.62% compared to the January 2026 period which amounted to IDR 32,281 per kilogram, but was still above the HAP for purebred chicken eggs which was set at IDR 30,000 per kilogram.

Also Read

"If we look at the HAP, it is Rp. 30,000, which means this is slightly above the HAP. And there are 80 districts/cities where the IPH of these breeds of chicken eggs has experienced an increase in IPH," said Ateng.

BPS also recorded that the highest price for purebred chicken eggs reached IDR 100,000 per kilogram, one of which was in Intan Jaya Regency. The lowest sales price was recorded at IDR 25,000 per kilogram.

Separately, the Ministry of Trade (Kemendag) denied that the supply of purebred chicken meat and eggs was running low on the market due to the Free Nutritious Meal (MBG) program.

Minister of Trade (Mendag) Budi Santoso said that MBG actually creates demand certainty which makes poultry production move more stably and measurably.

"No, it's like this, right? I have actually discussed this with friends. In the past, prices went up and down because demand went up and down. Demand went up and down, prices went up and down," said Budi when met at the Ministry of Trade Office, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) menyampaikan bahwa harga komoditas daging ayam ras dan telur ayam ras masih berada di atas harga acuan penjualan (HAP) masing-masing pada pekan kedua Februari 2026.

Deputi Bidang Statistik Distribusi dan Jasa BPS Ateng Hartono memaparkan bahwa secara nasional, harga rata-rata daging ayam ras mencapai Rp40.471 per kilogram atau naik 0,86% dibandingkan periode Januari 2026. Nominal itu berada di atas HAP daging ayam ras sebesar Rp40.000 per kilogram.

“Ada 155 kabupaten/kota yang daging ayam ras itu mengalami peningkatan IPH [indeks perkembangan harga],” kata Ateng dalam rapat koordinasi pengendalian inflasi daerah, disiarkan langsung di YouTube Kemendagri, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Lebih lanjut, BPS mencatat harga tertinggi daging ayam ras mencapai Rp100.000 per kilogram, yang terjadi di Kabupaten Intan Jaya. Sebaliknya, harga terendah daging ayam ras tercatat sebesar Rp25.000 per kilogram.

Terkait telur ayam ras, Ateng memaparkan bahwa harga rata-rata nasional komoditas tersebut sebesar Rp31.757 per kilogram pada pekan kedua bulan ini.

Nilai itu turun 1,62% dibandingkan periode Januari 2026 yang sebesar Rp32.281 per kilogram, tetapi masih berada di atas HAP telur ayam ras yang ditetapkan sebesar Rp30.000 per kilogram.

“Kalau kita lihat HAP-nya yaitu Rp30.000 artinya ini sedikit di atas HAP. Dan ada 80 kabupaten/kota yang telur ayam ras itu mengalami peningkatan IPH-nya,” ujar Ateng.

BPS juga mencatat harga tertinggi telur ayam ras mencapai Rp100.000 per kilogram, salah satunya di Kabupaten Intan Jaya. Harga penjualan terendah tercatat sebesar Rp25.000 per kilogram.

Terpisah, Kementerian Perdagangan (Kemendag) membantah bahwa pasokan daging ayam dan telur ayam ras menipis di pasar imbas program Makan Bergizi Gratis (MBG).

Menteri Perdagangan (Mendag) Budi Santoso mengatakan MBG justru menciptakan kepastian permintaan yang membuat produksi unggas bergerak lebih stabil dan terukur.

“Enggak, jadi kan gini ya. Ini justru saya sudah diskusi dengan teman-teman. Kalau dulu harga naik-turun karena permintaannya naik-turun. Permintaan naik turun, harga menjadi naik-turun,” kata Budi saat ditemui di Kantor Kemendag, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

title: Bapanas Reveals the Cause of the Skyrocketing Price of Cayenne Pepper, Says He Will Intervene
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The National Food Agency (Bapanas) revealed the reason why the commodity price of cayenne pepper increased by 16.6% in the second week of February 2026.

Bapanas Deputy for Food Availability and Stabilization I Gusti Ketut Astawa said that the high intensity of rain in various regions had hampered the distribution of cayenne pepper. As a result, the price of cayenne pepper in a number of areas is said to have exceeded IDR 80,000 per kilogram.

"Well, it's the rain that's causing it. It's not that there aren't any goods, there's a lot of standing crop, but nothing is starting to be picked," said Ketut in a regional inflation control coordination meeting, broadcast live on the Ministry of Home Affairs' YouTube, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

According to him, this is a challenge for Bapanas and related stakeholders to take steps to control chili prices, even though price reductions are starting to appear today.

He said that Bapanas would take intervention steps by encouraging chili stocks in a number of production centers towards main markets, in the hope that the selling price of chilies could decline.

Ketut explained that his party would collect chili stocks in West Java areas such as Bandung to Garut, then distribute them to the Kramat Jati Main Market and the Tanah Tinggi Main Market.

Also Read

"We have to push these two first, so that they can lower the position [of cayenne pepper prices] to maybe IDR 10,000, IDR 15,000, that's the trend," he said.

Meanwhile, Deputy for Distribution and Services Statistics at the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) Ateng Hartono said that the national average price of cayenne pepper in the second week of this month reached IDR 67,038 per kilogram, an increase of 16.6% compared to January 2026.

"If we compare it with the HAP [sales reference price] of Rp. 57,000, then it is relatively far above the HAP. In fact, this price is quite high compared to the December position," said Ateng on the same occasion.

According to him, the increase in IPH, aka the price development index for cayenne pepper, was seen in 210 districts/cities in the country, a jump from 189 districts/cities in the previous week.

BPS also noted that the highest price for cayenne pepper was recorded in Nduga Regency, reaching IDR 200,000 per kilogram. Meanwhile, the lowest price was recorded at IDR 22,500 per kilogram until the second week of February 2026.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Badan Pangan Nasional (Bapanas) mengungkapkan penyebab harga komoditas cabai rawit meningkat hingga 16,6% pada pekan kedua Februari 2026.

Deputi Bidang Ketersediaan dan Stabilisasi Pangan Bapanas I Gusti Ketut Astawa menyampaikan bahwa intensitas hujan yang tinggi di berbagai daerah membuat distribusi cabai rawit menjadi terhambat. Akibatnya, harga cabai rawit di sejumlah daerah disebutnya melampaui Rp80.000 per kilogram.

“Nah, ini hujan yang menyebabkan memang. Bukan tidak ada barang, barang sangat banyak di standing crop-nya, tapi tidak ada yang mulai dipetik,” kata Ketut dalam rapat koordinasi pengendalian inflasi daerah, disiarkan langsung di YouTube Kemendagri, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Menurutnya, hal ini menjadi tantangan tersendiri bagi Bapanas dan pemangku kepentingan terkait untuk melakukan langkah pengendalian harga cabai, kendati penurunan harga mulai tampak pada hari ini.

Dia menyebut bahwa Bapanas akan melakukan langkah intervensi dengan mendorong stok cabai di sejumlah daerah sentra produksi menuju pasar-pasar induk, dengan harapan harga penjualan cabai dapat melandai.

Ketut menggambarkan bahwa pihaknya akan mengumpulkan stok cabai di kawasan Jawa Barat seperti Bandung hingga Garut, lantas mendistribusikannya ke Pasar Induk Kramat Jati dan Pasar Induk Tanah Tinggi.

“Kalau kita bandingkan dengan HAP [harga acuan penjualan]-nya Rp57.000, maka relatif cukup jauh di atas HAP. Bahkan harga ini cukup tinggi dibandingkan pada posisi Desember,” kata Ateng dalam kesempatan yang sama.

Ketut menggambarkan bahwa pihaknya akan mengumpulkan stok cabai di kawasan Jawa Barat seperti Bandung hingga Garut, lantas mendistribusikannya ke Pasar Induk Kramat Jati dan Pasar Induk Tanah Tinggi.

Baca Juga

“Dua ini harus kita dorong dulu, sehingga mereka bisa menurunkan posisi [harga cabai rawit] mungkin Rp10.000, Rp15.000, kecenderungannya itu,” ujarnya.

Sementara itu, Deputi Bidang Statistik Distribusi dan Jasa Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) Ateng Hartono menyampaikan bahwa harga rata-rata nasional cabai rawit pada pekan kedua bulan ini mencapai Rp67.038 per kilogram, meningkat 16,6% dibandingkan dengan Januari 2026.

“Kalau kita bandingkan dengan HAP [harga acuan penjualan]-nya Rp57.000, maka relatif cukup jauh di atas HAP. Bahkan harga ini cukup tinggi dibandingkan pada posisi Desember,” kata Ateng dalam kesempatan yang sama.

Menurutnya, peningkatan IPH alias indeks perkembangan harga cabai rawit tampak di 210 kabupaten/kota di Tanah Air, melonjak dari 189 kabupaten/kota pada pekan sebelumnya.

BPS juga mencatat harga cabai rawit paling tinggi tercatat di Kabupaten Nduga, yakni mencapai Rp200.000 per kilogram. Sementara itu, harga terendah tercatat sebesar Rp22.500 per kilogram hingga pekan kedua Februari 2026.

title: Government Will Disburse IDR 3 Million Presidential Assistance for 200,000 MSME Victims of Sumatra Disaster
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) is currently working on a plan to distribute presidential assistance (banpres) to micro business actors affected by the Sumatra disaster.

Minister of UMKM Maman Abdurahman explained that presidential assistance would be provided to micro business actors who have not had access to capital from banks, either in the form of loans or people's business credit (KUR).

"On this occasion, we need to convey that our particular concern is for MSMEs who do not have access to banks. We are still continuing to determine this," he explained in a coordination meeting with the DPR RI leadership, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Maman continued, based on data from the Ministry of MSMEs, the total number of micro business actors who currently do not have access to banking is reported to have reached 200,000 people.

Later, the 200,000 people will be given presidential assistance worth IDR 3 million per person. Assuming these figures, the total budget ceiling required is IDR 600 billion.

Meanwhile, currently, the proposed distribution of the presidential ban is in the coordination stage with a number of ministries/institutions (k/l). Starting from the Ministry of Finance, Ministry of State Secretary and Bappenas.

Also Read

"We are discussing with the Ministry of National Development Planning/Bappenas, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of State Secretariat and regional governments, namely for MSMEs that do not yet have access to banks, this needs to be touched upon so that the economy can move downwards," he added.

Apart from that, the government is also opening up opportunities to provide financing relief for MSME business actors affected by the flood disaster in the Aceh-Sumatra region.

Based on Business records, the relief provided ranges from freezing installments, credit restructuring, to potential loan whitening.

Deputy for Micro Business at the Ministry of UMKM, Riza Damanik, said that the relaxation policy refers to Regulation of the Coordinating Minister for the Economy Number 2 of 2026 (Permenko 2/2026) concerning relaxation for MSMEs who borrowed KUR and non-KUR credit before the flood disaster occurred.

"Later, our MSMEs who are borrowing people's business credit will be able to find out about the facilitation that has been provided by the government, the relief provided by the government for installment payments or freezing or restructuring," he explained.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Usaha, Mikro, Kecil, dan Menengah (UMKM) tengah menggodok rencana penyaluran bantuan presiden (banpres) bagi para pelaku usaha mikro yang terdampak bencana Sumatra.

Menteri UMKM Maman Abdurahman menjelaskan bahwa bantuan presiden itu akan diberikan untuk pelaku usaha mikro yang belum mendapat akses permodalan dari perbankan, baik berbentuk kredit pinjaman maupun kredit usaha rakyat (KUR).

"Pada kesempatan kali ini, perlu kami sampaikan bahwa yang menjadi perhatian khususnya kita, yakni untuk UMKM yang memang mereka tidak mendapat akses ke bank. Ini masih kita terus lakukan penetapan," jelasnya dalam rapat koordinasi bersama Pimpinan DPR RI, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Maman melanjutkan, berdasarkan data Kementerian UMKM, total pelaku usaha mikro yang hingga saat ini belum mendapat akses perbankan dilaporkan mencapai 200.000 orang.

Nantinya, 200.000 orang itu akan diberikan banpres senilai Rp3 juta per orang. Dengan asumsi angka tersebut, maka total pagu anggaran yang dibutuhkan senilai Rp600 miliar.

Adapun, saat ini, usulan penyaluran banpres itu tengah dalam tahap koordinasi dengan sejumlah kementerian/lembaga (k/l). Mulai dari Kementerian Keuangan, Kementerian Sekretaris Negara dan Bappenas.

Selain itu, pemerintah juga tengah membuka peluang pemberian keringanan pembiayaan bagi pelaku usaha UMKM terdampak bencana banjir di wilayah Aceh—Sumatra.

Berdasarkan catatan Bisnis, keringanan yang diberikan mulai dari pembekuan (freeze) cicilan, restrukturisasi kredit, hingga potensi pemutihan pinjaman.

"Nantinya UMKM-UMKM kita yang sedang meminjam kredit usaha rakyat itu dapat mengetahui fasilitasi yang sudah diberikan oleh pemerintah, keringanan-keringanan yang diberikan oleh pemerintah untuk pembayaran cicilannya atau freeze atau dilakukan restrukturisasi," jelasnya.

title: Convection Entrepreneurs Start to Be Flooded with Orders Ahead of Eid 2026
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The domestic clothing industry is starting to see a surge in demand ahead of the 2026 Eid al-Fitr momentum. Convection business players have recorded a significant increase in orders in the last 2 months, in line with increasing public needs.

Chairman of the Working Convection Entrepreneurs Association (IPKB) Nandi Herdiaman said that the trend of increasing orders this year was much better than the same period last year. This increase is considered to be a positive signal for small and medium industrial players who had faced pressure throughout the previous year.

"There has been a decent increase in orders this year, from the last 2 months there has been an increase of around 60% from last year," said Nandi to Bisnis, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Not only from the production side, market activity is also starting to be seen in a number of textile and clothing trading centers. People's shopping activities in traditional markets and wholesale centers show an increase, especially towards the peak of the Ramadan shopping season.

Several locations such as Tanah Abang in Jakarta and Andir Market in Bandung are said to have experienced a surge in the number of visitors. This increase in buyer traffic provides additional encouragement for retail traders and convection manufacturers.

"On the offline market, it has started to look more vibrant, for example in Tanah Abang and Andir Market in Bandung, there has been an increase of around 30% in visitors," he said.

Also Read

However, business actors still face a number of challenges, especially in the realm of online marketing. Competition with cheap imported products on e-commerce platforms and limited capital when demand increases are obstacles that need to be overcome immediately.

Industry players hope that the government can maintain market stability, both online and offline, after the Eid momentum so that this growth can continue in a sustainable manner.

"We hope that after Eid the government will protect the market, both online and offline," he concluded.

Previously, IPKB also complained about trading regulations on e-commerce platforms which were considered unfair. The reason is, imported goods can be easily marketed at low prices.

Nandi also believes that the massive number of imported products sold at low prices in e-commerce makes it difficult for SMEs to compete.

"Online platforms as sales places should have clear regulations to ensure prices are fair and not skewed," said Nandi in a written statement, Wednesday (11/2/2026).

Currently, regulations related to the trade system for importing textiles and textile products (TPT) have been regulated by the Ministry of Trade and the Ministry of Industry.

However, Nandi believes that there are still many imported products being sold in e-commerce at unreasonable prices which makes SMEs unable to compete and ultimately suffer losses.

Not only that, according to him, traditional markets also need attention because many offline markets are closed and empty of visitors due to the shift of consumers to online.

"We hope that the government will supervise e-commerce and ensure that online platforms have clear regulations to protect SMEs. We also hope that the government can provide support to SMEs to increase their capabilities and competitiveness," he said.

Meanwhile, online platforms have become 85% of market sales, so it is very important for the government to supervise and ensure that all parties can compete fairly.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Industri pakaian dalam negeri mulai mendapatkan lonjakan permintaan menjelang momentum Hari Raya Lebaran 2026. Pelaku usaha konveksi mencatat peningkatan pesanan yang signifikan dalam 2 bulan terakhir, seiring meningkatnya kebutuhan masyarakat.

Ketua Ikatan Pengusaha Konveksi Berkarya (IPKB) Nandi Herdiaman mengatakan bahwa tren kenaikan pesanan tahun ini jauh lebih baik dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun lalu. Kenaikan ini dinilai menjadi sinyal positif bagi pelaku industri kecil dan menengah yang sempat menghadapi tekanan sepanjang tahun sebelumnya.

“Untuk pesanan order di tahun ini lumayan ada kenaikan, dari mulai 2 bulan terakhir ada peningkatan kisaran 60% dari tahun lalu,” kata Nandi kepada Bisnis, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Tak hanya dari sisi produksi, geliat pasar juga mulai terlihat di sejumlah pusat perdagangan tekstil dan pakaian. Aktivitas belanja masyarakat di pasar tradisional dan sentra grosir menunjukkan peningkatan, terutama menjelang puncak musim belanja Ramadan.

Beberapa lokasi seperti Tanah Abang di Jakarta dan Pasar Andir di Bandung disebut mengalami lonjakan jumlah pengunjung. Peningkatan trafik pembeli ini memberi dorongan tambahan bagi pedagang ritel maupun produsen konveksi.

“Untuk di pasar offline sudah mulai kelihatan menggeliat, contohnya di Tanah Abang dan di Pasar Andir Bandung, pengunjung ada peningkatan kisaran 30%,” tuturnya.

Baca Juga

  • Pengusaha Konveksi Teriak Barang Impor di E-Commerce Kelewat Murah
  • Krisis Penjahit Hantui IKM Konveksi Jelang Ramadan 2026
  • Rencana BUMN Tekstil Baru, Pengusaha Konveksi: Berantas Impor Ilegal Lebih Mendesak

Meski demikian, pelaku usaha masih menghadapi sejumlah tantangan, terutama di ranah pemasaran daring. Persaingan dengan produk impor murah di platform e-commerce serta keterbatasan permodalan saat permintaan meningkat menjadi hambatan yang perlu segera diatasi. 

Pelaku industri berharap pemerintah dapat menjaga stabilitas pasar, baik online maupun offline, setelah momentum Lebaran agar pertumbuhan ini dapat berlanjut secara berkelanjutan.

“Kami berharap setelah Lebaran pemerintah menjaga market, baik di online atau di offline,” tutupnya. 

Sebelumnya, IPKB juga mengeluhkan regulasi perdagangan di platform e-commerce yang dinilai tidak adil. Pasalnya, barang-barang impor dapat mudah dipasarkan dengan harga murah. 

Nandi juga menilai, masifnya produk impor yang dijual dengan harga murah di e-commerce membuat IKM sulit untuk bersaing.

“Sudah seharusnya platform online sebagai tempat penjualan ini memiliki regulasi yang jelas untuk memastikan harga yang fair dan tidak jomplang,” kata Nandi dalam keterangan tertulis, Rabu (11/2/2026). 

Saat ini, regulasi terkait tata niaga impor tekstil dan produk tekstil (TPT) telah diatur dari Kementerian Perdagangan dan Kementerian Perindustrian. 

Namun, Nandi menilai masih banyak produk impor yang dijual di e-commerce dengan harga yang tidak masuk akal yang membuat IKM tidak dapat bersaing dan akhirnya mengalami kerugian.

Tak hanya itu, menurut dia, pasar tradisional juga perlu diperhatikan karena banyak pasar offline yang tutup dan sepi pengunjung karena pergeseran konsumen ke online.

“Kami berharap kepada pemerintah untuk mengawasi e-commerce dan memastikan bahwa platform online memiliki regulasi yang jelas untuk melindungi IKM. Kami juga berharap agar pemerintah dapat memberikan dukungan kepada IKM untuk meningkatkan kemampuan dan daya saing mereka,” tuturnya. 

Adapun, platform online telah menjadi 85% market penjualan sehingga sangat penting bagi pemerintah untuk mengawasi dan memastikan bahwa semua pihak dapat bersaing dengan adil.

title: Profit and Loss Perminas Working on Rare Earth Metals in Gabon
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Economists reveal the advantages and disadvantages of the government's efforts to collaborate with New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd (NEM) to develop the rare earth metals (LTJ) ecosystem. Meanwhile, the collaboration was carried out through PT Perusahaan Mineral Nasional (Persero) or Perminas together with Danantara. This collaboration includes evaluating the potential of niobium and LTJ Maboumine resources in the Republic of Gabon, as well as downstream initiatives in Indonesia. Through this partnership, Indonesia is projected to act as a platform for downstream processing, manufacturing and industrial integration. This collaboration covers the entire value chain, from separation, refining, metal production, to manufacturing high-performance permanent magnets. Director of the Center of Economic and Law Studies (Celios) Bhima Yudhistira assesses that the agreement allows Perminas under Danantara to get access to LTJ from Gabon for a mix of defense industry and electronic products. According to him, there are challenges from a technical and capital perspective related to managing LTJ in Indonesia. Therefore, managing LTJ in Gabon is considered cheaper. Moreover, Indonesia is not a country that has abundant LTJ reserves. Apart from that, most of the LTJ in Indonesia is still in the exploration stage. However, Bhima is of the opinion that Perminas' collaboration with NEM has the potential to make Indonesia an importer of LTJ only. "But the BUMN's decision in Gabon means that Indonesia is actually only an importer of rare earth [LTJ] without having similar mineral downstreaming in the country," said Bhima to Bisnis, Wednesday (18/2/2026). According to Bhima, this collaboration could be profitable if there is a transfer of technology to the BUMN that manages downstreaming. Therefore, he believes that the collaboration with NEM should ideally be carried out by MIND ID instead of Perminas. This is because MIND ID has more long experience in the mineral sector. Bhima also emphasized that Danantara should focus more on improving the governance of existing minerals such as nickel and bauxite. "Danantara should just focus on improving the governance of existing minerals such as nickel and bauxite with issues of price, production capacity, and reducing the environmental impact of smelter energy sources," said Bhima. Meanwhile, Executive Director of the Center for Energy and Mining Law Studies (Pushep) Bisman Bhaktiar believes that cooperation between Perminas and NEM can provide initial access to LTJ resources. strategic for the battery, electric vehicle and high technology industries. "We, Indonesia, have the potential to secure supplies of raw materials while building downstream capacity domestically so that we not only become a market, but also a player in the global supply chain for critical minerals," said Bisman. He said that Indonesia's LTJ reserves are still limited and generally in the form of associated minerals, while Gabon is known to have significant and integrated LTJ potential. is increasing due to the need for the energy transition and for electric vehicles as well as the new renewable energy (EBT) development industry. "If managed with technology transfer and the construction of domestic processing facilities, the prospects are quite promising both in terms of industrial added value and Indonesia's bargaining position in the geopolitics of critical minerals," said Bisman.

content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Ekonom mengungkapkan keuntungan dan kekurangan dari upaya pemerintah menjalin kolaborasi dengan New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd (NEM) untuk mengembangkan ekosistem logam tanah jarang (LTJ).

Adapun, kolaborasi itu dilakukan lewat PT Perusahaan Mineral Nasional (Persero) atau Perminas bersama Danantara. Kerja sama itu mencakup evaluasi potensi sumber daya niobium dan LTJ Maboumine di Republik Gabon, sekaligus inisiatif hilirisasi di Indonesia.

Melalui kemitraan ini, Indonesia diproyeksikan berperan sebagai platform pemrosesan hilir, manufaktur, dan integrasi industri. Kolaborasi tersebut mencakup seluruh rantai nilai, mulai dari pemisahan, pemurnian, produksi logam, hingga manufaktur magnet permanen berkinerja tinggi.

Direktur Center of Economic and Law Studies (Celios) Bhima Yudhistira menilai, perjanjian itu membuat Perminas di bawah Danantara mendapat akses LTJ dari Gabon untuk campuran industri pertahanan dan produk elektronik.

Menurutnya, terdapat tantangan dari segi teknis dan permodalan terkait pengelolaan LTJ di Indonesia. Oleh karena itu, mengelola LTJ di Gabon dinilai lebih murah.

Apalagi, Indonesia bukan negara yang punya cadangan LTJ melimpah. Selain itu, sebagian besar LTJ di Indonesia masih dalam tahap eksplorasi. 

Kendati demikian, Bhima berpendapat kerja sama Perminas dengan NEM berpotensi membuat Indonesia sebagai importir LTJ saja.

"Tapi keputusan BUMN di Gabon membuat Indonesia sebenarnya hanya jadi importir rare earth [LTJ] tanpa punya hilirisasi mineral sejenis di dalam negeri," tutur Bhima kepada Bisnis, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Menurut Bhima, kerja sama tadi bisa menguntungkan kalau terjadi transfer teknologi ke BUMN yang mengurus hilirisasi. Oleh karena itu, dia menilai kerja sama dengan NEM idealnya dilakukan oleh MIND ID alih-alih Perminas.

Pasalnya, MIND ID lebih memiliki pengalaman panjang di sektor mineral. Bhima pun menekankan, seharusnya Danantara lebih fokus memperbaiki tata kelola mineral yang sudah ada seperti nikel dan bauksit.

"Danantara fokus saja memperbaiki tata kelola mineral yang sudah ada seperti nikel dan bauksit dengan persoalan harga, kapasitas produksi, hingga mengurangi dampak lingkungan dari sumber energi smelter," ucap Bhima.

Sementara itu, Direktur Eksekutif Pusat Studi Hukum Energi dan Pertambangan (Pushep) Bisman Bhaktiar berpendapat, kerja sama antara Perminas dan NEM bisa memberi akses awal terhadap sumber daya LTJ yang strategis untuk industri baterai, kendaraan listrik, dan teknologi tinggi. 

"Kita Indonesia berpotensi mengamankan pasokan bahan baku sekaligus membangun kapasitas hilirisasi di dalam negeri sehingga tidak hanya menjadi pasar, tetapi juga pemain dalam rantai pasok global mineral kritis," ucap Bisman.

Dia menuturkan, cadangan LTJ Indonesia masih terbatas dan umumnya berupa mineral ikutan, sementara Gabon dikenal memiliki potensi LTJ yang signifikan dan terintegrasi. 

Menurut Bisman, kolaborasi di luar negeri ini bisa jadi merupakan strategi untuk pengamanan pasokan agar Indonesia tidak bergantung pada satu sumber atau negara tertentu.

Terlebih, permintaan LTJ global terus meningkat karena kebutuhan transisi energi dan untuk kendaraan listrik serta industri pengembangan energi baru terbarukan (EBT). 

"Jika dikelola dengan transfer teknologi dan pembangunan fasilitas pemrosesan di dalam negeri, prospeknya cukup menjanjikan baik dari sisi nilai tambah industri maupun posisi tawar Indonesia dalam geopolitik mineral kritis," tutur Bisman.

title: DPR Highlights Merpati Airlines' Ex-Employee Severance Pay Arrears of IDR 251 Billion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Deputy Chairman of Commission IXDPR RI Charles Honoris emphasized the need for cross-ministerial steps to resolve the issue of the rights of former PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines workers which has not yet been resolved.

He believes that selling company assets alone is not enough to cover obligations to workers. According to him, the state must be actively present considering that Merpati Airlines is a state-owned company.

"This is not just a matter of numbers. There are 1,225 people who are pinning their hopes on resolving this problem. The state must not let go," said Charles at the Public Hearing Meeting (RDPU), Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Therefore, Charles encouraged holding a joint meeting with the relevant commissions by presenting ministries with authority, including the financial sector and management of BUMN. According to him, this effort is crucial so that concrete solutions can be formulated immediately.

Furthermore, Charles also emphasized that the constitution mandates the state to protect workers' rights, rather than leaving them in limbo without certainty.

Charles ensured that Commission IX of the DPR would bring this issue to internal discussion and follow up in the next session by summoning the relevant parties.

Also Read

"We will stand with all ladies and gentlemen to fight for the rights they should receive. This is the state's responsibility," he concluded.

On this occasion, the Justice Solidarity of Ex-Employees of PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines expressed their complaint regarding severance pay arrears for 12 years or since 2014.

This is because as many as 1,225 employees who stopped working since 2014 and have been waiting for a bankruptcy declaration for 10 years, still have to wait for a solution to resolve severance pay.

"We hope that the DPR can be the spearhead in fighting for the rights of PT Merpati Nusantara employees by carrying out the process of resolving the severance pay issue," he said.

Apart from that, the representative of former state-owned airline employees, Agus Slamet Budiman, explained that the company had paid IDR 96 billion to 1,225 former employees from a PT Perusahaan Pengelola Aset (PPA) loan from a total severance pay obligation of IDR 413 billion.

Thus, there are still pending obligations worth IDR 317 billion. Agus said that when PT Merpati Nusantara was declared bankrupt as of June 2 2022, the court had appointed a curator to sell the company's assets.

A number of assets that were sold from 2023 to 2026 were partly used to pay severance pay installments worth IDR 65.9 billion. Specifically in 2026, new installment payments amounting to IDR 402 million will be distributed to 1,225 employees.

As a result, the total severance pay arrears are still worth IDR 251.5 billion. However, around 90% of Merpati Nusantara's assets have been sold out.

"We hope that government policy and Commission IX can solve this problem considering that Merpati has also contributed greatly to this country as a bridge to the archipelago through opening routes to various regions and at the same time being a driver of economic growth," he concluded.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Wakil Ketua Komisi IX DPR RI Charles Honoris menegaskan perlunya langkah lintas kementerian untuk menyelesaikan persoalan hak eks pekerja PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines yang hingga kini belum tuntas. 

Dirinya menilai penjualan aset perusahaan semata tidak cukup untuk menutup kewajiban kepada para pekerja. Menurutnya, negara harus hadir secara aktif mengingat Merpati Airlines merupakan badan usaha milik negara.

“Ini bukan sekadar soal angka. Ada 1.225 orang yang menggantungkan harapan pada penyelesaian masalah ini. Negara tidak boleh lepas tangan,” kata Charles dalam Rapat Dengar Pendapat Umum (RDPU), Rabu (18/2/2026). 

Maka dari itu, Charles mendorong digelarnya rapat gabungan dengan komisi terkait dengan menghadirkan kementerian yang memiliki kewenangan, termasuk sektor keuangan dan pengelolaan BUMN. Upaya ini, menurutnya, bernilai krusial agar solusi konkret bisa segera dirumuskan.  

Lebih lanjut, Charles juga menekankan konstitusi mengamanatkan negara untuk melindungi hak-hak pekerja, bukan justru membiarkan mereka terkatung-katung tanpa kepastian.  

Charles memastikan Komisi IX DPR akan membawa persoalan ini ke pembahasan internal dan menindaklanjutinya pada masa sidang berikutnya dengan memanggil pihak-pihak terkait.

“Kami akan berdiri bersama bapak-ibu semua memperjuangkan hak yang seharusnya diterima. Ini tanggung jawab negara,” pungkasnya. 

Pada kesempatan tersebut, Solidaritas Keadilan Eks Pegawai PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines menyampaikan keluhannya terkait tunggakan pesangon selama 12 tahun atau sejak 2014. 

Pasalnya sebanyak 1.225 karyawan yang berhenti bekerja sejak 2014 dan telah menunggu pernyataan pailit selama 10 tahun, masih harus menunggu solusi penyelesaian pesangon. 

“Kami berharap DPR dapat menjadi ujung tombak dalam memperjuangkan hak-hak karyawan PT Merpati Nusantara dengan melakukan proses penyelesaian masalah pesangon,” tuturnya. 

Selain itu, perwakilan mantan pegawai maskapai pelat merah Agus Slamet Budiman menjelaskan, perusahaan telah membayar Rp96 miliar kepada 1.225 eks pegawai yang berasal dari pinjaman PT Perusahaan Pengelola Aset (PPA) dari total kewajiban pesangon senilai Rp413 miliar. 

Dengan demikian, masih terdapat kewajiban yang tertunda senilai Rp317 miliar. Agus menuturkan, saat PT Merpati Nusantara dinyatakan pailit per 2 Juni 2022, pengadilan telah menunjuk kurator untuk menjual aset perusahaan. 

Sejumlah aset yang telah terjual sejak 2023 hingga 2026 pun sebagian digunakan untuk membayar cicilan pesangon senilai Rp65,9 miliar. Khusus pada 2026, pembayaran cicilan baru sejumlah Rp402 juta yang dibagikan kepada 1.225 pegawai. 

Alhasil, total tunggakan pesangon masih senilai Rp251,5 miliar. Namun, sekitar 90% aset Merpati Nusantara telah habis terjual. 

“Mohon kiranya kebijakan pemerintah dan Komisi IX dapat menyelesaikan masalahnya ini mengingat Merpati juga pernah hadir berkontribusi besar pada negeri ini sebagai jembatan Nusantara melalui pembukaan rute-rute berbagai daerah dan sekaligus menjadi pendorong penggerak pertumbuhan ekonomi,” tutupnya.

title: Economists Push for Labor-Intensive Industrial Transformation to Boost Indonesian Manufacturing
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Manufacturing productivity is in the spotlight of the World Bank because it is considered to still provide low added value, especially to the workforce.

Professor at the Faculty of Economics and Business, University of Indonesia, Telisa Aulia Falianty, said that overall national manufacturing growth was increasing.

"Judging from the share, it has increased at 19%, growth is above 5%, from this BPS data, productivity has actually increased. However, the World Bank highlights human resource productivity, meaning production per capita," said Telisa to Business, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

If we look at per capita production, Telisa said, national industry is indeed lagging behind other countries, such as Thailand, Malaysia and India.

Telisa assesses that this condition is triggered by the flow of investment into Indonesia, the majority of which are capital-intensive industries. Meanwhile, technology transfer from this industry is also considered to be still rare.

Therefore, he revealed the importance of concrete and measurable steps to increase national productivity. According to him, productivity is the key so that Indonesia is able to strengthen industrial competitiveness amidst increasingly tight global competition.

Also Read

Based on data from the Asian Productivity Organization (APO), the productivity of Indonesian workers in recent years has indeed shown improvement.

In 2022, Indonesia's productivity will be recorded at around US$28.6 per worker, an increase compared to 2018 which was around US$23.9. However, this figure is still below the Asean average which has reached around US$30.2.

In terms of growth, Indonesia's productivity index (2010=1.0) has indeed increased consistently until 2022. However, the rate of increase is still lagging behind a number of countries such as China, Vietnam and Bangladesh which recorded higher acceleration in the same period.

"This means that we need to encourage transformation so that labor-intensive sectors can move up in class and produce greater added value," he explained.

As a solution, Telisa encourages a 4P approach, namely people, process, product and policy. In the people aspect, improving the quality of human resources is a priority, including competency-based training and preparing productivity specialists. On the process and product side, direct evaluation and intervention is needed in companies, especially medium scale.

Meanwhile, from a policy or regulatory perspective, strengthening the productivity ecosystem is considered important, starting from establishing a national productivity institution, giving productivity awards, to strengthening international networks through APO. He also emphasized the importance of utilizing data through productivity dashboards and labor market analysis as a basis for policy.

With directed and collaborative steps, Telisa is optimistic that Indonesia's productivity can grow faster and catch up with benchmark countries in the Asian region.

Meanwhile, Institute For Development of Economics and Finance (Indef) researcher Ariyo DP Irhamna said the government also needs to be more selective in providing incentives to investors. In this case, it is important to restructure the tax holiday so that it requires local content, technology transfer and integration of domestic suppliers, not just the establishment of an assembly plant.

"Then, strengthening human resources and infrastructure. Vocational reforms that are in line with the needs of technology-intensive industries and improving logistics to reduce production costs," he said.

No less important is integration into the global value chain by encouraging domestic companies to enter multinational supply networks through quality standards, certification and export facilitation.

Furthermore, the commercialization of domestic research and innovation is considered to be the biggest gap that has so far been ignored. The reason is, Indef sees that many BRIN and university research results stop at the prototype or even patent stage.

He also mentioned concrete steps such as strengthening office licensing technology (TLO) in research institutions and universities with a real commercial mandate, create a government-industry matching grant scheme to finance the pilot stage, reform intellectual property rights (IPR) regulations so that the patent process is faster and cheaper, and provide tax incentives for companies that purchase technology licenses from domestic research institutions.

"Without a bridge between laboratories and markets, research investment will never translate into industrial productivity," he concluded.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Produktivitas manufaktur menjadi sorotan World Bank alias Bank Dunia lantaran dinilai masih memberikan nilai tambah yang rendah, khususnya terhadap tenaga kerja. 

Guru Besar Fakultas Ekonomi dan Bisnis Universitas Indonesia Telisa Aulia Falianty mengatakan, jika dilihat secara keseluruhan pertumbuhan manufaktur nasional meningkat. 

"Dilihat dari share itu meningkat di 19%, growth di atas 5%, dari data BPS ini sebenarnya produktivitas naik. Namun, World Bank menyoroti produktivitas SDM, artinya produksi per kapita," kata Telisa kepada Bisnis, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Jika dilihat dari produksi per kapita, Telisa menyebut, industri nasional memang tertinggal dibandingkan negara lain, seperti Thailand, Malaysia, maupun India. 

Telisa menilai kondisi ini dipicu arus investasi yang masuk ke Indonesia mayoritas industri padat modal. Sementara itu, transfer teknologi dari industri tersebut juga dinilai masih langka. 

Oleh karena itu, dia mengungkap pentingnya langkah konkret dan terukur untuk meningkatkan produktivitas nasional. Menurutnya, produktivitas menjadi kunci agar Indonesia mampu memperkuat daya saing industri di tengah persaingan global yang semakin ketat.

Berdasarkan data Asian Productivity Organization (APO), produktivitas tenaga kerja Indonesia dalam beberapa tahun terakhir memang menunjukkan perbaikan. 

Pada 2022, produktivitas Indonesia tercatat sekitar US$28,6 per tenaga kerja, meningkat dibandingkan 2018 yang berada di kisaran US$23,9. Namun, angka tersebut masih di bawah rata-rata Asean yang telah mencapai sekitar US$30,2.

Dari sisi pertumbuhan, indeks produktivitas Indonesia (2010=1,0) memang naik secara konsisten hingga 2022. Meski begitu, laju kenaikannya masih tertinggal dibandingkan sejumlah negara seperti China, Vietnam, dan Bangladesh yang mencatat percepatan lebih tinggi dalam periode yang sama.

“Artinya, kita perlu mendorong transformasi agar sektor padat karya bisa naik kelas dan menghasilkan nilai tambah yang lebih besar," terangnya.

Sebagai solusi, Telisa mendorong pendekatan 4P, yaitu people, process, product, dan policy. Pada aspek people, peningkatan kualitas sumber daya manusia menjadi prioritas, termasuk pelatihan berbasis kompetensi dan penyiapan spesialis produktivitas. Di sisi process dan product, diperlukan evaluasi dan intervensi langsung di perusahaan, terutama skala menengah.

Sementara dari sisi policy atau regulasi, penguatan ekosistem produktivitas dinilai penting, mulai dari pembentukan lembaga produktivitas nasional, pemberian penghargaan produktivitas, hingga penguatan jejaring internasional melalui APO. Ia juga menekankan pentingnya pemanfaatan data melalui dashboard produktivitas dan analisis pasar tenaga kerja sebagai dasar kebijakan.

Dengan langkah yang terarah dan kolaboratif, Telisa optimistis produktivitas Indonesia dapat tumbuh lebih cepat dan mengejar ketertinggalan dari negara-negara benchmark di kawasan Asia.

Sementara itu, peneliti Institute For Development of Economics and Finance (Indef) Ariyo DP Irhamna mengatakan, pemerintah juga perlu lebih selektif dalam memberikan insentif kepada investor. Dalam hal ini, penting melakukan restrukturisasi tax holiday agar mensyaratkan kandungan lokal, transfer teknologi, dan integrasi pemasok domestik, bukan sekadar pendirian pabrik perakitan.

"Kemudian, penguatan SDM dan infrastruktur. Reformasi vokasional yang selaras kebutuhan industri padat teknologi dan perbaikan logistik untuk menekan biaya produksi," tuturnya. 

Tak kalah penting, integrasi ke rantai nilai global dengan mendorong perusahaan domestik masuk ke jaringan pasokan multinasional lewat standar kualitas, sertifikasi, dan fasilitasi ekspor.

Lebih lanjut, komersialisasi riset dan inovasi dalam negeri yang dinilai menjadi celah terbesar yang selama ini diabaikan. Pasalnya, Indef melihat ada banyak hasil riset BRIN dan universitas berhenti di tahap prototipe atau bahkan paten saja. 

Dia juga menyebutkan langkah konkret seperti penguatan technology licensing office (TLO) di lembaga riset dan perguruan tinggi dengan mandat komersial yang nyata, buat skema matching grant pemerintah-industri untuk membiayai tahap pilot, reformasi regulasi hak kekayaan intelektual (HKI) agar proses paten lebih cepat dan murah, dan berikan insentif pajak bagi perusahaan yang membeli lisensi teknologi dari lembaga riset domestik. 

"Tanpa jembatan antara laboratorium dan pasar, investasi riset tidak akan pernah menjelma menjadi produktivitas industri," pungkasnya.

title: Purbaya Compares Indonesia's Debt Ratio with Singapore Cs: We Are Still Safe
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Minister of Finance (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said that the central government debt ratio is still within safe limits even though the figure has reached 40.46% of gross domestic product (GDP).

Purbaya then compared it with several Southeast Asian countries such as Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand whose debt ratios are above 50%.

"It's okay. So what? Singapore? How much? [More than 100%]. Malaysia how much? [More than 60%]. Thailand how much? Just check Thailand how much. With that standard, we are still safe," explained Purbaya to journalists after the Sumatra Post-Disaster Recovery Task Force coordination meeting (coordination meeting) with the DPR at the Senayan Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

On the other hand, he also said that the fiscal deficit was still below the 3% limit of GDP. Purbaya said that the 2025 deficit, which almost touched the 3% limit, was deliberately maximized to ensure a reversal in the direction of economic growth.

In 2025, the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) reported that the economy grew 5.11% throughout the year and reached a post-pandemic high in the fourth quarter of 2025, namely 5.39%.

"It's actually a very smart strategy. We don't exceed the 3% [limit], expand fiscally, give stimulus to the economy, the economy will come back. We just have to run, we just need to manage the future as the economy is busy," said the former Chairman of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS).

Also Read

In detail, the government debt ratio up to December 31 2025 includes the issuance of SBN of IDR 8,387.23 trillion and loans of IDR 1,250.67 trillion.

"The government manages debt carefully and measurably to achieve an optimal debt portfolio and support the development of the domestic financial market. The majority of government debt composition is in the form of SBN instruments, reaching 87.02%," quoted from the official website of the Ministry of Finance's DJPPR.

Di sisi lain, dia juga menyampaikan bahwa defisit fiskal masih berada di bawah batas 3% terhadap PDB. Purbaya mengatakan bahwa defisit 2025 lalu yang nyaris menyentuh batas 3% sengaja dimaksimalkan untuk memastikan pembalikan arah pertumbuhan ekonomi.

Pada 2025, Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) melaporkan ekonomi tumbuh 5,11% sepanjang tahun dan mencapai rekor tertinggi pascapandemi pada kuartal IV/2025 yakni 5,39%. 

"Itu sebetulnya strategi yang amat smart. Kami enggak lewatin [batas] 3%, ekspansi fiskal, kasih stimulus ke ekonomi, ekonominya balik. Tinggal kami lari, tinggal atur ke depan seperti apa yang ramai ekonominya," tutur mantan Ketua Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan (LPS) itu.

title: Mining Expert: Ban on Tin Exports is Strategic to Build Local Manufacturing
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Association of Indonesian Mining Experts (Perhapi) considers the government's plan to ban tin exports to be a strategic step to encourage the growth of the domestic manufacturing industry. Meanwhile, the government's move to stop tin exports is to encourage downstreaming within the country. That way, added value can be created. Chairman of the Perhapi Advisory Board, Rizal Kasli, is of the opinion that the government should focus on developing the domestic manufacturing ecosystem, especially in the downstream industry of tin commodities. According to him, what PT Timah Tbk and other tin companies produce is currently only at the intermediate product stage, of which more than 90% is exported abroad. The reason is that domestic absorption is not yet large, so the choice is to export. "If this policy [stop tin exports] is realized, it will provide high added value in the utilization of Indonesia's mineral resources," said Rizal to Bisnis, Wednesday (18/2/2026). Moreover, intermediate products still require further stages to produce finished products. He gave an example, for industrial needs such as cans and tin soldering, the need for tin plate (tinplate) by PT Latinusa for example is still very low, namely around 6% which uses domestically produced tin commodities. Rizal also believes that stopping tin exports will open up many job opportunities. This is in line with the development of the domestic manufacturing industry. "The President [Prabowo Subianto] with his political promises in the campaign emphasized that he would create as many jobs as possible. This can be achieved by building as many domestic industries as possible, especially derivative industries from mineral and coal commodities and other natural resources," he explained. Nevertheless, Rizal reminded that steps to stop tin exports need to be studied comprehensively first with industry associations, professions and related ministries/institutions. This is to determine the positive and negative impacts as well as the amount of domestic absorption. According to him, the export ban can be implemented in stages if domestic industry absorption cannot accommodate 100% of the product. One step that the government can take is to implement a domestic market obligation (DMO) scheme as applied to coal commodities. "The increase in the DMO percentage is carried out in stages according to developments in the domestic industry. The government's focus is to create derivative industries to produce finished goods," added Rizal. He also warned that if this policy must be implemented 100% and a domestic market has not been created, it will disrupt the cash flow of mining companies. Because, there are products that cannot be sold and will become dead stock.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Perhimpunan Ahli Pertambangan Indonesia (Perhapi) menilai rencana pemerintah melarang ekspor timah menjadi langkah strategis untuk mendorong pertumbuhan industri manufaktur dalam negeri.

Adapun, langkah pemerintah menghentikan ekspor timah itu demi mendorong hilirisasi di dalam negeri. Dengan begitu, nilai tambah dapat tercipta.

Ketua Dewan Penasehat Perhapi Rizal Kasli berpendapat, sudah seharusnya pemerintah fokus dalam pengembangan ekosistem manufaktur dalam negeri terutama di industri hilir dari komoditas timah. 

Menurutnya, apa yang dihasilkan oleh PT Timah Tbk dan perusahaan timah lainnya saat ini baru pada tahap produk antara (intermediate product) yang lebih dari 90% diekspor ke luar negeri. Pasalnya, serapan dalam negeri belum besar sehingga pilihannya adalah melakukan ekspor. 

"Kebijakan ini [setop ekspor timah] apabila terealisasi akan memberikan nilai tambah yang tinggi dalam pemanfaatan sumber daya mineral Indonesia," ucap Rizal kepada Bisnis, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dia mengatakan, sangat disayangkan kalau komoditas ini tidak bisa dimanfaatkan secara maksimal di dalam negeri untuk kebangkitan industri manufaktur. Apalagi, produk antara masih memerlukan tahapan lanjutan untuk menghasilkan produk jadi.

Dia mencontohkan, untuk kebutuhan industri seperti kaleng hingga timah solder, kebutuhan pelat timah (tinplate) oleh PT Latinusa misalnya masih sangat rendah, yaitu sekitar 6% yang menggunakan komoditas timah produksi dalam negeri. 

Rizal juga menilai penghentian ekspor timah akan membuka banyak lapangan kerja. Hal ini seiring dengan pengembangan industri manufaktur dalam negeri. 

"Presiden [Prabowo Subianto] dengan janji politiknya dalam kampanye menekankan akan menciptakan lapangan kerja sebanyak-banyaknya. Ini bisa dicapai dengan membangun industri di dalam negeri sebanyak-banyaknya terutama industri turunan dari komoditas mineral dan batu bara serta sumber daya alam lainnya," jelasnya.

Kendati demikian, Rizal mengingatkan bahwa langkah penghentian ekspor timah perlu dikaji terlebih dahulu secara komprehensif dengan asosiasi industri, profesi dan kementerian/lembaga terkait. Ini guna mengetahui dampak positif dan negatif serta besarnya serapan dalam negeri.

Menurutnya, pelarangan ekspor tersebut bisa dilakukan secara bertahap apabila serapan industri dalam negeri belum dapat menampung 100% dari produk. Salah satu langkah yang bisa dilakukan pemerintah adalah dengan penerapan skema domestic market obligation (DMO) seperti yang diberlakukan di komoditas batu bara. 

"Penambahan persentase DMO dilakukan bertahap sesuai perkembangan industri dalam negeri. Fokus pemerintah adalah menciptakan industri turunan sehingga menghasilkan barang jadi," imbuh Rizal.

Dia pun mewanti-wanti apabila kebijakan ini serta merta harus diterapkan 100% dan pasar di dalam negeri belum tercipta, maka akan mengganggu cash flow perusahaan tambang. Sebab, terdapat produk yang tidak bisa dijual dan akan menjadi dead stock.

Pasalnya, serapan dalam negeri belum besar sehingga pilihannya adalah melakukan ekspor."Kebijakan ini [setop ekspor timah] apabila terealisasi akan memberikan nilai tambah yang tinggi dalam pemanfaatan sumber daya mineral Indonesia," ucap Rizal kepadaBisnis, Rabu (18/2/2026).Dia mengatakan, sangat disayangkan kalau komoditas ini tidak bisa dimanfaatkan secara maksimal di dalam negeri untuk kebangkitan industri manufaktur. Apalagi, produk antara masih memerlukan tahapan lanjutan untuk menghasilkan produk jadi.Dia mencontohkan, untuk kebutuhan industri seperti kaleng hingga timah solder, kebutuhan pelat timah (tinplate)oleh PT Latinusa misalnya masih sangat rendah, yaitu sekitar 6% yang menggunakan komoditas timah produksi dalam negeri.Rizal juga menilai penghentian ekspor timah akan membuka banyak lapangan kerja. Hal ini seiring dengan pengembangan industri manufaktur dalam negeri."Presiden [Prabowo Subianto] dengan janji politiknya dalam kampanye menekankan akan menciptakan lapangan kerja sebanyak-banyaknya. Ini bisa dicapai dengan membangun industri di dalam negeri sebanyak-banyaknya terutama industri turunan dari komoditas mineral dan batu bara serta sumber daya alam lainnya," jelasnya.Kendati demikian, Rizal mengingatkan bahwa langkah penghentian ekspor timah perlu dikaji terlebih dahulu secara komprehensif dengan asosiasi industri, profesi dan kementerian/lembaga terkait. Ini guna mengetahui dampak positif dan negatif serta besarnya serapan dalam negeri.Menurutnya, pelarangan ekspor tersebut bisa dilakukan secara bertahap apabila serapan industri dalam negeri belum dapat menampung 100% dari produk. Salah satu langkah yang bisa dilakukan pemerintah adalah dengan penerapan skemadomestic market obligation(DMO) seperti yang diberlakukan di komoditas batu bara."Penambahan persentase DMO dilakukan bertahap sesuai perkembangan industri dalam negeri. Fokus pemerintah adalah menciptakan industri turunan sehingga menghasilkan barang jadi," imbuh Rizal.Dia pun mewanti-wanti apabila kebijakan ini serta merta harus diterapkan 100% dan pasar di dalam negeri belum tercipta, maka akan mengganggucash flowperusahaan tambang. Sebab, terdapat produk yang tidak bisa dijual dan akan menjadidead stock.

title: Speeding up the Red and White Kopdes, the Ministry of Cooperatives will adjust land specifications
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Cooperatives (Kemenkop) will accelerate the physical development of the Red and White Village/Subdistrict Cooperatives (KopDes/Kel) by adjusting land specifications to make them more flexible, in line with limited land area in a number of areas.

Minister of Cooperatives (Menkop) Ferry Juliantono said that the smoothly running physical development of KopDes/Kel Merah Putih was the key to strengthening national food security as well as encouraging economic empowerment of communities at the village level.

To date, as many as 30,336 village cooperatives are in the development stage. However, there are still challenges faced, especially regarding the availability of land that suits the development needs of village cooperatives.

"We understand that there are limited land in several villages and sub-districts. Therefore, we will immediately adjust the physical development specifications of the cooperative so that it can be more flexible and in accordance with local conditions," said Ferry in a written statement, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

To overcome these land limitations, the Ministry of Cooperatives plans to implement a more flexible development design for cooperatives built in villages with limited land area. Later, this policy will be passed on to PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara as the implementer of the physical construction of the KopDes Merah Putih building.

Ferry explained that this step was taken so that physical development could still meet the set standards, even though there were different physical limitations in each region.

Also Read

Based on data collected by the Ministry of Cooperatives' Command Center, 48,734 areas of land have been mapped and 30,336 points are undergoing physical development. Of the total number, 1,135 points have been completed 100%.

According to Ferry, support from various parties is needed to accelerate the physical development process, including from ministries/institutions at the central level and regional governments.

"We hope that there will be stronger synergy between the center and the regions to accelerate the physical development of cooperatives, especially in terms of land acquisition and infrastructure development," he said.

Apart from that, the Ministry of Cooperatives will also optimize human resources (HR) training so that prospective administrators can manage cooperatives more professionally, transparently and accountably.

"With faster physical development and better management, KopDes Merah Putih will play an increasingly important role in promoting the welfare of village communities and supporting national food security," he concluded.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Koperasi (Kemenkop) akan mempercepat pembangunan fisik Koperasi Desa/Kelurahan (KopDes/Kel) Merah Putih dengan menyesuaikan spesifikasi lahan agar lebih fleksibel, seiring keterbatasan luas lahan di sejumlah wilayah.

Menteri Koperasi (Menkop) Ferry Juliantono mengatakan, pembangunan fisik KopDes/Kel Merah Putih yang berjalan lancar menjadi kunci dalam memperkuat ketahanan pangan nasional sekaligus mendorong pemberdayaan ekonomi masyarakat di tingkat desa.

Hingga saat ini, sebanyak 30.336 koperasi desa tengah dalam tahap pembangunan. Namun, masih ada tantangan yang dihadapi, terutama terkait ketersediaan lahan yang sesuai dengan kebutuhan pembangunan koperasi desa.

“Kami memahami adanya keterbatasan lahan di beberapa desa dan kelurahan. Oleh karena itu, kami akan segera menyesuaikan spesifikasi pembangunan fisik koperasi agar bisa lebih fleksibel dan sesuai dengan kondisi lokal,” kata Ferry dalam keterangan tertulis, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Untuk mengatasi keterbatasan lahan tersebut, Kemenkop berencana menerapkan desain pembangunan yang lebih fleksibel bagi koperasi yang dibangun di desa dengan luas lahan terbatas. Nantinya, kebijakan ini akan diteruskan kepada PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara sebagai pelaksana pembangunan fisik gedung KopDes Merah Putih.

Ferry menjelaskan langkah ini dilakukan agar pembangunan fisik tetap dapat memenuhi standar yang ditetapkan, meskipun dengan adanya keterbatasan fisik yang berbeda di tiap wilayah.

Berdasarkan data yang dihimpun Command Center Kemenkop, sebanyak 48.734 lahan sudah dilakukan pemetaan dan 30.336 titik yang tengah dilakukan pembangunan fisik. Dari total angka tersebut, yang telah rampung 100% adalah sebanyak 1.135 titik.

Menurut Ferry, perlunya dukungan dari berbagai pihak dalam mempercepat proses pembangunan fisik, termasuk dari kementerian/lembaga di tingkat pusat serta pemerintah daerah.

“Kami berharap ada sinergi yang lebih kuat antara pusat dan daerah untuk mempercepat pembangunan fisik koperasi, terutama dalam hal pengadaan lahan dan pembangunan infrastruktur,” ujarnya.

Selain itu, Kemenkop juga akan mengoptimalkan pelatihan sumber daya manusia (SDM) agar para calon pengurus dapat mengelola koperasi dengan lebih profesional, transparan, dan akuntabel.

“Dengan pembangunan fisik yang lebih cepat dan pengelolaan yang lebih baik, KopDes Merah Putih akan semakin berperan dalam mendorong kesejahteraan masyarakat desa dan mendukung ketahanan pangan nasional,” pungkasnya.

title: IMF Proposes to Raise Income Tax Rates, Purbaya: Rates Will Not Increase, Until the Economy Improves!
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Minister of Finance (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa confirmed that he would not increase tax rates while ensuring that the APBN deficit would remain under 3% of gross domestic product (GDP).

Purbaya's statement was expressed in response to a report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which among other things proposed an increase in employee income tax (PPh) so that the APBN deficit does not exceed the 3% limit.

This option is one of the IMF's illustrative instruments for Indonesia to reduce the government's dependence on deficit financing. This year, the government is targeting a deficit of IDR 689.1 trillion or 2.68% of GDP.

"Yes, that's good, the IMF's proposal is good for increasing taxes. Do you want to be taxed? I said that until the economy is strong, we won't change tax rates. But we will extensify it, close tax leaks and so on," explained Purbaya to journalists after a coordination meeting (coordination meeting) of the Sumatra Post-Disaster Recovery Task Force with the DPR at the Senayan Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Purbaya ensured that the government focused on accelerating economic growth. For your information, from the 2026 baseline economic growth in the APBN Law of 5.4%, Purbaya estimates that the economy can grow up to 6% this year.

With the economy growing faster, he believes government tax revenues could be higher.  "So the 3% [fiscal deficit limit] can be avoided automatically. If it's less, we'll increase taxes," he said jokingly.

Also Read

The economist, who has worked at Danareksa and the Presidential Staff Office (KSP), emphasized that he does not want to suddenly increase taxes. This can affect purchasing power so that economic growth slows down.

"We also have to cut the 3% if the economy falls. So I have used the cheapest possible costs to reverse the direction of the economy," he explained.

Previously, the IMF, through its Selected Issues Paper report entitled Golden Vision 2045: Making The Most Out of Public Investment, which was released in early February 2026, estimated that Indonesia needed real gross domestic product (GDP) growth in the range of 5.5% to 6.5% every year for the next two decades to achieve high-income country status in accordance with the vision of Golden Indonesia 2045.

To achieve that, the IMF identified increasing public investment as its main pillar. However, capital expenditure expansion must be accompanied by an increase in tax revenues so that the APBN deficit does not exceed the 3% threshold of gross domestic product (GDP).

The IMF report underlines that revenue mobilization is an absolute requirement to create loose fiscal space for the expansion of infrastructure and public projects.

"Mobilization of additional revenues will create the fiscal space needed to increase the scale of public investment while maintaining compliance with Indonesia's long-standing fiscal rules," explained the IMF research team consisting of Tsendsuren Batsuuri, Raju Huidrom and Philippe Wingender in the report, quoted on Saturday (14/2/2026).

In the framework of its macroeconomic simulations, the institution headquartered in Washington D.C. It projects that various domestic revenue extraction measures could contribute incremental state revenues of around 0.3 percentage points of GDP.

As an illustrative instrument, the IMF model offers the option of increasing employee income tax (labor income tax) to reduce the government's dependence on deficit financing.

However, the IMF provides thick notes regarding the stages of the execution of this tax policy. The IMF formulated that the initial surge in public investment funding be financed entirely through the budget deficit. As time goes by and the wheels of the economy begin to turn faster due to this investment, labor income tax collection is gradually increased.

Delay strategy be This initial tax ban is considered crucial so that tax pressure does not injure or put a brake on the rate of economic growth which is just about to take off.

Through a combination of these maneuvers, the overall fiscal deficit posture is believed to be maintained below 3%, based on the baseline of the 2024 APBN deficit realization at the level of 2.3% of GDP.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Menteri Keuangan (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa memastikan belum akan menaikkan tarif pajak sembari memastikan defisit APBN tetap akan terjaga di bawah 3% dari produk domestik bruto (PDB). 

Pernyataan Purbaya itu diungkapkan merespons laporan Dana Moneter Internasional atau International Monetary Fund (IMF) yang di antaranya mengusulkan kenaikan pajak penghasilan (PPh) karyawan agar defisit APBN tak melewati batas 3%. 

Opsi tersebut menjadi salah satu instrumen ilustratif IMF kepada Indonesia untuk mengurangi ketergantungan pemerintah pada pembiayaan defisit. Pada tahun ini, pemerintah menargetkan defisit Rp689,1 triliun atau 2,68% terhadap PDB. 

"Ya bagus, usulan IMF itu bagus untuk naikin pajak. Anda mau dipajakin? Kan saya bilang sebelum ekonominya kuat, kami enggak akan ubah-ubah itu tarif pajak. Tetapi kami akan ekstensifikasi, tutup kebocoran pajak dan lain-lain," terang Purbaya kepada wartawan usai rapat koordinasi (rakor) Satgas Pemulihan Pascabencana Sumatra bersama DPR di Kompleks Parlemen Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Purbaya memastikan bahwa pemerintah fokus untuk mempercepat pertumbuhan ekonomi. Untuk diketahui, dari baseline pertumbuhan ekonomi 2026 pada UU APBN sebesar 5,4%, Purbaya memperkirakan ekonomi bisa tumbuh sampai dengan 6% tahun ini. 

Dengan perekonomian yang tumbuh lebih cepat, dia meyakini penerimaan pajak pemerintah bisa lebih tinggi.  "Sehingga [batas defisit fiskal] 3% itu bisa dihindari secara otomatis. Nanti kalau kurang, ya kami naikin pajak," ujarnya sambil berkelakar. 

Baca Juga

  • Dirjen Pajak Wanti-wanti Fiskus Antisipasi Lonjakan Lapor SPT saat Ramadan
  • Bapenda Riau Targetkan Revisi Pergub Pajak Air Permukaan Rampung Maret 2026
  • IMF Usul Pajak Gaji Naik demi APBN, Awas Jadi Beban Kelas Menengah!

Ekonom yang pernah bekerja di Danareksa hingga Kantor Staf Presiden (KSP) itu menegaskan tidak ingin secara tiba-tiba menaikkan pajak. Itu bisa memengaruhi daya beli sehingga pertumbuhan ekonomi pun melambat. 

"Terpaksa 3% juga diterabas kalau ekonomi jatuh loh. Jadi saya sudah pakai biaya yang semurah mungkin untuk membalikkan arah ekonomi," terangnya. 

Masukan dari IMF

Sebelumnya, IMF melalui laporan Selected Issues Paper bertajuk Golden Vision 2045: Making The Most Out of Public Investment yang dirilis awal Februari 2026, menaksir Indonesia membutuhkan pertumbuhan produk domestik bruto (PDB) riil di kisaran 5,5% hingga 6,5% setiap tahunnya selama dua dekade ke depan untuk mencapai status negara berpendapatan tinggi sesuai visi Indonesia Emas 2045. 

Untuk mencapai itu, IMF mengidentifikasi peningkatan investasi publik sebagai pilar utamanya. Kendati demikian, ekspansi belanja modal itu wajib berbarengan dengan peningkatan penerimaan pajak agar defisit APBN tidak melampaui ambang batas 3% terhadap produk domestik bruto (PDB). 

Laporan IMF menggarisbawahi bahwa mobilisasi penerimaan adalah syarat mutlak guna menciptakan ruang fiskal yang longgar bagi ekspansi proyek infrastruktur dan publik. 

"Mobilisasi tambahan penerimaan akan menciptakan ruang fiskal yang dibutuhkan untuk meningkatkan skala investasi publik sembari mempertahankan kepatuhan terhadap aturan fiskal Indonesia yang telah berjalan lama," papar tim peneliti IMF yang beranggotakan Tsendsuren Batsuuri, Raju Huidrom, dan Philippe Wingender dalam laporan tersebut, dikutip Sabtu (14/2/2026). 

Dalam kerangka simulasi makroekonominya, lembaga yang bermarkas di Washington D.C. tersebut memproyeksikan bahwa berbagai langkah ekstraksi penerimaan domestik dapat menyumbang tambahan pendapatan negara secara bertahap sekitar 0,3 poin persentase dari PDB.

Sebagai salah satu instrumen ilustratif, model IMF menyodorkan opsi peningkatan pajak penghasilan karyawan (labor income tax) untuk mengurangi ketergantungan pemerintah pada pembiayaan defisit. 

Meski demikian, IMF memberikan catatan tebal terkait tahapan dari eksekusi kebijakan perpajakan ini. IMF merumuskan agar lonjakan awal pendanaan investasi publik dibiayai sepenuhnya lewat defisit anggaran. Seiring dengan berjalannya waktu dan roda ekonomi yang mulai berputar lebih kencang akibat investasi tersebut, barulah penarikan pajak penghasilan tenaga kerja ditingkatkan secara bertahap. 

Strategi penundaan beban pajak di awal ini dinilai krusial agar tekanan pajak tidak mencederai atau mengerem laju pertumbuhan ekonomi yang baru saja akan lepas landas. 

Melalui kombinasi manuver tersebut, postur defisit fiskal secara keseluruhan diyakini akan tetap terjaga di bawah 3%, berdasarkan baseline realisasi defisit APBN 2024 di level 2,3% dari PDB.
