title: Ministry of Transportation: Operators who stop pioneering flights in Papua will not be sanctioned
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - The Ministry of Transportation (Kemenhub) emphasized that operators who stop pilot flights in the Papua region due to security and aviation safety considerations will not be subject to sanctions.

Director General of Civil Aviation at the Ministry of Transportation Lukman F. Laisa said the policy was implemented in response to the shooting incident of the Smart Cakrawala Aviation plane which resulted in the death of the pilot and co-pilot of the pioneering plane.

"The Directorate General of Civil Aviation emphasized that operators who stop flights for security reasons will not be subject to sanctions," said Lukman in a statement in Jakarta, Wednesday.

He also said that pilot flights could still be carried out by ensuring that the security conditions of the destination airport were met.

Then the operator is given full authority to carry out security assessments and decide on operational continuity for the sake of safety.

The Ministry of Transportation through the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (Ditjen Hubud) is paying serious attention to the security conditions of pioneer flights in the Papua region.

Also Read

This has become a serious concern following the shooting incident of the Cessna Grand Caravan PK-SNR aircraft belonging to PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation on the Tanah Merah (TMH) – Danawage/Koroway Batu (DNW) route.

In the incident that occurred on February 11 2026, the pilot and co-pilot of the pilot aircraft died allegedly as a result of being shot in the Boven Digoel Regency area, South Papua Province.

Lukman emphasized that pioneering flights are a vital service in supporting the connectivity of the Papuan people, especially for access to health, education, logistics distribution and basic mobility of people in remote areas, so security is very crucial and must be maintained.

Furthermore, he said that the Ministry of Transportation continues to coordinate with flight operators to continue to increase vigilance in operations in security-prone areas, considering that current conditions are in the extreme risk category.

In order to anticipate undesirable events, currently the Directorate General of Communications has temporarily suspended flight operations at eleven airports/service units (satpel) or airfields (lapter) that are vulnerable to security until an undetermined time limit.

The 11 pioneer airports include the Koroway Batu Subdivision, Bomakia Airport, Yaniruma Subdistrict, Manggelum Subdistrict, Kapiraya Lapter, Iwur Lapter, Faowi Lapter, Dagai Lapter, Aboy Lapter, Teraplu Lapter, and Beoga Lapter

"Operational activities at these airports will be reopened after receiving security from TNI/Polri officers and security conditions are declared conducive and meet aviation safety standards," said Lukman.

Apart from that, there are five airports where the situation is dangerously under control but there is security from the TNI/Polri apparatus so that flight operations can be carried out while still paying attention to developments in regional conditions.

The five airports include Kiwirok Airport, Moanamani Airport, Sinak Satpel in Ilaga, Agandugume Satpel in Ilaga, and Illu Airport.

After the shooting incident, the Directorate General of Civil Affairs has also prepared several strategic steps, firstly sending an official letter to the TNI/Polri to increase security in certain areas; second, instructions to all pilot aviation area coordinators to carry out intensive coordination with security forces.

Third, integration of security issues in the annual safety assessment in the Papua region; fourthly, review of pilot air transportation contract clauses, including strengthening force majeure clauses related to security conditions.

The Directorate General of Communications is also mapping airports based on risk levels, preparing special Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for flight crew in critical areas, and coordinating with the Coordinating Ministry for Political and Security Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia and law enforcement officials regarding incident investigations in accordance with the provisions of aviation legislation.

“In the future, we will "and emphasizes the importance of strengthening the legal basis for temporary suspension of operations if security conditions are not met, as well as the need for a Joint Decree (SKB) between regional governments and security forces to strengthen the implementation of pioneering air transportation," stressed Lukman.

Aviation safety and security is a top priority. The Directorate General of Communications is committed to coordinating across ministries, regional governments and security forces to ensure that pioneering air transportation services continue to run according to the safety first principle.

He added that the shooting of the pilot and co-pilot of PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation's PK-SNR caused deep wounds in the world of air transportation, as well as reminding him how high the risks of working in Papua are.

"We again express our deep condolences for the loss of the pilot and co-pilot of PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation's PK-SNR while on duty. "They are the real transportation heroes," said Lukman.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Kementerian Perhubungan (Kemenhub) menegaskan operator yang menghentikan penerbangan perintis di wilayah Papua dengan pertimbangan keamanan dan keselamatan penerbangan tidak akan dikenakan sanksi.

Direktur Jenderal Perhubungan Udara Kemenhub Lukman F. Laisa mengatakan kebijakan itu diterapkan dalam menyikapi kejadian penembakan pesawat Smart Cakrawala Aviation yang mengakibatkan pilot dan kopilot pesawat perintis itu meninggal dunia.

"Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Udara menegaskan operator yang menghentikan penerbangan karena alasan keamanan tidak akan dikenakan sanksi," kata Lukman dalam keterangan di Jakarta, Rabu.

Dia juga menyampaikan penerbangan perintis tetap dapat dilaksanakan dengan memastikan kondisi keamanan bandara tujuan terpenuhi.

Kemudian operator diberikan kewenangan penuh untuk melakukan penilaian keamanan dan memutuskan keberlanjutan operasional demi keselamatan.

Kemenhub melalui Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Udara (Ditjen Hubud) memberikan perhatian serius terhadap kondisi keamanan penerbangan perintis di wilayah Papua.

Baca Juga

  • Kemenhub Tutup Sementara 11 Bandara dan Lapangan Terbang di Papua demi Keamanan

Hal itu menjadi perhatian serius pascainsiden penembakan terhadap pesawat Cessna Grand Caravan PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation pada rute Tanah Merah (TMH) – Danawage/Koroway Batu (DNW).

Dalam insiden yang terjadi pada 11 Februari 2026 itu, pilot dan kopilot pesawat perintis meninggal dunia diduga akibat ditembak di wilayah Kabupaten Boven Digoel, Provinsi Papua Selatan.

Lukman menegaskan penerbangan perintis merupakan layanan vital dalam mendukung konektivitas masyarakat Papua, khususnya untuk akses kesehatan, pendidikan, distribusi logistik, serta mobilitas dasar masyarakat di wilayah terpencil, sehingga keamanannya sangat krusial dan harus dijaga.

Lebih lanjut, dia mengatakan Kementerian Perhubungan terus berkoordinasi dengan para operator penerbangan untuk terus meningkatkan kewaspadaan dalam operasional di daerah rawan keamanan, mengingat kondisi saat ini termasuk dalam kategori risiko ekstrem.

Guna antisipasi kejadian yang tidak diinginkan, saat ini Ditjen Hubud telah menghentikan sementara operasional penerbangan di sebelas bandara/satuan pelayanan (satpel) atau lapangan terbang (lapter) yang rawan keamanan hingga batas waktu yang belum ditentukan.

Ke-11 bandara perintis itu meliputi Satpel Koroway Batu, Bandara Bomakia, Satpel Yaniruma, Satpel Manggelum, Lapter Kapiraya, Lapter Iwur, Lapter Faowi, Lapter Dagai, Lapter Aboy, Lapter Teraplu, dan Lapter Beoga

“Kegiatan operasional pada bandara-bandara tersebut akan dibuka kembali setelah mendapat pengamanan dari aparat TNI/Polri dan kondisi keamanan dinyatakan kondusif serta memenuhi standar keselamatan penerbangan,” kata Lukman.

Selain itu, terdapat lima bandara dengan situasi rawan terkendali namun terdapat pengamanan dari aparat TNI/Polri sehingga operasional penerbangan dapat dilaksanakan dengan tetap memperhatikan perkembangan kondisi daerahnya,

Kelima bandara itu meliputi Bandara Kiwirok, Bandara Moanamani, Satpel Sinak di Ilaga, Satpel Agandugume di Ilaga, dan Bandara Illu.

Pasca kejadian penembakan, Ditjen Hubud juga telah menyiapkan beberapa langkah strategis, pertama penyampaian surat resmi kepada TNI/Polri guna peningkatan pengamanan di wilayah tertentu; kedua, instruksi kepada seluruh koordinator wilayah penerbangan perintis untuk melakukan koordinasi intensif dengan aparat keamanan.

Ketiga, integrasi isu keamanan dalam safety assessment tahunan di wilayah Papua; keempat review klausul kontrak angkutan udara perintis, termasuk penguatan klausul force majeure terkait kondisi keamanan.

Ditjen Hubud juga tengah melakukan pemetaan bandara berdasarkan tingkat risiko, menyusun Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) khusus bagi awak pesawat di wilayah kritis, serta berkoordinasi dengan Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Politik dan Keamanan Republik Indonesia dan aparat penegak hukum terkait investigasi insiden sesuai ketentuan perundang-undangan penerbangan.

“Ke depannya kami akan menekankan pentingnya penguatan dasar hukum penghentian sementara operasional apabila kondisi keamanan tidak terpenuhi, serta perlunya Surat Keputusan Bersama (SKB) antara pemerintah daerah dan aparat keamanan untuk memperkuat pelaksanaan angkutan udara perintis,” tegas Lukman.

Keselamatan dan keamanan penerbangan merupakan prioritas utama. Ditjen Hubud berkomitmen melakukan koordinasi lintas kementerian, pemerintah daerah, dan aparat keamanan guna memastikan layanan angkutan udara perintis tetap berjalan dengan prinsip safety first.

Ia menambahkan penembakan pilot dan kopilot PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation menorehkan luka yang mendalam bagi dunia transportasi udara, sekaligus mengingatkan betapa tingginya risiko bertugas di tanah Papua.

"Kami menyampaikan kembali belasungkawa yang mendalam atas gugurnya pilot dan kopilot PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation saat bertugas. Mereka adalah pahlawan transportasi yang sesungguhnya," kata Lukman.

title_original: Kemenhub: Operator yang Hentikan Penerbangan Perintis di Papua Tak Disanksi
content_original:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Kementerian Perhubungan (Kemenhub) menegaskan operator yang menghentikan penerbangan perintis di wilayah Papua dengan pertimbangan keamanan dan keselamatan penerbangan tidak akan dikenakan sanksi.

Direktur Jenderal Perhubungan Udara Kemenhub Lukman F. Laisa mengatakan kebijakan itu diterapkan dalam menyikapi kejadian penembakan pesawat Smart Cakrawala Aviation yang mengakibatkan pilot dan kopilot pesawat perintis itu meninggal dunia.

"Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Udara menegaskan operator yang menghentikan penerbangan karena alasan keamanan tidak akan dikenakan sanksi," kata Lukman dalam keterangan di Jakarta, Rabu.

Dia juga menyampaikan penerbangan perintis tetap dapat dilaksanakan dengan memastikan kondisi keamanan bandara tujuan terpenuhi.

Kemudian operator diberikan kewenangan penuh untuk melakukan penilaian keamanan dan memutuskan keberlanjutan operasional demi keselamatan.

Kemenhub melalui Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Udara (Ditjen Hubud) memberikan perhatian serius terhadap kondisi keamanan penerbangan perintis di wilayah Papua.

Baca Juga

Hal itu menjadi perhatian serius pascainsiden penembakan terhadap pesawat Cessna Grand Caravan PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation pada rute Tanah Merah (TMH) – Danawage/Koroway Batu (DNW).

Dalam insiden yang terjadi pada 11 Februari 2026 itu, pilot dan kopilot pesawat perintis meninggal dunia diduga akibat ditembak di wilayah Kabupaten Boven Digoel, Provinsi Papua Selatan.

Lukman menegaskan penerbangan perintis merupakan layanan vital dalam mendukung konektivitas masyarakat Papua, khususnya untuk akses kesehatan, pendidikan, distribusi logistik, serta mobilitas dasar masyarakat di wilayah terpencil, sehingga keamanannya sangat krusial dan harus dijaga.

Lebih lanjut, dia mengatakan Kementerian Perhubungan terus berkoordinasi dengan para operator penerbangan untuk terus meningkatkan kewaspadaan dalam operasional di daerah rawan keamanan, mengingat kondisi saat ini termasuk dalam kategori risiko ekstrem.

Guna antisipasi kejadian yang tidak diinginkan, saat ini Ditjen Hubud telah menghentikan sementara operasional penerbangan di sebelas bandara/satuan pelayanan (satpel) atau lapangan terbang (lapter) yang rawan keamanan hingga batas waktu yang belum ditentukan.

Ke-11 bandara perintis itu meliputi Satpel Koroway Batu, Bandara Bomakia, Satpel Yaniruma, Satpel Manggelum, Lapter Kapiraya, Lapter Iwur, Lapter Faowi, Lapter Dagai, Lapter Aboy, Lapter Teraplu, dan Lapter Beoga

“Kegiatan operasional pada bandara-bandara tersebut akan dibuka kembali setelah mendapat pengamanan dari aparat TNI/Polri dan kondisi keamanan dinyatakan kondusif serta memenuhi standar keselamatan penerbangan,” kata Lukman.

Selain itu, terdapat lima bandara dengan situasi rawan terkendali namun terdapat pengamanan dari aparat TNI/Polri sehingga operasional penerbangan dapat dilaksanakan dengan tetap memperhatikan perkembangan kondisi daerahnya,

Kelima bandara itu meliputi Bandara Kiwirok, Bandara Moanamani, Satpel Sinak di Ilaga, Satpel Agandugume di Ilaga, dan Bandara Illu.

Pasca kejadian penembakan, Ditjen Hubud juga telah menyiapkan beberapa langkah strategis, pertama penyampaian surat resmi kepada TNI/Polri guna peningkatan pengamanan di wilayah tertentu; kedua, instruksi kepada seluruh koordinator wilayah penerbangan perintis untuk melakukan koordinasi intensif dengan aparat keamanan.

Ketiga, integrasi isu keamanan dalam safety assessment tahunan di wilayah Papua; keempat review klausul kontrak angkutan udara perintis, termasuk penguatan klausul force majeure terkait kondisi keamanan.

Ditjen Hubud juga tengah melakukan pemetaan bandara berdasarkan tingkat risiko, menyusun Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) khusus bagi awak pesawat di wilayah kritis, serta berkoordinasi dengan Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Politik dan Keamanan Republik Indonesia dan aparat penegak hukum terkait investigasi insiden sesuai ketentuan perundang-undangan penerbangan.

“Ke depannya kami akan menekankan pentingnya penguatan dasar hukum penghentian sementara operasional apabila kondisi keamanan tidak terpenuhi, serta perlunya Surat Keputusan Bersama (SKB) antara pemerintah daerah dan aparat keamanan untuk memperkuat pelaksanaan angkutan udara perintis,” tegas Lukman.

Keselamatan dan keamanan penerbangan merupakan prioritas utama. Ditjen Hubud berkomitmen melakukan koordinasi lintas kementerian, pemerintah daerah, dan aparat keamanan guna memastikan layanan angkutan udara perintis tetap berjalan dengan prinsip safety first.

Ia menambahkan penembakan pilot dan kopilot PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation menorehkan luka yang mendalam bagi dunia transportasi udara, sekaligus mengingatkan betapa tingginya risiko bertugas di tanah Papua.

"Kami menyampaikan kembali belasungkawa yang mendalam atas gugurnya pilot dan kopilot PK-SNR milik PT Smart Cakrawala Aviation saat bertugas. Mereka adalah pahlawan transportasi yang sesungguhnya," kata Lukman.

title: DJP Records 13.9 Million Taxpayers Activating Coretax, Only 2.9 Million Report SPT
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Directorate General of Taxes, Ministry of Finance (DJP Kemenkeu) has received 2.9 million notification letter reports, aka annual SPTs for 2025 income tax (PPh) up to 18 February 2026.

Director of Service Extension and Public Relations at the Ministry of Finance, Inge Diana Rismawanti, detailed that for the January - December financial year, the maximum SPT for personal income tax (OP) for employees was 2.55 million SPT.

Then, 270,960 SPTs from non-employee OPs as well as 82,229 corporate SPTs denominated in rupiah and 92 corporate SPTs denominated in US dollars.

As for those with different financial years, or reported starting August 1 2025, the amount received is 594 SPTs from taxpayers denominated in rupiah, and 16 corporate taxpayer tax returns denominated in US dollars.

On the other hand, the progress of Coretax account activation has reached 13.9 million accounts, including 12.9 million OP accounts, 892,396 corporate taxpayers, 89,503 government agency taxpayers, and 225 trading company taxpayers via electronic systems.

Previously, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said that improving the Coretax system was one way to achieve this year's tax revenue target of IDR 2,357.7 trillion.

Also Read

Minister of Finance (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa estimates that 2026 tax revenues could exceed the target set in the APBN, namely IDR 2,357.7 trillion. This is estimated by him despite the low base of growth in tax revenues last year which also became the focus of foreign rating agencies.

For your information, the government has set a tax revenue target this year of IDR 2,357.7 trillion or growth of 7.69% (YoY) from the 2025 APBN target of IDR 2,189.3 trillion.

The problem is, the realization of tax revenue last year was only IDR 1,917.6 trillion, resulting in a shortfall of IDR 271.7 trillion. This means that the growth base from last year's realization to achieve this year's target is higher, namely 22.9% (YoY). In other words, the government must pursue additional deposits of IDR 440.1 trillion to achieve the 2026 target from realization until the end of last year.

However, it seems that Minister of Finance Purbaya remains optimistic. He even estimates that this year he will be able to collect tax revenues to exceed the target. This optimism emerged after the realization of tax revenues in January 2026 jumped 30.8% (YoY).

Purbaya conveyed this at a joint meeting with Commission XI DPR which discussed state revenues, Wednesday (4/2/2026). He reported that the realization of tax revenues in January 2026 amounted to IDR 116.2 trillion or grew 30.8% (YoY) compared to January 2025, namely IDR 88.9 trillion.

Purbaya explained that the double digit growth in tax revenues in early 2026 was driven by gross revenues of 7% (YoY) and a decrease in tax returns (restitution) of minus 23%. Thus, he explained, all types of taxes recorded net positive growth.

"The picture of tax revenues this January shows that it seems that a reversal in economic direction is indeed taking place so that tax revenues have grown from last year," he explained, quoted again on Sunday (8/2/2026).

From the double digit annual growth in the first month of 2026, Purbaya sees the possibility that the 2026 tax revenue target of IDR 2,357.7 trillion could even be exceeded. However, of course if it is considered without changes in future conditions (ceteris paribus).

"Let's assume the same, we can maintain that growth. At the end of the year [2026] we can get tax income of IDR 2,492 trillion. This is already above the figure of IDR 2,357 trillion in the 2026 APBN. This is an overly exaggerated example, but at least we already see that it is possible," he said to members of the DPR Finance Commission.

The former Chairman of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS) explained that there were various improvements he wanted to make. An example is the matter of restitution or tax refund.

In 2025, tax refunds will jump to IDR 361 trillion. Purbaya said the increase was almost IDR 100 trillion compared to 2024.

Efforts to improve too a is carried out in the core tax administration system, namely Coretax, as well as internally from the Directorate General of Taxes (DJP). After the previous week reshuffled 31 officials at the Directorate General of Customs and Excise (DJBC), Purbaya rotated the positions of 40 DJP echelon II officials, Friday (6/2/2026).

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Direktorat Jenderal Pajak Kementerian Keuangan (DJP Kemenkeu) telah menerima sebanyak 2,9 juta laporan surat pemberitahuan alias SPT tahunan pajak penghasilan (PPh) 2025 sampai dengan 18 Februari 2026. 

Direktur Penyuluhan Pelayanan dan Hubungan Masyarakat DJP Kemenkeu Inge Diana Rismawanti merinci untuk Tahun Buku Januari - Desember, SPT untuk PPh orang pribadi (OP) karyawan paling banyak yakni 2,55 juta SPT. 

Kemudian, 270.960 SPT dari OP nonkaryawan serta 82.229 SPT badan berdenominasi rupiah dan 92 SPT badan berdenominasi dolar AS. 

Adapun untuk yang beda tahun buku, atau dilaporkan mulai 1 Agustus 2025, jumlah yang diterima yakni 594 SPT dari WP berdenominasi rupiah, dan 16 SPT WP badan berdenominasi dolar AS. 

Di sisi lain, progres aktivasi akun Coretax telah mencapai 13,9 juta akun yang meliputi WP OP 12,9 juta akun, 892.396 WP badan, 89.503 WP instansi pemerintah, serta 225 WP perusahaan perdagangan melalui sistem elektronik. 

Salah Satu Strategi Purbaya

Sebelumnya Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa menyebut pembenahan sistem Coretax menjadi salah satu caranya untuk mengejar target penerimaan pajak tahun ini sebesar Rp2.357,7 triliun. 

Baca Juga

  • Waspada! Marak Penipuan Berkedok Coretax hingga Pemadanan NIK-NPWP
  • Cara Lapor SPT Tahunan di Coretax DJP 2026, Ini Tahapan Lengkapnya!
  • DJP Terima 1,82 Juta SPT Pajak per 9 Februari 2026, 13,3 Juta Akun Coretax Sudah Aktivasi

Menteri Keuangan (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa memperkirakan penerimaan pajak 2026 bisa melampaui target yang ditetapkan pada APBN yakni Rp2.357,7 triliun. Hal ini diperkirakan olehnya kendati basis pertumbuhan penerimaan pajak tahun lalu yang rendah sehingga turut menjadi sorotan lembaga pemeringkat asing. 

Untuk diketahui, pemerintah memasang target penerimaan pajak tahun ini sebesar Rp2.357,7 triliun atau tumbuh 7,69% (YoY) dari target APBN 2025 yakni Rp2.189,3 triliun. 

Masalahnya, realisasi penerimaan pajak tahun lalu hanya Rp1.917,6 triliun sehingga terjadi shortfallsebesar Rp271,7 triliun. Artinya, basis pertumbuhan dari realisasi tahun lalu untuk mengejar target tahun ini menjadi lebih tinggi yakni 22,9% (YoY). Dengan kata lain, pemerintah harus mengejar tambahan setoran Rp440,1 triliun untuk mencapai target 2026 dari realisasi sampai akhir tahun lalu.  

Namun demikian, tampaknya Menkeu Purbaya tetap optimistis. Dia bahkan memperkirakan tahun ini bisa mengumpulkan penerimaan pajak hingga melampaui target. Optimisme itu muncul usai realisasi penerimaan pajak Januari 2026 melonjak 30,8% (YoY). 

Hal itu disampaikan Purbaya pada rapat bersama Komisi XI DPR yang membahas penerimaan negara, Rabu (4/2/2026). Dia melaporkan bahwa realisasi penerimaan pajak pada Januari 2026 sebesar Rp116,2 triliun atau tumbuh 30,8% (YoY) dibandingkan Januari 2025 yaitu Rp88,9 triliun. 

Purbaya memaparkan bahwa pertumbuhan double digit penerimaan pajak awal 2026 itu didorong oleh penerimaan bruto sebesar 7% (YoY) dan penurunan pengembalian pajak (restitusi) sebesar minus 23%. Dengan demikian, terangnya, seluruh jenis pajak mencatat pertumbuhan positif secara neto. 

"Gambaran penerimaan pajak Januari ini menunjukkan bahwa kelihatannya betul-betul memang pembalikan arah ekonomi sedang terjadi sehingga pendapatan pajaknya tumbuh dari tahun lalu," terangnya, dikutip kembali Minggu (8/2/2026).

Dari pertumbuhan tahunan double digit pada satu bulan pertama 2026, Purbaya melihat ada kemungkinan target penerimaan pajak 2026 Rp2.357,7 triliun bahkan bisa terlampaui. Namun, tentunya apabila dipertimbangkan tanpa perubahan kondisi ke depan (ceteris paribus). 

"Let's kita asumsikan sama, kami bisa jaga pertumbuhan itu. Akhir tahun [2026] kami bisa dapat pajak income Rp2.492 triliun. Ini sudah di atas angka Rp2.357 triliun di APBN 2026. Ini kan permisalan yang terlalu berlebihan, tetapi paling enggak kami udah kelihatan lah seperti itu ada kemungkinannya," katanya kepada anggota Komisi Keuangan DPR.

Mantan Ketua Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan (LPS) itu memaparkan terdapat berbagai upaya pembenahan yang ingin dilakukan olehnya. Contohnya yakni soal restitusi atau pengembalian pajak. 

Pada 2025, restitusi pajak melonjak ke Rp361 triliun. Purbaya menyebut kenaikannya hampir Rp100 triliun dibandingkan 2024. 

Upaya pembenahan juga dilakukan pada sistem inti administrasi perpajakan, yakni Coretax, maupun dari internal Direktorat Jenderal Pajak (DJP). Usai pekan sebelumnya merombak 31 pejabat di Direktorat Jenderal Bea dan Cukai (DJBC), Purbaya melakukan rotasi jabatan pada 40 pejabat eselon II DJP, Jumat (6/2/2026).

title: The Minister of Trade is outspoken about the reasons why oil prices have not fallen ahead of fasting
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Trade (Kemendag) admits that the high price of crude palm oil (CPO) is one of the factors that is putting pressure on the cooking oil supply chain, including Minyakita.

Minister of Trade (Mendag) Budi Santoso said that CPO prices are currently at a higher level compared to the conditions three years ago when the highest retail price (HET) policy was established.

Even though last year the price of CPO experienced a decline of around 15%–16%, on average the price of CPO is now recorded at IDR 14,035 per kilogram, exceeding the distribution price from producers to first level distributors (D1) which is around IDR 13,500 per kilogram.

"Now the CPO price for oil raw materials yesterday in Palembang was IDR 14,035, CPO," said Budi when met at the Ministry of Trade Office, Jakarta, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

For this reason, the government will increase the number of second brand cooking oils as a companion to Minyakita so that people have more choices of products at affordable prices.

However, Budi ensured that the CPO price did not affect the price of Minyakita at the producer level. He ensured that the government continues to coordinate with producers so that the selling price of Minyakita from producers to D1 remains in accordance with the HET.

Also Read

"We continue to coordinate with them [manufacturers], because sales must remain in accordance with the HET," he said.

Budi said that currently the average price of Minyakita is at IDR 16,020 per liter or still exceeding the highest retail price (HET) of IDR 15,700 per liter. He explained that this condition occurred because the supply fulfillment process was still ongoing at the State-Owned Food Enterprise (BUMN) level.

Currently, the realization of the distribution of Oilita from producers to BUMN has approached 30% of the minimum target of 35%. Even though supplies are starting to become available, distribution to all regions of Indonesia takes time, so prices at the consumer level have not yet fully returned to HET.

"Well, they also have to distribute it, distributing it throughout the archipelago may also take time," he explained.

Previously, the Ministry of Trade noted an increase in the Reference Price (HR) for crude palm oil (CPO) commodities ahead of the Chinese New Year and Ramadan 2026 celebrations.

Director General of Foreign Trade at the Ministry of Trade, Tommy Andana, said that HR CPO for the period 1-28 February 2026 was set at US$918.47 per metric ton (MT). This figure increased by US$2.84 or around 0.31% compared to HR January 2026 which was at the level of US$915.64/MT.

According to Tommy, the increase in CPO HR was triggered by increasing demand amidst a decline in production.

"This increase was caused by increased demand in anticipation of the Chinese New Year and Ramadan, which was not accompanied by an increase in supply due to a decrease in production," said Tommy in a written statement, Friday (30/1/2026).

The determination of HR CPO refers to the average price from a number of exchanges, namely the Indonesian CPO Exchange at US$855.66/MT, the Malaysian CPO Exchange at US$981.28/MT, and the CPO price at the Port of Rotterdam which reached US$1,209.81/MT.

From these three sources, the final calculation uses the average of the two median prices to produce HR CPO of US$918.47/MT.

Meanwhile, the government has set the CPO Export Duty (BK) for February 2026 to remain at US$74 per MT. The Export Levy (PE) is set at 10% of HR CPO or US$91.8472 per MT.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Perdagangan (Kemendag) mengakui tingginya harga minyak sawit mentah (crude palm oil/CPO) menjadi salah satu faktor yang menekan rantai pasok minyak goreng, termasuk Minyakita.

Menteri Perdagangan (Mendag) Budi Santoso mengatakan harga CPO saat ini berada pada level yang lebih tinggi jika dibandingkan dengan kondisi tiga tahun lalu saat kebijakan harga eceran tertinggi (HET) ditetapkan.

Meski pada tahun lalu harga CPO sempat mengalami penurunan sekitar 15%–16%, secara rata-rata harga CPO kini tercatat mencapai Rp14.035 per kilogram, melampaui harga distribusi dari produsen ke distributor tingkat pertama (D1) yang berada di kisaran Rp13.500 per kilogram.

“Sekarang harga CPO Untuk bahan baku minyak itu kemarin ya di Palembang itu Rp14.035, CPO-nya,” kata Budi saat ditemui di Kantor Kemendag, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Untuk itu, pemerintah akan memperbanyak minyak goreng second brand sebagai pendamping Minyakita agar masyarakat memiliki lebih banyak pilihan produk dengan harga terjangkau.

Namun demikian, Budi memastikan harga CPO tidak memengaruhi harga Minyakita di tingkat produsen. Dia memastikan, pemerintah terus melakukan koordinasi dengan para produsen agar harga jual Minyakita dari produsen ke D1 tetap sesuai HET.

“Kami terus koordinasi dengan mereka [produsen], karena kan dia penjualannya harus tetap sesuai HET,” ujarnya.

Budi menuturkan saat ini harga rata-rata Minyakita berada di level Rp16.020 per liter atau masih melampaui harga eceran tertinggi (HET) Rp15.700 per liter. Dia menjelaskan, kondisi tersebut terjadi karena proses pemenuhan pasokan masih berjalan di tingkat Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) Pangan.

Adapun saat ini, realisasi penyaluran Minyakita dari produsen ke BUMN telah mendekati 30% dari target minimal 35%. Meski pasokan mulai tersedia, distribusi ke seluruh wilayah Indonesia membutuhkan waktu, sehingga harga di tingkat konsumen belum sepenuhnya kembali ke HET.

“Nah cuman kan mereka juga harus mendistribusikan, mendistribusikan ke seluruh nusantara mungkin juga butuh waktu,” terangnya.

Sebelumnya, Kemendag mencatat adanya kenaikan Harga Referensi (HR) untuk komoditas minyak kelapa sawit mentah (crude palm oil/CPO) menjelang perayaan Hari Raya Imlek serta Ramadan 2026.

Direktur Jenderal Perdagangan Luar Negeri Kemendag Tommy Andana mengatakan HR CPO periode 1—28 Februari 2026 ditetapkan sebesar US$918,47 per metrik ton (MT). Angka tersebut meningkat sebesar US$2,84 atau sekitar 0,31% dibandingkan HR Januari 2026 yang berada di level US$915,64/MT.

Menurut Tommy, kenaikan HR CPO tersebut dipicu oleh meningkatnya permintaan di tengah penurunan produksi.

“Peningkatan ini disebabkan oleh naiknya permintaan sebagai antisipasi Hari Raya Imlek dan Ramadan, yang tidak diiringi dengan peningkatan suplai akibat penurunan produksi,” kata Tommy dalam keterangan tertulis, Jumat (30/1/2026).

Adapun penetapan HR CPO mengacu pada rata-rata harga dari sejumlah bursa, yakni Bursa CPO Indonesia sebesar US$855,66/MT, Bursa CPO Malaysia US$981,28/MT, serta harga CPO di Pelabuhan Rotterdam yang mencapai US$1.209,81/MT.

Dari ketiga sumber tersebut, perhitungan akhir menggunakan rata-rata dua harga median sehingga menghasilkan HR CPO sebesar US$918,47/MT.

Sementara itu, pemerintah menetapkan Bea Keluar (BK) CPO untuk Februari 2026 tetap sebesar US$74 per MT. Adapun Pungutan Ekspor (PE) ditetapkan sebesar 10% dari HR CPO atau senilai US$91,8472 per MT.

title: 21 Bayan Group Telecommunication Towers Connect Remote Areas of East Kalimantan
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - PT Bayan Resources Tbk (BYAN) has built 21 telecommunications towers in three districts of East Kalimantan since 2009 to strengthen communications network connectivity in remote areas with minimal telecommunications access.

This leading coal producer is realizing its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program through developing telecommunications infrastructure spread across Kutai Kartanegara Regency, East Kutai Regency and West Kutai Regency.

The Bayan Resources Directors explained that the existence of telecommunications towers helps people communicate more effectively, both for personal needs, work, business and educational activities.

"One concrete form of Bayan Group's contribution in improving the quality of life of the community is through the development of telecommunications infrastructure. This is realized in the project to build 21 telecommunications towers which aims to strengthen communications network connectivity in remote areas with minimal telecommunications access," said the Directors of Bayan Resources in a written statement, Wednesday (11/2/2026).

The development of telecommunications infrastructure, which began in 2009, continues to develop to this day, reflecting Bayan Group's long-term commitment to supporting regional development around the company's operational areas.

The benefits of the existence of this tower are felt by the local community, especially in speeding up access to information, facilitating communication between regions, and supporting the economic and social activities of local communities.

The presence of telecommunications infrastructure in remote areas opens up new economic opportunities for the community, especially in developing small and medium businesses that require internet connectivity for product marketing.

Apart from that, better communication access also supports improving the quality of education through easy access to information and digital learning, as well as making it easier to coordinate health services and other public services.

"Bayan Group hopes that this telecommunication tower infrastructure development program will continue to develop and provide a sustainable positive impact on society, especially in areas around the company's operations," he concluded.

This telecommunications infrastructure development initiative shows Bayan Group's efforts to play an active role as a regional development partner, not only focusing on core activities in the mining sector, but also empowering communities around the company's operational areas.
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - PT Bayan Resources Tbk (BYAN) membangun 21 menara telekomunikasi di tiga kabupaten Kalimantan Timur sejak 2009 untuk memperkuat konektivitas jaringan komunikasi di wilayah terpencil yang minim akses telekomunikasi.

Produsen batu bara terkemuka ini mewujudkan program Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) melalui pengembangan infrastruktur telekomunikasi yang tersebar di Kabupaten Kutai Kartanegara, Kabupaten Kutai Timur, dan Kabupaten Kutai Barat.

Direksi Bayan Resources menjelaskan, keberadaan menara telekomunikasi membantu masyarakat menjalin komunikasi lebih efektif, baik untuk keperluan pribadi, pekerjaan, usaha, maupun kegiatan pendidikan.

"Salah satu bentuk nyata dari kontribusi Bayan Group dalam meningkatkan kualitas hidup masyarakat adalah melalui pengembangan infrastruktur telekomunikasi. Hal ini diwujudkan dalam proyek pembangunan 21 menara telekomunikasi yang bertujuan untuk memperkuat konektivitas jaringan komunikasi di wilayah terpencil dan minim akses telekomunikasi," ujar Direksi Bayan Resources dalam keterangan tertulis, Rabu (11/2/2026).

Pembangunan infrastruktur telekomunikasi yang dimulai pada 2009 ini terus mengalami pengembangan hingga saat ini, mencerminkan komitmen jangka panjang Bayan Group dalam mendukung pembangunan daerah sekitar wilayah operasional perusahaan.

Manfaat keberadaan menara ini sangat dirasakan masyarakat sekitar, khususnya dalam mempercepat akses informasi, mempermudah komunikasi antarkawasan, serta mendukung kegiatan ekonomi dan sosial masyarakat setempat.

Kehadiran infrastruktur telekomunikasi di wilayah terpencil membuka peluang ekonomi baru bagi masyarakat, terutama dalam mengembangkan usaha kecil dan menengah yang membutuhkan konektivitas internet untuk pemasaran produk.

Selain itu, akses komunikasi yang lebih baik juga mendukung peningkatan kualitas pendidikan melalui kemudahan akses informasi dan pembelajaran digital, serta mempermudah koordinasi layanan kesehatan dan layanan publik lainnya.

"Harapan Bayan Group bahwa program pembangunan infrastruktur menara telekomunikasi ini akan terus berkembang dan memberikan dampak positif yang berkelanjutan bagi masyarakat, khususnya di wilayah-wilayah sekitar operasional perusahaan," pungkasnya.

Inisiatif pembangunan infrastruktur telekomunikasi ini menunjukkan upaya Bayan Group berperan aktif sebagai mitra pembangunan daerah, tidak hanya fokus pada kegiatan inti di sektor pertambangan, tetapi juga pemberdayaan masyarakat di sekitar area operasional perusahaan.

title: GOLD Starts Gold Production at Pani Mine, First Year Target 115,000 Ounces
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk (EMAS) carried out the first gold pour or casting of goldperdana at the Pani Gold Mine, Pohuwato Regency, Gorontalo Province, on February 14 2026.

This activity was recorded earlier than the realization target which was originally estimated at the end of the first quarter of 2026.

EMAS President Director, Boyke Poerbaya Abidin, explained that the first gold pour which produced dore bullion marked the start of the commercial gold production stage at the Pani Gold Mine.

The dore bullion produced is obtained through a heap leach process, followed by gold recovery through the Adsorption, Desorption and Recovery (ADR) facility.

According to Boyke, this achievement is an important milestone after EMAS completed all development stages since asset acquisition in 2020.

"The operation of the Pani Gold Mine is also the foundation for increasing production capacity to the next stage," said Boyke in an official statement, Wednesday (18/2/2026). He said that the initial phase of Pani Gold Mine operations used the heap leach method with a production target of around 110,000–115,000 ounces of gold in the first year of operation. This figure is higher than the initial target, namely 80,000 ounces of gold for 2026.

Also Read

Boyke also said that this mine is managed as an open pit mine with ore reserves (Ore Reserve) of around 4.8 million ounces of gold and a mineral resource estimate (Mineral Resource Estimate) of more than 7 million ounces of gold, making it one of the most prospective primary gold mines in Indonesia.

Furthermore, Boyke said that along with the start of heap leach production, EMAS had started the Carbon-In-Leach (CIL) construction phase, with earthwork work already underway since early 2026, faster than the original expectation of 2027.

Apart from that, this subsidiary of PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) is also accelerating the CIL facility of 12 million tonnes of ore per year which is now targeted for completion in 2028, compared to the initial plan (first phase of 7 million tonnes in 2029 and expansion of 5 million tonnes to 12 million tonnes in 2032).

According to Boyke, with this acceleration, EMAS is targeting potential production of around 500,000 ounces of gold per year to be achieved in 2029, faster than the previous projection of 2032.

In addition, ahead of the production phase, the Pani Gold Mine has completed all major development and commissioning stages, including initial mining, Ore Preparation Plant (OPP) facilities, heap leach, and ADR facilities, so it is ready to enter the full commercial gold production stage.

"In addition to strengthening the Merdeka Group's gold portfolio, the Pani Gold Mine also makes a real contribution to Indonesia's gold production and Gorontalo's economic development through job creation and community empowerment programs," said Boyke.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk (EMAS) melakukan first gold pour atau penuangan emas perdana di Tambang Emas Pani, Kabupaten Pohuwato, Provinsi Gorontalo, pada 14 Februari 2026.

Kegiatan tersebut tercatat lebih awal dari target realisasi yang semula diperkirakan pada akhir kuartal I 2026.

Presiden Direktur EMAS, Boyke Poerbaya Abidin, menjelaskan bahwa first gold pour yang menghasilkan dore bullion menandai dimulainya tahap produksi emas komersial Tambang Emas Pani.

Adapun dore bullion yang dihasilkan diperoleh melalui proses pelindian (heap leach), dilanjutkan dengan pemulihan emas melalui fasilitas Adsorption, Desorption, and Recovery (ADR).

Menurut Boyke, pencapaian ini menjadi tonggak penting setelah EMAS menyelesaikan seluruh tahapan pengembangan sejak akuisisi aset pada 2020.

"Beroperasinya Tambang Emas Pani juga menjadi fondasi bagi peningkatan kapasitas produksi ke tahap berikutnya," ujar Boyke melalui keterangan resmi, Rabu (18/2/2026).
Dia menuturkan, fase awal operasi Tambang Emas Pani menggunakan metode heap leach dengan target produksi sekitar 110.000–115.000 ounces emas pada tahun pertama operasi. Angka ini lebih tinggi dibanding target awal, yakni 80.000 ounces emas untuk tahun 2026.

  • Merdeka Gold (EMAS) Mulai Ore Feeding di Tambang Emas Pani

Boyke juga menyebut tambang ini dikelola sebagai tambang terbuka (open pit) dengan cadangan bijih (Ore Reserve) sekitar 4,8 juta ounces emas dan perkiraan sumber daya mineral (Mineral Resource Estimate) lebih dari 7 juta ounces emas, menjadikannya salah satu tambang emas primer paling prospektif di Indonesia.

Lebih lanjut, Boyke mengatakan bahwa seiring dimulainya produksi heap leach, EMAS telah memulai tahap konstruksi Carbon-In-Leach (CIL), dengan pekerjaan earthwork yang sudah berjalan sejak awal 2026, lebih cepat dibanding ekspektasi semula pada 2027.

Selain itu, anak usaha PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) ini juga mempercepat fasilitas CIL 12 juta ton bijih per tahun yang kini ditargetkan rampung pada 2028, dibandingkan rencana awal (tahap pertama 7 juta ton pada 2029 dan ekspansi 5 juta ton menjadi 12 juta ton pada 2032).

Menurut Boyke, dengan percepatan ini, EMAS menargetkan potensi produksi sekitar 500.000 ounces emas per tahun dapat dicapai pada 2029, lebih cepat dari proyeksi sebelumnya pada 2032.

Di samping itu, menjelang fase produksi, Tambang Emas Pani telah menyelesaikan seluruh tahapan pengembangan dan commissioning utama, termasuk penambangan awal, fasilitas Ore Preparation Plant (OPP), heap leach, serta fasilitas ADR, sehingga siap memasuki tahap produksi emas komersial secara penuh.

"Selain memperkuat portofolio emas Grup Merdeka, Tambang Emas Pani juga memberikan kontribusi nyata bagi produksi emas Indonesia serta pembangunan ekonomi Gorontalo melalui penciptaan lapangan kerja dan program pemberdayaan masyarakat," kata Boyke.

title: Reference Coal Prices (HBA) Second Period February 2026 Compactly Down
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The price of reference coal (HBA) in the second period of February 2026 fell compactly. The HBA for high calorie black gold also dropped. The latest HBA was determined by the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) Bahlil Lahadalia through the Decree of the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Number 97.K/MB.01/MEM.B/2026 concerning Reference Metal Mineral Prices and Reference Coal Prices for the Second Period in February 2026. Based on this decision, the HBA for high calorie coal in terms of calorific value is 6,322 kcal/kg GAR in the second period February 2026 it is set at US$102.87 per ton. This figure is down compared to the HBA in the first period of February 2026, namely US$106.11 per ton. Furthermore, the HBA for coal with a calorific value of 5,300 kcal/kg GAR was set at US$71.74 per ton in the second period of February 2026. The HBA for this type of coal also decreased compared to the first period of February 2026 at US$73.69 per ton. Meanwhile, for coal with an equivalent calorific value 4,100 kcal/kg GAR, HBA is set at US$47.74 per ton in the second period of February 2026. This figure is down compared to the first reference price in February 2026 at US$48.21 per ton. Meanwhile, HBA for coal with an equivalent calorific value of 3,400 kcal/kg GAR is set at US$33.85 per ton. The reference price rose slightly from the position in the first period of February 2026 at US$35.83 per ton. The HBA for February 2026 for the second period was also used as a basis for calculating the coal benchmark price (HPB) this month. Apart from the HBA, the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia also set the reference mineral price (HMA) for various mineral commodities for the second period of February 2026. The HMA for nickel was pegged at US$17,670/dmt, weakening compared to the first period of February 2026. 2026 amounted to US$17,774/dmt. Likewise, aluminum HMA weakened to US$3,129.72/dmt from the previous US$3,138.53/dmt. Meanwhile, copper HMA rose slightly to US$13,066.44/dmt from the previous US$13,060.87/dmt. Through Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Decree Number 80.K/MB.01/MEM.B/2025 concerning Reference Metal Mineral Prices and Reference Coal Prices, HBA and HMA will be published twice a month, namely every 1st and 15th.

Selanjutnya, HBA untuk batu bara nilai kalori 5.300 kcal/kg GAR ditetapkan pada level US$71,74 per ton pada periode kedua Februari 2026. HBA jenis batu bara ini juga trun dibandingkan periode pertama Februari 2026 senilai US$73,69 per ton.

Sementara itu, untuk batu bara dengan kesetaraan nilai kalori 4.100 kcal/kg GAR, HBA dipatok sebesar US$47,74 per ton pada periode kedua Februari 2026. Angka itu turun dibandingkan harga acuan pertama Februari 2026 di angka US$48,21 per ton.

title: Minister of Trade Admits Prices of Oilita and Chicken Eggs Will Rise Ahead of Ramadan 2026
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Trade (Kemendag) acknowledged that a number of strategic food prices such as oil and chicken eggs are creeping up ahead of Ramadan 2026.

Minister of Trade (Mendag) Budi Santoso said the average national food price was still in good condition. However, there are several commodities that are recorded as being above the highest retail price (HET), one of which is Minyakita.

Based on the Market and Basic Needs Monitoring System (SP2KP), the national average price of Minyakita is priced at IDR 16,020 per liter. The price is above the HET which is set at IDR 15,700 per liter.

"If we look at the national average price, it is indeed good. There are indeed ones that are above the HET, for example, Minyakita. Today the price of Minyakita is IDR 16,020. The HET is IDR 15,700 [per liter]. Well, yesterday before the Ministerial Decree [Permendag 43/2025] the average price was IDR 16,800 [per liter]. So now it has decreased," said Budi when met at the Ministry of Trade Office, Jakarta, Wednesday. (18/2/2026).

Meanwhile, Minister of Trade Regulation 43/2025 regulates the obligation to fulfill the domestic market obligation (DMO) of at least 35% by producers to Food BUMN, including Bulog and ID Food. In this regulation, BUMN is required to report the realization of absorption every 10th so that the government can factually monitor the implementation of the DMO.

Apart from Minyakita, purebred chicken eggs also experienced a slight increase. The national average price for chicken eggs was recorded at IDR 30,750 per kilogram, slightly higher than the sales reference price (HAP) which was set at IDR 30,000 per kilogram.

Also Read

Meanwhile, Budi said that prices for other food commodities were still below the reference limit. For beef prices, for example, the national average was recorded at IDR 133,618 per kilogram, still below the HAP of IDR 140,000. Likewise, the price of garlic is in the range of IDR 36,875 per kilogram, lower than the HET which is set at IDR 38,000 per kilogram.

In a Business note, the Ministry of Agriculture (Kementan) asked business actors, especially producers and distributors, not to stockpile strategic commodities in the form of purebred chicken meat and purebred chicken eggs ahead of the National Religious Holidays (HBKN) Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr 2026.

Director General of Plantations and Animal Health at the Ministry of Agriculture, Agung Suganda, explained the importance of the role of integrator companies, livestock farms, and cooperatives, including broiler chicken and egg producers, to maintain adequate production and supply according to community needs.

"We also ask that producers and distributors not hoard stock," said Agung in a written statement, Wednesday (28/1/2026).

The Ministry of Agriculture also encourages regional governments to strengthen monitoring of supply availability and price developments for eggs and purebred chicken meat in each region.

"And from the results of this supervision, of course we ask our colleagues to take firm action so that producers and distributors do not carry out hoarding," he said.

Meanwhile, Deputy for Food Availability and Stabilization of the National Food Agency (Bapanas) I Gusti Ketut Astawa asked business actors to ensure that distributor partners do not trigger price fluctuations at the downstream level.

"We ask that business actors remind their distributors not to move prices beyond the price provisions set by the government," concluded Ketut.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Perdagangan (Kemendag) mengakui sejumlah harga pangan strategis seperti Minyakita hingga telur ayam merangkak naik menjelang Ramadan 2026.

Menteri Perdagangan (Mendag) Budi Santoso mengatakan harga rata-rata pangan nasional masih berada dalam kondisi yang baik. Namun, terdapat beberapa komoditas yang tercatat berada di atas harga eceran tertinggi (HET), salah satunya Minyakita.

Berdasarkan Sistem Pemantauan Pasar dan Kebutuhan Pokok (SP2KP), harga rata-rata nasional Minyakita dibanderol Rp16.020 per liter. Harganya berada di atas HET yang ditetapkan sebesar Rp15.700 per liter.

“Kalau kita lihat harga rata-rata nasional memang bagus. Ada memang yang di atas HET misalnya Minyakita. Minyakita hari ini harganya Rp16.020. HET-nya kan Rp15.700 [per liter]. Nah kemarin sebelum Permen [Permendag 43/2025] kan rata-rata harganya Rp16.800 [per liter]. Nah sekarang sudah mengalami penurunan,” kata Budi saat ditemui di Kantor Kemendag, Jakarta, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Adapun, Permendag 43/2025 mengatur kewajiban pemenuhan domestic market obligation (DMO) minimal 35% oleh produsen kepada BUMN Pangan, termasuk Bulog dan ID Food. Dalam aturan tersebut, BUMN diwajibkan melaporkan realisasi penyerapan setiap tanggal 10 agar pemerintah dapat memantau pelaksanaan DMO secara faktual.

Selain Minyakita, telur ayam ras juga mengalami kenaikan tipis. Harga rata-rata nasional telur ayam tercatat sebesar Rp30.750 per kilogram, sedikit lebih tinggi dari harga acuan penjualan (HAP) yang ditetapkan sebesar Rp30.000 per kilogram.

  • Mendag Ungkap Nasib HET Minyakita Kala Harga CPO Melambung
  • Kemendag Pede Harga Minyakita Turun Jelang Ramadan, Ini Alasannya

Sementara itu, Budi menuturkan harga komoditas pangan lain masih berada di bawah batas acuan. Untuk harga daging sapi misalnya, rata-rata nasional tercatat Rp133.618 per kilogram, masih di bawah HAP sebesar Rp140.000. Begitu pula dengan harga bawang putih yang berada di kisaran Rp36.875 per kilogram, lebih rendah dari HET yang ditetapkan sebesar Rp38.000 per kilogram.

Dalam catatan Bisnis, Kementerian Pertanian (Kementan) meminta pelaku usaha, terutama produsen dan distributor, agar tidak melakukan penimbunan komoditas strategis berupa daging ayam ras dan telur ayam ras menjelang Hari Besar Keagamaan Nasional (HBKN) Ramadan dan Idulfitri 2026.

Direktur Jenderal Perkebunan dan Kesehatan Hewan Kementan Agung Suganda menuturkan pentingnya peran perusahaan integrator, peternakan, hingga koperasi, termasuk produsen ayam broiler dan telur untuk menjaga kecukupan produksi dan pasokan sesuai kebutuhan masyarakat.

“Kami juga meminta agar produsen dan distributor tidak melakukan penimbunan stok,” kata Agung dalam keterangan tertulis, Rabu (28/1/2026).

Kementan juga mendorong pemerintah daerah untuk memperkuat pengawasan terhadap ketersediaan pasokan serta perkembangan harga telur dan daging ayam ras di masing-masing wilayah.

“Dan dari hasil pengawasan ini, tentu kami meminta kepada teman-teman dinas juga untuk melakukan tindakan tegas agar para produsen dan distributor tidak melakukan penimbunan,” ujarnya.

Sementara itu, Deputi Ketersediaan dan Stabilisasi Pangan Badan Pangan Nasional (Bapanas) I Gusti Ketut Astawa meminta pelaku usaha memastikan para mitra distributor tidak memicu gejolak harga di tingkat hilir.

“Tolong agar para pelaku usaha mengingatkan kepada para distributornya untuk tidak membuat harga bergerak melebihi ketentuan harga yang telah ditetapkan pemerintah,” pungkas Ketut.

title: RI's Foreign Debt Increases to IDR 7,196 Trillion as of Quarter IV/2025
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's Foreign Debt reached US$431.7 billion per quarter IV/2025 or around IDR 7,196.43 trillion (JISDOR exchange rate for December 31 2025 was IDR 16,670 per US dollar).

Compared to the previous period or the third quarter of 2025 of US$427.6 billion, Indonesia's foreign debt (ULN) position increased by 0.96%.

Executive Director of the Communications Department, Ramdan Denny Prakoso, explained that external debt is divided into government and private debt. In detail, government external debt was recorded at US$214.3 billion, an increase from the previous period of US$210.1 billion.

"The development of external debt was influenced by the inflow of foreign capital in international Government Securities [SBN]," explained Denny in his statement, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

He said the government's external debt was directed to support the financing of priority programs, which were said to be for sustainability and strengthening the national economy.

Based on sector, government ULN is used for the Health Services and Social Activities Sector (22.1% of total government ULN); Government Administration, Defense, and Mandatory Social Security (19.8%); Education Services (16.2%); Construction (11.7%); to Transportation and Warehousing (8.6%).

Also Read

"The position of government external debt is dominated by long-term debt with a share reaching 99.99% of the total government external debt," he explained.

In contrast, private external debt decreased from US$194.5 billion in the third quarter of 2025 to US$192.8 billion in the fourth quarter of 2025. Denny explained that it was influenced by the decline in external debt of non-financial corporations.

Based on economic sector, the largest share of private external debt comes from the Processing Industry Sector; Financial Services and Insurance; Procurement of Electricity and Gas; and Mining and Quarrying, with a share of 79.9% of total private external debt.

"Private external debt remains dominated by long-term debt with a share reaching 76.3% of total private external debt," said Denny.

In line with this, Indonesia's external debt ratio to gross domestic product (GDP) became 29.9% per quarter IV/2025, an increase compared to the previous period of 29.5%. This figure is dominated by long-term external debt at 85.7% of total external debt, a decrease from the third quarter of 2025 of 86.1%.

"Bank Indonesia and the Government continue to strengthen coordination in monitoring the development of external debt. The role of external debt will also continue to be optimized to support development financing and encourage sustainable national economic growth. This effort is carried out by minimizing risks that could affect economic stability," concluded Denny.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Bank Indonesia melaporkan Utang Luar Negeri Indonesia mencapai US$431,7 miliar per kuartal IV/2025 atau sekitar Rp7.196,43 triliun (kurs JISDOR 31 Desember 2025 sebesar Rp16.670 per dolar AS).

Dibandingkan periode sebelumnya atau kuartal III/2025 sebesar US$427,6 miliar, posisi utang luar negeri (ULN) Indonesia itu naik 0,96%.

Direktur Eksekutif Departemen Komunikasi Ramdan Denny Prakoso menjelaskan ULN terbagi ke utang pemerintah dan swasta. Perinciannya, ULN pemerintah tercatat sebesar US$214,3 miliar atau naik dari periode sebelumnya sebesar US$210,1 miliar.

"Perkembangan ULN tersebut dipengaruhi oleh aliran masuk modal asing pada Surat Berharga Negara [SBN] internasional," jelas Denny dalam keterangannya, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Dia menyebut ULN pemerintah diarahkan untuk mendukung pembiayaan program-program prioritas, yang disebut untuk keberlanjutan dan penguatan perekonomian nasional.

Berdasarkan sektornya, ULN pemerintah dimanfaatkan untuk Sektor Jasa Kesehatan dan Kegiatan Sosial (22,1% dari total ULN pemerintah); Administrasi Pemerintah, Pertahanan, dan Jaminan Sosial Wajib (19,8%); Jasa Pendidikan (16,2%); Konstruksi (11,7%); hingga Transportasi dan Pergudangan (8,6%).

title: Check out the Temporary Whoosh Schedule During the SUTT KM 129 Cable Transfer
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China (KCIC) began implementing adjustments to the Whoosh travel schedule on February 18 2026. This adjustment was made due to work on moving High Voltage Overhead Line (SUTT) cables.

KCIC General Manager Corporate Secretary, Eva Chairunisa, explained that the SUTT cable runs across KM 129 on the Padalarang–Tegalluar Summarecon route, right above the Whoosh operational route.

"This work is on the Whoosh operational route so all stages must be ensured to be safe before and during implementation. The schedule adjustment which took effect Wednesday [18/2] is part of our efforts to maintain overall operational safety," said Eva in an official statement, Wednesday (18/2/2026). Eva emphasized that the travel schedule adjustment is temporary. Once the SUTT cable removal work is complete, the Whoosh schedule will return to normal.

This cable removal work is relatively complex and applies high safety standards, so it requires quite a long maintenance time, namely from 21.30 WIB to 06.30 WIB (work window of 9 hours per day) for 22 consecutive days.

The 150 kV SUTT cable that was moved was 550 meters long and ran across the Whoosh line with a height of 60–70 meters at KM 129 on the Padalarang–Tegalluar route. The transfer process is carried out with strict SOPs and thorough preparation, always prioritizing safety aspects.

From February 18, 2026 to March 12, 2026, the number of Whoosh trips is adjusted to 42–56 trips per day. The first train from Halim Station departs at 07.25 WIB and from Tegalluar Summarecon Station at 07.35 WIB. The last departure is from Halim Station at 20.00 WIB and from Tegalluar Summarecon Station at 20.05 WIB.

KCIC ensures that tickets with the latest schedule are available through all official sales channels, namely the Whoosh Application, website ticket.kcic.co.id, as well as partner applications such as Access by KAI, Livin' by Mandiri, BRImo, Wondr by BNI, Tiket.com, Traveloka, and Trip.com.

"KCIC urges passengers to always pay attention to the latest travel schedules and monitor official information via KCIC communication channels," concluded Eva.

title: US-Japan Trade Agreement Begins, Initial Investment Reaches US$36 Billion
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Japan will invest an initial US$36 billion in critical oil, gas and mineral projects in the United States (US), marking the realization of the first phase of its US$550 billion commitment in a trade deal with US President Donald Trump.

"Our great trade deal with Japan has just begun! The scale of this project is enormous, and it would not be possible without one very special word, tariffs," Trump wrote in a post on his social media as reported by Bloomberg, Wednesday (18/2/2026).

Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi stated that the investment was designed to build a resilient supply chain through cooperation in strategic sectors for economic security, including critical minerals, energy and artificial intelligence (AI).

"We believe this initiative is fully aligned with its primary goals: promoting mutual benefits for Japan and the United States, ensuring economic security, and spurring growth," he said.

The largest investment will focus on building a natural gas facility in Ohio that is estimated to be capable of generating up to 9.2 gigawatts (GW) of electricity, according to a statement by US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick. Trump called this project the largest in history.

Japan is projected to invest US$33 billion in the project, which will be led by SoftBank Group Corp.'s subsidiary, SB Energy.

If fully operational, the plant's capacity is equivalent to nine nuclear reactors or sufficient for the electricity needs of around 7.4 million households on the largest electricity grid in the US managed by PJM Interconnection LLC.

The second project includes a deepwater crude oil export facility in the Gulf of Mexico. The US$2.1 billion investment will be allocated to the Texas GulfLink export terminal operated by Sentinel Midstream. The facility is estimated to be able to generate US crude oil exports of up to US$30 billion per year when fully operational.

In addition, Japan will also invest in synthetic industrial diamond manufacturing facilities in Georgia. The US$ 600 million project involves Element Six, a subsidiary of De Beers. Synthetic diamonds are valued as an important component in industrial production and advanced technology.

Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary, Minoru Kihara, confirmed that the two governments would continue to coordinate to finalize technical details and speed up the realization of the project.

This announcement is an important milestone in the implementation of the trade pact that Trump announced last year. Under the deal, the US imposed a 15% tariff on Japanese products, including reduced import duties on vehicles - a crucial sector for the Japanese economy - in return for a US$550 billion investment commitment.

The meeting between Trump and Takaichi in Washington which is scheduled for March 19 is expected to make investment implementation the main agenda.

Japanese Trade Minister Ryosei Akazawa previously emphasized that the funded projects would not be high risk, but would be oriented towards relatively safe returns. Of the total scheme of US$550 billion, only around 1%–2% will be direct cash investments, with the rest in the form of loans and credit guarantees.

In his statement, Lutnick emphasized that the financing structure was designed so that Japan would get investment returns, while the US would get strategic assets, expand industrial capacity and strengthen energy dominance.

The surge in electricity demand, especially from new data centers along with the AI ​​boom, is considered to make investing in power plants very relevant. Previously, the two countries had identified potential projects with a value ranging from US$350 million to US$100 billion during Trump's visit to Japan last year, including the involvement of companies such as Toshiba Corp. and Westinghouse.

The agreement also contains a provision that Japan has 45 working days to realize the funding after project is selected. If funding is cancelled, the US reserves the right to withdraw some of the revenue or even reimpose higher tariffs.

Trump previously threatened to increase tariffs to 25% before finally agreeing to a 15% tariff after Japan increased investment commitments.

Hudson Institute senior analyst William Chou assesses that the three projects reflect the shared priorities of the US and Japan in the energy, AI and semiconductor sectors, while also fitting with Japan's industrial advantages in the US market.

"This announcement maintains political momentum ahead of PM Takaichi's visit to Washington next month and shows that Japan is an ally that keeps its commitments," he said.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA - Jepang akan menggelontorkan investasi awal US$36 miliar untuk proyek minyak, gas, dan mineral kritis di Amerika Serikat (AS), menandai realisasi tahap pertama dari komitmen US$550 miliar dalam kesepakatan dagang dengan Presiden AS Donald Trump.

"Kesepakatan dagang besar kami dengan Jepang baru saja dimulai! Skala proyek ini sangat besar, dan tidak mungkin terwujud tanpa satu kata yang sangat istimewa, tarif," tulis Trump dalam unggahan di media sosialnya sebagaimana dilansir dari Bloomberg, Rabu (18/2/2026).

Perdana Menteri Jepang Sanae Takaichi menyatakan investasi tersebut dirancang untuk membangun rantai pasok yang tangguh melalui kerja sama di sektor-sektor strategis bagi keamanan ekonomi, termasuk mineral kritis, energi, dan kecerdasan buatan (artificial intelligence/AI).

“Kami meyakini inisiatif ini sepenuhnya selaras dengan tujuan utamanya: mendorong manfaat timbal balik bagi Jepang dan Amerika Serikat, menjamin keamanan ekonomi, serta memacu pertumbuhan,” ujarnya.

Investasi terbesar akan difokuskan pada pembangunan fasilitas gas alam di Ohio yang diperkirakan mampu menghasilkan listrik hingga 9,2 gigawatt (GW), menurut pernyataan Menteri Perdagangan AS Howard Lutnick. Trump menyebut proyek ini sebagai yang terbesar dalam sejarah.

Jepang diproyeksikan menanamkan US$33 miliar pada proyek tersebut, yang akan dipimpin anak usaha SoftBank Group Corp., yakni SB Energy.

Baca Juga : Prabowo Bertemu Trump, Industri Tekstil Berharap Keringanan Tarif dari AS

Jika beroperasi penuh, kapasitas pembangkit tersebut setara dengan sembilan reaktor nuklir atau mencukupi kebutuhan listrik sekitar 7,4 juta rumah tangga pada jaringan listrik terbesar di AS yang dikelola PJM Interconnection LLC.

Proyek kedua mencakup fasilitas ekspor minyak mentah laut dalam di Teluk Meksiko. Investasi senilai US$2,1 miliar akan dialokasikan untuk terminal ekspor Texas GulfLink yang dioperasikan Sentinel Midstream. Fasilitas tersebut diperkirakan mampu menghasilkan ekspor minyak mentah AS hingga US$30 miliar per tahun saat beroperasi penuh.

Selain itu, Jepang juga akan berinvestasi pada fasilitas manufaktur berlian industri sintetis di Georgia. Proyek senilai US$600 juta itu melibatkan Element Six, anak usaha De Beers. Berlian sintetis dinilai sebagai komponen penting dalam produksi industri dan teknologi canggih.

Kepala Sekretaris Kabinet Jepang, Minoru Kihara, memastikan kedua pemerintah akan terus berkoordinasi guna merampungkan detail teknis dan mempercepat realisasi proyek.

Terkait Kesepakatan Tarif 15%

Pengumuman ini menjadi tonggak penting dalam implementasi pakta dagang yang diumumkan Trump tahun lalu. Di bawah kesepakatan tersebut, AS menetapkan tarif sebesar 15% untuk produk Jepang, termasuk penurunan bea masuk kendaraan— sektor krusial bagi perekonomian Jepang— sebagai imbal balik atas komitmen investasi US$550 miliar.

Pertemuan antara Trump dan Takaichi di Washington yang dijadwalkan pada 19 Maret mendatang diperkirakan akan menjadikan implementasi investasi sebagai agenda utama.

Menteri Perdagangan Jepang Ryosei Akazawa sebelumnya menegaskan proyek-proyek yang didanai tidak akan berisiko tinggi, melainkan berorientasi pada imbal hasil yang relatif aman. Dari total skema US$550 miliar, hanya sekitar 1%–2% yang akan berupa investasi tunai langsung, sementara sisanya dalam bentuk pinjaman dan penjaminan kredit.

Dalam pernyataannya, Lutnick menegaskan struktur pembiayaan dirancang agar Jepang memperoleh imbal hasil investasi, sementara AS mendapatkan aset strategis, perluasan kapasitas industri, serta penguatan dominasi energi.

Lonjakan permintaan listrik, terutama dari pusat data baru seiring booming AI, dinilai membuat investasi pembangkit listrik menjadi sangat relevan. Sebelumnya, kedua negara telah mengidentifikasi proyek potensial dengan nilai berkisar US$350 juta hingga US$100 miliar dalam kunjungan Trump ke Jepang tahun lalu, termasuk keterlibatan perusahaan seperti Toshiba Corp. dan Westinghouse.

Kesepakatan tersebut juga memuat ketentuan bahwa Jepang memiliki waktu 45 hari kerja untuk merealisasikan pendanaan setelah proyek dipilih. Jika batal mendanai, AS berhak menarik kembali sebagian pendapatan atau bahkan memberlakukan kembali tarif yang lebih tinggi. 

Trump sebelumnya sempat mengancam menaikkan tarif hingga 25% sebelum akhirnya menyepakati tarif 15% setelah Jepang meningkatkan komitmen investasi.

Analis senior Hudson Institute, William Chou, menilai ketiga proyek mencerminkan prioritas bersama AS dan Jepang di sektor energi, AI, dan semikonduktor, sekaligus sesuai dengan keunggulan industri Jepang di pasar AS.

“Pengumuman ini menjaga momentum politik menjelang kunjungan PM Takaichi ke Washington bulan depan dan menunjukkan bahwa Jepang adalah sekutu yang menepati komitmennya,” ujarnya.
