  • RI-Thailand Kaji Pembaruan Kemitraan di Bidang Ekonomi Kreatif dan Digital
  • Purbaya Akui Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5% Tak Cukup Serap Tenaga Kerja Baru

Dalam skenario IMF, jika Indonesia menghilangkan hambatan non-tarif maka pelaku usaha dalam negeri bakal meraup akses bahan baku perantara (intermediate inputs) yang lebih terjangkau. Skenario tersebut dinilai ampuh meningkatkan produktivitas dan daya saing industri, baik untuk pemenuhan pasar domestik maupun ekspor.

Keuntungan ekonomi ini bakal makin menebal apabila diiringi pembukaan akses pasar lewat perjanjian perdagangan mendalam dengan mitra strategis (menambah peningkatan PDB riil sekitar 1,7%). Langkah ini diyakini akan memicu relokasi aktivitas ke sektor-sektor yang menjadi keunggulan komparatif Indonesia.

Lebih jauh, IMF membedah bahwa manuver kebijakan dagang semata tak akan cukup. Pemerintah dituntut mengeksekusi reformasi struktural yang komprehensif, khususnya di sektor kualitas sumber daya manusia (SDM) dan logistik (diproyeksikan memberi tambahan PDB riil sekitar 0,5%).

Perbaikan infrastruktur dan proses logistik diyakini mampu menjadi pendorong ekspor barang. Sementara itu, suntikan investasi pada kualitas SDM diharapkan menjadi fondasi krusial bagi lonjakan ekspor jasa modern, seperti sektor teknologi informasi dan komunikasi (TIK) serta keuangan.

Sebagai tambahan, IMF memproyeksikan bahwa keterbukaan dagang dan penguatan struktural bakal membuat Indonesia semakin menarik di mata investor asing, terutama di tengah pergeseran rantai pasok global. 

Akibatnya, investasi asing langsung diprediksi akan semakin deras apabila RI semakin terintegrasi dalam rantai nilai global sehingga melipatgandakan keuntungan ekonomi melampaui estimasi awal rumusan model tersebut.

"Bahkan seiring langkah Indonesia dalam mendorong liberalisasi perdagangan dan reformasi struktural, penting untuk memastikan tersedianya langkah-langkah dukungan yang tepat guna membantu para pekerja beralih ke peluang-peluang baru, sehingga membantu memastikan bahwa keuntungan dari perdagangan dapat terwujud sepenuhnya dan dinikmati secara luas," tutup catatan akhir laporan IMF tersebut.

title: What needs to be prioritized when Prabowo and Trump discuss trade agreements
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Entrepreneurs and economists asked the government to fight for national industrialization when President Prabowo Subianto flew to the United States to meet with President Donald Trump.

Stakeholders also hope that protection of the textile and footwear industry will be a concern in future discussions.

Deputy General Chair of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Erwin Aksa, said that the government needs to pay special attention to the industrial sector which has been the backbone of exports and absorption of the national workforce.

"Regarding US tariff policy, the sectors that need attention are export-oriented and labor-intensive industries such as textiles and textile products, footwear, furniture, fisheries, as well as certain manufactured products," said Erwin to Bisnis, Monday (16/2/2026).

According to Erwin, these sectors are important contributors to job creation and foreign exchange earnings. Therefore, he believes that the government needs to maintain the sustainability of industrial competitiveness through appropriate negotiation strategies.

In terms of the negotiation approach, Kadin believes that the government needs to strengthen mutually beneficial trade partnerships, encourage equal tariff treatment with competing countries, and improve logistics efficiency and ease of doing business within the country.

Also Read

"With this step, Indonesia is not only talking about tariffs, but also showing that Indonesia is a strategic partner in the global supply chain," he continued.

Workers in the textile industry

General Chairperson of Apindo Shinta Widjaja Kamdani said the sectors most vulnerable to US tariff policies are labor-intensive industries that have high exposure to Uncle Sam's export market.

"Regarding US tariff policy, from the perspective of the business world, the most vulnerable sectors are labor-intensive industries that have high exposure to the export market to the United States," Shinta told Bisnis.

Based on export data, Shinta explained a number of commodities with significant dependence on the US market. He gave the example that knitted clothing and accessories account for around 61% of exports to the US, furniture and lighting around 59%, processed meat/fish/crustaceans around 56%, and leather products around 56%. Meanwhile, non-knitted clothing is around 49%, toys and sports equipment is around 45%, and footwear is around 33%.

According to him, the data shows that changes in tariffs will have a direct impact on orders, production capacity utilization levels, and company cash flow, which ultimately has the potential to reduce labor absorption.

"Therefore, these sectors [labor-intensive industries] need to be a priority for protection in negotiations, considering their contribution to manufacturing and national employment stability," he explained.

On the other hand, Shinta said that Apindo was involved in US reciprocal tariff negotiations by providing industry input, mapping business obstacles, and communicating with business world partners in the US.

Apart from that, Shinta assessed that strengthening Indonesia's bargaining position also requires an understanding of the context of US reciprocal tariff policy which aims to balance the trade balance and reduce the trade deficit.

"Indonesia's approach cannot only be defensive in asking for tariff reductions, but must also offer concrete solutions that answer these interests," he explained.

Based on the upload from the official Instagram account @sekretariat.kabinet, President Prabowo summoned Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Minister of State Secretary Prasetyo Hadi, and Minister of Investment and Downstreaming/Head of BKPM and CEO of Danantara Rosan Roeslani.

The meeting was held at his private residence in Hambalang, Bogor, on Sunday (15/2/2026). During the meeting, the Indonesian Head of State emphasized the importance of ensuring that Indonesia's position in every international economic negotiation is at the most favorable point for national interests l, especially regarding tariff negotiations with the US.

"President Prabowo wants every policy taken to provide concrete benefits as soon as possible and as much as possible for Indonesia," he was quoted as saying on the official Instagram account @sekretariat.kabinet, Monday (16/2/2026).
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pengusaha dan ekonom meminta pemerintah untuk memperjuangkan industrialisasi nasional dalam saat Presiden Prabowo Subianto terbang ke Amerika Serikat bertemu dengan Presiden Donald Trump.

Para pemangku kepentingan juga berharap agar proteksi terhadap industri tekstil dan alas kaki menjadi perhatian dalam pembahasan nanti.

Wakil Ketua Umum Kadin Indonesia Erwin Aksa menyebut pemerintah perlu memberikan perhatian khusus kepada sektor industri yang selama ini menjadi tulang punggung ekspor dan penyerapan tenaga kerja nasional.

“Terkait kebijakan tarif AS, sektor yang perlu mendapat perhatian adalah industri berorientasi ekspor dan padat karya seperti tekstil dan produk tekstil, alas kaki, furnitur, perikanan, serta beberapa produk manufaktur tertentu,” kata Erwin kepada Bisnis, Senin (16/2/2026).

Menurut Erwin, sederet sektor tersebut merupakan kontributor penting bagi penciptaan lapangan kerja dan perolehan devisa. Oleh karena itu, dia menilai pemerintah perlu menjaga keberlanjutan daya saing industri melalui strategi negosiasi yang tepat.

Dari sisi pendekatan perundingan, Kadin menilai pemerintah perlu memperkuat kemitraan dagang yang saling menguntungkan, mendorong kesetaraan perlakuan tarif dengan negara pesaing, serta meningkatkan efisiensi logistik dan kemudahan berusaha di dalam negeri.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo ke AS Bahas Perjanjian Dagang, Ekonom: Industri Tekstil Butuh Keringanan
  • Prabowo Undang 22 Pengusaha ke Hambalang, Bahas Peran Industri Tekstil hingga Mamin
  • Menko Airlangga Sebut Pembentukan BUMN Tekstil Masih dalam Kajian

“Dengan langkah tersebut, Indonesia tidak hanya berbicara soal tarif, tetapi juga menunjukkan bahwa Indonesia adalah mitra strategis dalam rantai pasok global,” lanjutnya.

Ketua Umum Apindo Shinta Widjaja Kamdani mengatakan sektor paling rentan terhadap kebijakan tarif AS adalah industri padat karya yang memiliki eksposur tinggi ke pasar ekspor Negeri Paman Sam.

“Terkait kebijakan tarif AS, dari perspektif dunia usaha, sektor yang paling rentan adalah industri padat karya yang memiliki eksposur tinggi terhadap pasar ekspor ke Amerika Serikat,” kata Shinta kepada Bisnis.

Berdasarkan data ekspor, Shinta memaparkan sejumlah komoditas dengan ketergantungan signifikan terhadap pasar AS. Dia mencontohkan, pakaian dan aksesori rajutan mencatat sekitar 61% ekspor ke AS, furnitur dan lampu sekitar 59%, olahan daging/ikan/krustasea sekitar 56%, serta produk kulit sekitar 56%. Adapun pakaian non-rajutan sekitar 49%, mainan dan perlengkapan olahraga sekitar 45%, dan alas kaki sekitar 33%.

Menurutnya, data tersebut menunjukkan perubahan tarif akan berdampak langsung pada pesanan, tingkat utilisasi kapasitas produksi, hingga arus kas perusahaan, yang pada akhirnya berpotensi menekan penyerapan tenaga kerja.

“Karena itu, sektor-sektor ini [industri padat karya] perlu menjadi prioritas perlindungan dalam negosiasi, mengingat kontribusinya terhadap manufaktur dan stabilitas ketenagakerjaan nasional,” terangnya.

Di sisi lain, Shinta menuturkan Apindo ikut terlibat dalam negosiasi tarif resiprokal AS dengan memberi masukan industri, memetakan hambatan usaha, hingga berkomunikasi dengan mitra dunia usaha di AS. 

Selain itu, Shinta menilai penguatan posisi tawar Indonesia juga menuntut pemahaman atas konteks kebijakan tarif resiprokal AS yang bertujuan menyeimbangkan neraca perdagangan dan menekan defisit dagang.

“Pendekatan Indonesia tidak bisa hanya defensif meminta penurunan tarif, tetapi juga harus menawarkan solusi konkret yang menjawab kepentingan tersebut,” terangnya.

Berdasarkan unggahan akun Instagram resmi @sekretariat.kabinet, Presiden Prabowo memanggil Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto, Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Menteri Sekretaris Negara Prasetyo Hadi, serta Menteri Investasi dan Hilirisasi/Kepala BKPM sekaligus CEO Danantara Rosan Roeslani.

Pertemuan itu dilaksanakan di kediaman pribadinya di Hambalang, Bogor, pada Minggu (15/2/2026). Dalam pertemuan tersebut, Kepala Negara RI menekankan pentingnya memastikan posisi Indonesia dalam setiap perundingan ekonomi internasional berada pada titik yang paling menguntungkan bagi kepentingan nasional, terutama terkait perundingan tarif dengan AS.

“Presiden Prabowo menginginkan setiap kebijakan yang diambil harus sesegera dan sebanyak mungkin memberi keuntungan konkret untuk Indonesia,” demikian dikutip dari akun Instagram resmi @sekretariat.kabinet, Senin (16/2/2026).

title: Food Prices February 17 Ahead of Ramadan: Beef and Buffalo Rise
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Movements in national average prices for food commodities for consumers in Indonesia were observed to vary on Tuesday (17/2/2026), coinciding with the 2026 Chinese New Year holiday and the eve of Ramadan.

Based on the National Food Agency (Bapanas) price panel page at 09.45 WIB, the average price of premium rice in the country fell 1.16% to IDR 15,450 per kilogram compared to the previous day.

title: Citilink flies the Padang & Pekanbaru route from Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Garuda Indonesia Group through Citilink has opened a new domestic flight route from Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport to Padang and Pekanbaru, which will operate from February 16 2026.

Citilink President Director, Darsito Hendroseputro, said that the opening of these two routes was a strategic step in expanding the Garuda Indonesia Group network while optimizing the utilization of aircraft that had been reactivated.

"The opening of this new route is a form of Citilink's commitment to providing wider travel alternatives, especially connecting Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport with Padang and Pekanbaru to facilitate people's mobility," he said in a press release quoted on Tuesday (17/2/2026).

He explained that Citilink's Jakarta – Padang and Jakarta – Pekanbaru flights operate every day using Airbus A320 aircraft.

Meanwhile, the Jakarta to Padang route is scheduled to depart at 07.00 local time and arrive in Padang at 08.50 local time with flight number QG180.

The reverse flight route from Padang to Jakarta departs at 09.20 local time and arrives in Jakarta at 11.15 local time with flight number QG181.

Also Read

Meanwhile, the Jakarta to Pekanbaru route is scheduled to depart at 16.45 local time and arrive in Pekanbaru at 18.30 local time with flight number QG032.

Then, the reverse flight on the Pekanbaru route to Jakarta departs at 19.00 local time and arrives in Jakarta at 20.50 local time with flight number QG033.

Darsito hopes that the opening of this new Citilink route can make a positive contribution to all sectors, especially in supporting the acceleration of economic growth between regions in Indonesia.

Citilink is committed to continuing to strengthen operational performance and maintain service consistency by always prioritizing aspects of flight safety, security and comfort.

“Dengan dibukanya rute baru ini merupakan bentuk komitmen Citilink dalam menyediakan alternatif perjalanan yang lebih luas, khususnya menghubungkan Jakarta melalui Bandar Udara Internasional Halim Perdanakusuma dengan Padang dan Pekanbaru untuk memudahkan mobilitas masyarakat,” katanya dalam siaran pers dikutip Selasa (17/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan penerbangan Citilink rute Jakarta – Padang dan Jakarta – Pekanbaru beroperasi setiap hari dengan menggunakan pesawat Airbus A320.

Adapun, untuk rute Jakarta menuju Padang dijadwalkan berangkat pukul 07.00 waktu setempat dan tiba di Padang pukul 08.50 waktu setempat dengan nomor penerbangan QG180.

Rute penerbangan sebaliknya dari Padang menuju Jakarta berangkat pukul 09.20 waktu setempat dan tiba di Jakarta pukul 11.15 waktu setempat dengan nomor penerbangan QG181.

title: Building Trust, Deputy Minister of Cooperatives Asks KopDes Merah Putih to Be Managed Transparently
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Cooperatives (Kemenkop) stated that the management of the Red and White Village/Kelurahan Cooperative (KopDes/Kel) must be carried out professionally and transparently so that it can grow and develop sustainably.

Deputy Minister of Cooperatives (Wamenkop) Farida Farichah said cooperatives need to implement good governance, supported by an orderly administration system, open financial reporting, and clear and accountable monitoring mechanisms.

According to him, public trust is the main capital so that cooperatives can be sustainable, so that the integrity of the management is an absolute prerequisite.

"There is no business that suddenly gets big. All big businesses start small. They can get big if there is trust from members and the public. If trust is high, people will definitely shop there," said Farida in a written statement, quoted Monday (16/2/2026).

Apart from that, Farida added that management professionalism is also an important requirement for banks to distribute capital loans. He assessed that if the source of capital comes from members, management transparency is an inseparable part of professional management practices.

"The important thing is no longer shopping, the important thing is that money goes out. Everything must be checked regularly, how much is spent, how much money comes in," he explained.

Also Read

On the other hand, Farida said that the Ministry of Cooperatives also provides training to administrators and supervisors to ensure that cooperative management runs professionally.

He assessed that every village and sub-district has economic potential that can be managed to improve the welfare of residents, so the Village Cooperative/Kel Merah Putih needs to explore and develop local potential in their respective areas.

"For example, there are villages whose villages have plantation potential, but the residents only become laborers because they don't know how to manage and market them. Capital owners from outside come to control them. We don't want things like that to happen again. In the future, villages and sub-districts will not depend on outsiders," he said.

For this reason, Farida asked residents and all KopDes/Kel Merah Putih managers to run the cooperative seriously and diligently, even though this will not be felt in the near future. However, he assessed that these benefits would come along with a gradual process.

In addition, Farida said that the Ministry of Cooperatives had issued Minister of Cooperatives Regulation Number 9 of 2025 (Permenkop 9/2025) regarding the distribution of loans from LPDB Cooperatives for cooperatives that need funding. He ensured that every KopDes/Kel Merah Putih that needed capital could apply for a loan through the LPDB Cooperative.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Koperasi (Kemenkop) menyatakan pengelolaan Koperasi Desa/Kelurahan (KopDes/Kel) Merah Putih harus dilakukan secara profesional dan transparan agar mampu tumbuh dan berkembang secara berkelanjutan.

Wakil Menteri Koperasi (Wamenkop) Farida Farichah mengatakan koperasi perlu menerapkan tata kelola yang baik, didukung sistem administrasi yang tertib, pelaporan keuangan yang terbuka, serta mekanisme pengawasan yang jelas dan dapat dipertanggungjawabkan.

Menurutnya, kepercayaan masyarakat merupakan modal utama agar koperasi dapat berkelanjutan, sehingga integritas pengurus menjadi prasyarat mutlak.

“Tidak ada bisnis yang tiba-tiba besar. Semua bisnis besar berawal dari kecil. Bisa besar kalau ada kepercayaan anggota dan masyarakat. Kalau kepercayaan tinggi, pasti masyarakat berbelaja di situ,” kata Farida dalam keterangan tertulis, dikutip Senin (16/2/2026).

Selain itu, Farida menambahkan bahwa profesionalisme pengelolaan juga menjadi syarat penting bagi perbankan untuk menyalurkan pinjaman modal. Dia menilai, apabila sumber modal berasal dari anggota, transparansi pengelolaan merupakan bagian tak terpisahkan dari praktik manajemen yang profesional.

“Tidak boleh lagi yang penting belanja, yang penting uang keluar. Semua harus dicek secara berkala, berapa belanja, berapa uang yang masuk,” terangnya.

Baca Juga

  • Kopdes Merah Putih diguyur Triliunan Rupiah, dari Dana Desa hingga Duit SAL
  • Ini Alasan Purbaya Wajibkan 58% Dana Desa 2026 untuk Kopdes Merah Putih
  • Risiko di Balik Kebijakan 58% Dana Desa 2026 untuk Kopdes Merah Putih

Di sisi lain, Farida menyampaikan Kemenkop turut memberikan pelatihan kepada pengurus dan pengawas untuk memastikan pengelolaan koperasi berjalan secara profesional.

Dia menilai setiap desa dan kelurahan memiliki potensi ekonomi yang dapat dikelola untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan warga, sehingga KopDes/Kel Merah Putih perlu menggali dan mengembangkan potensi lokal di wilayahnya masing-masing.

“Misalnya, ada yang desanya punya potensi perkebunan, tapi warganya hanya jadi buruh karena tidak tahu cara mengelola dan memasarkannya. Pemilik modal dari luar datang menguasainya. Kita tidak ingin hal seperti itu terjadi lagi. Ke depan, desa dan kelurahan tidak tergantung pada orang luar,” tuturnya.

Untuk itu, Farida meminta warga dan seluruh pengelola KopDes/Kel Merah Putih menjalankan koperasi secara serius dan tekun, meski belum dirasakan dalam waktu dekat. Namun, dia menilai manfaat tersebut akan seiring proses yang berjalan secara bertahap.

Di samping itu, Farida menyampaikan Kemenkop telah menerbitkan Peraturan Menteri Koperasi Nomor 9 Tahun 2025 (Permenkop 9/2025) terkait penyaluran pinjaman dari LPDB Koperasi bagi koperasi yang membutuhkan pendanaan. Dia memastikan setiap KopDes/Kel Merah Putih yang memerlukan permodalan dapat mengajukan pinjaman melalui LPDB Koperasi.

title: Pertamina Tests Well Production in Rokan Block, Reaches 1,274 Barrels per Day
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Pertamina Hulu Rokan (PHR) successfully carried out the first production test from the Libo SE #86 well in Siak Regency, Riau Province.

The oil and gas well is capable of producing up to 1,274 barrels of oil per day (bpd) in early 2026. This success is considered to be an important milestone for the development of the oil field in the Rokan Block.

GM PHR Rokan Zone, Andre Wijanarko, said that this achievement was special because the production results showed a 0% Water Cut figure. This means that the hydrocarbons that come out of the earth are pure oil without being mixed with water.

He considered that the success of the Libo SE #86 well was not just luck. PHR implemented a precise and innovative technical strategy to maximize the potential of the Top Menggala layer at a depth of 5,680 feet and with a maximum permeability (perm) of 2.2 Darcy.

"This achievement is clear proof that with technological innovation and the hard work of PHR officers, the Rokan Block still has great potential to support Indonesia's national energy security," said Andre in an official statement, Monday (16/2/2026).

He explained that several keys to technical success that were applied included selective perforation or the method of selectively perforating well pipes. This is done to ensure oil flows from the most potential depth of the reservoir.

Then optimize the ESP pump, in the form of using a submersible electric pump with a low speed that is adjusted to the characteristics of the well's optimal production rate.

Furthermore, the installation of sophisticated equipment in the form of a combination of Advanced Gas Handlers (AGH) at subsurface pumps and Gas Separators at surface facilities to ensure oil flow remains stable even if there is gas content (gassy conditions).

Andre said that his party is committed to continuing to increase national oil and gas production by carrying out continuous drilling in the same area. Currently, the team in the field is moving quickly to drill the Libo SE #88 well at the same wellpad location.

According to him, a total of four additional wells will soon be drilled (infill drilling). This is a follow-up to the success of the Libo SE #86 drilling which aims to maximize the oil potential in the Libo SE area.

Andre added that cross-functional collaboration from the SSDP Team, DWI Team, PTE Team, P&O Team and Land-CorSec Team is the main key to the success of this drilling in the future.

"Hopefully in the future, PHR can continue to prove operational reliability while maintaining HSE aspects for energy security," he concluded.

Dia menilai, kesuksesan sumur Libo SE #86 bukan sekadar keberuntungan. PHR menerapkan strategi teknis yang presisi dan inovatif untuk memaksimalkan potensi di lapisan Top Menggala pada kedalaman 5.680 kaki dan dengan maksimal permeabilitas (perm) 2.2 Darcy.

“Pencapaian ini menjadi bukti nyata bahwa dengan inovasi teknologi dan kerja keras Perwira PHR, Blok Rokan masih memiliki potensi besar untuk mendukung ketahanan energi nasional Indonesia,” kata Andre melalui keterangan resmi, Senin (16/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan, beberapa kunci keberhasilan teknis yang diterapkan antara lain yakni selective perforation atau metode pelubangan pipa sumur secara selektif. Hal ini dilakukan untuk memastikan minyak mengalir dari titik kedalaman reservoir yang paling potensial.

Menurutnya, total masih terdapat empat sumur tambahan yang akan segera dibor (infill drilling). Ini sebagai tindak lanjut keberhasilan pengeboran Libo SE #86 ini yang bertujuan untuk mengangkat potensi minyak di area Libo SE secara maksimal. 

Andre menambahkan bahwa kolaborasi lintas fungsi dari Tim SSDP, Tim DWI, Tim PTE, Tim P&O dan Tim Land-CorSec menjadi kunci utama untuk keberhasilan pengeboran ini ke depannya.

“Semoga ke depannya, PHR dapat terus membuktikan keandalan operasi dengan tetap menjaga aspek HSE untuk ketahanan energi,” pungkasnya.

title: Purbaya Splashes IDR 809 Trillion: ASN THR & Stimulus Become Economic Motors in Early 2026
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government is targeting budget absorption to reach IDR 809 trillion in the first quarter of 2026. This spending is aimed at encouraging economic growth in the first three months of this year.

At the Indonesia Economic Outlook 2026 event, Friday (13/2/2026), Minister of Finance (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa targeted government spending of IDR 809 trillion to help the economy grow in the range of 5.5% to 6.6% in the first quarter of 2026.

When met after the event, the Director General of Budget at the Ministry of Finance, Luky Alfirman, said that this realization would really depend on its realization. He was reluctant to estimate how much impact it would have on the economy.

"It's called an estimate, it depends on the execution," he said when met on the sidelines of the event held at Wisma Danantara, quoted Monday (17/2/2026).

The government's target for spending is IDR 809 trillion, or 21% of total state spending in 2026, namely IDR 3,842.7 trillion, one of which includes an economic stimulus of IDR 13 trillion.

Based on the stimulus that has been announced, the incentive package that the government will distribute for Eid al-Fitr is a VAT incentive borne by the government or VAT DTP for plane tickets at 11%, discounts on transportation tickets, food assistance and WFA policies for ASN and the private sector.

Also Read

As for ASN and TNI-Polri, the government has also prepared THR with a total budget of IDR 55 trillion. Purbaya Minister of Finance Yudhi Sadewa targets that the THR can be disbursed in the near future.

"I don't know the exact date. What is clear is that at the start of the fast, we hope that we will be able to distribute it," he explained to journalists at the same event.

On the priority program side, the government is targeting budget absorption to accelerate the distribution of Free Nutritious Meals (MBG) of IDR 62 trillion.

Meanwhile, the budget for post-disaster rehabilitation and reconstruction in Sumatra is IDR 6 trillion.

Not only the APBN, in collaboration with Danantara, the government will also support the construction of the Red and White Village Cooperative (KDMP) with up to 30,000 units worth IDR 90 trillion, as well as the construction of commercial houses and BSPS IDR 20 trillion.

"Indonesia's strong economic growth momentum in 2025 will continue until 2026. Our prediction is that in the first quarter, in the first quarter our economy could grow between 5.5% and 6%," he explained.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pemerintah menargetkan penyerapan anggaran belanja mencapai Rp809 triliun pada kuartal I/2026. Belanja itu diarahkan untuk mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi pada tiga bulan pertama tahun ini. 

Pada acara Indonesia Economic Outlook 2026, Jumat (13/2/2026), Menteri Keuangan (Menkeu) Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa menargetkan belanja pemerintah Rp809 triliun bisa membantu ekonomi tumbuh pada kisaran 5,5% sampai dengan 6,6% pada kuartal I/2026. 

Saat ditemui usai acara tersebut, Dirjen Anggaran Kemenkeu Luky Alfirman menyebut realisasi tersebut akan sangat tergantung dengan realisasinya. Dia enggan memperkirakan berapa dampaknya ke perekonomian. 

"Namanya perkiraan, itu tergantung eksekusinya," ujarnya saat ditemui pada sela-sela acara yang diselenggarakan di Wisma Danantara itu, dikutip Senin (17/2/2026). 

Adapun target pemerintah belanja Rp809 triliun, atau 21% dari total belanja negara 2026 yakni Rp3.842,7 triliun itu salah satunya meliputi stimulus ekonomi Rp13 triliun. 

Berdasarkan stimulus yang telah diumumkan, paket insentif yang akan disalurkan pemerintah dalam rangka Idulfitri adalah insentif PPN ditanggung pemerintah atau PPN DTP untuk tiket pesawat sebesar 11%, diskon tiket transportasi, bantuan pangan dan kebijakan WFA bagi ASN maupun swasta.

  • Purbaya Akui Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5% Tak Cukup Serap Tenaga Kerja Baru

Adapun untuk ASN dan TNI-Polri, pemerintah juga menyiapkan THR dengan total anggaran Rp55 triliun. Menkeu Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa menargetkan THR bisa dicairkan dalam waktu dekat. 

"Saya enggak tahu tanggal pastinya. Yang jelas di awal-awal puasa kami harapkan udah bisa kami salurkan," terangnya kepada wartawan pada acara yang sama. 

Pada sisi program prioritas, pemerintah menargetkan penyerapan anggaran untuk percepatan penyaluran Makan Bergizi Gratis (MBG) Rp62 triliun. 

Sementara itu, rehabilitasi dan rekonstruksi pascabencana di Sumatra dianggarkan Rp6 triliun. 

Tidak hanya APBN, berkolaborasi dengan Danantara, pemerintah juga akan mendukung pembangunan Koperasi Desa Merah Putih (KDMP) sampai 30.000 unit senilai Rp90 triliun, serta pembangunan rumah komersil dan BSPS Rp20 triliun. 

"Momentum pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia yang kuat tahun 2025 akan terus berlanjut hingga tahun 2026. Prediksi kami di triwulan pertama, di triwulan pertama ekonomi kita bisa tumbuh antara 5,5% sampai dengan 6%," terangnya.

title: 2026 Chinese New Year holidays, 119,532 vehicles leaving Jakarta towards East Java
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Vehicle flows to the eastern region of Trans Java soared at the peak of the 2026 Chinese New Year holiday. A total of 119,532 vehicles passed through the Cikampek Utama Toll Gate (GT) towards the east of Java.

This figure is an accumulation in the H-4 to H-2 period or in the range 13–15 February 2026. Traffic flow increased by 31.37% compared to normal conditions which averaged 90,987 vehicles.

VP Corporate Secretary & Legal PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol (JTT), Ria Marlinda Paallo, said the increase also occurred in the reverse flow.

"For vehicles from the eastern region of Trans Java to Jakarta via GT Cikampek Utama, there were 95,039 vehicles recorded, or an increase of 2.95% compared to normal traffic of 92,312 vehicles," said Ria in her official statement, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

The return flow is expected to start increasing on Tuesday (17/2/2026). Vehicle volume from the east towards Jakarta is projected to reach 39,379 vehicles or an increase of 53.75% from normal traffic of 25,612 vehicles.

The increase in traffic volume does not only occur at the Cikampek Utama GT. In the Central Java region, vehicle flows were also observed to increase significantly.

Also Read

At GT Kalikangkung, vehicles heading to Semarang were recorded at 68,976 units or an increase of 32.49% from normal conditions of 52,060 vehicles. Meanwhile, vehicles leaving Semarang reached 52,838 units or an increase of 9.22%.

Meanwhile at GT Banyumanik, traffic to Solo reached 98,921 vehicles or an increase of 25.52% compared to normal conditions. In the direction of Jakarta, 69,980 vehicles were recorded or an increase of 11.86%.

Similar conditions also occurred at a number of toll gates in the East Java region. At GT Warugunung, vehicles heading to Surabaya were recorded at 72,241 units or an increase of 11.46% from normal. Meanwhile, traffic to Jakarta reached 76,804 vehicles or an increase of 27.09%.

At Kejapanan Utama GT, as many as 98,522 vehicles went to Malang or an increase of 23.84%. In the direction of Surabaya, 88,476 vehicles were recorded or an increase of 6.88% compared to normal conditions.

Meanwhile, at GT Singosari, vehicles heading to Malang were recorded at 53,482 units or an increase of 14.65%. Meanwhile, vehicles heading to Surabaya reached 47,999 units or an increase of 8.23%.

To anticipate this surge, JTT took a number of steps, starting from optimizing toll booths, strengthening operational services, to preparing officers in the field. Coordination with the police and related agencies is also carried out to maintain the smooth flow of vehicles.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Arus kendaraan menuju wilayah timur Trans Jawa melonjak pada puncak libur Tahun Baru Imlek 2026. Sebanyak 119.532 kendaraan melintas melalui Gerbang Tol (GT) Cikampek Utama menuju arah timur Jawa. 

Angka tersebut merupakan akumulasi pada periode H-4 hingga H-2 atau pada rentang 13–15 Februari 2026. Arus lalu lintas meningkat 31,37% dibandingkan kondisi normal yang rata-rata mencapai 90.987 kendaraan.

VP Corporate Secretary & Legal PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol (JTT), Ria Marlinda Paallo, mengatakan peningkatan juga terjadi pada arus sebaliknya. 

“Untuk kendaraan dari wilayah timur Trans Jawa menuju Jakarta melalui GT Cikampek Utama tercatat sebanyak 95.039 kendaraan, atau meningkat 2,95% dibandingkan lalu lintas normal sebanyak 92.312 kendaraan,” kata Ria dalam keterangan resminya, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Arus balik diperkirakan mulai meningkat pada Selasa (17/2/2026). Volume kendaraan dari arah timur menuju Jakarta diproyeksikan mencapai 39.379 kendaraan atau melonjak 53,75% dari lalu lintas normal sebanyak 25.612 kendaraan.

Peningkatan volume lalu lintas tidak hanya terjadi di GT Cikampek Utama. Di wilayah Jawa Tengah, arus kendaraan juga terpantau naik signifikan.

Adapun di GT Banyumanik, arus menuju Solo mencapai 98.921 kendaraan atau naik 25,52% dibandingkan kondisi normal. Untuk arah Jakarta, tercatat 69.980 kendaraan atau meningkat 11,86%.

Kondisi serupa juga terjadi di sejumlah gerbang tol wilayah Jawa Timur. Di GT Warugunung, kendaraan menuju Surabaya tercatat 72.241 unit atau naik 11,46% dari normal. Sementara arus menuju Jakarta mencapai 76.804 kendaraan atau melonjak 27,09%.

Di GT Kejapanan Utama, sebanyak 98.522 kendaraan menuju Malang atau naik 23,84%. Untuk arah Surabaya tercatat 88.476 kendaraan atau meningkat 6,88% dibandingkan kondisi normal.

Sementara itu, di GT Singosari, kendaraan menuju Malang tercatat 53.482 unit atau naik 14,65%. Adapun kendaraan menuju Surabaya mencapai 47.999 unit atau meningkat 8,23%.

Untuk mengantisipasi lonjakan tersebut, JTT melakukan sejumlah langkah, mulai dari optimalisasi gardu tol, penguatan layanan operasional, hingga kesiapan petugas di lapangan. Koordinasi dengan kepolisian dan instansi terkait juga dilakukan guna menjaga kelancaran arus kendaraan.

title: Moody's Lowers Outlook, OJK Affirms Himbara's Rating Remains Investment Grade

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Financial Services Authority (OJK) emphasized that outlook adjustments by a number of State-Owned Bank Association (Himbara) banks do not reflect a fundamental weakening of national banking performance.

The regulator ensures that the credit rating (rating) of Himbara banks remains at investment grade level with solid capital, liquidity and asset quality conditions.

Chief Executive of Banking Supervision and Member of the Board of Commissioners of the Financial Services Authority, Dian Ediana Rae, explained that the change in outlook was more influenced by external factors, especially the decline in Indonesia's sovereign outlook and global macroeconomic dynamics. Thus, the adjustment was not caused by a decline in the internal performance of each bank.

"The credit rating is maintained at investment grade level, which shows strong confidence in solid capital conditions, adequate liquidity, maintained asset quality and resilient profitability," said Dian to Bisnis, Monday (16/2/2026).

Until the end of 2025, Dian noted that the capital level of Himbara banks was recorded to be in the range of 19% to 21%. This figure is far above the minimum requirement according to each bank's risk profile.

Apart from that, the majority of capital is supported by core capital, aka tier one banks, with a ratio of around 17% to 20%, providing room for expansion as well as a cushion in anticipating potential future risks.

In terms of liquidity, the AL/NCD and AL/DPK ratios were recorded as being above the specified threshold, exceeding 50% and 10% respectively. Meanwhile, the Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR) and Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) are also above 100%, reflecting sufficient short and medium-long term liquidity.

Credit growth for the majority of Himbara banks is also still in the double digit range and exceeds the industry average of 9.69% on an annual basis.

On the funding side, growth in third party funds (DPK) for a number of Himbara banks also grew double digits, in line with improvements in the low-cost funds ratio (CASA), which shows that the level of public trust remains maintained.

Asset quality is also relatively under control with the gross non-performing loan (NPL) ratio in the range of below 1% to 3%, accompanied by adequate provision formation. OJK assesses that this reflects the implementation of prudent risk management amidst pressures from global interest rates and domestic economic dynamics.

For investors, potential pressure on net interest margins (NIM) and increases in funding costs are a major concern. However, Dian views the profitability prospects of large banks, including Himbara, as remaining on a positive and sustainable path.

Income diversification through increasing fee-based income, optimizing digital transactions, and a funding structure dominated by current accounts and savings are factors supporting profit stability.

Dian added that the national banking regulatory and supervisory framework has been aligned with international standards set by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS). This implementation is also periodically evaluated through international assessments to ensure consistency and effectiveness of supervision.

With strong fundamentals and consistent supervision, Dian is optimistic that Himbara banks will continue to have adequate capacity to support national economic financing and maintain financial system stability amidst global uncertainty.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK) menegaskan penyesuaian outlook oleh terhadap sejumlah bank Himpunan Bank Milik Negara (Himbara) tidak mencerminkan pelemahan fundamental kinerja perbankan nasional. 

Regulator memastikan peringkat kredit (rating) bank-bank Himbara tetap berada pada level investment grade dengan kondisi permodalan, likuiditas, dan kualitas aset yang solid.

Kepala Eksekutif Pengawas Perbankan Merangkap Anggota Dewan Komisioner Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Dian Ediana Rae menjelaskan perubahan outlook tersebut lebih dipengaruhi faktor eksternal, terutama penurunan outlook sovereign Indonesia serta dinamika makro ekonomi global. Dengan demikian, penyesuaian itu bukan disebabkan oleh penurunan kinerja internal masing-masing bank.

“Peringkat kredit tetap dipertahankan pada level investment grade, yang menunjukkan keyakinan kuat terhadap kondisi permodalan yang solid, likuiditas memadai, kualitas aset terjaga, serta profitabilitas yang resilien,” kata Dian kepada Bisnis, Senin (16/2/2026). 

Hingga akhir 2025, Dian mencatat bahwa tingkat permodalan bank-bank Himbara tercatat berada pada kisaran 19% sampai dengan 21%. Angka ini jauh di atas ketentuan minimum sesuai profil risiko masing-masing bank. 

Selain itu, mayoritas permodalan tersebut ditopang modal inti alias bank tier satu dengan rasio sekitar 17% sampai 20%, memberikan ruang ekspansi sekaligus bantalan dalam mengantisipasi potensi risiko ke depan.

Dari sisi likuiditas, rasio AL/NCD dan AL/DPK tercatat berada di atas ambang batas yang ditetapkan, masing-masing melampaui 50% dan 10%. Sementara itu, Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR) dan Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) juga berada di atas 100%, mencerminkan kecukupan likuiditas jangka pendek maupun menengah-panjang.

Pertumbuhan kredit mayoritas bank Himbara juga masih berada pada kisaran double digit dan melampaui rata-rata industri yang tercatat 9,69% secara tahunan. 

Di sisi pendanaan, pertumbuhan dana pihak ketiga (DPK) sejumlah bank Himbara juga tumbuh dua digit, sejalan dengan perbaikan rasio dana murah (CASA) yang menunjukkan tingkat kepercayaan masyarakat tetap terjaga.

Kualitas aset pun relatif terkendali dengan rasio kredit bermasalah (NPL) gross berada pada kisaran di bawah 1% hingga 3%, disertai pembentukan pencadangan yang memadai. OJK menilai hal tersebut mencerminkan penerapan manajemen risiko yang prudent di tengah tekanan suku bunga global dan dinamika ekonomi domestik.

Bagi investor, potensi tekanan terhadap margin bunga bersih (NIM) dan kenaikan biaya dana menjadi perhatian utama. Namun demikian, Dian memandang prospek profitabilitas bank-bank besar, termasuk Himbara, tetap berada pada jalur positif dan berkelanjutan. 

Diversifikasi pendapatan melalui peningkatan fee-based income, optimalisasi transaksi digital, serta struktur pendanaan yang didominasi giro dan tabungan menjadi faktor penopang stabilitas laba.

Dian menambahkan, kerangka regulasi dan pengawasan perbankan nasional telah diselaraskan dengan standar internasional yang ditetapkan oleh Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS). Penerapan tersebut secara berkala juga dievaluasi melalui asesmen internasional guna memastikan konsistensi dan efektivitas pengawasan.

Dengan fundamental yang kuat dan pengawasan yang konsisten, Dian optimistis bank-bank Himbara tetap memiliki kapasitas memadai untuk mendukung pembiayaan perekonomian nasional serta menjaga stabilitas sistem keuangan di tengah ketidakpastian global.

title: Airlangga Spokesperson Talks About Potential Surprises at the Prabowo-Trump Meeting
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The government implied that there would be 'surprises' related to the signing of a trade agreement or agreement on reciprocal trade (ART) between Indonesia and the United States (US).

Just for the record, the Indonesian and US governments have completed the entire negotiation process and legal language harmonization process (legal drafting) related to the trade agreement which began with the imposition of import tariffs on Indonesian products in 2025.

From initially being threatened with a 32% tariff, President Prabowo Subianto last year agreed with President Donald Trump to reduce import duties on Indonesian products to 19%. In contrast, most US products will be subject to 0% import duties.

Ahead of the signing of the ART which is scheduled for February 19 2026, the entire results of the negotiations and preparation of the legal documents for the trade agreement have been submitted to President Prabowo. Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto, who led the team of negotiators, also presented the results the day before Prabowo left for the US.

"The presence of economic ministers in Hambalang [Prabowo's private residence] before the President's departure is a form of final consolidation so that Indonesia's position is solid in the negotiations. We hope that there will be positive surprises from ART that will increasingly benefit Indonesia," said Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs spokesperson Haryo Limanseto in a press release, Monday (16/2/2026).

Haryo then said that tariff negotiations had been completed and the two countries had completed the process of harmonizing legal language or legal drafting.

Also Read

In addition to reducing tariffs to 19%, the US government also excluded tariffs for a number of Indonesia's leading export commodities, including crude palm oil (CPO), coffee and cocoa.

Previously, the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs also revealed that there were a number of mainstay export commodities from Indonesia to the US which had been successfully negotiated optimally with the United States Trade Representative (USTR).

Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Susiwijono Moegiarso, was reluctant to reveal what commodities he meant. He only gave a signal that this commodity was the mainstay of Indonesian exports to Uncle Sam's country.

"Later there will be a little surprise for several commodities whose exports are very high to America, we have succeeded in negotiating very optimally and becoming a driver for our economy in the first quarter of 2026," he explained at the 2nd Decade Commemoration of the Association of Priority Line Companies (APJP) at the Borobudur Hotel, Jakarta, Thursday (29/1/2026).

On the other hand, it is certain that business people will also leave for the US. They will be involved in one of a series of events during Prabowo's visit to the US, namely a meeting between businessmen from the two countries.

General Chairperson of the Indonesian Entrepreneurs Association (Apindo) Shinta W. Kamdani said there were around 20 entrepreneurs who would attend, consisting of various associations and related business actors.

"From us, maybe around 20 have been [confirmed], so far, we are still adding, maybe around 20," he explained to journalists after attending a meeting at the office of the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Jakarta, Thursday (12/2/2026).

Shinta admitted that all preparations for the national business meeting with US businessmen were complete. The businessmen who will accompany President Prabowo to the US are those who have an interest in the country from a trade perspective.

He explained that due to the agreement on lower import tariffs by the US, Indonesia had agreed to import more products or commodities from this superpower. For example, soybeans, wheat, corn and cotton.

From the Indonesian side, the entrepreneurs most interested in exports to the US are textiles, garments, shoes, furniture and palm oil (CPO). Especially for native commodities grown in Indonesia, such as cocoa and palm oil, Indonesia has succeeded in getting an exemption from the 19% tariff.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pemerintah menyiratkan bahwa akan ada 'kejutan' terkait dengan penandatanganan kesepakatan dagang atau agreement on reciprocal trade (ART) antara Indonesia dan Amerika Serikat (AS). 

Sekadar catatan, pemerintah Indonesia dan AS telah menyelesaikan seluruh proses negosiasi dan proses harmonisasi bahasa hukum (legal drafting) terkait dengan perjanjian dagang yang diawali dengan pengenaan tarif impor terhadap produk Indonesia 2025 lalu. 

Dari awalnya diancam dengan tarif 32%, Presiden Prabowo Subianto pada tahun lalu menyepakati dengan Presiden Donald Trump agar tarif bea masuk terhadap produk Indonesia diturunkan ke 19%. Sebaliknya, sebagian besar produk AS akan dikenai bea masuk 0%. 

Jelang penandatanganan ART yang dijadwalkan 19 Februari 2026 mendatang, keseluruhan hasil negosiasi dan penyusunan dokumen hukum perjanjian dagang itu telah disampaikan kepada Presiden Prabowo. Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto, yang memimpin tim negosiator, turut menyampaikan hasil dimaksud sehari sebelum Prabowo bertolak ke AS.

"Hadirnya para menteri bidang ekonomi di Hambalang [kediaman pribadi Prabowo] sebelum keberangkatan Presiden merupakan bentuk konsolidasi akhir agar posisi Indonesia solid dalam perundingan. Kita berharap akan ada kejutan-kejutan positif dari ART yang semakin menguntungkan Indonesia," kata Juru Bicara Kemenko Perekonomian Haryo Limanseto melalui siaran pers, Senin (16/2/2026). 

Haryo lalu menuturkan bahwa negosiasi tarif telah rampung dan kedua negara telah menyelesaikan proses harmonisasi bahasa hukum atau legal drafting.  

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo ke AS Bahas Perjanjian Dagang, Ekonom: Industri Tekstil Butuh Keringanan
  • Prabowo Bertemu Trump Rundingkan Tarif Bea Masuk, Apindo Minta Industri Padat Karya Dilindungi
  • Agenda Prabowo ke AS: Teken Kesepakatan Dagang, Ikut Pertemuan Board of Peace Trump

Selain tarif turun menjadi 19%, pemerintah AS turut mengecualikan tarif bagi sejumlah komoditas unggulan ekspor Indonesia termasuk minyak kelapa sawit atau crude palm oil (CPO), kopi dan kakao. 

Sebelumnya, Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian turut mengungkap terdapat sejumlah komoditas andalan ekspor dari Indonesia ke AS yang berhasil dinegosiasikan dengan optimal dengan pihak United States Trade Representative (USTR). 

Sekretaris Kemenko Perekonomian Susiwijono Moegiarso enggan mengungkap komoditas apa saja yang dimaksud olehnya. Dia hanya memberikan sinyal bahwa komoditas itu adalah andalan ekspor Indonesia ke Negara Paman Sam itu. 

"Nanti akan ada sedikit surprise beberapa komoditas yang ekspornya tinggi sekali ke Amerika, kami berhasil menegosiasikan sangat optimal dan menjadi pendorong ekonomi kita di kuartal 1 di tahun 2026," terangnya pada acara Peringatan 2 Dekade Asosiasi Perusahaan Jalur Prioritas (APJP) di Hotel Borobudur, Jakarta, Kamis (29/1/2026). 

Di sisi lain, kalangan pengusaha pun dipastikan bakal ikut bertolak ke AS. Mereka akan terlibat dalam salah satu rangkaian acara kunjungan Prabowo ke AS yakni pertemuan antara pengusaha kedua negara. 

Ketua Umum Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia (Apindo) Shinta W. Kamdani menyebut ada sekitar 20 pengusaha yang akan ikut hadir terdiri dari berbagai asosiasi maupun pelaku usaha terkait. 

"Dari kami mungkin sekitar yang udah [konfirmasi] ya, so far, masih terus nambah sih mungkin sekitar 20," terangnya kepada wartawan usai menghadiri pertemuan di kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Kamis (12/2/2026). 

Shinta mengaku seluruh persiapan untuk pertemuan pengusaha nasional dengan pengusaha AS itu sudah matang. Pengusaha yang akan ikut bersama Presiden Prabowo ke AS merupakan mereka yang berkepentingan dengan negara tersebut dari sisi perdagangan.  

Dia menjelaskan, atas kesepakatan tarif impor lebih rendah oleh AS, Indonesia telah menyetujui untuk mengimpor lebih banyak produk atau komoditas negara adidaya tersebut. Misalnya, kedelai, terigu, jagung maupun kapas.  

Dari sisi Indonesia, pengusaha yang paling berkepentingan dalam hal ekspor ke AS yakni tekstil, garmen, sepatu, mebel hingga minyak kelapa sawit (CPO). Khusus komoditas asli yang ditanam di Indonesia seperti kakao hingga sawit, Indonesia berhasil mendapatkan pengecualian dari tarif 19%.

title: Portrait of Indonesian Citizens' Expenditures: Upper Class Still Dominant, Lower Class Starting to Rise
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA -- The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) explained that the realization of Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 was 5.11%.

Despite recorded growth, the distribution of community income is still quite unequal despite improvements compared to previous years.

BPS as quoted on Wednesday (18/2/2026) noted that by September 2025, the top 20% of the population will have at least 44.80% of the total expenditure of the Indonesian population.

In terms of trend, this number is actually experiencing a decrease compared to September 2024 where the population of 20% and above was able to contribute 46.24% of the total population expenditure.

Meanwhile, in contrast to the top 20% of the population, people in the middle 40% population category have experienced an increase in their role. This group was recorded as having a contribution of 35.92% of total expenditure. There is an increase in contribution compared to September 2024 which was only 35.35%.

This trend also occurs in the bottom 40% of the population. Their contribution increased from 18.41% in September 2024 to 19.28% in September 2025.

Also Read

Meanwhile, Bank Indonesia (BI) reported that the average proportion of consumer income spent fell in January 2026, reaching its lowest point in the last 6 years.

Based on data from the BI Consumer Survey January 2026, the average portion of people's income used for consumption fell to 72.3%. This figure has decreased compared to the previous month's position which was still recorded at 74.3%.

In fact, if we take historical data further back, the level of 72.3% is the lowest record since December 2020 or six years ago, when the consumption portion touched 69.0% due to the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

This decrease in the spending portion was followed by an increase in the allocation of income which was diverted to savings and paying loan installments.

BI data shows that the proportion of income saved (savings) in January 2026 was at the level of 16.5%, an increase compared to the previous month which was 14.8%. This savings figure is also the highest since the beginning of 2023.

Apart from saving, people also appear to be more burdened by debt obligations. The ratio of loan installment payments to income was recorded to increase to 11.2% in January 2026, compared to 10.8% at the end of last year.

In terms of income demographics, the strongest action to hold money is carried out by the upper middle class.

The group with expenditures above IDR 5 million per month recorded the deepest decline in consumption share, namely only 70.1% of their total income.

On the other hand, the lower class who spend IDR 1-2 million per month still have to spend most of their income on living necessities, with the consumption ratio still high at 74.5%.

Anomaly with Consumer Confidence This phenomenon created an anomaly at the beginning of 2026. This is because the latest Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) showed an increase of 3.5 points, from 123.5 in December 2024 to 127 in January 2026, the highest figure in the last year or since January 2025 (127.2).

For information, the survey conducted by BI shows consumer confidence in current economic conditions and their expectations for the future. IKK is an indicator that can be used to predict developments in household consumption and savings.

IKK uses a reference year with a value of 100. This means that the consumer confidence index in January 2026 is in the optimistic zone or above the reference value.

"The Bank Indonesia Consumer Survey in January 2026 indicated that consumer confidence in economic conditions had increased compared to the previous month," said Executive Director of the BI Communications Department Ramdan Denny Prakoso in his statement, Monday (9/2/2026).

Based on expenditure, the increase in IKK in January occurred in almost all groups, namely >5 million (from 128.3 to 134.3); IDR 3.1—4 million (from 118.3 to 120.7); Rp. 2.1—3 million (from 117.9 to 121.2); and IDR 1—2 million (from 113.7 to 118.8). Meanwhile, the Rp. 4.1-5 million expenditure group decreased from 129.2 to 124.2.

The Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu) is preparing a strategy to accelerate the absorption of state spending to stimulate the circulation of money in society, after the allocation of public income for spending in early 2026 touched its lowest level in the last 6 years.

Director General of Economic and Fiscal Strategy at the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, stated that although data on the share of income for consumption has decreased, the Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) indicator has actually shown a consistent improving trend since September last year.

To mitigate the risk of holding back spending by households, Febrio emphasized that the government will take a more aggressive role through the State Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBN) instrument.

"So we will continue to maintain public consumption and government spending will also be faster. So that money can circulate a lot in the economy," he said in Jakarta at the Supreme Court Building, Jakarta, Monday (9/2/2026).

The subordinate of the Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, admitted that he was optimistic that this strategy could maintain the momentum of economic growth that had already been formed. He highlighted the achievement of economic growth in the fourth quarter of 2025 which recorded a significant reversal to the level of 5.39%.

The government, he continued, has the ambition to maintain this positive trend in the first three months of this year. In fact, the Ministry of Finance is targeting higher economic growth in the first quarter of 2026.

"So we hope that in Q1 [quarter I/2026] we will also maintain the momentum, so that we can maintain growth at around 5.5% and above," he said.

Furthermore, Febrio believes that if the growth target above 5.5% is achieved through a combination of maintained household consumption and increased government spending, job creation will follow automatically.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA -- Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) memaparkan realisasi pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia pada tahun 2025 sebanyak 5,11%.

Meski tercatat tumbuh, distribusi pendapatan masyarakat masih cukup timpang kendati ada perbaikan dibanding tahun-tahun sebelumnya.

BPS sebagaimana dikutip Rabu (18/2/2026) mencatat sampai dengan September 2025, 20% penduduk teratas setidaknya memiliki 44,80% dari total pengeluaran penduduk Indonesia. 

Secara tren jumlah ini sebenarnya mengalami penyusutan dibanding September 2024 dimana penduduk 20% ke atas mampu berkontribusi sebesar 46,24% dari total pengeluaran penduduk.

Sementara itu, berbanding terbalik dengan 20% penduduk teratas, masyarakat yang masuk kategori penduduk 40% menengah mengalami peningkatan peranannya. Kelompok ini tercatat memiliki kontribusi sebesar 35,92% dari total pengeluaran. Ada kenaikan kontribusi dibandingkan September 2024 yang hanya 35,35%.

Tren tersebut juga terjadi di dalam kelompok penduduk 40% terbawah. Kontribusi mereka naik dari 18,41% pada September 2024 menjadi 19,28% pada September 2025.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo Klaim Program MBG Dongkrak Konsumsi Rumah Tangga RI
  • Prabowo Bertemu Apindo, Bahas Konsumsi Rumah Tangga Naik Imbas MBG
  • Strategi Kemenkeu Genjot Konsumsi Ungkit Daya Beli Masyarakat Turun

Kondisi Pengeluaran Januari 2026

Sementara itu, Bank Indonesia (BI) melaporkan rata-rata proporsi pendapatan konsumen yang dibelanjakan anjlok pada Januari 2026, menyentuh titik terendah dalam kurun waktu 6 tahun terakhir.

Berdasarkan data Survei Konsumen BI Januari 2026, rata-rata porsi pendapatan masyarakat yang digunakan untuk konsumsi turun ke level 72,3%. Angka ini merosot dibandingkan posisi bulan sebelumnya yang masih mencatatkan angka 74,3%.

Bahkan, jika ditarik data historis lebih jauh ke belakang maka level 72,3% itu merupakan rekor terendah sejak Desember 2020 atau enam tahun lalu, yang mana porsi konsumsi sempat menyentuh 69,0% akibat hantaman pandemi Covid-19.

Penurunan porsi belanja ini diikuti peningkatan alokasi pendapatan yang dialihkan untuk simpanan atau tabungan dan membayar cicilan pinjaman.

Data BI menunjukkan, proporsi pendapatan yang disimpan (tabungan) pada Januari 2026 ada di level 16,5%, naik dibandingkan bulan sebelumnya yang sebesar 14,8%. Angka tabungan ini juga merupakan yang tertinggi sejak awal 2023.

Selain menabung, masyarakat juga tampak lebih terbebani oleh kewajiban utang. Rasio pembayaran cicilan pinjaman terhadap pendapatan tercatat naik menjadi 11,2% pada Januari 2026, dibandingkan 10,8% pada akhir tahun lalu.

Secara demografi pendapatan, aksi tahan uang paling kencang dilakukan oleh kelompok masyarakat kelas menengah-atas.

Kelompok dengan pengeluaran di atas Rp5 juta per bulan mencatatkan penurunan porsi konsumsi paling dalam, yaitu hanya 70,1% dari total pendapatan mereka.

Sebaliknya, kelompok masyarakat bawah dengan pengeluaran Rp1-2 juta per bulan masih harus membelanjakan sebagian besar pendapatannya untuk kebutuhan hidup, dengan rasio konsumsi yang masih tinggi di level 74,5%.

Anomali dengan Keyakinan Konsumen
Fenomena ini menciptakan sebuah anomali pada awal 2026. Pasalnya, Indeks Keyakinan Konsumen (IKK) terbaru menunjukkan kenaikan 3,5 poin, dari 123,5 pada Desember 2024 menjadi 127 pada Januari 2026, angka tertinggi dalam setahun terakhir atau sejak Januari 2025 (127,2).

Sebagai informasi, survei yang dilakukan oleh BI itu menunjukkan keyakinan konsumen terhadap kondisi ekonomi saat ini dan ekspektasi mereka terhadap masa depan. IKK merupakan indikator yang dapat digunakan untuk memprediksi perkembangan konsumsi dan tabungan rumah tangga.

IKK menggunakan tahun acuan dengan nilai 100. Artinya indeks kepercayaan konsumen pada Januari 2026 berada di zona optimistis atau di atas nilai acuan.

"Survei Konsumen Bank Indonesia pada Januari 2026 mengindikasikan keyakinan konsumen terhadap kondisi ekonomi meningkat dibandingkan dengan bulan sebelumnya," kata Direktur Eksekutif Departemen Komunikasi BI Ramdan Denny Prakoso dalam keterangannya, Senin (9/2/2026).

Berdasarkan pengeluaran, kenaikan IKK Januari terjadi di hampir semua kelompok yaitu >5 juta (dari 128,3 menjadi 134,3); Rp3,1—4 juta (dari 118,3 menjadi 120,7); Rp2,1—3 juta (dari 117,9 menjadi 121,2); dan Rp1—2 juta (dari 113,7 menjadi 118,8). Sementara kelompok pengeluaran Rp4,1—5 juta menurunkan dari 129,2 menjadi 124,2.

Apa Strategi Pemerintah?

Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu) menyiapkan strategi untuk mempercepat penyerapan belanja negara guna memacu perputaran uang di masyarakat, usai alokasi pendapatan masyarakat untuk belanja pada awal 2026 menyentuh level terendah dalam 6 tahun terakhir.

Direktur Jenderal Strategi Ekonomi dan Fiskal Kemenkeu Febrio Nathan Kacaribu menyatakan, meskipun data porsi pendapatan untuk konsumsi menurun, indikator Indeks Keyakinan Konsumen (IKK) sebenarnya menunjukkan tren perbaikan yang konsisten sejak September tahun lalu.

Untuk memitigasi risiko penahanan belanja oleh rumah tangga, Febrio menegaskan pemerintah akan mengambil peran lebih agresif melalui instrumen Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara (APBN).

"Jadi kita akan terus jaga konsumsi masyarakat dan juga belanja pemerintah juga kita pasti akan lebih cepat. Jadi supaya uang bisa berputar banyak di perekonomian," ujarnya di Jakarta di Gedung Mahkamah Agung, Jakarta, Senin (9/2/2026).

Anak buah Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa itu mengaku optimistis strategi ini dapat menjaga momentum pertumbuhan ekonomi yang sudah terbentuk. Dia menyoroti capaian pertumbuhan ekonomi pada kuartal IV/2025 yang mencatatkan pembalikan signifikan ke level 5,39%.

Pemerintah, lanjutnya, berambisi menjaga tren positif tersebut pada tiga bulan pertama tahun ini. Bahkan, Kemenkeu membidik pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal I/2026 yang lebih tinggi.

"Jadi kita harapkan di Q1 [kuartal I/2026] ini juga momentumnya kita jaga, sehingga kita bisa jaga pertumbuhannya di sekitar 5,5% ke atas," ungkapnya.

Lebih lanjut, Febrio meyakini bahwa jika target pertumbuhan di atas 5,5% tersebut tercapai melalui kombinasi konsumsi rumah tangga yang dijaga dan belanja pemerintah yang digeber maka penciptaan lapangan kerja akan mengikuti secara otomatis.

title: RI Textile Industry Awaits 'Luck' Prabowo–Trump Meeting
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Indonesian textile and textile products (TPT) industry has full hopes for the results of President Prabowo Subianto's meeting with United States President Donald Trump, namely a reciprocal tariff reduction.

The Association of Indonesian Fiber and Filament Yarn Producers (APSyFI) emphasized that although the United States market is strategic, the burden of tariffs makes it difficult for local products to compete with other countries that enjoy more competitive treatment.

The General Chair of APSyFI, Redma Gita Wirawasta, stated to Bisnis that reducing reciprocal tariffs was the only way for the Indonesian spinning industry to become competitive again in Uncle Sam's country.

"Of course we hope that the US will provide tariff relief so that our exports to the US can become competitive again, even though this is difficult without improvements on the industrial side," said Redma, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

However, the realization of tariff reductions is not without challenges. The US asked Indonesia to increase cotton purchases from Uncle Sam's country as a condition for reducing tariffs from the previous 32% to 19%.

This request is a dilemma, because the utilization rate of the Indonesian spinning industry is currently still below 50%. This means that the ability to absorb additional cotton is very limited.

Also Read

APSyFI data notes that before the Covid-19 pandemic, Indonesia's total cotton imports reached around 600,000 tonnes per year, with half coming from the US.

However, the import trend since 2022 has continued to decline, and in 2025 total imports will be recorded at only around 300,000 tonnes, with the portion from the US remaining at 70,000 tonnes. This decline reflects sluggish production activity in the spinning sector in recent years.

"So as long as the utilization of the spinning industry is below 50%, it is unlikely that our cotton imports from the US will increase," explained Redma.

Pressure on the industry does not only come from cotton, but also from the flood of imported products which are suspected of being sold through dumping practices, both in the form of cloth and yarn. This condition puts pressure on the domestic market and erodes demand for local products.

"It is impossible for spinning utilization to increase as long as dumped imported goods continue to flood the domestic market. Because the industry's main need is the market and fair competition," added Redma.

The national textile industry now depends on the government's ability in trade diplomacy. The success of the Prabowo–Trump meeting could potentially pave the way for lower tariffs and more competitive market access.

APSyFI hopes that diplomatic efforts will not only focus on reducing tariffs, but will also be accompanied by improvements within the country: adequate market protection, fair business competition, and support for increasing production capacity.

However, as trade observers highlight, the industry's reliance on one market — the US — also makes the sector vulnerable. CSIS researcher, Yoshe Rizal Damuri, emphasized the importance of market diversification so that the industry does not stop when there are changes in tariff or regulatory policies in the US.

“Our competitors are not necessarily cheaper, but they can benefit from preferential tariffs and clear trade rules,” Yoshe said.

The advantage of other countries, such as Vietnam, lies in market access through free trade agreements which provide more competitive tariffs, while Indonesia still faces high tariffs, so its competitiveness is relatively lagging behind.

A similar phenomenon also occurs in the footwear industry. The United States is the main market with around 40% of total exports, and reciprocal tariff increases threaten the competitiveness of Indonesian products.

Head of Aprisindo's Trade & International Negotiations Division, Devi Kusumaningtyas, said that the entry tariff for Indonesian footwear to the US was already very high, namely 7% -35%, and increased by 19% due to reciprocal tariffs.

"With these additional tariffs, total import duties could increase sharply and burden producers' cost structures," he said.

This shows that the tariff negotiations were successful not only important for textiles, but also for other manufacturing sectors that depend on the US market.

Business people consider policy certainty to be the main factor in restoring investor confidence.

Deputy General Chair of Apindo, Sanny Iskandar, emphasized the importance of active communication between the government and business actors. Dialogue forums, including direct meetings with the President, provide space for the business world to convey obstacles and offer solutions.

"We also convey the obstacles in the field but also provide solutions," said Sanny.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Industri tekstil dan produk tekstil (TPT) Indonesia berharap penuh pada hasil pertemuan Presiden Prabowo Subianto dengan Presiden Amerika Serikat Donald Trump yakni penurunan tarif resiprokal.

Asosiasi Produsen Serat dan Benang Filamen Indonesia (APSyFI) menegaskan bahwa meskipun pasar Amerika Serikat strategis, beban tarif membuat produk lokal sulit bersaing dengan negara lain yang menikmati perlakuan lebih kompetitif.

Ketua Umum APSyFI, Redma Gita Wirawasta, menyatakan kepada Bisnis bahwa penurunan tarif resiprokal merupakan satu-satunya jalan agar industri pemintalan Indonesia kembali kompetitif di Negeri Paman Sam.

“Tentunya kami berharap AS akan memberikan keringanan tarif agar ekspor kita ke AS bisa kembali bersaing meskipun hal itu sulit tanpa ada perbaikan di sisi industrinya,” kata Redma, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Namun, realisasi penurunan tarif bukan tanpa tantangan. AS meminta Indonesia meningkatkan pembelian kapas (cotton) dari Negeri Paman Sam sebagai syarat untuk menurunkan tarif dari sebelumnya 32% menjadi 19%.

Permintaan ini menjadi dilema, karena tingkat utilisasi industri pemintalan Indonesia saat ini masih di bawah 50%. Artinya, kemampuan untuk menyerap kapas tambahan sangat terbatas.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo Bertemu Trump, Industri Tekstil Berharap Keringanan Tarif dari AS
  • Prabowo ke AS Bahas Perjanjian Dagang, Ekonom: Industri Tekstil Butuh Keringanan
  • Daftar Sektor Manufaktur yang Terkontraksi pada 2025, Tekstil Tak Termasuk

Data APSyFI mencatat, sebelum pandemi Covid-19, total impor kapas Indonesia mencapai sekitar 600.000 ton per tahun, dengan setengahnya berasal dari AS.

Namun, tren impor sejak 2022 terus menurun, dan pada 2025 total impor tercatat hanya sekitar 300.000 ton, dengan porsi dari AS tinggal 70.000 ton. Penurunan ini mencerminkan lesunya aktivitas produksi di sektor pemintalan dalam beberapa tahun terakhir.

“Jadi selama utilisasi industri pemintalan berada di bawah 50%, kecil kemungkinan impor kapas kita dari AS bisa naik,” jelas Redma.

Tekanan terhadap industri tidak hanya datang dari kapas, tetapi juga dari membanjirnya produk impor yang diduga dijual dengan praktik dumping, baik dalam bentuk kain maupun benang. Kondisi ini menekan pasar domestik dan menggerus permintaan terhadap produk lokal.

“Utilisasi pemintalan tidak mungkin bisa naik selama barang-barang impor dumping masih membanjiri pasar domestik. Karena kebutuhan utama industri hanyalah pasar dan persaingannya yang fair,” tambah Redma.

Ketergantungan Industri pada Diplomasi Perdagangan

Industri tekstil nasional kini bergantung pada kemampuan pemerintah dalam diplomasi perdagangan. Keberhasilan pertemuan Prabowo–Trump berpotensi membuka jalan bagi tarif lebih rendah dan akses pasar yang lebih kompetitif.

APSyFI berharap upaya diplomasi tidak hanya fokus pada penurunan tarif, tetapi juga diiringi pembenahan di dalam negeri: perlindungan pasar yang memadai, persaingan usaha yang adil, dan dukungan terhadap peningkatan kapasitas produksi.

Namun, seperti disoroti pengamat perdagangan, ketergantungan industri pada satu pasar — AS — juga membuat sektor ini rentan. Peneliti CSIS, Yoshe Rizal Damuri, menekankan pentingnya diversifikasi pasar agar industri tidak terhenti ketika terjadi perubahan kebijakan tarif atau regulasi di AS.

“Pesaing kita tidak selalu lebih murah, tetapi mereka bisa diuntungkan oleh tarif preferensial dan aturan perdagangan yang jelas,” kata Yoshe.

Keunggulan negara lain, seperti Vietnam, terletak pada akses pasar melalui perjanjian dagang bebas yang memberikan tarif lebih kompetitif, sementara Indonesia masih menghadapi tarif yang tinggi, sehingga daya saingnya relatif tertinggal.

Sektor Alas Kaki Tertekan

Fenomena serupa juga terjadi pada industri alas kaki. Amerika Serikat menjadi pasar utama dengan porsi sekitar 40% dari total ekspor, dan kenaikan tarif resiprokal mengancam daya saing produk Indonesia.

Ketua Bidang Perdagangan & Perundingan Internasional Aprisindo, Devi Kusumaningtyas, menyebut tarif masuk untuk alas kaki Indonesia ke AS sudah sangat tinggi, yakni 7%-35%, dan bertambah 19% akibat tarif resiprokal.

“Dengan tambahan tarif tersebut, total bea masuk bisa melonjak tajam dan membebani struktur biaya produsen,” ujarnya.

Hal ini menunjukkan bahwa keberhasilan negosiasi tarif tidak hanya penting bagi tekstil, tetapi juga bagi sektor manufaktur lain yang tergantung pada pasar AS.

Kalangan dunia usaha menilai kepastian kebijakan menjadi faktor utama untuk memulihkan kepercayaan investor.

Wakil Ketua Umum Apindo, Sanny Iskandar, menekankan pentingnya komunikasi aktif antara pemerintah dan pelaku usaha. Forum dialog, termasuk pertemuan langsung dengan Presiden, memberi ruang bagi dunia usaha untuk menyampaikan hambatan sekaligus menawarkan solusi.

“Kita juga sampaikan hambatan di lapangan namun juga memberikan solusinya,” ujar Sanny.
