Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Industri alas kaki nasional menghadapi tekanan berat akibat lonjakan tarif dagang Amerika Serikat (AS) dalam setahun terakhir. Kebijakan tersebut dinilai akan membebani kinerja ekspor di tengah kondisi ekonomi global yang belum pulih sepenuhnya.

Peneliti CSIS Yoshe Rizal Damuri mengatakan tekanan tarif tersebut dapat memperlemah daya saing produk nasional di tengah ketatnya persaingan pasar global, terutama di pasar utama seperti AS dan Uni Eropa.

Menurut Yoshe, risiko terhadap rantai pasok dan ketergantungan pada komoditas impor juga meningkat seiring kebijakan proteksionis yang ditempuh sejumlah negara. Dia menilai kondisi ini membuat pelaku industri harus lebih cermat membaca dinamika pasar dan arah kebijakan perdagangan global.

“Pesaing kita tidak selalu lebih murah, tetapi mereka bisa diuntungkan oleh tarif preferensial dan aturan perdagangan yang jelas,” ujar Yoshe kepada Bisnis, dikutip Selasa (17/2/2026).

Dia menjelaskan, negara seperti Vietnam memang belum tentu memiliki biaya produksi lebih rendah dari Indonesia. Namun, keunggulan Vietnam terletak pada akses pasar melalui perjanjian dagang yang memberikan tarif lebih kompetitif serta kepastian regulasi.

Dalam konteks pasar Uni Eropa, misalnya, Vietnam telah lebih dulu menikmati tarif 0% melalui perjanjian dagang bebas. Sementara itu, Indonesia masih menghadapi tarif yang lebih tinggi sehingga posisi kompetitifnya relatif tertinggal. “Dalam situasi saat ini, semakin penting bagi kita untuk melakukan diversifikasi pasar,” tuturnya.

Baca Juga

  • Pengusaha Alas Kaki Waswas Investor Kabur ke India, Ini Penyebabnya
  • Aprisindo Target Ekspor Alas Kaki Capai Rp169 Triliun dalam 3 Tahun ke Depan
  • Buruh Sektor Padat Karya Bebas Pajak di 2026, Begini Respons Pengusaha Alas Kaki

Yoshe menekankan bahwa ketergantungan yang besar pada satu pasar, seperti AS, membuat industri nasional lebih rentan ketika terjadi perubahan kebijakan seperti tarif resiprokal. Diversifikasi dinilai menjadi strategi penting untuk menjaga stabilitas ekspor.

Selain soal tarif, ia juga menyoroti tren regulasi keberlanjutan yang semakin ketat di berbagai negara tujuan ekspor. Industri alas kaki Indonesia perlu bersiap menghadapi tuntutan standar lingkungan dan ketertelusuran rantai pasok yang lebih tinggi.

“Kita juga perlu bersiap menghadapi aturan keberlanjutan yang lebih ketat dan tuntutan ketertelusuran rantai pasok,” tuturnya.

Di sisi lain, Yoshe menilai peningkatan produktivitas menjadi kunci untuk meredam beban biaya, termasuk dampak tarif resiprokal AS. Upaya tersebut dapat dilakukan melalui perbaikan operasional di tingkat perusahaan, digitalisasi proses produksi, serta peningkatan keterampilan tenaga kerja agar industri tetap kompetitif di tengah tekanan perdagangan global.

Untuk diketahui, Asosiasi Persepatuan Indonesia (Aprisindo) mencatat Amerika Serikat merupakan pasar utama bagi produk alas kaki Indonesia dengan porsi sekitar 40% dari total ekspor. Ketergantungan ini membuat setiap perubahan tarif langsung berdampak signifikan terhadap pelaku industri di dalam negeri.

Ketua Bidang Perdagangan & Perundingan Internasional Aprisindo Devi Kusumaningtyas mengatakan tarif dasar produk lokal ke AS sudah terlampau tinggi dan makin terbebani dengan kebijakan tarif resiprokal. 

“Sedangkan sektor alas kaki itu untuk tarif masuk ke AS yang normal aja, sudah paling tinggi dari semua sektor yang ada. Jadi kita itu sekitar 7%-35% tarif masuk untuk alas kaki ke AS. Jadi sangat tinggi,” jelasnya. 

Kenaikan dilakukan secara bertahap sejak tahun lalu dan menambah beban biaya masuk bagi eksportir Indonesia.

Tambahan tarif tersebut membuat struktur biaya semakin berat, terutama bagi produsen yang margin keuntungannya tidak terlalu besar. Kenaikan ini dinilai berpotensi menekan daya saing produk Indonesia dibanding negara pesaing seperti Vietnam dan China.

Dengan tambahan 19% di luar tarif normal, total bea masuk untuk sejumlah produk bisa melonjak tajam. Dalam kondisi tertentu, beban tarif bahkan bisa menembus lebih dari separuh harga barang sebelum masuk ke pasar AS.

Pelaku usaha menyebut kenaikan tarif bukan hanya berdampak pada harga jual, tetapi juga mengganggu rencana ekspansi. Dana yang seharusnya dialokasikan untuk investasi mesin dan peningkatan kapasitas produksi justru tersedot untuk membayar bea masuk.

“Jadi cost-nya itu banyak kan untuk bayar tarif gitu kan. Bukan untuk investasi baru, bukan untuk beli mesin gitu kan,” terangnya.

Di tengah tekanan tersebut, industri berharap ada upaya negosiasi yang bisa memperbaiki akses pasar ke AS. Tanpa perbaikan kebijakan tarif, laju pertumbuhan ekspor alas kaki Indonesia diperkirakan akan tertahan dalam jangka pendek.

“Kami sangat apresiasi dari pemerintah juga, kita berkoordinasi sangat dekat dan sangat di-engage oleh lead negosiator kita. Untuk alas kaki ini kira-kira argumen apa yang bisa disampaikan kepada pemerintah Amerika,” terangnya. 

Dia menilai mestinya pemerintah masih memiliki ruang negosiasi seiring dengan kebutuhan alas kaki AS yang impor 97%. Indonesia sebagai eksportir ketiga setelah China dan Vietnam dapat masuk mengambil peluang lebih besar.

title: A total of 685,413 vehicles left Jabotabek during the 2026 Chinese New Year celebration
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk. It was recorded that 685,413 vehicles were recorded leaving the Jabotabek area during the H-4 to H-1 period of the 2026 Chinese New Year holiday.

This volume passes through four main toll gates (GT), namely GT Cikupa towards Merak, GT Ciawi towards Puncak, GT Cikampek Utama towards Trans Java, and GT Kalihurip Utama towards Bandung.

Jasa Marga Main Director Rivan A. Purwantono said this number had increased by 15.32% compared to normal traffic. This increase reflects the high mobility of people taking advantage of the momentum of the long Chinese New Year holiday.

Of the total vehicles leaving Jabotabek, the majority headed to the East (Trans Java and Bandung) with 322,277 vehicles or 47.0%. Meanwhile, 192,713 vehicles or 28.1% headed west (Merak), and 170,423 vehicles or 24.9% headed south (Puncak).

In the East direction, vehicles heading to Trans Java via GT Cikampek Utama on the Jakarta-Cikampek Toll Road were recorded at 149,663 units or an increase of 27.81% compared to normal conditions. Meanwhile, vehicles heading to Bandung via GT Kalihurip Utama on the Cipularang Toll Road reached 172,614 units or an increase of 28.14%.

In total, vehicles heading to Trans Java and Bandung via the two toll gates reached 322,277 units or an increase of 27.98% from normal traffic.

Also Read

Meanwhile, for the West direction towards Merak via GT Cikupa on the Tangerang-Merak Toll Road, there were 192,713 vehicles recorded. This figure is slightly lower by 0.08% compared to normal traffic.

Meanwhile, vehicles heading towards the South or Puncak via GT Ciawi on the Jagorawi Toll Road reached 170,423 units, an increase of 13.87% from normal conditions.

On D-1 of the Chinese New Year holiday or February 16 2026, the volume of vehicles leaving Jabotabek via the four main GTs still showed an increase. It was recorded that 148,232 vehicles passed or an increase of 13.47% compared to normal traffic.

"Meanwhile, for vehicles returning to Jabotabek, we also saw an increase in the number of vehicles. A total of 165,041 vehicles returned to Jabotabek via the four main GTs in the same period. The total traffic volume returning to Jabotabek increased by 27.25% compared to normal traffic," said Rivan in his official statement, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

He added that the flow of vehicles returning to Jabotabek on Tuesday, February 17 2026 is expected to still increase. Jasa Marga projects vehicle volume to reach around 173,000 units or an increase of 33.0% compared to normal traffic.

For this reason, the public is advised to plan their trips carefully, avoid times and points prone to congestion, and utilize the latest traffic information in real time, including through the Travoy application.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk. mencatat sebanyak 685.413 kendaraan tercatat meninggalkan wilayah Jabotabek pada periode H-4 hingga H-1 libur Tahun Baru Imlek 2026. 

Volume tersebut melintas melalui empat gerbang tol (GT) utama, yakni GT Cikupa arah Merak, GT Ciawi arah Puncak, GT Cikampek Utama arah Trans Jawa, serta GT Kalihurip Utama arah Bandung.

Direktur Utama Jasa Marga Rivan A. Purwantono mengatakan jumlah tersebut meningkat 15,32% dibandingkan lalu lintas normal. Kenaikan ini mencerminkan tingginya mobilitas masyarakat memanfaatkan momentum libur panjang Imlek.

Dari total kendaraan yang meninggalkan Jabotabek, mayoritas mengarah ke Timur (Trans Jawa dan Bandung) sebanyak 322.277 kendaraan atau 47,0%. Sementara itu, 192.713 kendaraan atau 28,1% menuju arah Barat (Merak), dan 170.423 kendaraan atau 24,9% menuju arah Selatan (Puncak).

Untuk arah Timur, kendaraan yang menuju Trans Jawa melalui GT Cikampek Utama di Jalan Tol Jakarta-Cikampek tercatat sebanyak 149.663 unit atau naik 27,81% dibandingkan kondisi normal. Sementara, kendaraan menuju Bandung melalui GT Kalihurip Utama di Jalan Tol Cipularang mencapai 172.614 unit atau meningkat 28,14%.

Secara total, kendaraan menuju Trans Jawa dan Bandung melalui kedua gerbang tol tersebut mencapai 322.277 unit atau naik 27,98% dari lalu lintas normal.

Sementara itu, untuk arah Barat menuju Merak melalui GT Cikupa di Jalan Tol Tangerang-Merak, tercatat sebanyak 192.713 kendaraan. Angka ini sedikit lebih rendah 0,08% dibandingkan lalu lintas normal.

Adapun, kendaraan menuju arah Selatan atau Puncak melalui GT Ciawi di Jalan Tol Jagorawi mencapai 170.423 unit, meningkat 13,87% dari kondisi normal.

Pada H-1 libur Imlek atau 16 Februari 2026, volume kendaraan yang meninggalkan Jabotabek melalui empat GT utama masih menunjukkan peningkatan. Tercatat sebanyak 148.232 kendaraan melintas atau naik 13,47% dibandingkan lalu lintas normal.

“Sementara itu, untuk kendaraan yang kembali ke Jabotabek, kami juga melihat adanya peningkatan jumlah kendaraan. Total sebanyak 165.041 kendaraan telah kembali ke Jabotabek melalui empat GT utama di periode yang sama. Total volume lalin kembali ke Jabotabek ini naik 27,25% jika dibandingkan lalin normal,” ujar Rivan dalam keterangan resminya, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Dia menambahkan, arus kendaraan kembali ke Jabotabek pada Selasa, 17 Februari 2026 diperkirakan masih meningkat. Jasa Marga memproyeksikan volume kendaraan mencapai sekitar 173.000 unit atau naik 33,0% dibandingkan lalu lintas normal. 

Untuk itu, masyarakat diimbau merencanakan perjalanan dengan cermat, menghindari waktu dan titik rawan kepadatan, serta memanfaatkan informasi lalu lintas terkini secara real time, termasuk melalui aplikasi Travoy.

title: Danantara and Perminas Work on the Indonesia-Gabon Rare Earth Metal Ecosystem
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Perusahaan Mineral Nasional (Persero) or Perminas together with Danantara has collaborated with New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd (NEM) to develop a rare earth metal ecosystem.

The agreement was marked by the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Monday (16/2/2026) which includes an evaluation of the resource potential of niobium and rare earth elements (REE) Maboumine in the Republic of Gabon, as well as downstream initiatives in Indonesia.

Danantara Indonesia CEO Rosan Roeslani stated that the next phase of national industrial growth requires strong access to strategic inputs, as well as the ability to convert them into competitive downstream products.

"This cooperation framework is in line with this ambition and supports the development of a future-oriented strategic critical mineral value chain," said Rosan in an official statement, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

Through this partnership, Indonesia is projected to act as a platform for downstream processing, manufacturing and industrial integration. The collaboration covers the entire value chain, from separation, refining, metal production, to high-performance permanent magnet manufacturing.

Perminas President Director Gilarsi Wahju Setijono emphasized the company's commitment to pushing the strategic goals of downstream industrialization.

Also Read

"This MoU creates a structured pathway to connect upstream potential with downstream value creation, in line with strong governance," he said.

Strategic materials such as niobium (Nb) and rare earth metals such as neodymium (Nd) and praseodymium (Pr) are said to be key components for the production of permanent magnets. This material is essential for the electric vehicle (EV) industry, wind turbines, and advanced defense applications.

To speed up project realization, the parties have formed a Joint Working Group. Apart from technical aspects, fast-track negotiations regarding potential financing and strategic investments will also begin.

Meanwhile, Danantara and Perminas are opening opportunities for equity and debt participation in the Maboumine mine and related project entities to capture the full benefits of this vertical integration.

Head of the Mineral Industry Agency (BIM) Brian Yuliarto added that the collaboration also marks a new phase of Indonesia's involvement in the global critical mineral market. Collaboration with NEM is considered proof of increasing international partners' confidence in the country's industrial capacity.

"Through this partnership, Indonesia aims to encourage the development of domestic industry, while strengthening its participation in the global critical mineral market," said Brian Yuliarto.

On the other hand, President of New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd Abduljabbar Alsayegh also appreciated Indonesia's vision in advancing the critical mineral value chain. According to him, this agenda is increasingly important for the global energy transition and technological leadership in the future.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Perusahaan Mineral Nasional (Persero) atau Perminas bersama Danantara menjalin kolaborasi dengan New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd (NEM) untuk mengembangkan ekosistem logam tanah jarang.

Kesepakatan tersebut ditandai dengan penandatanganan Nota Kesepahaman (MoU) pada Senin (16/2/2026) yang mencakup evaluasi potensi sumber daya niobium dan logam tanah jarang atau rare earth elements (REE) Maboumine di Republik Gabon, sekaligus inisiatif hilirisasi di Indonesia.

CEO Danantara Indonesia Rosan Roeslani menyatakan fase pertumbuhan industri nasional berikutnya memerlukan akses kuat terhadap input strategis, serta kemampuan mengonversinya menjadi produk hilir yang kompetitif.

"Kerangka kerja sama ini selaras dengan ambisi tersebut dan mendukung pengembangan rantai nilai mineral kritis strategis yang berorientasi masa depan,” ujar Rosan dalam keterangan resmi, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Melalui kemitraan ini, Indonesia diproyeksikan berperan sebagai platform pemrosesan hilir, manufaktur, dan integrasi industri. Kolaborasi tersebut mencakup seluruh rantai nilai, mulai dari pemisahan, pemurnian, produksi logam, hingga manufaktur magnet permanen berkinerja tinggi.

Direktur Utama Perminas Gilarsi Wahju Setijono menegaskan komitmen perusahaan dalam mendorong tujuan strategis industrialisasi hilir. 

Baca Juga

  • BIM Usulkan Perminas Garap Tambang Logam Tanah Jarang di Mamuju
  • United Tractors (UNTR) Buka Suara soal Pengalihan Agincourt Resources ke Perminas
  • Bos Danantara Ungkap Perminas Bakal Garap Tambang Tanah Jarang

"MoU ini menciptakan jalur terstruktur untuk menghubungkan potensi hulu dengan penciptaan nilai hilir, selaras dengan tata kelola yang kuat,” tuturnya.

Material strategis seperti niobium (Nb) serta logam tanah jarang seperti neodymium (Nd) dan praseodymium (Pr) disebut sebagai komponen kunci untuk produksi magnet permanen. Material ini esensial bagi industri kendaraan listrik (electric vehicle/EV), turbin angin, hingga aplikasi pertahanan tingkat lanjut.

Adapun untuk mempercepat realisasi proyek, para pihak telah membentuk Joint Working Group. Selain aspek teknis, negosiasi jalur cepat terkait potensi pembiayaan dan investasi strategis juga akan dimulai.

Sementara itu, Danantara dan Perminas membuka peluang partisipasi ekuitas maupun utang pada tambang Maboumine dan entitas proyek terkait guna menangkap manfaat penuh dari integrasi vertikal ini.

Kepala Badan Industri Mineral (BIM) Brian Yuliarto menambahkan bahwa kerja sama turut menandai fase baru keterlibatan Indonesia di pasar mineral kritis global. Kerja sama dengan NEM dianggap sebagai bukti meningkatnya kepercayaan mitra internasional terhadap kapasitas industri tanah air.

"Melalui kemitraan ini, Indonesia bertujuan mendorong pengembangan industri dalam negeri, sekaligus memperkuat partisipasinya dalam pasar mineral kritis global,” kata Brian Yuliarto. 

Di sisi lain, President New Energy Metals Holdings Ltd Abduljabbar Alsayegh juga mengapresiasi visi Indonesia dalam memajukan rantai nilai mineral kritis. Menurutnya, agenda tersebut semakin penting bagi transisi energi global dan kepemimpinan teknologi di masa depan.

title: Jasa Marga (JSMR) Records Nusantara Regional Toll Traffic Volume Increases 9.1%
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk. (JSMR) through the Jasamarga Nusantara Tollroad Regional Division (JNT) recorded an increase in traffic volume of up to 9.1% ahead of the 2026 Chinese New Year holiday.

Based on data for the period 13-16 February 2026 or H-4 to H-1 Chinese New Year, the total volume of vehicles passing reached 801,449 units. This figure exceeds the normal traffic volume which usually reaches 734,571 vehicles.

"Overall, the total traffic volume was recorded at 801,449 vehicles. This number increased by 9.1% from the normal total traffic volume of 734,571 vehicles," wrote Jasa Marga's official statement, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

This increase in vehicle flow is spread across five main segments of the Indonesian Archipelago, starting from Sumatra to the functional segment in Central Java.

The Solo–Yogyakarta–NYIA Kulon Progo toll road section, the Kartasura–Prambanan segment recorded the highest percentage increase, reaching 36.5%. It was recorded that 82,188 vehicles passed on this route, where the flow to Yogyakarta via the Prambanan Toll Gate (GT) jumped 45.97% compared to normal conditions.

In Kalimantan, the Balikpapan–Samarinda toll road section also recorded significant growth of 21.4% with a total of 54,615 vehicles.

Also Read

Meanwhile, in the main tourist destination, the Nusa Dua–Ngurah Rai–Benoa Toll Road in Bali recorded a volume of 236,101 vehicles or an increase of 8.3%. In the North Sumatra region, the Belawan–Medan–Tanjung Morawa (Belmera) toll road remains the busiest with a volume of 331,172 vehicles.

The traffic flow entering and leaving Medan City via GT Amplas increased on average in the range of 5.7% to 8.9%. Furthermore, the Medan–Kualanamu–Tebing Tinggi (MKTT) toll road section recorded traffic of 69,862 vehicles, an increase of 11.8%.

Specifically, access to Kualanamu International Airport via GT Kualanamu experienced an increase in mobility of 16.78%. Jasa Marga management urges road users to anticipate travel during this long holiday period by ensuring that the vehicle and driver's physical condition is in top condition.

title: Almost 1 Million Train Tickets Sold during Chinese New Year Holidays, Yogyakarta's Favorite Destination
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — PT Kereta Api Indonesia (Persero) or KAI noted the high mobility of people using trains during the 2026 Chinese New Year holidays.

KAI Vice President Corporate Communication Anne Purba said that 985,426 departure tickets for the period 13-17 February 2026 had been sold, out of a total of 825,086 seats provided.

According to him, this number still has the potential to increase because ticket sales continue until close to departure time.

"KAI expresses its appreciation for the trust of the public in choosing trains as a mode of transportation during the long Chinese New Year holiday," he explained in an official statement, quoted on Tuesday (17/2/2026).

He further said that the average daily occupancy during the four long holidays was recorded to exceed 100%. At the peak of the return flow, ticket sales even exceeded the available seating capacity.

This condition is influenced by dynamic travel patterns, with passengers getting on and off at intermediate stations, so that one seat can be used by more than one customer in one trip.

Also Read

During the four-day transportation period from 13–16 February 2026, KAI recorded that it had served 813,141 customers in various travel relationships.

Entering the last day of the long holiday period on Tuesday (17/2/2026), the volume of return flow is projected to increase with the number of customers reaching more than 172,285 people.

"We urge customers to use the official KAI channel to obtain accurate and safe information. See you on your next trip," he concluded.

title: IMF Suggests Increase in Payroll Tax for APBN, Beware of Burden on Middle Class!
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Center for Indonesia Taxation Analysis (CITA) criticizes the latest report from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) which presents a scenario for expanding public investment to achieve the vision of a Golden Indonesia 2045 or a developed country on the 100th anniversary of Indonesia's independence.

CITA Head of Research Fajry Akbar considers the proposal to ignore aspects of inclusivity and actually risks burdening the squeezed middle class. He believes that there is one fundamental element that has been forgotten in the macroeconomic model built by the IMF, namely regarding which group gets the most from the economic growth cake.

According to him, the IMF proposal in the report entitled Golden Vision 2045: Making the Most Out of Public Investment only focuses on the efficiency requirements of public investment, without touching on the inclusiveness of its impact.

"This is important. After the pandemic, we experienced what is called a K-shaped economic recovery. Economic growth was enjoyed more by the upper group, while the middle group enjoyed the least," he said, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

Fajry explained that this inequality in recovery was reflected in the increase in the average savings of the upper group, which was inversely proportional to the decline in savings of the group below IDR 100 million. Apart from that, the increase in real wages after the pandemic was also recorded to be much smaller compared to the pre-pandemic era, which in turn put pressure on purchasing power and the size of the middle class in the country.

Therefore, Fajry criticized the option of increasing employee income tax (labor income tax) aka PPh Article 21 which was proposed by the IMF model as an illustration of an instrument to fill the deficit in the future. The reason is that the middle group is the largest contributor to the payment of PPh Article 21 based on the number of taxpayers.

Also Read

"If economic growth is not enjoyed by the middle and lower groups, it will be difficult for an increase in labor income tax to increase tax revenues optimally," he explained.

Furthermore, Fajry warned of the dangers behind policies that burden the middle class amidst economic conditions that are not yet fully in their favor. Even though the tax option in the IMF report is claimed to be merely an illustration, its application in the real world could trigger social unrest.

"Increasing the tax burden on the middle class when they are the ones who enjoy the least of the economic growth cake, I think that only angers the middle class and creates big political risks. Besides the impact on revenue, it will also not be optimal," he explained.

Reject Justifications for Widening the Deficit

From a fiscal governance perspective, CITA firmly rejects if the Washington DC-based institution's recommendations will be used as an excuse for the government to aggressively widen the APBN deficit and increase the ratio of government debt to gross domestic product (GDP).

Fajry views that forcing an increase in public investment which will ultimately widen the deficit and accumulate debt will actually backfire on the national economy at this time amidst much scrutiny by international rating agencies.

Instead of rushing to expand capital expenditure, the government is encouraged to first complete various basic homework assignments. This step is considered much more crucial for creating a healthy investment and fiscal climate without having to sacrifice stability.

"The government should first improve governance, the level of corruption, policy and business uncertainty, improve the quality of government spending, as well as other structural problems," concluded Fajry.

For information, in its initial release in February 2026, the IMF estimates that Indonesia needs real GDP growth of 5.5%–6.5% every year in order to move up to become a high-income country.

The IMF also recommends that the initial surge in public investment funding be financed through a budget deficit, followed by income tax withdrawals gradually to keep the APBN deficit below the threshold of 3% of GDP.
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Center for Indonesia Taxation Analysis (CITA) memberikan kritik terhadap laporan terbaru Dana Moneter Internasional (IMF) yang menyodorkan skenario ekspansi investasi publik untuk menggapai visi Indonesia Emas 2045 atau negara maju pada perayaan 100 tahun kemerdekaan Indonesia. 

Kepala Riset CITA Fajry Akbar menganggap proposal tersebut abai terhadap aspek inklusivitas dan justru berisiko membebani kelas menengah yang tengah terhimpit. Dia menilai ada satu elemen fundamental yang terlupakan dalam model makroekonomi yang dibangun oleh IMF, yaitu mengenai siapa kelompok yang paling menikmati kue pertumbuhan ekonomi.

Menurutnya, proposal IMF dalam laporan bertajuk Golden Vision 2045: Making The Most Out of Public Investment hanya menitikberatkan pada syarat efisiensi dari investasi publik (public investment), tanpa menyentuh sisi inklusivitas dari dampaknya.

"Ini penting. Pascapandemi kita mengalami apa yang disebut sebagai K-shaped economic recovery. Pertumbuhan ekonomi lebih dinikmati oleh kelompok atas, sedangkan kelompok menengah menjadi yang menikmati paling sedikit," ujarnya, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Fajry memaparkan bahwa ketimpangan pemulihan ini tecermin dari meningkatnya rata-rata tabungan kelompok atas, yang berbanding terbalik dengan merosotnya tabungan kelompok di bawah Rp100 juta. Selain itu, kenaikan upah riil pascapandemi juga tercatat jauh lebih kecil dibandingkan dengan era prapandemi, yang pada gilirannya menekan daya beli dan jumlah kelas menengah di Tanah Air.

Oleh karena itu, Fajry mengkritisi opsi peningkatan pajak penghasilan karyawan (labor income tax) alias PPh Pasal 21 yang disodorkan model IMF sebagai ilustrasi instrumen untuk menambal defisit ke depan. Alasannya, kelompok menengah merupakan penyumbang terbesar dalam pembayaran PPh Pasal 21 berdasarkan jumlah wajib pajak.

Baca Juga

  • Strategi Purbaya Kejar Setoran PPh Badan yang Naik Tembus 17%
  • Target Pajak 2026: PPh 21 Karyawan Dipangkas, Setoran Korporasi Dikerek
  • Asosiasi Beberkan Efek Kebijakan Insentif PPh Final UMKM

"Kalau pertumbuhan ekonomi tidak dinikmati kelompok menengah dan bawah, sulit rasanya kenaikan labor income tax akan meningkatkan penerimaan pajak secara optimal," jelasnya.

Lebih jauh, Fajry memperingatkan adanya bahaya di balik kebijakan yang membebani kelas menengah di tengah kondisi ekonomi yang belum sepenuhnya berpihak pada mereka. Meskipun opsi pajak tersebut dalam laporan IMF diklaim sekadar ilustrasi, penerapannya di dunia nyata bisa memantik gejolak sosial.

"Meningkatkan beban pajak kelas menengah ketika mereka yang paling sedikit menikmati kue pertumbuhan ekonomi, saya rasa itu hanya memancing kemarahan kelas menengah dan menciptakan risiko politik yang besar. Di samping dampaknya ke penerimaan juga tidak akan optimal," urainya.

Tolak Pembenaran Pelebaran Defisit

Dari kacamata tata kelola fiskal, CITA secara tegas menolak apabila rekomendasi lembaga yang bermarkas di Washington DC tersebut ini kelak dijadikan dalih bagi pemerintah untuk memperlebar defisit APBN secara agresif dan mengerek rasio utang pemerintah terhadap produk domestik bruto (PDB).

Fajry memandang, pemaksaan peningkatan investasi publik yang ujung-ujungnya melebarkan defisit dan menumpuk utang justru akan menjadi bumerang bagi perekonomian nasional saat ini di tengah banyaknya sorotan oleh lembaga rating internasional.

Alih-alih terburu-buru ekspansi belanja modal, pemerintah didorong untuk terlebih dahulu membereskan berbagai pekerjaan rumah yang sifatnya mendasar. Langkah ini dinilai jauh lebih krusial untuk menciptakan iklim investasi dan fiskal yang sehat tanpa harus mengorbankan stabilitas.

"Pemerintah harusnya perbaiki dahulu governance, tingkat korupsi, ketidakpastian kebijakan dan berusaha, meningkatkan kualitas belanja pemerintah, serta masalah struktural lainnya," tutup Fajry.

Sebagai informasi, dalam rilis awal Februari 2026, IMF menaksir Indonesia membutuhkan pertumbuhan PDB riil 5,5%–6,5% setiap tahun agar bisa naik kelas menjadi negara berpendapatan tinggi.

IMF pun merekomendasikan lonjakan awal pendanaan investasi publik dibiayai lewat defisit anggaran, yang disusul dengan penarikan pajak penghasilan secara bertahap untuk menjaga defisit APBN tetap di bawah ambang batas 3% terhadap PDB.

title: IDR 9 trillion in Chinese New Year money turnover, the tourism sector has the potential to receive blessings
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) estimates that the long holiday celebrating the 2026 Chinese New Year until Tuesday (17/2/2026) can increase the income of the tourism sector and its derivatives, including fruit shops.

Deputy General Chairperson of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry for Regional Autonomy, Sarman Simanjorang, said that the increase in turnover has the potential to be recorded in tourist destination centers, malls/retail outlets, culinary centers, cafes, regional specialties, logistics, transportation, Chinese New Year knick-knacks, and even fruit shops in line with the increase in community movement.

"Demand for the typical fruit above is estimated to increase by around 30% during the Chinese New Year celebration," said Sarman in a written statement, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

Apart from that, he also estimates that the potential circulation of money during the Chinese New Year holiday could reach IDR 9.06 trillion. This number was calculated from the population of Indonesian citizens of Chinese descent, which he said reached 11.25 million people or around 2.81 million families.

Assuming that each family spends at least IDR 1 million for Chinese New Year celebrations, the circulation of money could reach IDR 2.81 trillion. This nominal value is added to the 3.36 million people who go on tourist trips and are assumed to spend at least IDR 500,000, which will result in a turnover of IDR 1.68 trillion.

There is also the potential for money circulation from sales of flight, train and fast train tickets, which respectively reach IDR 1.74 trillion, IDR 150 billion and IDR 6.2 billion.

Also Read

Sarman also underlined the potential of the retail sector from estimates by the Indonesian Shopping Center Retailers & Tenants Association (Hippindo), that the transaction value will reach IDR 53.38 trillion from the Chinese New Year celebrations to Eid al-Fitr 1447 Hijriah.

"If we estimate that during the Chinese New Year holidays there will be 5% transactions, then the potential money turnover in the retail sector is around IDR 2,669,000,000,000. Thus, the potential money turnover during the 2026 Chinese New Year celebrations and holidays is estimated to be approximately IDR 9,067,480,000," explained Sarman.

According to him, this amount also does not include money turnover from toll fees incurred, fuel expenditure for private vehicles, to tourists traveling by ship and crossings.

Sarman is also optimistic that this momentum can increase the contribution of household consumption to national economic growth which is targeted at around 5.5%.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia memperkirakan bahwa libur panjang perayaan Imlek 2026 hingga Selasa (17/2/2026) ini dapat mengerek peningkatan pendapatan sektor pariwisata beserta turunannya, termasuk toko buah.

Wakil Ketua Umum Kadin Indonesia Bidang Otonomi Daerah Sarman Simanjorang menyebut bahwa peningkatan omzet berpotensi dicatatkan pusat destinasi wisata, mal/gerai ritel, pusat kuliner, kafe, makanan khas daerah, logistik, transportasi, pernak-pernik Imlek, hingga toko buah seiring dengan meningkatnya pergerakan masyarakat.

“Permintaan buah khas di atas diperkirakan mengalami kenaikan sekitar 30% selama perayaan Imlek,” kata Sarman dalam keterangan tertulis, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Selain itu, dia juga memperkirakan potensi perputaran uang selama libur Imlek dapat mencapai Rp9,06 triliun. Jumlah ini dihitung dari populasi warga negara Indonesia keturunan Tionghoa yang dia sebut mencapai 11,25 juta orang atau sekitar 2,81 juta keluarga.

Dengan asumsi setiap keluarga membelanjakan sedikitnya Rp1 juta untuk perayaan Imlek, maka perputaran uang dapat mencapai Rp2,81 triliun. Nominal ini ditambah dengan 3,36 juta orang yang melakukan perjalanan wisata dan diasumsikan berbelanja setidaknya Rp500.000, maka akan menghasilkan perputaran Rp1,68 triliun.

Terdapat pula potensi perputaran uang dari penjualan tiket penerbangan, kereta api, hingga kereta cepat yang masing-masing mencapai Rp1,74 triliun, Rp150 miliar, serta Rp6,2 miliar.

“Jika selama libur imlek kita perkirakan terjadi transaksi 5%, maka potensi perputaran uang sektor ritel sekitar Rp.2.669.000.000.000. Dengan demikian, potensi perputaran uang selama perayaan dan libur Imlek 2026 diperkirakan lebih kurang Rp.9.067.480.000,” jelas Sarman.

Menurutnya, jumlah itu juga belum mencakup perputaran uang dari biaya tol yang dikeluarkan, belanja BBM kendaraan pribadi, hingga wisatawan yang bepergian naik kapal laut dan penyeberangan.

Sarman pun optimistis momentum ini dapat mengerek kontribusi konsumsi rumah tangga dalam pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional yang ditargetkan pada kisaran 5,5%.

title_original: Perputaran Uang Imlek Rp9 Triliun, Sektor Pariwisata Berpotensi Ketiban Berkah
content_original:
Bisnis.com,JAKARTA — Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia memperkirakan bahwa libur panjang perayaanImlek2026 hingga Selasa (17/2/2026) ini dapat mengerek peningkatan pendapatan sektorpariwisatabeserta turunannya, termasuk toko buah.

Wakil Ketua Umum Kadin Indonesia Bidang Otonomi Daerah Sarman Simanjorang menyebut bahwa peningkatan omzet berpotensi dicatatkan pusat destinasi wisata, mal/gerai ritel, pusat kuliner, kafe, makanan khas daerah, logistik, transportasi, pernak-pernik Imlek, hingga toko buah seiring dengan meningkatnya pergerakan masyarakat.

“Permintaan buah khas di atas diperkirakan mengalami kenaikan sekitar 30% selama perayaan Imlek,” kata Sarman dalam keterangan tertulis, Selasa (17/2/2026).

Selain itu, dia juga memperkirakan potensi perputaran uang selama libur Imlek dapat mencapai Rp9,06 triliun. Jumlah ini dihitung dari populasi warga negara Indonesia keturunan Tionghoa yang dia sebut mencapai 11,25 juta orang atau sekitar 2,81 juta keluarga.

Dengan asumsi setiap keluarga membelanjakan sedikitnya Rp1 juta untuk perayaan Imlek, maka perputaran uang dapat mencapai Rp2,81 triliun. Nominal ini ditambah dengan 3,36 juta orang yang melakukan perjalanan wisata dan diasumsikan berbelanja setidaknya Rp500.000, maka akan menghasilkan perputaran Rp1,68 triliun.

Terdapat pula potensi perputaran uang dari penjualan tiket penerbangan, kereta api, hingga kereta cepat yang masing-masing mencapai Rp1,74 triliun, Rp150 miliar, serta Rp6,2 miliar.

Baca Juga

Sarman juga menggarisbawahi potensi sektor ritel dari perkiraan Himpunan Peritel & Penyewa Pusat Perbelanjaan Indonesia (Hippindo), bahwa nilai transaksi akan mencapai Rp53,38 triliun sejak perayaan Imlek hingga Idulfitri 1447 Hijriah nanti.

“Jika selama libur imlek kita perkirakan terjadi transaksi 5%, maka potensi perputaran uang sektor ritel sekitar Rp.2.669.000.000.000. Dengan demikian, potensi perputaran uang selama perayaan dan libur Imlek 2026 diperkirakan lebih kurang Rp.9.067.480.000,” jelas Sarman.

Menurutnya, jumlah itu juga belum mencakup perputaran uang dari biaya tol yang dikeluarkan, belanja BBM kendaraan pribadi, hingga wisatawan yang bepergian naik kapal laut dan penyeberangan.

Sarman pun optimistis momentum ini dapat mengerek kontribusi konsumsi rumah tangga dalam pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional yang ditargetkan pada kisaran 5,5%.

title: Entrepreneurs: New Investments Need Policy Certainty from the Government
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The business world considers policy certainty to be the main factor in maintaining and restoring investor confidence in the domestic and global economy.

Deputy General Chair of the Indonesian Entrepreneurs Association (Apindo) Sanny Iskandar said active communication between the government and business actors is very necessary at this time.

According to Sanny, recent global and domestic economic dynamics mean that investors need additional confidence before making expansion or new investment decisions.

In such conditions, the government's role becomes crucial in providing calming signals to the market.

"Yes, investors must always be reassured, right, especially with the recent situation which may cause concern from many parties," said Sanny to Bisnis, quoted Tuesday (17/2/2026).

He added that the President and ministry leaders need to have more frequent dialogue with the business world to hear directly about various obstacles in the field.

Also Read

Communication forums are considered not only as a place to convey aspirations, but also as a space to formulate joint solutions.

Sanny gave the example of a meeting between business actors and the President a few days ago, where Apindo was invited to address a number of issues as well as offer concrete solutions. This dialogue, he said, provides space for the business world to feel heard.

"We also convey what are the obstacles to problems in the field but also provide solutions as well," he explained.

Apart from direct dialogue, the government is also said to provide communication access via a special hotline so that business actors can immediately report the problems they face. This step is expected to speed up problem resolution without having to wait for an official forum.

According to Sanny, easy access to communication is important so that no business actor experiences prolonged difficulties in carrying out their business activities. A quick response from the government will be an indicator of its seriousness in creating a conducive business climate.

Furthermore, he emphasized that the main challenge currently is not only the substance of regulations, but also their implementation.

The business world needs consistent policy certainty, including legal certainty and security, so that investment decisions are not delayed.

"That's what sometimes, in reality, implementation is often difficult. Actually, the rules are okay, the implementation is good," he explained.

Previously, the Industrial Area Association (HKI) revealed that there are still many regulatory polemics in the country that hinder investors, such as overlapping regulations, tiered licensing procedures, and policy changes that occur too frequently.

HKI General Chair Akhmad Ma'ruf Maulana said that this condition often becomes a real obstacle to investment in Indonesia, both for new capital investment and the development of existing industrial businesses.

He emphasized that the main problem felt by investors does not lie in business standards or obligations, but in the uncertainty of regulations and inconsistencies in implementation in the field.

"Investors are not afraid of regulations, but what they worry about is uncertainty. In many cases, investment interest already exists, but its realization is delayed because regulations are not in sync and change frequently," said Ma'ruf in his official statement.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kalangan dunia usaha menilai kepastian kebijakan menjadi faktor utama dalam menjaga dan memulihkan kepercayaan investor di tengah ekonomi domestik dan global.

Wakil Ketua Umum Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia (Apindo) Sanny Iskandar mengatakan komunikasi aktif antara pemerintah dan pelaku usaha sangat diperlukan saat ini.

Menurut Sanny, dinamika ekonomi global maupun domestik belakangan ini membuat investor membutuhkan keyakinan tambahan sebelum mengambil keputusan ekspansi maupun investasi baru. 

Dalam kondisi seperti itu, peran pemerintah menjadi krusial untuk memberikan sinyal yang menenangkan pasar.

“Ya memang investor harus selalu diyakinkan kan, apalagi dengan situasi akhir-akhir ini yang mungkin membuat kekhawatiran ya dari banyak pihak,” ujar Sanny kepada Bisnis, dikutip Selasa (17/2/2026). 

Dia menambahkan, Presiden dan para pimpinan kementerian perlu lebih sering berdialog dengan dunia usaha guna mendengar langsung berbagai hambatan di lapangan. 

Baca Juga

  • Jelang Pertemuan Prabowo-Trump soal Tarif, Kadin Titip Ini Diprioritaskan
  • Prabowo Mau Rombak Insentif Fiskal, Kadin Wanti-Wanti Hal Ini
  • Kadin Kepri Bidik Investasi Eropa, Bangun Pipeline Bisnis Maritim Lewat Jejaring Diaspora

Forum komunikasi dinilai bukan hanya sebagai ajang penyampaian aspirasi, tetapi juga ruang untuk merumuskan solusi bersama.

Sanny mencontohkan pertemuan pelaku usaha dengan Presiden beberapa hari lalu, di mana Apindo diundang untuk menyampaikan sejumlah persoalan sekaligus menawarkan solusi konkret. Dialog tersebut, kata dia, memberi ruang bagi dunia usaha untuk merasa didengar.

“Kita juga sampaikan apa yang menjadi hambatan-hambatan permasalahan di lapangan namun juga memberikan solusinya juga,” jelasnya.

Selain dialog langsung, pemerintah juga disebut memberikan akses komunikasi melalui hotline khusus agar pelaku usaha bisa segera melaporkan kendala yang dihadapi. Langkah ini diharapkan mampu mempercepat penyelesaian masalah tanpa harus menunggu forum resmi.

Menurut Sanny, kemudahan akses komunikasi menjadi penting agar tidak ada pelaku usaha yang mengalami kesulitan berkepanjangan dalam menjalankan kegiatan bisnisnya. Respons cepat dari pemerintah akan menjadi indikator keseriusan dalam menciptakan iklim usaha yang kondusif.

Lebih jauh, dia menegaskan bahwa tantangan utama saat ini bukan semata pada substansi regulasi, melainkan pada implementasinya. 

Dunia usaha membutuhkan kepastian kebijakan yang konsisten, termasuk kepastian hukum dan keamanan, agar keputusan investasi tidak tertunda.

“Itu yang kadang-kadang dalam kenyataannya seringkali implementasinya yang susah. Sebetulnya aturan-aturannya sudah oke, implementasinya,” terangnya.

Sebelumnya, Himpunan Kawasan Industri (HKI) mengungkapkan masih banyak polemik regulasi di Tanah Air yang menghambat investor, seperti tumpang tindih peraturan, prosedur perizinan yang berjenjang, hingga perubahan kebijakan yang terlalu sering terjadi. 

Ketua Umum HKI Akhmad Ma’ruf Maulana mengatakan kondisi tersebut kerap menjadi hambatan nyata bagi investasi di Indonesia, baik untuk penanaman modal baru maupun pengembangan usaha industri yang sudah berjalan.

Dia menekankan bahwa persoalan utama yang dirasakan investor bukan terletak pada standar atau kewajiban usaha, melainkan pada ketidakpastian aturan serta ketidakkonsistenan implementasi di lapangan.

“Investor tidak takut dengan aturan namun yang mereka khawatirkan adalah ketidakpastian. Di banyak kasus, minat investasi sudah ada, tetapi realisasinya tertahan karena regulasi tidak sinkron dan sering berubah,” kata Ma’ruf dalam keterangan resminya.

title: Prabowo Meets Trump, Textile Industry Hopes for Tariff Relief from the US
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Fiber and Filament Yarn Producers Association (APSyFI) still hopes that the government will be able to negotiate lower tariffs during President Prabowo Subianto's meeting with United States President Donald Trump.

The textile and textile products (TPT) industry hopes that the reciprocal tariff, which is currently at the level of 19%, can be pushed lower so that the competitiveness of exports to Uncle Sam's country can recover.

APSyFI General Chair Redma Gita Wirawasta said that the United States market is still one of the main destinations for Indonesian textile exports. However, the tariff burden is considered to make it difficult for national products to compete with other countries that receive more competitive treatment.

"Of course we hope that the US will provide tariff relief so that our exports to the US can become competitive again, even though this is difficult without improvements on the industrial side," said Redma to Bisnis, Tuesday (17/2/2026).

In these negotiations, the United States is said to have asked Indonesia to increase its purchases of cotton from Uncle Sam's country as one of the conditions for reducing reciprocal tariffs from the previous 32% to 19%. This demand is a challenge in itself amidst conditions in the spinning industry that have not yet fully recovered.

According to Redma, increasing cotton imports from the US is difficult to realize if the spinning industry utilization rate is still below 50%. With production capacity not yet optimal, the need for raw materials automatically decreases.

Also Read

"This will be difficult to implement as long as our spinning industry's utilization is still below 50%," he explained.

APSyFI data notes that before the Covid-19 pandemic, Indonesia's total cotton imports reached around 600,000 tons per year, with around 300,000 tons coming from the United States. However, since 2022 the import trend has continued to decline significantly.

In 2025, Indonesia's total cotton imports will be recorded at only around 300,000 tons, with the portion from the United States remaining at around 70,000 tons. This decline reflects sluggish production activity in the spinning sector in recent years.

"So as long as the utilization of the spinning industry is below 50%, it is unlikely that our cotton imports from the US will increase," he explained.

He added that the low utilization of industry cannot be separated from the flood of imported products which are suspected of being sold through dumping practices, both in the form of cloth and thread. This condition puts pressure on the domestic market and erodes demand for domestic products.

"It is impossible for spinning utilization to increase as long as dumped imported goods, both cloth and yarn, continue to flood the domestic market. Because the industry's main need is the market and fair competition," he said.

APSyFI also hopes that the government's trade diplomacy efforts will not only focus on reducing tariffs, but will also be accompanied by domestic improvements. Without adequate market protection and fair business competition, the industry finds it difficult to increase production while meeting additional demand for cotton imports from the United States.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Asosiasi Produsen Serat dan Benang Filamen (APSyFI) masih menaruh harapan agar pemerintah mampu menegosiasikan tarif yang lebih rendah dalam pertemuan Presiden Prabowo Subianto dengan Presiden Amerika Serikat Donald Trump.

Industri tekstil dan produk tekstil (TPT) berharap tarif resiprokal yang saat ini berada di level 19% bisa ditekan lebih rendah agar daya saing ekspor ke Negeri Paman Sam kembali pulih.

Ketua Umum APSyFI Redma Gita Wirawasta mengatakan, pasar Amerika Serikat masih menjadi salah satu tujuan utama ekspor tekstil Indonesia. Namun, beban tarif dinilai membuat produk nasional sulit bersaing dengan negara lain yang mendapatkan perlakuan lebih kompetitif.

“Tentunya kami berharap AS akan memberikan keringanan tarif agar ekspor kita ke AS bisa kembali bersaing meskipun hal itu sulit tanpa ada perbaikan di sisi industrinya,” ujar Redma kepada Bisnis, Selasa (17/2/2026). 

Dalam negosiasi tersebut, Amerika Serikat disebut meminta Indonesia meningkatkan pembelian kapas (cotton) dari Negeri Paman Sam sebagai salah satu syarat penurunan tarif resiprokal dari sebelumnya 32% menjadi 19%. Permintaan itu menjadi tantangan tersendiri di tengah kondisi industri pemintalan yang belum sepenuhnya pulih.

Menurut Redma, peningkatan impor kapas dari AS sulit direalisasikan apabila tingkat utilisasi industri pemintalan masih berada di bawah 50%. Dengan kapasitas produksi yang belum optimal, kebutuhan bahan baku otomatis ikut menurun.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo ke AS Bahas Perjanjian Dagang, Ekonom: Industri Tekstil Butuh Keringanan
  • Daftar Sektor Manufaktur yang Terkontraksi pada 2025, Tekstil Tak Termasuk
  • Prabowo Undang 22 Pengusaha ke Hambalang, Bahas Peran Industri Tekstil hingga Mamin

“Hal ini akan sulit dilaksanakan selama industri pemintalan kita utilisasinya masih di bawah 50%,” terangnya.

Data APSyFI mencatat, sebelum pandemi Covid-19 total impor kapas Indonesia mencapai sekitar 600.000 ton per tahun, dengan sekitar 300.000 ton berasal dari Amerika Serikat. Namun, sejak 2022 tren impor terus mengalami penurunan signifikan.

Pada 2025, total impor kapas Indonesia tercatat hanya sekitar 300.000 ton, dengan porsi dari Amerika Serikat tinggal sekitar 70.000 ton. Penurunan ini mencerminkan lesunya aktivitas produksi di sektor pemintalan dalam beberapa tahun terakhir.

“Jadi selama utilisasi industri pemintalan berada di bawah 50%, kecil kemungkinan impor cotton kita dari AS bisa naik,” jelasnya.

Dia menambahkan, rendahnya utilisasi industri tidak lepas dari membanjirnya produk impor yang diduga dijual dengan praktik dumping, baik dalam bentuk kain maupun benang. Kondisi ini membuat pasar domestik tertekan dan menggerus permintaan terhadap produk dalam negeri.

“Utilisasi pemintalan tidak mungkin bisa naik selama barang-barang impor dumping baik kain maupun benang masih membanjiri pasar domestik. Karena kebutuhan utama industri hanyalah pasar dan persaingannya yang fair,” ujarnya.

APSyFI pun berharap upaya diplomasi perdagangan yang dilakukan pemerintah tidak hanya berfokus pada penurunan tarif, tetapi juga diiringi dengan pembenahan di dalam negeri. Tanpa perlindungan pasar yang memadai dan persaingan usaha yang adil, industri menilai sulit untuk meningkatkan produksi sekaligus memenuhi permintaan tambahan impor kapas dari Amerika Serikat.

title: IMF Calculates Indonesia's GDP Could Rise 4.1% As Long As Non-Trade Barriers Are Cut
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The International Monetary Fund (IMF) projects that Indonesia's real gross domestic product (GDP) could increase by up to 4.1%, as long as it integrates more into global trade.

Based on the Selected Issues Paper report entitled Golden Vision 2045: Reaping the Gains from Trade, which was released in early February 2026, the projected additional economic growth can occur if the government prioritizes cutting non-tariff barriers (NTB).

IMF economist Ashique Habib, as the author of the report, noted that Indonesia is pushing for deeper trade integration in order to leverage external demand, which is a step towards paving the way towards the Golden Indonesia Vision 2045 or becoming a developed country on the 100th anniversary of its independence.

The IMF admits that Indonesia has lowered average manufacturing tariffs in recent years. Nevertheless, the institution which is headquartered in Washington DC highlighted that Indonesia's non-tariff barriers are still high, which are above the average for regional countries such as Asean and globally such as America, Europe and East Asia.

"Our analysis shows that deeper trade integration, with a focus on reducing non-tariff barriers, along with complementary structural reforms, could generate significant GDP gains for Indonesia," wrote the report, quoted Tuesday (17/2/2026).

Interestingly, the largest portion of the projected additional GDP increase of 4.1% actually comes from Indonesia's unilateral steps to relax its trade barriers (around 1.9%).

Also Read

In the IMF scenario, if Indonesia eliminates non-tariff barriers, domestic business actors will gain access to more affordable intermediate raw materials. This scenario is considered effective in increasing industrial productivity and competitiveness, both to fulfill domestic and export markets.

These economic benefits will be even greater if accompanied by the opening of market access through in-depth trade agreements with strategic partners (adding to an increase in real GDP of around 1.7%). It is believed that this step will trigger the relocation of activities to sectors that are Indonesia's comparative advantages.

Furthermore, the IMF explained that trade policy maneuvers alone would not be enough. The government is required to execute comprehensive structural reforms, especially in the human resource (HR) quality and logistics sectors (projected to provide additional real GDP of around 0.5%).

Improvements in infrastructure and logistics processes are believed to be able to encourage exports of goods. Meanwhile, the injection of investment in the quality of human resources is expected to be a crucial foundation for a surge in exports of modern services, such as the information and communications technology (ICT) and financial sectors.

In addition, the IMF projects that trade openness and structural strengthening will make Indonesia more attractive in the eyes of foreign investors, especially amidst shifts in global supply chains.

As a result, foreign direct investment is predicted to increase if Indonesia is increasingly integrated into the global value chain, thereby multiplying economic profits beyond the initial estimates of the model formulation.

"Even as Indonesia moves forward with trade liberalization and structural reform, it is important to ensure that appropriate support measures are in place to help workers transition to new opportunities, thereby helping ensure that the benefits of trade can be fully realized and widely enjoyed," concludes the end note to the IMF report.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Dana Moneter Internasional (IMF) memproyeksikan produk domestik bruto (PDB) riil Indonesia bisa terkerek hingga 4,1%, asalkan lebih mengintegrasikan diri ke perdagangan global.

Berdasarkan laporan Selected Issues Paper bertajuk Golden Vision 2045: Reaping the Gains from Trade yang dirilis pada awal Februari 2026, proyeksi tambahan pertumbuhan ekonomi itu dapat terjadi apabila pemerintah memprioritaskan pemangkasan hambatan non-tarif (non-tariff barriers/NTB).

Ekonom IMF Ashique Habib, selaku penyusun laporan, mencatat bahwa Indonesia tengah memacu integrasi perdagangan yang lebih dalam demi mengungkit permintaan eksternal, yang merupakan langkah untuk memuluskan menuju Visi Indonesia Emas 2045 atau menjadi negara maju pada perayaan 100 tahun kemerdekaannya.

IMF mengakui bahwa Indonesia telah menurunkan tarif rata-rata manufaktur dalam beberapa tahun terakhir. Kendati demikian, lembaga yang bermarkas di Washington DC itu menyoroti masih tingginya hambatan non-tarif RI yang bertengger di atas rata-rata negara kawasan seperti Asean maupun global seperti Amerika, Eropa, hingga Asia Timur.

"Analisis kami menunjukkan bahwa integrasi perdagangan yang lebih dalam, dengan fokus pada pengurangan hambatan non-tarif, beserta reformasi struktural yang melengkapinya, dapat menghasilkan keuntungan PDB yang signifikan bagi Indonesia," tulis laporan tersebut, dikutip Selasa (17/2/2026).

Menariknya, porsi terbesar dari proyeksi kenaikan PDB tambahan sebesar 4,1% ini justru bersumber dari langkah sepihak Indonesia dalam melonggarkan hambatan perdagangannya (sekitar 1,9%).

Dalam skenario IMF, jika Indonesia menghilangkan hambatan non-tarif maka pelaku usaha dalam negeri bakal meraup akses bahan baku perantara (intermediate inputs) yang lebih terjangkau. Skenario tersebut dinilai ampuh meningkatkan produktivitas dan daya saing industri, baik untuk pemenuhan pasar domestik maupun ekspor.

Keuntungan ekonomi ini bakal makin menebal apabila diiringi pembukaan akses pasar lewat perjanjian perdagangan mendalam dengan mitra strategis (menambah peningkatan PDB riil sekitar 1,7%). Langkah ini diyakini akan memicu relokasi aktivitas ke sektor-sektor yang menjadi keunggulan komparatif Indonesia.

Lebih jauh, IMF membedah bahwa manuver kebijakan dagang semata tak akan cukup. Pemerintah dituntut mengeksekusi reformasi struktural yang komprehensif, khususnya di sektor kualitas sumber daya manusia (SDM) dan logistik (diproyeksikan memberi tambahan PDB riil sekitar 0,5%).

Perbaikan infrastruktur dan proses logistik diyakini mampu menjadi pendorong ekspor barang. Sementara itu, suntikan investasi pada kualitas SDM diharapkan menjadi fondasi krusial bagi lonjakan ekspor jasa modern, seperti sektor teknologi informasi dan komunikasi (TIK) serta keuangan.

Sebagai tambahan, IMF memproyeksikan bahwa keterbukaan dagang dan penguatan struktural bakal membuat Indonesia semakin menarik di mata investor asing, terutama di tengah pergeseran rantai pasok global. 

Akibatnya, investasi asing langsung diprediksi akan semakin deras apabila RI semakin terintegrasi dalam rantai nilai global sehingga melipatgandakan keuntungan ekonomi melampaui estimasi awal rumusan model tersebut.

"Bahkan seiring langkah Indonesia dalam mendorong liberalisasi perdagangan dan reformasi struktural, penting untuk memastikan tersedianya langkah-langkah dukungan yang tepat guna membantu para pekerja beralih ke peluang-peluang baru, sehingga membantu memastikan bahwa keuntungan dari perdagangan dapat terwujud sepenuhnya dan dinikmati secara luas," tutup catatan akhir laporan IMF tersebut.

title: What needs to be prioritized when Prabowo and Trump discuss trade agreements
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Entrepreneurs and economists asked the government to fight for national industrialization when President Prabowo Subianto flew to the United States to meet with President Donald Trump.

Stakeholders also hope that protection of the textile and footwear industry will be a concern in future discussions.

Deputy General Chair of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Erwin Aksa, said that the government needs to pay special attention to the industrial sector which has been the backbone of exports and absorption of the national workforce.

"Regarding US tariff policy, the sectors that need attention are export-oriented and labor-intensive industries such as textiles and textile products, footwear, furniture, fisheries, as well as certain manufactured products," said Erwin to Bisnis, Monday (16/2/2026).

According to Erwin, these sectors are important contributors to job creation and foreign exchange earnings. Therefore, he believes that the government needs to maintain the sustainability of industrial competitiveness through appropriate negotiation strategies.

In terms of the negotiation approach, Kadin believes that the government needs to strengthen mutually beneficial trade partnerships, encourage equal tariff treatment with competing countries, and improve logistics efficiency and ease of doing business within the country.

Also Read

"With this step, Indonesia is not only talking about tariffs, but also showing that Indonesia is a strategic partner in the global supply chain," he continued.

Workers in the textile industry

General Chairperson of Apindo Shinta Widjaja Kamdani said the sectors most vulnerable to US tariff policies are labor-intensive industries that have high exposure to Uncle Sam's export market.

"Regarding US tariff policy, from the perspective of the business world, the most vulnerable sectors are labor-intensive industries that have high exposure to the export market to the United States," Shinta told Bisnis.

Based on export data, Shinta explained a number of commodities with significant dependence on the US market. He gave the example that knitted clothing and accessories account for around 61% of exports to the US, furniture and lighting around 59%, processed meat/fish/crustaceans around 56%, and leather products around 56%. Meanwhile, non-knitted clothing is around 49%, toys and sports equipment is around 45%, and footwear is around 33%.

According to him, the data shows that changes in tariffs will have a direct impact on orders, production capacity utilization levels, and company cash flow, which ultimately has the potential to reduce labor absorption.

"Therefore, these sectors [labor-intensive industries] need to be a priority for protection in negotiations, considering their contribution to manufacturing and national employment stability," he explained.

On the other hand, Shinta said that Apindo was involved in US reciprocal tariff negotiations by providing industry input, mapping business obstacles, and communicating with business world partners in the US.

Apart from that, Shinta assessed that strengthening Indonesia's bargaining position also requires an understanding of the context of US reciprocal tariff policy which aims to balance the trade balance and reduce the trade deficit.

"Indonesia's approach cannot only be defensive in asking for tariff reductions, but must also offer concrete solutions that answer these interests," he explained.

Based on the upload from the official Instagram account @sekretariat.kabinet, President Prabowo summoned Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto, Minister of Finance Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Minister of State Secretary Prasetyo Hadi, and Minister of Investment and Downstreaming/Head of BKPM and CEO of Danantara Rosan Roeslani.

The meeting was held at his private residence in Hambalang, Bogor, on Sunday (15/2/2026). During the meeting, the Indonesian Head of State emphasized the importance of ensuring that Indonesia's position in every international economic negotiation is at the most favorable point for national interests l, especially regarding tariff negotiations with the US.

"President Prabowo wants every policy taken to provide concrete benefits as soon as possible and as much as possible for Indonesia," he was quoted as saying on the official Instagram account @sekretariat.kabinet, Monday (16/2/2026).
content_html:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pengusaha dan ekonom meminta pemerintah untuk memperjuangkan industrialisasi nasional dalam saat Presiden Prabowo Subianto terbang ke Amerika Serikat bertemu dengan Presiden Donald Trump.

Para pemangku kepentingan juga berharap agar proteksi terhadap industri tekstil dan alas kaki menjadi perhatian dalam pembahasan nanti.

Wakil Ketua Umum Kadin Indonesia Erwin Aksa menyebut pemerintah perlu memberikan perhatian khusus kepada sektor industri yang selama ini menjadi tulang punggung ekspor dan penyerapan tenaga kerja nasional.

“Terkait kebijakan tarif AS, sektor yang perlu mendapat perhatian adalah industri berorientasi ekspor dan padat karya seperti tekstil dan produk tekstil, alas kaki, furnitur, perikanan, serta beberapa produk manufaktur tertentu,” kata Erwin kepada Bisnis, Senin (16/2/2026).

Menurut Erwin, sederet sektor tersebut merupakan kontributor penting bagi penciptaan lapangan kerja dan perolehan devisa. Oleh karena itu, dia menilai pemerintah perlu menjaga keberlanjutan daya saing industri melalui strategi negosiasi yang tepat.

Dari sisi pendekatan perundingan, Kadin menilai pemerintah perlu memperkuat kemitraan dagang yang saling menguntungkan, mendorong kesetaraan perlakuan tarif dengan negara pesaing, serta meningkatkan efisiensi logistik dan kemudahan berusaha di dalam negeri.

Baca Juga

  • Prabowo ke AS Bahas Perjanjian Dagang, Ekonom: Industri Tekstil Butuh Keringanan
  • Prabowo Undang 22 Pengusaha ke Hambalang, Bahas Peran Industri Tekstil hingga Mamin
  • Menko Airlangga Sebut Pembentukan BUMN Tekstil Masih dalam Kajian

“Dengan langkah tersebut, Indonesia tidak hanya berbicara soal tarif, tetapi juga menunjukkan bahwa Indonesia adalah mitra strategis dalam rantai pasok global,” lanjutnya.

Ketua Umum Apindo Shinta Widjaja Kamdani mengatakan sektor paling rentan terhadap kebijakan tarif AS adalah industri padat karya yang memiliki eksposur tinggi ke pasar ekspor Negeri Paman Sam.

“Terkait kebijakan tarif AS, dari perspektif dunia usaha, sektor yang paling rentan adalah industri padat karya yang memiliki eksposur tinggi terhadap pasar ekspor ke Amerika Serikat,” kata Shinta kepada Bisnis.

Berdasarkan data ekspor, Shinta memaparkan sejumlah komoditas dengan ketergantungan signifikan terhadap pasar AS. Dia mencontohkan, pakaian dan aksesori rajutan mencatat sekitar 61% ekspor ke AS, furnitur dan lampu sekitar 59%, olahan daging/ikan/krustasea sekitar 56%, serta produk kulit sekitar 56%. Adapun pakaian non-rajutan sekitar 49%, mainan dan perlengkapan olahraga sekitar 45%, dan alas kaki sekitar 33%.

Menurutnya, data tersebut menunjukkan perubahan tarif akan berdampak langsung pada pesanan, tingkat utilisasi kapasitas produksi, hingga arus kas perusahaan, yang pada akhirnya berpotensi menekan penyerapan tenaga kerja.

“Karena itu, sektor-sektor ini [industri padat karya] perlu menjadi prioritas perlindungan dalam negosiasi, mengingat kontribusinya terhadap manufaktur dan stabilitas ketenagakerjaan nasional,” terangnya.

Di sisi lain, Shinta menuturkan Apindo ikut terlibat dalam negosiasi tarif resiprokal AS dengan memberi masukan industri, memetakan hambatan usaha, hingga berkomunikasi dengan mitra dunia usaha di AS. 

Selain itu, Shinta menilai penguatan posisi tawar Indonesia juga menuntut pemahaman atas konteks kebijakan tarif resiprokal AS yang bertujuan menyeimbangkan neraca perdagangan dan menekan defisit dagang.

“Pendekatan Indonesia tidak bisa hanya defensif meminta penurunan tarif, tetapi juga harus menawarkan solusi konkret yang menjawab kepentingan tersebut,” terangnya.

Berdasarkan unggahan akun Instagram resmi @sekretariat.kabinet, Presiden Prabowo memanggil Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto, Menteri Keuangan Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Menteri Sekretaris Negara Prasetyo Hadi, serta Menteri Investasi dan Hilirisasi/Kepala BKPM sekaligus CEO Danantara Rosan Roeslani.

Pertemuan itu dilaksanakan di kediaman pribadinya di Hambalang, Bogor, pada Minggu (15/2/2026). Dalam pertemuan tersebut, Kepala Negara RI menekankan pentingnya memastikan posisi Indonesia dalam setiap perundingan ekonomi internasional berada pada titik yang paling menguntungkan bagi kepentingan nasional, terutama terkait perundingan tarif dengan AS.

“Presiden Prabowo menginginkan setiap kebijakan yang diambil harus sesegera dan sebanyak mungkin memberi keuntungan konkret untuk Indonesia,” demikian dikutip dari akun Instagram resmi @sekretariat.kabinet, Senin (16/2/2026).

title: Food Prices February 17 Ahead of Ramadan: Beef and Buffalo Rise
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Movements in national average prices for food commodities for consumers in Indonesia were observed to vary on Tuesday (17/2/2026), coinciding with the 2026 Chinese New Year holiday and the eve of Ramadan.

Based on the National Food Agency (Bapanas) price panel page at 09.45 WIB, the average price of premium rice in the country fell 1.16% to IDR 15,450 per kilogram compared to the previous day.

The price of medium rice also fell 0.49% to IDR 13,305 per kilogram, while Perum Bulog's Food Supply and Price Stabilization (SPHP) rice fell 0.38% to IDR 12,403 per kilogram.

Apart from that, there was also the price of non-SPHP medium rice which fell 0.82% to IDR 13,825 per kilogram, as well as local special rice which rose 1.89% to IDR 15,946.

Other commodities such as livestock corn fell 2.96% to IDR 6,644 per kilogram, and imported dry seed soybeans fell 1.05% to IDR 10,810 per kilogram.

Meanwhile, red onions fell 4.79% to IDR 40,076 per kilogram, while bulb garlic was also 2.74% cheaper to IDR 38,026 per kilogram.

Also Read

Meanwhile, curly red chilies fell 2.48% to IDR 44,174 per kilogram, large red chilies fell 7.06% to IDR 39,013 per kilogram, while red cayenne peppers rose 0.07% to IDR 75,027 per kilogram.

Meanwhile, the price of pure beef rose 1.15% to IDR 139,618 per kilogram. The price of purebred chicken meat fell 0.8% to IDR 40,817 per kilogram, while purebred chicken eggs fell 1.93% to IDR 30,563 per kilogram.

Furthermore, sugar consumption was observed to fall 1.18% to IDR 18,058 per kilogram, salt consumption fell 0.51% to IDR 11,517 per kilogram, bulk wheat flour fell 3.64% to IDR 9,385 and packaged wheat flour fell 2.61% to IDR 12,669.

Packaged cooking oil was observed to fall 2.04% to IDR 20,744 per liter, while bulk cooking oil fell 0.78% to IDR 17,618 per liter. Meanwhile, Minyakita fell 1.66% to IDR 16,897 per liter.

Meanwhile, mackerel rose 1.54% to IDR 46,339 per kilogram, tuna fell 1.18% to IDR 37,169 per kilogram, while milkfish fell 0.83% to IDR 37,004 per kilogram.

Price changes also occurred for foreign imported frozen buffalo meat, which fell 0.17% to IDR 111,916 per kilogram. Meanwhile, local fresh buffalo meat rose 1.06% to IDR 150,000 per kilogram.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Pergerakan harga rata-rata nasional komoditas pangan konsumen di Indonesia terpantau bervariasi pada Selasa (17/2/2026), bertepatan dengan hari raya Imlek 2026 dan menjelang Ramadan.

Berdasarkan laman panel harga Badan Pangan Nasional (Bapanas) pukul 09.45 WIB, harga rata-rata beras premium di Tanah Air turun 1,16% menjadi Rp15.450 per kilogram dibandingkan dengan hari sebelumnya.

Harga beras medium juga turun 0,49% ke Rp13.305 per kilogram, sedangkan beras Stabilisasi Pasokan dan Harga Pangan (SPHP) Perum Bulog tercatat turun 0,38% ke angka Rp12.403 per kilogram.

title: Citilink flies the Padang & Pekanbaru route from Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Garuda Indonesia Group through Citilink has opened a new domestic flight route from Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport to Padang and Pekanbaru, which will operate from February 16 2026.

Citilink President Director, Darsito Hendroseputro, said that the opening of these two routes was a strategic step in expanding the Garuda Indonesia Group network while optimizing the utilization of aircraft that had been reactivated.

"The opening of this new route is a form of Citilink's commitment to providing wider travel alternatives, especially connecting Jakarta via Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport with Padang and Pekanbaru to facilitate people's mobility," he said in a press release quoted on Tuesday (17/2/2026).

He explained that Citilink's Jakarta – Padang and Jakarta – Pekanbaru flights operate every day using Airbus A320 aircraft.

Meanwhile, the Jakarta to Padang route is scheduled to depart at 07.00 local time and arrive in Padang at 08.50 local time with flight number QG180.

The reverse flight route from Padang to Jakarta departs at 09.20 local time and arrives in Jakarta at 11.15 local time with flight number QG181.

Also Read

Meanwhile, the Jakarta to Pekanbaru route is scheduled to depart at 16.45 local time and arrive in Pekanbaru at 18.30 local time with flight number QG032.

Then, the reverse flight on the Pekanbaru route to Jakarta departs at 19.00 local time and arrives in Jakarta at 20.50 local time with flight number QG033.

Darsito hopes that the opening of this new Citilink route can make a positive contribution to all sectors, especially in supporting the acceleration of economic growth between regions in Indonesia.

Citilink is committed to continuing to strengthen operational performance and maintain service consistency by always prioritizing aspects of flight safety, security and comfort.

title: Building Trust, Deputy Minister of Cooperatives Asks KopDes Merah Putih to Be Managed Transparently
content:
Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — The Ministry of Cooperatives (Kemenkop) stated that the management of the Red and White Village/Kelurahan Cooperative (KopDes/Kel) must be carried out professionally and transparently so that it can grow and develop sustainably.

Deputy Minister of Cooperatives (Wamenkop) Farida Farichah said cooperatives need to implement good governance, supported by an orderly administration system, open financial reporting, and clear and accountable monitoring mechanisms.

According to him, public trust is the main capital so that cooperatives can be sustainable, so that the integrity of the management is an absolute prerequisite.

"There is no business that suddenly gets big. All big businesses start small. They can get big if there is trust from members and the public. If trust is high, people will definitely shop there," said Farida in a written statement, quoted Monday (16/2/2026).

Apart from that, Farida added that management professionalism is also an important requirement for banks to distribute capital loans. He assessed that if the source of capital comes from members, management transparency is an inseparable part of professional management practices.

"The important thing is no longer shopping, the important thing is that money goes out. Everything must be checked regularly, how much is spent, how much money comes in," he explained.

Also Read

On the other hand, Farida said that the Ministry of Cooperatives also provides training to administrators and supervisors to ensure that cooperative management runs professionally.

He assessed that every village and sub-district has economic potential that can be managed to improve the welfare of residents, so the Village Cooperative/Kel Merah Putih needs to explore and develop local potential in their respective areas.

"For example, there are villages whose villages have plantation potential, but the residents only become laborers because they don't know how to manage and market them. Capital owners from outside come to control them. We don't want things like that to happen again. In the future, villages and sub-districts will not depend on outsiders," he said.

For this reason, Farida asked residents and all KopDes/Kel Merah Putih managers to run the cooperative seriously and diligently, even though this will not be felt in the near future. However, he assessed that these benefits would come along with a gradual process.

In addition, Farida said that the Ministry of Cooperatives had issued Minister of Cooperatives Regulation Number 9 of 2025 (Permenkop 9/2025) regarding the distribution of loans from LPDB Cooperatives for cooperatives that need funding. He ensured that every KopDes/Kel Merah Putih that needed capital could apply for a loan through the LPDB Cooperative.

Bisnis.com, JAKARTA — Kementerian Koperasi (Kemenkop) menyatakan pengelolaan Koperasi Desa/Kelurahan (KopDes/Kel) Merah Putih harus dilakukan secara profesional dan transparan agar mampu tumbuh dan berkembang secara berkelanjutan.

Wakil Menteri Koperasi (Wamenkop) Farida Farichah mengatakan koperasi perlu menerapkan tata kelola yang baik, didukung sistem administrasi yang tertib, pelaporan keuangan yang terbuka, serta mekanisme pengawasan yang jelas dan dapat dipertanggungjawabkan.

Menurutnya, kepercayaan masyarakat merupakan modal utama agar koperasi dapat berkelanjutan, sehingga integritas pengurus menjadi prasyarat mutlak.

“Tidak ada bisnis yang tiba-tiba besar. Semua bisnis besar berawal dari kecil. Bisa besar kalau ada kepercayaan anggota dan masyarakat. Kalau kepercayaan tinggi, pasti masyarakat berbelaja di situ,” kata Farida dalam keterangan tertulis, dikutip Senin (16/2/2026).

Selain itu, Farida menambahkan bahwa profesionalisme pengelolaan juga menjadi syarat penting bagi perbankan untuk menyalurkan pinjaman modal. Dia menilai, apabila sumber modal berasal dari anggota, transparansi pengelolaan merupakan bagian tak terpisahkan dari praktik manajemen yang profesional.

“Tidak boleh lagi yang penting belanja, yang penting uang keluar. Semua harus dicek secara berkala, berapa belanja, berapa uang yang masuk,” terangnya.

  • Kopdes Merah Putih diguyur Triliunan Rupiah, dari Dana Desa hingga Duit SAL
  • Ini Alasan Purbaya Wajibkan 58% Dana Desa 2026 untuk Kopdes Merah Putih
  • Risiko di Balik Kebijakan 58% Dana Desa 2026 untuk Kopdes Merah Putih

Di sisi lain, Farida menyampaikan Kemenkop turut memberikan pelatihan kepada pengurus dan pengawas untuk memastikan pengelolaan koperasi berjalan secara profesional.

Dia menilai setiap desa dan kelurahan memiliki potensi ekonomi yang dapat dikelola untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan warga, sehingga KopDes/Kel Merah Putih perlu menggali dan mengembangkan potensi lokal di wilayahnya masing-masing.

“Misalnya, ada yang desanya punya potensi perkebunan, tapi warganya hanya jadi buruh karena tidak tahu cara mengelola dan memasarkannya. Pemilik modal dari luar datang menguasainya. Kita tidak ingin hal seperti itu terjadi lagi. Ke depan, desa dan kelurahan tidak tergantung pada orang luar,” tuturnya.

Untuk itu, Farida meminta warga dan seluruh pengelola KopDes/Kel Merah Putih menjalankan koperasi secara serius dan tekun, meski belum dirasakan dalam waktu dekat. Namun, dia menilai manfaat tersebut akan seiring proses yang berjalan secara bertahap.

Di samping itu, Farida menyampaikan Kemenkop telah menerbitkan Peraturan Menteri Koperasi Nomor 9 Tahun 2025 (Permenkop 9/2025) terkait penyaluran pinjaman dari LPDB Koperasi bagi koperasi yang membutuhkan pendanaan. Dia memastikan setiap KopDes/Kel Merah Putih yang memerlukan permodalan dapat mengajukan pinjaman melalui LPDB Koperasi.
